2585.name: Lugworm
2585.description: A hairy marine worm that lives under beach sand. Live bait for ocean fishing.

2586.name: Moth Pupa
2586.description: A moth in the third stage of its development into an adult. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2587.name: Pill Bug
2587.description: A small insect covered in a grey protective carapace. Is known to curl up in a ball when agitated. Live bait for ocean fishing.

2588.name: Crayfish Ball
2588.description: A ball of crayfish and rye flour paste. Processed bait for freshwater fishing.

2589.name: Goby Ball
2589.description: A ball of goby and rye flour paste. Processed bait for ocean fishing.

2590.name: Bloodworm
2590.description: A common earthworm that earns its name from the blood red tint of its body. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2591.name: Rat Tail
2591.description: The thin tail of a rat, often carried by young Lalafellin boys as a good-luck charm. Bait for ocean fishing.

2592.name: Midge Basket
2592.description: A tightly knitted wicker basket filled with a swarm of biting midges. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2593.name: Crab Ball
2593.description: A ball of crabmeat and rye flour paste. Processed bait for ocean fishing.

2594.name: Butterworm
2594.description: If allowed to pupate, this bright-yellow larva will transform into a hideous moth which can devour an entire tunic in a single turn of the sun. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2595.name: Bass Ball
2595.description: A ball of dark bass and sunset flour paste. Processed bait for freshwater fishing.

2596.name: Spoon Worm
2596.description: Also colorfully known as a “fisherman's member,” the stench of this sea-dwelling creature when sliced up is perfect for attracting hungry fish. Live bait for ocean fishing.

2597.name: Syrphid Basket
2597.description: A tightly knitted wicker basket filled with a swarm of angry syrphids. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2598.name: Herring Ball
2598.description: A ball of Indigo herring and sunset flour paste. Processed bait for ocean fishing.

2599.name: Honey Worm
2599.description: The honeyfly will lay its eggs in beehives where, upon hatching, the larvae will feed on honey until pupation. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2600.name: Sand Leech
2600.description: A spineless creature which hides patiently under the desert─ofttimes for several moons─until a larger beast passes nearby. The leech will then attach itself to the new host's leg and proceed to drink deep of the beast's blood until its belly is full, after which it releases itself back to the desert to wait for its next victim. Live bait for dunefishing.

2601.name: Stem Borer
2601.description: This longhorn beetle larva can most commonly be found burrowed deep into the trunks of fallen logs. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2602.name: Sand Gecko
2602.description: When night falls, thousands of these tiny scalekin can be seen scampering about the Sagolii Desert in search of the beetles on which they dine. Live bait for dunefishing.

2603.name: Glowworm
2603.description: It is not known why one end of these vilekin shines bright like a candle. It is, however, known that the light emitted by these creatures makes them a perfect target for hungry fish. Live bait for freshwater and ocean fishing.

2604.name: Rolling Stone
2604.description: When threatened, this tiny desert crustacean will curl itself into a ball which, to the untrained eye, will appear no more than a simple pebble. Live bait for dunefishing.

2605.name: Hoverworm
2605.description: Unlike other vilekin larvae, the hoverworm is not confined to life on the ground. Filling its belly with air allows it to freely ride the thermals over the Sea of Clouds. Live bait for skyfishing.

2606.name: Northern Krill
2606.description: Microscopic shrimp which inhabit the colder sea currents hailing from the northern seas. Live bait for ocean fishing.

2607.name: Caddisfly Larva
2607.description: The fact they are extremely difficult to harvest from their underwater homes makes fishing with caddisfly larvae an option for only the most well-to-do anglers. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

2608.name: Soil Creeper
2608.description: Atypical of common caterpillars, this sand-dwelling species is covered in a rock-like outer skin which serves to prevent the loss of moisture to the hot desert sun. Live bait for dunefishing.

2609.name: Balloon Bug
2609.description: With wings too underdeveloped for flying, this beetle has adopted another method of locomotion about the Sea of Clouds─a second bladder it fills with a noxious lighter-than-air gas. This foul stench is known to attract larger, hungrier creatures. Live bait for skyfishing.

2610.name: Chocobo Fly
2610.description: A freshwater fishing lure made from a chocobo feather. The faint aroma of stable hay brings back memories of a simpler time.

2611.name: Floating Minnow
2611.description: A light plug lure made to resemble a minnow. Especially effective when used to land fish swimming close to the water's surface.

2612.name: Brass Spoon Lure
2612.description: A polished brass lure shaped like a spoon so it will oscillate when dragged through the water, attracting fish. Especially effective in lakes.

2613.name: Shrimp Cage Feeder
2613.description: A small metal cage packed with a pungent mixture of chopped shrimp. Fish are drawn to the area as pieces of shrimp break off from the cage. Processed bait for ocean fishing.

2614.name: Crow Fly
2614.description: A caddisfly-shaped lure crafted from a crow feather. Recommended for freshwater fly fishing novices.

2615.name: Silver Spoon Lure
2615.description: A polished silver lure shaped like a spoon so it will oscillate when dragged through the water, attracting fish. Especially effective in lakes.

2616.name: Steel Jig
2616.description: The weight of this steel lure allows for casting great distances, such as from coastlines.

2617.name: Sinking Minnow
2617.description: A heavy plug lure made to resemble a minnow. Effective in attracting fish from both surface and floor.

2618.name: Snurble Fly
2618.description: A freshwater fishing lure made from a snurble tuft.

2619.name: Heavy Steel Jig
2619.description: The sheer weight of this steel lure allows for casting tremendous distances, such as from coastlines.

2620.name: Spinner
2620.description: A metal river lure designed to resemble both a mayfly and a minnow, allowing for use in a variety of different situations.

2621.name: Krill Cage Feeder
2621.description: A small metal cage packed with northern krill. Fish are drawn to the area as krill float off from the cage. Processed bait for ocean fishing.

2622.name: Mythril Spoon Lure
2622.description: A polished mythril lure shaped like a spoon so it will oscillate when dragged through the water, attracting all manner of lake and marsh life.

2623.name: Wildfowl Fly
2623.description: A freshwater lure made from a wildfowl feather. Its uncanny resemblance to a mayfly makes it irresistible to vilekin-feeding fish such as trout.

2624.name: Topwater Frog
2624.description: A light freshwater lure crafted to resemble a frog. Best suited for larger prey such as pikes and certain trout.

2625.name: Rainbow Spoon Lure
2625.description: A shiny blacklip oyster shell lure shaped like a spoon so it will oscillate when dragged through the water, attracting all manner of aquatic life. Especially effective in lakes.

2626.name: Spinnerbait
2626.description: Several small spinners joined together to resemble a school of fish. Especially effective in rivers.

2627.name: Streamer
2627.description: A freshwater fly designed to sink below the water's surface, and by doing so, attract the larger carnivorous fish living near the floor.

2628.name: Yumizuno
2628.description: A curved man-made lure used traditionally in the Far East, the name means literally “bow horn.” Increases chances of landing a big catch, even when casting from shore.

4551.name: Potion
4551.description: This weak concoction instantly restores a small amount of HP.

4552.name: Hi-Potion
4552.description: This concoction instantly restores a fair amount of HP.

4553.name: Mega-Potion
4553.description: This potent concoction instantly restores a large amount of HP.

4554.name: X-Potion
4554.description: This powerful concoction instantly restores a sizable amount of HP.

4555.name: Ether
4555.description: Processed via the alchemical extraction of aetheric essence occurring in elemental crystals, the contents of this vial instantly restore a small amount of MP.

4556.name: Hi-Ether
4556.description: Processed via the alchemical extraction of aetheric essence occurring in elemental crystals, the contents of this vial instantly restore a fair amount of MP.

4557.name: Mega-Ether
4557.description: Processed via the alchemical extraction of aetheric essence occurring in elemental crystals, the contents of this vial instantly restore a large amount of MP.

4558.name: X-Ether
4558.description: Processed via the alchemical extraction of aetheric essence occurring in elemental crystals, the contents of this vial instantly restore a sizable amount of MP.

4559.name: Elixir
4559.description: This special blend of herbal extracts and aetheric essence rejuvenates body and mind, instantly restoring HP and MP.

4560.name: Hi-Elixir
4560.description: This special blend of herbal extracts and aetheric essence rejuvenates body and mind, instantly restoring HP and MP.

4564.name: Antidote
4564.description: This alchemically crafted restorative instantly cures most instances of poison.

4565.name: Eye Drops
4565.description: This alchemically crafted restorative instantly cures most instances of blindness.

4566.name: Echo Drops
4566.description: This alchemically crafted restorative instantly cures most instances of silence.

4567.name: Smelling Salts
4567.description: This alchemically crafted restorative instantly rouses most sleeping targets.

4568.name: Spine Drops
4568.description: This alchemically crafted restorative instantly cures most instances of paralysis.

4569.name: Gold Needle
4569.description: The properties of this solid-gold needle include curing petrification and pricking fingers.

4570.name: Phoenix Down
4570.description:
The billowy plumage of the fledgling Phoenix─a legendary bird that, upon each fiery death, is said to rise from its own ashes in a literal “blaze of glory.” When placed upon the body of one who is incapacitated, it will instantly revive the person. While some cultures insist that the tailfeather's restorative properties trump those of down, these claims have yet to be proven in any sort of scientific capacity.

※Cannot be used during battle.

4574.name: Weak Poisoning Potion
4574.description: An unstable concoction which induces profuse internal bleeding. Effective on most targets up to level 20. Effect: Poison Duration: 15s

4575.name: Weak Blinding Potion
4575.description: An unstable concoction which induces temporary loss of sight. Effective on most targets up to level 20. Effect: Blind Duration: 12s

4576.name: Weak Silencing Potion
4576.description: An unstable concoction which induces temporary loss of voice. Effective on most targets up to level 20. Effect: Silence Duration: 1s

4577.name: Weak Sleeping Potion
4577.description: An unstable concoction which instantly induces deep slumber. Effective on most targets up to level 20. Effect: Sleep Duration: 20s

4578.name: Weak Paralyzing Potion
4578.description: An unstable concoction which induces temporary loss of motor skills. Effective on most targets up to level 20. Effect: Paralysis Duration: 10s

4579.name: Poisoning Potion
4579.description: A concoction which induces profuse internal bleeding. Effective on most targets up to level 35. Effect: Poison Duration: 15s

4580.name: Blinding Potion
4580.description: A concoction which induces temporary loss of sight. Effective on most targets up to level 35. Effect: Blind Duration: 12s

4581.name: Silencing Potion
4581.description: A concoction which induces temporary loss of voice. Effective on most targets up to level 35. Effect: Silence Duration: 1s

4582.name: Sleeping Potion
4582.description: A concoction which instantly induces deep slumber. Effective on most targets up to level 35. Effect: Sleep Duration: 20s

4583.name: Paralyzing Potion
4583.description: A concoction which induces temporary loss of motor skills. Effective on most targets up to level 35. Effect: Paralysis Duration: 10s

4584.name: Potent Poisoning Potion
4584.description: A powerful concoction which induces profuse internal bleeding. Effective on most targets up to level 50. Effect: Poison Duration: 15s

4585.name: Potent Blinding Potion
4585.description: A powerful concoction which induces temporary loss of sight. Effective on most targets up to level 50. Effect: Blind Duration: 12s

4586.name: Potent Silencing Potion
4586.description: A powerful concoction which induces temporary loss of voice. Effective on most targets up to level 50. Effect: Silence Duration: 1s

4587.name: Potent Sleeping Potion
4587.description: A powerful concoction which instantly induces deep slumber. Effective on most targets up to level 50. Effect: Sleep Duration: 20s

4588.name: Potent Paralyzing Potion
4588.description: A powerful concoction which induces temporary loss of motor skills. Effective on most targets up to level 50. Effect: Paralysis Duration: 10s

4594.name: Potion of Strength
4594.description: This weak concoction temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

4595.name: Potion of Dexterity
4595.description: This weak concoction temporarily increases dexterity. Duration: 15s

4596.name: Potion of Vitality

4598.name: Potion of Mind

4599.description: This concoction temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

4608.name: Mega-Potion of Mind

4609.description: This powerful concoction temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

4610.name: X-Potion of Dexterity

4613.name: X-Potion of Mind
4613.description: This powerful concoction temporarily increases mind. Duration: 15s

4614.name: Fire Ward Potion
4614.description:
Everyone knows this elementally charged concoction slightly increases resistance to fire-aspected damage. What few people know, however, is that after long periods of disuse, the liquid undergoes a natural alchemical transformation that grants it the same coloring properties as common dye.

Cannot be opened in instanced areas such as dungeons, PvP areas, or raids.

Cannot be opened in instanced areas such as dungeons, PvP areas, or raids.

4637.name: Lunar Curtain
4637.description: Unaspected crystals ground into a fine powder that, when cast in the air, form a magical barrier by means of absorbing free-roaming aetherial particles and concentrating them in a single point. Unfortunately, this particular powder has lost all effectiveness.

4638.name: Over-aspected Crystal
4638.description: A crystalline manifestation of aetheric energy exhibiting an extreme elemental charge. Duration: 15s

4639.name: Marmot Steak
4639.description: A fillet of marmot grilled with sweet wild onions and pungent Garlean garlic. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4640.name: Grilled Dodo
4640.description: A lean dodo tenderloin grilled over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4641.name: Mole Loaf
4641.description: A moist, juicy loaf of ground mole meat and onions baked to a golden brown. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4642.name: Meat Miq'abob
4642.description: A traditional Keeper of the Moon dish consisting of tender dodo meat and ripe ruby tomatoes on a stick, roasted to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4643.name: Antelope Steak
4643.description: A slice of lean antelope meat charred on all sides. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4644.name: Aldgoat Steak
4644.description: A traditional dish of the Highland Hyur consisting of a thick cut of aldgoat chuck charred over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4645.name: Smoked Raptor
4645.description: A traditional Hellsguard staple consisting of a raptor leg smoked with aromatic wood chips. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4646.name: Jerked Beef
4646.description: A thick strip of lean buffalo meat dried in the sun. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4647.name: Eft Steak
4647.description: A thick slab of gristly eft meat charred to an abyssal black. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4648.name: Sauteed Coeurl
4648.description: Lean coeurl meat sautéed in creamy butter and a strong red wine to mask the gamy flavor. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4649.name: Roast Dodo
4649.description: A whole dodo slow-roasted over an open fire and stuffed with a savory blend of bread and nuts. Often used in year-end ceremonies as an offering to the Twelve. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4650.name: Boiled Egg
4650.description: A boiled chicken egg. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4651.name: Dodo Omelette
4651.description: A traditional Plainsfolk dish made from deftly whisked dodo eggs fried in butter and expertly formed into a soft, fluffy mountain. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4652.name: Mustard Eggs
4652.description: A complex dish consisting of a boiled egg covered in mustard. Preparation should only be attempted by the most skilled culinarians. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4653.name: Fried Egg
4653.description: A puk egg fried in butter, sunny-side up. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4654.name: Scrambled Eggs
4654.description: A breakfast dish consisting of several puk eggs scrambled and fried with white truffles. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4655.name: Deviled Eggs
4655.description: Boiled eggs stuffed with creamed egg yolk and fish paste. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4656.name: Apkallu Omelette
4656.description: Apkallu eggs beaten and then cooked in rich butter until fluffy and light. A favorite in Vylbrand's coastal hamlets. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4657.name: Braised Pipira
4657.description: A fresh pipira braised with creamy butter and chanterelle mushrooms. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4658.name: Tree Toad Legs
4658.description: A generous portion of battered and fried tree toad legs served with a side of snails. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4659.name: Boiled Crayfish
4659.description: A crayfish boiled in hot water. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4660.name: Grilled Trout
4660.description: A fresh princess trout sprinkled with salt and grilled over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4661.name: Grilled Carp
4661.description: A plump maiden carp sprinkled with salt and grilled to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4662.name: Salmon Meuniere
4662.description: A traditional Keeper of the Moon dish consisting of a thick fillet of salmon breaded with flour and fried in rich butter and savory spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4663.name: Mugwort Carp
4663.description: This Velodyna carp has been covered with a copious amount of fragrant mugwort before being roasted over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4664.name: Stuffed Cabbage
4664.description: A traditional Sea Wolf dish consisting of pike wrapped in cabbage and steamed until soft. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4665.name: Lava Toad Legs
4665.description: A generous portion of battered and fried lava toad legs served with a side of snails. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4666.name: Salt Cod
4666.description: A tiger cod salted and sun-dried. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4667.name: Raw Oyster
4667.description: A fresh, raw oyster, shucked and splashed with a squeeze of sun lemon. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4668.name: Boiled Bream
4668.description: A whole bream boiled until thoroughly cooked, and then covered in a thick sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4669.name: Baked Sole
4669.description: A thin slice of oven-baked black sole smothered in a gil bun sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4670.name: Tuna Miq'abob
4670.description: A traditional Seeker of the Sun dish consisting of light, flaky tuna and ripe peppers on a stick, roasted to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4671.name: Salt Cod Puffs
4671.description: Balls of ground salt cod dipped in batter and fried in oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4672.name: Pan-fried Mahi-mahi
4672.description: Fillets of fresh mahi-mahi covered in a light blanket of flour and fried in oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4673.name: Mutton Stew
4673.description: A hearty stew made from lean mutton loin and a selection of freshly picked vegetables. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4674.name: Lentils and Chestnuts
4674.description: A stew consisting of Lalafellin lentils and Gridanian chestnuts boiled in sour red wine. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4675.name: Antelope Stew
4675.description: A thick, flavorful soup made by simmering a variety of wild vegetables and antelope meat over low heat for several hours. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4676.name: Orobon Stew
4676.description: A hearty soup made from the liver of an orobon. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4677.name: Ratatouille
4677.description: A nutritious soup made from a variety of vegetables sautéed in lavender oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4678.name: Beef Stew
4678.description: A sumptuous stew made by slowly cooking buffalo meat in sour red wine for several hours until it falls off the bone. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4679.name: Dzemael Gratin
4679.description: Passed down through generations by the Dzemael family, this dish consists of thinly sliced popotoes and eft tails baked in a creamy white sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4680.name: Zoni
4680.description: A clear soup served on special occasions. Its origins are in the Far East. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4681.name: Jack-o'-lantern
4681.description: An ogre pumpkin carved into a grinning face and boiled in a sweet sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4682.name: Parsnip Salad
4682.description: A salad made with fried parsnip slices and garnished with a drizzle of fragrant olive oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4683.name: Roasted Nopales
4683.description: Cactus leaves roasted like a steak and slathered in a colorful vegetable sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4684.name: Spinach Saute
4684.description: A simple dish consisting of Cieldalaes spinach sautéed in rich salted butter. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4685.name: Alligator Salad
4685.description: A simple salad made from slices of alligator pear tossed in dark vinegar. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4686.name: Sauerkraut
4686.description: Chopped midland cabbage pickled with salt. A staple on all Lominsan trade ships, as it is said to prevent the scurvy. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4687.name: Stuffed Artichoke
4687.description: A roasted artichoke stuffed with a savory blend of pungent cheese and succulent crabmeat. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4688.name: Landtrap Salad
4688.description: A salad made with the still-twitching leaves of a landtrap and garnished with a drizzle of fragrant olive oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4689.name: Chanterelle Saute
4689.description: Wild chanterelles sautéed in butter. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4690.name: Chicken and Mushrooms
4690.description: Simple, home-cooked fare consisting of chicken sautéed with gil buns. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4691.name: Forest Miq'abob
4691.description: A traditional Keeper of the Moon dish consisting of freshly picked mushrooms on a stick, roasted to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4692.name: Raptor Stew
4692.description: A tender piece of lean raptor shank stewed with mushrooms. A Carline Canopy specialty. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4693.name: Button Mushroom Saute
4693.description: Freshly picked button mushrooms sautéed in olive oil and garlic. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4694.name: Buttons in a Blanket
4694.description: Button mushrooms wrapped in parboiled cabbage and stewed in a savory soup. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4695.name: Black Truffle Risotto
4695.description: A creamy blend of rice and cheese, topped off with slices of rare, fragrant black truffle. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4696.name: Flatbread
4696.description: Simple, unleavened bread made of flour and water. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4697.name: Walnut Bread
4697.description: A soft white bread filled with fragrant walnuts. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4698.name: Honey Muffin
4698.description: A traditional Midlander cake made with a generous portion of honey. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4699.name: Dark Pretzel
4699.description: A traditional Dunesfolk bread twisted into the shape of a knot and sprinkled generously with coarse-ground salt before being baked to a deep brown. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4700.name: Cornbread
4700.description: A fluffy yellow bread made from cornmeal. A specialty at the Drowning Wench in Limsa Lominsa. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4701.name: Acorn Cookie
4701.description: A crisp cookie made with iron acorn paste. A favorite of the Qiqirn. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4702.name: Knight's Bread
4702.description: A hard, leavened rye bread traditionally eaten by the knights of Ishgard. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4703.name: La Noscean Toast
4703.description: A slice of bread soaked in a mixture of buffalo milk and eggs, and then fried in creamy butter. A specialty at the Drowning Wench in Limsa Lominsa. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4704.name: Finger Sandwich
4704.description: The Bismarck's take on a common meal popular amongst Galadion Bay's dockworkers. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4705.name: Mizzenmast Biscuit
4705.description: A complimentary acorn treat baked by the Mizzenmast Inn. May contain nuts. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4706.name: Roost Biscuit
4706.description: A complimentary acorn treat baked by the Roost. May contain nuts. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4707.name: Hourglass Biscuit
4707.description: A complimentary acorn treat baked by the Hourglass. May contain nuts. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4708.name: Rabbit Pie
4708.description: A traditional pastry dish of the Wildwood Elezen formed to resemble a rabbit, but not necessarily containing any meat of leporine origin. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4709.name: Apple Tart
4709.description: A round pastry filled with sweet faerie apples and fragrant spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4710.name: Shepherd's Pie
4710.description: Pulled antelope shank covered with mashed popotoes and baked in a golden, buttery pie crust. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4711.name: Eel Pie
4711.description: Plump, protein-rich eel baked in a flaky crust. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4712.name: Blood Currant Tart
4712.description: A sweet and sour pastry made with a generous portion of blood currants. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4713.name: Crowned Pie
4713.description: A galette-style pie decorated with a golden crown and served at Ishgardian festivals. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4714.name: Tomato Pie
4714.description: Considered a delicacy in Gridania, this pie is arranged with sliced tomatoes, giving it the appearance of a flower garden. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4715.name: Trapper's Quiche
4715.description: Eggs, cheese, and chopped eft blended together and baked in a flaky crust. A favorite amongst Ishgardian nobles. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4716.name: Frumenty
4716.description: A tasty gruel of cracked wheat, raisins, and spices boiled in aldgoat milk. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4717.name: Stone Soup
4717.description: This vegetable soup is made cold and then heated by inserting a scalding rock. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4718.name: Pea Soup
4718.description: An emerald green soup made from mashed jade peas. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4719.name: Cawl Cennin
4719.description: Soup made from leeks and onions sautéed in butter and mixed with chicken stock. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4720.name: Fish Soup
4720.description: A light soup of butter-sautéed whitefish and vegetables. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4721.name: Bouillabaisse
4721.description: A piping hot Midlander-style soup chock-full of succulent samples from each of the five seas of Eorzea. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4722.name: Mashed Popotoes
4722.description: Boiled popotoes, mashed into a smooth, creamy paste. This dish, originating in the New World, is best with a generous dollop of salty butter. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4723.name: Cheese Risotto
4723.description: Sticky rice doused in a rich cheese sauce and simmered over low heat until it reaches just the right consistency. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4724.name: Cheese Souffle
4724.description: A light, fluffy egg dish flavored with only the finest fragrant cheeses. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4725.name: Rolanberry Cheesecake
4725.description: Rich cheesecake slathered in a sticky, sweet rolanberry compote. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4726.name: Mint Lassi
4726.description: A cool and refreshing drink made from cultured milk. Popular in the Near Eastern citystate of RadzatHan for its ability to offset the blistering heat of the Thavnairian midday sun. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4727.name: Rolanberry Lassi
4727.description: A sweet and tangy drink made from cultured milk. Popular in the Near Eastern citystate of RadzatHan for its ability to soothe the burn of heavily spiced dishes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4728.name: Raisins
4728.description: Dried lowland grapes, sweetened in the sun. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4729.name: Snowflake Peak
4729.description: A fluffy Starlight Celebration dessert popular in Ishgard. This towering cake is formed to resemble one of the snowy peaks of Coerthas. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4730.name: Dried Plums
4730.description: Dried pixie plums, sweetened in the sun. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4731.name: Ginger Cookie
4731.description: A sweet and spicy cookie cut into the shape of a legendary black mage said to have recovered MP by eating the crispy treats. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4732.name: Crumpet
4732.description: A savory type of leavened bread, often doused in butter and honey and eaten with a cup of piping hot tea. A specialty at the Quicksand in Ul'dah. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4733.name: Pastry Fish
4733.description: An apple-filled pastry shaped to resemble the legendary sunfish. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4734.name: Pineapple Ponzecake
4734.description: The ponzecake earns its name from the fact that the total weight of the dry ingredients (before pineapples) equals a single ponze. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4735.name: Bubble Chocolate
4735.description: A luscious bonbon made from dark chocolate infused with lighter-than-air bubbles. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4736.name: Pearl Chocolate
4736.description: A rich bonbon made from sweet white chocolate infused with heavier-than-air bubbles. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4737.name: White Chocolate
4737.description: A heart-shaped morsel of pure white chocolate. Those adventurers allergic to normal chocolate can rest at ease, for this silky smooth confectionary does not actually contain any kukuru powder. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4738.name: Heart Chocolate
4738.description: A heart-shaped morsel of dark chocolate, chock-full of bittersweet memories. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4739.name: Consecrated Chocolate
4739.description: This heart chocolate has been blessed by an ordained sister of the Temple of Menphina. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4740.name: Princess Pudding
4740.description: A tasty Starlight Celebration dessert popular in Limsa Lominsa. This cake-like sweet is formed to resemble the legendary notorious monster, Princess Pudding─a terrible beast rumored to once have roamed the meadows of La Noscea. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4741.name: Ore Fruitcake
4741.description: A Starlight Celebration dessert popular in Ul'dah. This cake, if it can be called that, is unparalleled in hardness and density. Every season, at least thirty-seven severe injuries are attributed to various fruitcake-related accidents. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4742.name: Starlight Log
4742.description: A sweet Starlight Celebration dessert popular in Gridania. This cylindrical cake is formed to resemble one of the Black Shroud's many sacred trees. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4743.name: Years-old Pumpkin Cookie
4743.description: A devilish imp is thought to have made this slightly burnt biscuit shaped like a pumpkin head nigh on a decade ago. One can only wonder what ingredients it contains. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4744.name: Sweet Rice Cake
4744.description: This three-layered rice cake has been molded into a diamond shape. The coloring used in the layers has medicinal properties. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4745.name: Orange Juice
4745.description: Juice freshly squeezed from ripe La Noscean oranges. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4746.name: Grape Juice
4746.description: Juice freshly squeezed from plump noble grapes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4747.name: Apple Juice
4747.description: Juice freshly squeezed from shiny red mirror apples. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4748.name: Pineapple Juice
4748.description: Juice freshly squeezed from sun-ripened prickly pineapples. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4749.name: Chamomile Tea
4749.description: A delicately fragranced infusion brewed from tiny yellow chamomile flowers. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4750.name: Mulled Tea
4750.description: A pungent infusion brewed from several exotic spices and herbs. Enjoyed in the sultanate of Ul'dah. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4751.name: Mineral Water
4751.description: Clear water taken from a mountain spring near Ishgard. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4752.name: Aldgoat Milk
4752.description: The thick, creamy milk of an aldgoat nanny. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4753.name: Buffalo Milk
4753.description: The smooth, light milk of a buffalo cow. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4754.name: Cottage Cheese
4754.description: A creamy mixture of unripened cheese curds. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4755.name: Blue Cheese
4755.description: This creamy, pungent cheese gets its distinct flavor from the thin layer of grey-blue mold growing upon it. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4756.name: Cream Cheese
4756.description: A smooth, buttery cheese made from cultured buffalo milk. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4757.name: Rolanberry Cheese
4757.description: Cream cheese blended with tart dried rolanberries. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4759.name: Mutton Loin
4759.description: A lean cut of meat taken from below a sheep's rib cage.

4760.name: Dodo Tenderloin
4760.description: A lean piece of meat taken from under the short ribs of a dodo.

4761.name: Mole Meat
4761.description: A fist-sized chunk of lean, bloody meat cleanly sliced from the carcass of a pesky mole.

4762.name: Salamander Tail
4762.description: Sinewy meat taken from the tail of a salamander.

4763.name: Young Dodo Roaster
4763.description: A whole young dodo, small enough to fit in most conventional household ovens.

4764.name: Chicken Breast
4764.description: A tender piece of meat taken from the breast of a chicken.

4765.name: Antelope Shank
4765.description: A tough piece of meat taken from the upper leg of an antelope.

4766.name: Aldgoat Chuck
4766.description: A large, tender slab of meat taken from the shoulder of an aldgoat.

4767.name: Raptor Shank
4767.description: An extra-lean, tough piece of meat taken from the leg of a raptor.

4768.name: Buffalo Sirloin
4768.description: A cut of tender, lean meat taken from the rear back of a buffalo.

4769.name: Eft Tail
4769.description: Sinewy meat taken from the tail of an eft.

4770.name: Orobon Liver
4770.description: The soft liver of a deepwater orobon.

4771.name: Megalocrab Leg
4771.description: A fat megalocrab leg, bursting with sweet, juicy meat.

4772.name: Chicken Egg
4772.description: The egg of a domesticated chicken.

4773.name: Dodo Egg
4773.description: The heavy egg of a wild dodo.

4774.name: Puk Egg
4774.description: The lightweight egg of a puk.

4775.name: Apkallu Egg
4775.description: The large egg of a wild apkallu.

4776.name: Malm Kelp
4776.description:
This dark green variety of seaweed found in all five of Eorzea's seas has been known to grow up to a malm in length.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4777.name: Wild Onion
4777.description: A pungent bulb vegetable native to the Near East.

4778.name: Coerthan Carrot
4778.description: A long orange root vegetable commonly grown in the rocky alpine soil of the Coerthas region.

4779.name: Ogre Pumpkin
4779.description: A bright-orange squash which sweetens in flavor when cooked.

4780.name: Ruby Tomato
4780.description: Though many botanists claim this tangy blood red specimen is more closely related to a fruit than a vegetable, it is widely accepted across Eorzea as the latter.

4781.name: Alpine Parsnip
4781.description: A long white root vegetable indigenous to the mountainous region of Coerthas.

4782.name: La Noscean Lettuce
4782.description: A crisp leafy vegetable native to the plains of La Noscea.

4783.name: Cieldalaes Spinach
4783.description: An iron-rich leafy vegetable native to the Cieldalaes.

4784.name: Highland Parsley
4784.description: Oft used as a garnish in other dishes, this pungent vegetable grows in abundance in the mountainous region of upper La Noscea.

4785.name: Paprika
4785.description: A pepper which can be dried and ground to make a mild red spice. It is often used in medicines, as well as in cooking.

4786.name: Nopales
4786.description: An edible oval-leaved cactus brought back by explorers of the New World.

4787.name: Popoto
4787.description: A starchy tuberous vegetable originally introduced to Eorzea by explorers from the distant western continent.

4788.name: Wizard Eggplant
4788.description: A firm purple-skinned vegetable indigenous to the mountains of the Near East. A common wives' tale claims if you eat too many of this vegetable, you will turn into one.

4789.name: Midland Cabbage
4789.description: A round leafy vegetable which prefers the steady climate of the Black Shroud.

4790.name: Aloe
4790.description: A thick spiny-leaved cactus indigenous to the southern continent of Meracydia. The Miqo'te are known to treat severe burns with the cool gel-like substance found inside the leaves.

4791.name: Salt Leek
4791.description: A long, pungent, leafy vegetable that lacks a bulb like that of its cousin, the onion.

4792.name: Ramhorn Zucchini
4792.description: This long, thin variety of squash earns its name from its resemblance to the horn of a mountain ram.

4793.name: Maiden Artichoke
4793.description: The leaf-like bud of an artichoke plant. Due to the roughness of its petals, only the fleshy lower portions can be consumed, as well as the center of the bud, commonly known as the “heart.”

4794.name: Shriekshroom
4794.description: The underdeveloped sporeling of a funguar.

4795.name: Chanterelle
4795.description: An edible mushroom known for its leaf-like appearance as well as its fruit-like fragrance.

4796.name: Gil Bun
4796.description: This tiny round mushroom has a cap which resembles a coin, and is known for its rich flavor and pungent aroma.

4797.name: Button Mushroom
4797.description: A small white mushroom commonly found in moist areas across Eorzea.

4798.name: White Truffle
4798.description: A rare white mushroom that grows in the soil, rather than above it, making the specimen almost impossible to locate. It is treasured as a delicacy for its unique aroma.

4799.name: Ratstool
4799.description: The underdeveloped “sporeling” of a myconid. Popular myth has that rats will use the chair-shaped fungus as a place to rest.

4800.name: Black Truffle
4800.description: A rare black mushroom that grows in the soil, rather than above it, making the specimen almost impossible to locate. It is treasured as a delicacy for its unique aroma.

4801.name: Dalamud Nut
4801.description: The shell which encases this walnut is reminiscent of the (now fallen) lesser moon of its namesake.

4802.name: Moon Nut
4802.description: The ghostly white shell which encases this walnut is reminiscent of the celestial body of its namesake.

4803.name: Kukuru Bean
4803.description: This seed of the kukuru tree is the primary ingredient in chocolate.

4804.name: Cinderfoot Olive
4804.description: The seed of an olive tree, often preserved in brine or pressed to make oil.

4805.name: Gridanian Chestnut
4805.description: The seed of a chestnut tree, this savory nut is covered in a coat of prickly spikes.

4806.name: Gridanian Walnut
4806.description: The seed of a walnut tree, this fragrant nut is covered by a thin, fleshy outer shell and a hard inner shell.

4807.name: Iron Acorn
4807.description: The seed of an oak tree, this small nut is covered by an extremely hard outer shell.

4808.name: Lowland Grapes
4808.description: A semisweet variety of grape which has adapted to the volcanic soil abundant on Vylbrand. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4809.name: La Noscean Orange
4809.description: A sweet citrus fruit known to thrive in the temperate climate of lower La Noscea. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4810.name: Faerie Apple
4810.description: A tart variety of apple commonly found growing in the cool mountain passes of Coerthas. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4811.name: Sun Lemon
4811.description: A sour citrus fruit indigenous to the Near East. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4812.name: Pixie Plums
4812.description: A tart fruit commonly grown in mountain orchards in the Coerthas region. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4813.name: Alligator Pear
4813.description: A soft green fruit, also known as “Shroud butter.” Though not thought to be indigenous to Eorzea, it is not certain how the plant first came to the realm. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4814.name: Blood Currants
4814.description: A tart red berry found growing throughout the Black Shroud. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4815.name: Rolanberry
4815.description: A tart fruit─one of few still found growing in the devastated region of Mor Dhona. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4816.name: Prickly Pineapple
4816.description: A sweet and tangy fruit covered in a thick, spike-laden skin. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

4817.name: Sunflower Seeds
4817.description: The fruit of a sunflower, this small seed is covered by a thin black shell.

4818.name: Buffalo Beans
4818.description: A common variety of green bean recognizable by its long thin pods. Buffalo are said to be fond of the beans, and have been known to eat entire crops if left unchecked.

4819.name: Sticky Rice
4819.description: This grain is imported from a land far to the east. When cooked, it has a consistency slightly more glutinous than normal rice.

4820.name: Lalafellin Lentil
4820.description: Thin round beans resembling tiny convex lenses. Thought to have been introduced to Eorzea by the realm's first Lalafellin settlers.

4821.name: Millioncorn
4821.description: Hundreds of sweet yellow kernels adorn each cob of this vegetable native to the recently discovered New World.

4822.name: Jade Peas
4822.description: Sweet green beans recognizable by their thin, crescent-shaped pods.

4823.name: Rye
4823.description: A dark variety of rye grass commonly found growing in the higher elevations of Mor Dhona and Coerthas.

4824.name: Sunset Wheat
4824.description: A common variety of golden brown wheat eaten as a staple in many of Eorzea's citystates.

4828.name: Cinnamon
4828.description: The sweet-smelling bark of the cinnamon tree is often dried and ground into a spice used to add flavor to confectionaries, though it is also commonly used in medicines.

4829.name: Garlean Garlic
4829.description: A pungent spice used to flavor many different varieties of dishes. It is also thought to ward off vampiric bats, but there is no evidence to substantiate that claim.

4830.name: Black Pepper
4830.description: An aromatic spice used in cooking as well as pickling.

4831.name: Cloves
4831.description: A sweet-smelling spice made from the dried buds of the clove tree. It is used to flavor confectionaries, and as an essential oil.

4832.name: Marjoram
4832.description: A sweet-smelling herb used in cooking and in medicines.

4833.name: Vanilla Beans
4833.description: A sweet-smelling spice made from the dried pod of the rare vanilla plant. It is often used in the making confectionaries as well as medicines.

4834.name: Galago Mint
4834.description: A leafy herb with a crisp, fragrant aroma. It is often used in cooking and in teas, as well as for its essential oil.

4835.name: Ala Mhigan Mustard
4835.description: When dried and ground into a fine powder, this yellow-tinged spice can add quite the kick to any dish.

4836.name: Pearl Ginger
4836.description: An exotic root vegetable native to the Far East that is often dried, ground, and used in cooking as well as in the creation of medicines.

4837.name: Midland Basil
4837.description: A fragrant herb used to flavor various meat and poultry dishes.

4838.name: Dragon Pepper
4838.description: A red-hot spice known to cause severe burns in the mouths of those who consume too many.

4839.name: Laurel
4839.description: A savory spice made from the dried leaves of the laurel bush, or as it is known by some, the yanny bush.

4840.name: Mugwort
4840.description: The young leaves of the mugwort plant are used not only as a spice in cooking, but also as a curative agent in various unguents.

4841.name: Thyme
4841.description: A fragrant herb used to flavor various meat and poultry dishes.

4842.name: Almonds
4842.description: A tear-shaped nut which can be used to season exotic sweets, or pressed for its fragrant oil.

4843.name: Desert Saffron
4843.description: This spice made from the dried styles of the desert saffron flower gives a bright-yellow color to dishes.

4844.name: Nutmeg
4844.description: A sweet-smelling seed that is ground into a powder and used to flavor pastries and tea. It is also widely used in Far Eastern medicines.

4845.name: Sagolii Sage
4845.description: A savory herb often found growing in parched desert environments. It is used in cooking and various medicinal ointments and unguents.

4846.name: Thanalan Tea Leaves
4846.description: These leaves, when dried and steeped in hot water, create a sweet-smelling tea known for its curative properties.

4847.name: Table Salt
4847.description: Finely ground salt used not only for flavoring foods, but for pickling and preserving as well.

4848.name: Maple Sugar
4848.description: Crystallized sugar made from boiling down maple syrup.

4849.name: Maple Syrup
4849.description: A sweet, dark liquid made by boiling down maple sap.

4850.name: Honey
4850.description: Bees make this sweet golden honey from the nectar of flowers.

4851.name: Powdered Sugar
4851.description: Sweet, snow-like sugar, perfect for dusting Starlight Celebration sweets.

4852.name: Sweet Cream
4852.description: The butterfat-rich layer skimmed off of buffalo milk. Widely used in confectionaries.

4853.name: Smooth Butter
4853.description: A smooth, fatty cream made by churning buffalo milk.

4854.name: Kukuru Butter
4854.description: A thick oil extracted from kukuru beans. Used in making chocolate.

4855.name: Kukuru Powder
4855.description: Roasted kukuru beans ground into a fine powder. Used in making chocolate.

4857.name: Olive Oil
4857.description: A fragrant light-green oil extracted from pressed olives.

4859.name: Cider Vinegar
4859.description: A fruity vinegar made from fermenting faerie apples.

4860.name: Dark Vinegar
4860.description: A high-quality distilled vinegar made from select lowland grapes.

4861.name: Pie Dough
4861.description: Simple pie dough made of flour and butter.

4862.name: Sour Red
4862.description: Made from lowland grapes grown on arid soil, this vinegary wine is more suited to cooking than it is to drinking (though that does little to stop most Lominsan pirates from drowning their sorrows in the phenolic seepage).

4863.name: Gelatin
4863.description: A clear gelling agent extracted from animal skin and fish bones.

4864.name: Fish Stock
4864.description: Broth created from boiling down the flesh and bones of various types of seafood.

4865.name: Tomato Sauce
4865.description: A tangy sauce made from crushed tomatoes.

4866.name: Dodo Stuffing
4866.description: A mixture of dried bread, nuts, and fruit, blended with several savory spices.

4867.name: Chicken Stock
4867.description: A clear golden broth made by boiling chicken bones.

4868.name: Gysahl Greens
4868.description: A leafy vegetable indigenous to the Near East. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the greens are often used as fodder for the animals. Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by offering multiple servings)

4869.name: Merlthor Goby
4869.description:
A vividly striped saltwater fish commonly found in the Strait of Merlthor.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4870.name: Lominsan Anchovy
4870.description:
These small saltwater fish form massive schools resembling colossal sea creatures to discourage predators from approaching.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4871.name: Finger Shrimp
4871.description:
A common saltwater shrimp found in the plankton-rich waters of the Sea of Jade.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4872.name: Ocean Cloud
4872.description:
A semi-transparent jellyfish commonly found in the Strait of Merlthor, where it goes through nine separate stages of development before reaching adulthood.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4873.name: Sea Cucumber
4873.description:
A purple, spiny, sluglike creature found in the shallows off of the island of Mazlaya, and treasured in the Far East as a delicacy.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4874.name: Harbor Herring
4874.description:
This particular variety of herring will gather in busy harbors to feed on the small sea creatures which consume the waste dumped from ships.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4875.name: Vongola Clam
4875.description:
A tasty bivalve mollusk commonly found on and near the island of Bianaq.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4876.name: Coral Butterfly
4876.description:
A colorful saltwater fish commonly found in the warm seas around the island of Bianaq. Not known for its flavor, the wavekin is most often kept as a pet.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4877.name: Moraby Flounder
4877.description:
A flat bottom-feeder commonly found in the relatively calm waters of Moraby Bay.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4878.name: Pebble Crab
4878.description:
A small bluish grey crab found in tide pools along the La Noscean coast.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4879.name: Tiger Cod
4879.description:
A striped saltwater fish indigenous to the cold northern waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4880.name: Helmet Crab
4880.description:
This saltwater wavekin, most commonly found in the shallows of the Strait of Merlthor, is protected by a hard shell resembling a helmet.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4881.name: Rothlyt Oyster
4881.description:
Also known as the milk of the sea, these tasty bivalve mollusks can be found on sea rocks all around Eorzea, but it is said the plumpest, most succulent grow in the nutrient-rich waters of the Rothlyt Sound.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4882.name: Navigator's Dagger
4882.description:
These thin, long saltwater fish will oft jump out of the water and glide for yalms across the surface, using their pectoral fins as ersatz wings.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4883.name: Angelfish
4883.description:
A small colorful fish native to the warmer waters of the seas near Meracydia. Since the Calamity, more and more have been caught off Eorzea's southern coastline.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4884.name: Razor Clam
4884.description:
A long bivalve mollusk most commonly found buried in the beaches of islands situated in the Rhotano Sea. They are known to leap out of their burrows when surprised or agitated.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4885.name: Blue Octopus
4885.description:
The somber blue tone of its skin does not make this variety of octopus any more docile than its crimson cousins. It is a crafty hunter who lurks in the shadows, snatching unwary prey and strangling it with its powerful eight arms before shredding it with its razor-sharp beak.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4886.name: Blowfish
4886.description:
A saltwater fish that, when provoked, blows up to three times its normal size to intimidate the would-be attacker. It is also known to have an organ which contains a potent silencing poison.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4887.name: Saber Sardine
4887.description:
This tiny saltwater fish travels in giant schools through the Indigo Deep searching for food. Its razor-like fins have been known to cut straight through the strongest of fishing nets.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4888.name: Ogre Barracuda
4888.description:
A large saltwater wavekin that roams the Rhotano Sea in small schools, preying on smaller fish such as anchovies or sardines.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4889.name: Monkfish
4889.description:
This deep-sea-dwelling wavekin attracts its prey with a tiny glowing appendage protruding forth from its disfigured head, and then swallows the poor victim whole with its unnaturally large mouth.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4890.name: Sea Bo
4890.description:
When swimming upright, this strange sea creature closely resembles a riding chocobo, hence the name.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4891.name: Bianaq Bream
4891.description:
A cherry-colored saltwater fish found in abundance in all of Eorzea's five seas, though it is said those caught near Bianaq are the largest.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4892.name: Black Sole
4892.description:
A flat bottom-feeder commonly found in the frigid waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4893.name: Hammerhead Shark
4893.description:
A ravenous shark with a hammer-shaped head it uses to quickly detect its prey. This wavekin is most commonly found living in small schools in the Strait of Merlthor.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4894.name: Sea Pickle
4894.description:
A blue, spiny, sluglike creature found in the shallows off of Vylbrand, and considered a delicacy by Sea Wolves.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4895.name: Indigo Herring
4895.description:
This blue-backed, white-bellied saltwater fish native to the Indigo Deep is known to migrate in large schools from north to south in the winter, and back again in the summer.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4896.name: Ash Tuna
4896.description:
A large saltwater fish known to migrate between the Sea of Jade and the Sea of Ash. In recent years, overfishing by boats from the Far East has led to a significant drop in their numbers.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4897.name: Leafy Seadragon
4897.description:
Though once found all across the five seas, seadragon numbers are now but a mere fraction of what they once were, due in part to Ishgardian culling parties.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4898.name: Fullmoon Sardine
4898.description:
A tiny saltwater fish native to the waters of Vylbrand. Unlike other wavekin, they feed only at night, their activity increasing as Menphina waxes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4899.name: Haraldr Haddock
4899.description:
A tasty saltwater fish indigenous to the cold waters of the Bloodbrine Sea. Its name comes from a legendary northern king who it was said would only eat the fatty flesh of this wavekin.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4900.name: Whitelip Oyster
4900.description:
A bivalve mollusk found on the cliffs and rocks lining the Rhotano Sea. On rare occasions, sand will become trapped inside the shell and gradually form into a pearl.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4901.name: Lavender Remora
4901.description:
A violet-hued fish found in the warmer waters of Eorzea's southern seas.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4902.name: Balloonfish
4902.description:
A saltwater fish covered in scores of sharp spines, discouraging would-be predators from dining on this otherwise defenseless fry.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4903.name: Silver Shark
4903.description:
A large, spindle-shaped shark commonly found in the Sea of Ash and known to attack without provocation.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4904.name: Wahoo
4904.description:
A razor-fanged saltwater fish known to migrate throughout the warm waters of the Sea of Ash, following the schools of shrimp on which it feeds.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4905.name: Raincaller
4905.description:
A deep-blue freshwater fish native to the lakes and swamps of the Black Shroud. They can be seen sticking their heads out of the water whenever it rains, leading people to believe it is the fish summoning the storm. However, naturalists have surmised that the fish are simply rising to the surface in search of food, mistaking the drops of water for insects.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4906.name: Nautilus
4906.description:
A giant cephalopod characterized by its spectacular whorling shell. Commonly found in the nutrient-rich Bay of Dha'yuz, the wavekin are thought by sailors and pirates to be the heralds of the Navigator, Llymlaen, and their shells are often carved into celebratory chalices.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4907.name: Pike Eel
4907.description:
When stretched straight from head to tail, the longest of saltwater pike eels can measure more than a full yalm in length.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4908.name: Mummer Wrasse
4908.description:
This saltwater fish's name comes from the odd lump on its head, thought to resemble a mummer's motley cap.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4909.name: Plaice
4909.description:
A bottom-feeding flatfish, the plaice is most commonly found blending into the sands covering the sea floor near the Isles of Umbra.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4910.name: Sea Devil
4910.description:
Legends tell of giant sea devils emerging from the sea to wrap their many arms around ships and drag them to the abyss. This seems impossible today, as the largest catches in recent memory are little more than a yalm across.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4911.name: Rock Lobster
4911.description:
A large crimson crustacean commonly found hiding in the rocks off the shores of islands dotting the Rhotano Sea. The rich, flavorful tails are regarded as a delicacy across Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4912.name: Goosefish
4912.description:
A large-mouthed saltwater glutton, thought to feed on most anything, from smaller fish, to seaweed, to the flesh of drowned sailors.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4913.name: Little Thalaos
4913.description:
Despite the modifier, the little Thalaos is anything but small; though compared to the Thalaos of legend, even the largest of sea serpents would be deemed “little.” Normally only found far offshore in the Indigo Deep, this rare wavekin can sometimes be found swimming near the eastern cliffs of La Noscea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4914.name: Shall Shell
4914.description:
This enormous bivalve mollusk is easily recognizable by the unique wave pattern found on its outer shell.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4915.name: Mahi-mahi
4915.description:
This deep-sea predator is not only massive, but deceptively fast. Some sailors swear that a mahi-mahi can make the journey from Meracydia to the Cieldalaes in less than a fortnight, though knowing most sailors, that claim may be slightly exaggerated.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4916.name: Halibut
4916.description:
While similar to the sole or plaice in appearance and behavior, the halibut is much larger than both, and can feed a Lalafellin family of five for several turns of the sun.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4917.name: Mazlaya Marlin
4917.description:
A large saltwater fish found in the warm waters south of the Sea of Ash and known for its remarkable swimming speed.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4918.name: Coelacanth
4918.description:
An ancient species of saltwater fish which appears to have flourished in times well before the Allagans built their empire.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4919.name: Giant Squid
4919.description:
This rarely seen giant cephalopod makes an appearance in ancient Sea Wolf mythology as the creature on which the legendary whale Bismarck fed.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4920.name: Gigant Octopus
4920.description:
A legendary cephalopod feared by sailors young and old. Tales of these cyclopean creatures tearing up ships and dragging them down to the abyss can still be heard in alehouses and inns across Hydaelyn.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4921.name: Sunfish
4921.description:
Legends say this giant saltwater fish will help those stranded in the water by allowing them to ride it back to shore.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4922.name: Dinichthys
4922.description:
A legendary saltwater fish covered in thick armor and said to have once been worshipped by the Sahagin.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4923.name: Megalodon
4923.description:
A legendary shark with a mouth so big and an appetite so large, it is said it can swallow an adult Roegadyn whole.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4924.name: Titanic Sawfish
4924.description:
Legends say that this gargantuan saltwater fish once ripped a hundred-man galleon in two with its saw-like head.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

4925.name: Crayfish
4925.description:
A brown-carapaced freshwater crustacean commonly found in the rivers and lakes of Aldenard.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4926.name: Chub
4926.description:
A common freshwater fish found in rivers across Eorzea. Prefers the slow-moving waters found near a river's mouth to the rapids found upstream.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4927.name: Striped Goby
4927.description:
A brightly striped freshwater fish native to the rivers and lakes of the Coerthas and Mor Dhona regions.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4928.name: Dwarf Catfish
4928.description:
An undersized variety of catfish found in still, swampy waters across Aldenard.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4929.name: Bone Crayfish
4929.description:
A white-carapaced freshwater crustacean commonly found living in caves or deep lakes where sunlight is absent.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4930.name: Princess Trout
4930.description:
Unlike other freshwater trout which make their habitat in swift-flowing rivers, the silver princess trout prefers the relative seclusion of inland lakes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4931.name: Dusk Goby
4931.description:
A hardy species, the dusk goby can survive not only in freshwater, but also the mouths of rivers, where the tides can bring saltwater malms inland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4932.name: Pipira
4932.description:
A fierce freshwater fish most commonly found in Gridania's Jadeite Flood and Black Tea Brook.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4933.name: Crimson Crayfish
4933.description:
A crimson-carapaced freshwater crustacean commonly found in the streams and lakes of Vylbrand.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4934.name: Gudgeon
4934.description:
Each night, this freshwater fish will use its fins to dig a shallow burrow in river or lake beds, where it will sleep, relatively safe from predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4935.name: Brass Loach
4935.description:
This long, thin, brass-colored freshwater fish is most commonly found in the Yafaem Saltmoor and surrounding rivers and lakes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4936.name: Maiden Carp
4936.description:
Large schools of these dark silver fish can be found in the White Maiden and her tributaries.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4937.name: Abalathian Smelt
4937.description:
A tiny freshwater fish native to the lakes and rivers fed by runoff from Abalathia's Spine.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4938.name: Blindfish
4938.description:
Commonly found in the sea caves and grottoes of Vylbrand, the eyes of this freshwater fish regressed long ago, earning the specimen its name.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4939.name: Mudskipper
4939.description:
An amphibious fish which can survive for bells out of water as long as its skin remains moist. When on land, the mudskipper uses its pectoral fins to “wander” about in search of shelter. Because of this trait, the fish is sometimes associated with the god Oschon.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4940.name: Rainbow Trout
4940.description:
Found in the crystal-clear rivers and lakes of Mor Dhona and Coerthas, this fish's scales reflect all seven colors of the rainbow, making it difficult to locate in the water.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4941.name: River Crab
4941.description:
A tiny freshwater crustacean commonly found in rivers throughout Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4942.name: Ala Mhigan Fighting Fish
4942.description:
A beautiful blue freshwater fish known for its violent disposition.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4943.name: Faerie Bass
4943.description:
A common freshwater fish found in rivers and lakes in almost every corner of Eorzea. A staple for many of the realm's smallfolk.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4944.name: Acorn Snail
4944.description:
Believed to have hitched a ride on the hull of a trade ship, the acorn snail is an invasive species originally from the New World, far to the west. As it has few natural predators in Eorzea, its numbers have exploded in recent years.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4945.name: Dark Sleeper
4945.description:
A small freshwater fish originally from the eastern continent of Othard. It is said that the first dark sleeper was introduced to Eorzea by an exiled Lalafellin prince who wished to once again experience the luxuries of his homeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4946.name: La Noscean Perch
4946.description:
A fair-sized freshwater fish found distributed evenly throughout the lakes and rivers of lower Vylbrand.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4947.name: Moat Carp
4947.description:
This freshwater fish is found in lakes and marshes throughout the Black Shroud...but rarely in moats.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4948.name: Copperfish
4948.description:
The copperfish's dull orange scales─a hue rare in freshwater wavekin─make this species popular amongst Ul'dahn nobles, who apparently prefer even their fish to be the color of their coin.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4949.name: Bluebell Salmon
4949.description:
Hatched far up inland rivers, bluebell salmon will travel all the way downstream to the Indigo Deep where they will spend the majority of their adulthood. Then, however, when it comes time to spawn, they will return back upstream to the place of their birth.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4950.name: Mudcrab
4950.description:
As its name implies, the mudcrab spends most of its life in the muddy freshwater shallows of swamps and moors.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4951.name: Tricolored Carp
4951.description:
Patches of gold, silver, and bronze cover this medium-sized freshwater fish's body, making it a favorite choice for the private garden pools of Ul'dahn nobles.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4952.name: Eunuch Crayfish
4952.description:
The grip of this tiny freshwater crustacean's claw is so strong, it has been the end of many a Lalafell's fingers...and more. Take care when handling.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4953.name: Jade Eel
4953.description:
Similar to salmon, this green-grey freshwater eel lives the majority of its life in the salty waters of the sea, returning to inland rivers to only spawn and die.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4954.name: Pond Mussel
4954.description:
This bivalve freshwater mollusk with a tear-shaped shell can be found either clinging to the side of submerged boulders or simply lying half-buried in the mud.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4955.name: Warmwater Trout
4955.description:
This freshwater fish was once found only in the waters heated by the flows of lava coursing beneath the mighty volcano O'Ghomoro. After the Calamity, however, fishers began finding the wavekin in other warm locations such as Thanalan.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4956.name: Glass Perch
4956.description:
With an almost completely transparent body, this variety of freshwater perch is coveted by naturalists wishing to study the inner workings of organs on a living specimen.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4957.name: Four-eyed Fish
4957.description:
Four-eyed fish do not actually have four eyes, but two eyes that are divided into an upper and lower portion that allow the wavekin to see both above and below the water at the same time.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4958.name: Black Eel
4958.description:
Black eels reach maturity in the Sea of Jade, at which point they return back up the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers to spawn.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4959.name: Dark Bass
4959.description:
This freshwater fish, known for its voracious appetite, is originally native to the southern continent of Meracydia.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4960.name: Aegis Shrimp
4960.description:
Whereas other shrimp shed their old exoskeletons each summer in favor of new ones, the aegis shrimp simply adds a new layer every year until the shell is so hard, not even a blow from a trained pugilist can break through it.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4961.name: Five-ilm Pleco
4961.description:
