This freshwater fish commonly found in the rivers of the Black Shroud will often grow no larger than a mere five ilms.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4962.name: Climbing Perch
4962.description:
Though not amphibious like the mudskipper, the climbing perch will jump from Black Shroud rivers onto low-lying tree branches in order to catch flies and beetles.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4963.name: Shadow Catfish
4963.description:
A large whiskered fish that can be found in the calm marshes of the Black Shroud.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4964.name: Black Ghost
4964.description:
Native to the rivers and lakes of the Black Shroud, this freshwater fish uses electric receptors on its body to locate food.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4965.name: Lamprey
4965.description:
A long, ugly freshwater eel found in nearly every river and lake in Eorzea. Its toothy grin is enough to frighten children across the realm.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4966.name: Plaguefish
4966.description:
This variety of freshwater fish has the queer habit of wearing the skulls of small drowned animals, though it is not known exactly why.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4967.name: Yugr'am Salmon
4967.description:
This freshwater fish matures in the salty waters of the Bloodbrine Sea, only to return up the Yugr'am River where it was born to spawn.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4968.name: Spotted Pleco
4968.description:
Tiny white spots cover the body of this rare freshwater fish.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4969.name: Ropefish
4969.description:
As it has the tendency to coil up while inactive, this variety of freshwater eel is oft mistaken for lost boat rigging.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4970.name: Grip Killifish
4970.description:
A rare type of fish oft found in stagnant waters such as the isolated pools which collect in the basin of Empty Heart on the western finger of the Gods' Grip.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4971.name: Bone Cleaner
4971.description:
A freshwater snail that survives solely on the carrion of animals that get caught and perish in the sucking mud of swamps and marshes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4972.name: Root Skipper
4972.description:
A small fish that is found only in Rootslake in the Black Shroud.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4973.name: Bonytongue
4973.description:
A single flat tooth on the bottom of this freshwater species' mouth gives the bonytongue its name.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4974.name: Mitten Crab
4974.description:
The claws of this freshwater crustacean are covered in myriad tiny bristles which provide the illusion that the crab is wearing mittens.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4975.name: Monke Onke
4975.description:
A giant freshwater fish found in the tepid rivers and lakes of the Black Shroud.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4976.name: Seema
4976.description:
The flesh of this freshwater trout native to central and northern Eorzea is a bright pink, leading to the common nickname, “cherry trout.”

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4977.name: Sandfish
4977.description:
An amphibious fish capable of breathing on land. This trait has allowed it to adapt to life in the deserts of Thanalan.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4978.name: Silverfish
4978.description:
As are copperfish and goldfish, freshwater silverfish are prized amongst well-to-do Ul'dahns, and often kept as pets.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4979.name: Clown Loach
4979.description:
Bright patterns, similar to a clown's motley, cover this small freshwater fish from head to tail.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4980.name: Armored Pleco
4980.description:
The rock-hard scales of the armored pleco are thought to protect the wavekin from injury when being dashed about swift-water rapids.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4981.name: Giant Bass
4981.description:
Significantly larger than a dark bass, landing a giant bass can prove quite the challenge for even the most seasoned angler.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4982.name: Velodyna Carp
4982.description:
This scarlet cousin to the maiden carp can most commonly be found in the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4983.name: Spotted Puffer
4983.description:
A cousin of the sea-dwelling balloonfish, spotted puffers are unique in that they can survive in the brackish waters of deltas and river mouths.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4984.name: Golden Loach
4984.description:
Truly a prize, this bright-gold fish, though rare, can be found in rivers and lakes across Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4985.name: Trader Eel
4985.description:
This freshwater eel native to the rivers and lakes of Thanalan will often display the unique trait of swapping its mate with other nearby eels when spawning.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4986.name: Crimson Trout
4986.description:
A red-scaled trout commonly found in the rivers originating on Abalathia's Spine.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4987.name: Discus
4987.description:
A colorful freshwater fish that can only survive in rivers located in more temperate climes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4988.name: Bronze Lake Trout
4988.description:
A species of trout native to Vylbrand's Bronze Lake.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

4989.name: Ignus Snail
4989.description:
The fiery red shells of this freshwater snail are prized by the Amalj'aa, and are useful when bartering with the beast tribe.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4990.name: Loyal Pleco
4990.description:
This variety of striped freshwater fish earns its name from its tendency to gather by the legs of any man or beast who enters its habitat.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4991.name: Thunderbolt Sculpin
4991.description:
A rare freshwater fish decorated with a thunderbolt-like pattern down its back.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4992.name: Fall Jumper
4992.description:
Fall jumpers are born with an inherent tendency to swim against the current. When they arrive at a falls, this leaves them with no option but to leap out of the water in an attempt to continue upstream.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4993.name: Knifefish
4993.description:
The freshwater knifefish is named such due to its resemblance to a flat blade.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4994.name: Oakroot
4994.description:
A giant freshwater fish found in inland lakes and rivers. Its name is derived from its resemblance to a knotty oaken root.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4995.name: Common Sculpin
4995.description:
This freshwater fish has highly developed fins and spines which not only protect the wavekin, but serve as weapons for hunting its prey.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4996.name: Southern Pike
4996.description:
Though classified as a freshwater fish native to the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers, this particular wavekin can survive in the brackish delta where the waterways spill into the Sea of Jade.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4997.name: Northern Pike
4997.description:
Though classified as a freshwater fish native to the White Maiden, this particular wavekin can survive in the brackish waters where the Maiden meets the Strait of Merlthor.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

4998.name: Kobold Puffer
4998.description:
Similar to the spotted puffer, the kobold puffer can also survive in the brackish waters of deltas and river mouths. Its spots, however, are replaced with a hideous coat of bristly spines which give it the appearance of a bedraggled kobold.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

4999.name: Archerfish
4999.description:
When feeding, the archerfish will lift its head ever so slightly above a lake's or river's surface and spit a stream of water up to a yalm to strike flies from low-lying branches into the water with remarkable accuracy.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5000.name: Goblin Perch
5000.description:
The goblins claim that they brought this variety of perch back from their years-long pilgrimage into Othard and Ilsabard...because it tasted so divine.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5001.name: Agelyss Carp
5001.description:
A rare species of carp native to the Agelyss River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5002.name: Assassin Betta
5002.description:
A violent species of freshwater fish from central Abalathia's Spine that will attack other assassin betta if they draw too near while feeding.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5003.name: Sludgeskipper
5003.description:
Similar to its cousin the mudskipper, the sludgeskipper can also survive outside water for several bells. The sludgeskipper, however, is at home in highly polluted pools where other creatures would likely perish.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5004.name: Boltfish
5004.description:
This freshwater anomaly possesses high concentrations of lightning-aspected aetherial energy which can be used to inflict serious injury on any foolish enough to provoke the fish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5005.name: Garpike
5005.description:
A hard-scaled freshwater fish native to southern Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5006.name: Ilsabardian Bass
5006.description:
Unlike its Eorzean cousins, the Ilsabardian bass is mean-tempered and quick to bite, attacking other species sharing the same lake until there are none left but its own.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5007.name: Paglth'an Discus
5007.description:
A brightly colored freshwater fish native to the warm waters in and around the Amalj'aa territory of Paglth'an.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5008.name: Boxing Pleco
5008.description:
The largest pleco known to naturalists, this variety is known for violently flailing its fins at any unfortunate creature that happens to swim by.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5009.name: Kissing Trout
5009.description:
Native to the freshwater rivers of Abalathia's Spine, the kissing trout is famous for its mating “dance” in which a male and female will face each other for several moments before proceeding to couple.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5010.name: Angry Pike
5010.description:
While all species of freshwater pike are known to be violent, this particular variety has been recorded actually biting the ankles of wading fishers.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5011.name: Goldfish
5011.description:
The brilliant luster of this freshwater fish native to the Far East has made it a popular addition to the aquariums and garden ponds of Ul'dahn patricians.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5012.name: Vampire Lampern
5012.description:
Just as its name implies, the vampire lampern is indeed a sucker of blood, using its multiple rows of teeth to latch onto its prey, whether it be sea or land creature, and bore a hole from which to drink.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5013.name: Wandering Sculpin
5013.description:
Legend states that this particular variety of sculpin is a favorite of Oschon, the Wanderer, and that the god will oft dine on this fish while on His journeys through the realm of man.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5014.name: Cave Cherax
5014.description:
It is said that not even a fishing line made from adamantite wire can withstand the cutting force of this legendary giant crustacean's claws.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5015.name: Coeurlfish
5015.description:
Two front teeth of this freshwater fish are exceptionally long and therefore protrude from the mouth, giving them the appearance of coeurl fangs.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5016.name: Giant Donko
5016.description:
A giant freshwater fish native to the rivers and swamps of La Noscea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5017.name: Sundisc
5017.description:
This freshwater fish has a bright-yellow sun-like pattern across its body, giving rise to the name “sundisc.”

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5018.name: Alligator Garfish
5018.description:
A legendary freshwater fish said to have a head not unlike that of an alligator, complete with rows of razor-sharp teeth.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5019.name: Wootz Knifefish
5019.description:
It is believed that after living in waters tainted with wootz ore for so long, this knifefish absorbed so much of the mineral that it began showing in its scales.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5020.name: Giant Catfish
5020.description:
A giant freshwater fish found throughout Aldenard and known for the decidedly feline whiskers which it uses to detect the movement of prey.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5021.name: Cadaver Carp
5021.description:
Neither dead nor necrophagous, the cadaver carp is called such because of where it chooses to live─some of the most tainted, noisome, and foul waters in all of Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5022.name: Mushroom Crab
5022.description:
This amazing crab will rub its shell up against funguars to collect spores, which it will then grow on its back. Once the sporelings begin to sprout, the crab will use its claws to slice off the mushrooms and eat them.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5023.name: Judgment Staff
5023.description:
Named after the primal Ramuh's signature weapon, this strange freshwater fish will only feed when the weather is rainy.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5024.name: Poxpike
5024.description:
The rock-hard scales of this variety of freshwater garpike are spattered with scores of unhealthy-looking spots.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5025.name: Emperor Fish
5025.description:
This giant freshwater fish lives out its adulthood feeding in the Indigo Deep before returning all the way back up to the head of the White Maiden to spawn.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5026.name: Bowfin
5026.description:
Record of the bowfin being caught in the Black Shroud dates back to the time of the first Elezen settlers.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5027.name: Heliobatis
5027.description:
A flat freshwater bottom-feeder found predominantly in marshes and swamps, where it can hide under the blanket of organic detritus collected on the floor.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5028.name: Takitaro
5028.description:
A legendary giant freshwater fish indigenous to the lands of the Far East. The takitaro found in Eorzea are thought to be the offspring of a specimen presented as a gift to an eccentric sultan who loosed the fish into a cenote when it grew too large to keep in the royal aquariums.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5029.name: Pirarucu
5029.description:
A legendary giant freshwater fish rumored to live in the bottomless swamps hidden deep within the unexplored regions of the Black Shroud.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5030.name: Morinabaligi
5030.description:
A giant freshwater fish so shrouded in mystery that naught is known of it.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5031.name: Jungle Catfish
5031.description:
It is rumored that a jungle catfish can grow to become as large as an aurochs, and while there are sightings aplenty of these massive specimens, one that large has yet to be caught.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5032.name: Sand Bream
5032.description:
A tiny sand-dwelling fish which can spend its whole life out of the water.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5033.name: Desert Catfish
5033.description:
A large variety of air-breathing catfish. Its near-frictionless scales allow it to “swim” through the desert as a normal fish would through the water.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5034.name: Dustfish
5034.description:
When threatened, this sand-dwelling fish will beat the ground with its fins, kicking up a cloud of dust and allowing it the opportunity to escape unscathed.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5035.name: Storm Rider
5035.description:
These sand-dwelling fish will skip across the desert unless they are fortunate enough to stumble across a sandstorm, in which case they will spread their fins and ride the storm great distances.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5036.name: Antlion Slug
5036.description:
This sand-dwelling slug is able to maintain its mucous coating by absorbing the moisture from prey it catches at the bottom of conical pits not unlike the ones antlions are known to dig.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5037.name: Dune Manta
5037.description:
Remarkably smooth skin allows the dune manta to glide through desert sand as if it were the sea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5038.name: Cloud Jellyfish
5038.description:
Cloud jellyfish aimlessly drift about the Sea of Clouds, tentacles spread out below them, searching for the small birds on which they feed.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5039.name: Skyfish
5039.description:
One of the more common creatures found living on the thermal currents above the Sea of Clouds, from a distance, the skyfish appears to be no more than a simple rod outfitted with three sets of transparent wings.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5040.name: Cloud Cutter
5040.description:
The swiftest inhabitants of the Sea of Clouds, cloud cutters will fly straight in a single direction for malms before quickly turning at some unthinkable angle and darting off in another direction.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5041.name: Blind Manta
5041.description:
The blind manta is thought to navigate the Sea of Clouds in a manner similar to how bats keep their bearings─using sound and echoes to determine the location of cliff faces and other creatures.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5042.name: Rift Sailor
5042.description:
The rift sailor uses the light elastic webbing between its wings to catch the roiling winds of the Sea of Clouds and glide across the rifts.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5043.name: Sagolii Monkfish
5043.description:
When hunting, the Sagolii monkfish uses a method similar to its sea-bound cousin─attracting potential prey to its location with a glowing appendage situated directly above its gaping maw.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5044.name: Saucerfish
5044.description:
Lacking feet or wings to propel itself from the ground, only death awaits the saucerfish that is foolish enough to leave the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5045.name: Caravan Eel
5045.description:
After maturing in the Grand Wake, caravan eels will form long lines in the sand and make their way back to the Sagolii Desert to spawn and die.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

5046.name: Rhamphorhynchus
5046.description:
Its massive lance-shaped nose makes this legendary denizen of the Sea of Clouds a formidable nuisance for airships passing through the area.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

5047.name: Tricorn
5047.description: A legendary amphibian with a boomerang-like head said to be powerful enough to split a harpoon in two.

5048.name: Young Indigo Herring
5048.description: A large fish native to the Indigo Deep. When packed in salt, it can be preserved for up to a year.

5049.name: Navigator's Ear
5049.description: This medium-sized oyster is high in nutrients, making it optimal for use in medicines and rations.

5050.name: Allagan Snail
5050.description: A giant snail believed to have been bred for consumption during the reign of the Great Allagan Empire.

5051.name: Tree Toad
5051.description: A giant green toad found in nearly all of the lakes and swamps of Aldenard.

5052.name: Box Turtle
5052.description: A common, thick-shelled turtle found in wetlands throughout Eorzea.

5053.name: Nether Newt
5053.description: An amphibious type of scalekin found in the wetlands of Vylbrand. Its body is covered with colorful markings which some of Limsa Lominsa's more superstitious folk believe are burns the creature received when crawling its way through each of the seven hells before arriving on the face of Hydaelyn.

5054.name: Dart Frog
5054.description: This tiny frog found in the swamps and lakes of the Black Shroud secretes a powerful poison known to induce paralysis.

5055.name: Lava Toad
5055.description: This giant red toad, native to the swamps of Vylbrand but now found throughout Aldenard, earns its name from the red firerock which once spewed forth from the now-dormant volcano, O'Ghomoro.

5061.name: Darksteel Nugget
5061.description: A small nugget of impure darksteel.

5067.name: Rose Gold Ingot
5067.description: An ingot of smelted rose gold.

5068.name: Rose Gold Nugget
5068.description: A small nugget of impure rose gold.

5070.name: Gold Nugget
5070.description: A small nugget of impure gold.

5091.name: Bronze Rivets
5091.description: Short bronze pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5092.name: Iron Rivets
5092.description: Short iron pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5093.name: Steel Rivets
5093.description: Short steel pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5094.name: Cobalt Rivets
5094.description: Short cobalt pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5095.name: Darksteel Rivets
5095.description: Short darksteel pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5096.name: Copper Rivets
5096.description: Short copper pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5097.name: Brass Rivets
5097.description: Short brass pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5098.name: Silver Rivets
5098.description: Short silver pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5099.name: Mythril Rivets
5099.description: Short mythril pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

5100.name: Copper Dust
5100.description: Several thousand minute flecks of copper ore.

5101.name: Silver Dust
5101.description: Several thousand minute flecks of silver ore.

5102.name: Gold Dust
5102.description: Several thousand minute flecks of gold ore.

5103.name: Silver Leaf
5103.description: A square of silver pounded until it is paper-thin. Often applied to wood to give it the appearance of solid silver.

5104.name: Garlean Steel Joint
5104.description: A mechanical joint made with a remarkably light variety of steel impossible to reproduce in Eorzean forges.

5105.name: Garlean Steel Plate
5105.description: A plate hammered from a remarkably light variety of steel impossible to reproduce in Eorzean forges.

5106.name: Copper Ore
5106.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal copper.

5107.name: Tin Ore
5107.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal tin.

5108.name: Yellow Copper Ore
5108.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal copper mixed with traces of iron and sulphur.

5109.name: Pyrite
5109.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing iron and sulphur, creating the mineral pyrite.

5110.name: Zinc Ore
5110.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal zinc.

5111.name: Iron Ore
5111.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal iron.

5112.name: Limonite
5112.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing a small amount of oxidized iron. It is said to have deodorizing properties.

5113.name: Silver Ore
5113.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the semi-precious metal silver.

5114.name: Mythril Ore
5114.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal mythril.

5115.name: Electrum Ore
5115.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal electrum.

5116.name: Cobalt Ore
5116.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal cobalt.

5117.name: Light Kidney Ore
5117.description: A reddish ore containing large quantities of iron. Its wide availability makes it optimal for smelting in locations where purer forms of iron ore are difficult to procure, such as militia forges. This particular type of kidney ore is far more porous than the common variety, making it much easier to transport.

5118.name: Gold Ore
5118.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal gold.

5119.name: Peacock Ore
5119.description: A colorful ore with a high copper content.

5120.name: Platinum Ore
5120.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal platinum.

5121.name: Darksteel Ore
5121.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal darksteel.

5123.name: Flint Stone
5123.description: An extremely hard rock often used in stone weapons and firearms.

5124.name: Obsidian
5124.description: A sharp, glossy volcanic stone often used in the manufacture of weapons and jewelry.

5125.name: Wyvern Obsidian
5125.description: A hard variety of obsidian. Said to have been formed in the flames of a wyvern's breath.

5126.name: Dragon Obsidian
5126.description: A hard yet light variety of obsidian. Said to have been formed in the flames of a dragon's breath.

5127.name: Wyrm Obsidian

5451.description: The chitinous wing case of a weevil, used to protect the vilekin's paper-thin wings from damage.

5452.name: Ladybug Elytron
5452.description: The chitinous wing case of a ladybug, used to protect the vilekin's paper-thin wings from damage.

5453.name: Firefly Elytron
5453.description: The glowing wing case of a firefly, used to protect the vilekin's paper-thin wings from damage.

5454.name: Yellow Yarzon Leg
5454.description: The pronged leg of a sand yarzon.

5455.name: Blue Yarzon Leg
5455.description: The pronged leg of a bog yarzon.

5456.name: Green Megalocrab Shell
5456.description: The hard green carapace of a megalocrab.

5457.name: Red Megalocrab Shell
5457.description: The hard red carapace of a megalocrab.

5458.name: Adamantoise Shell
5458.description: The shell of a giant tortoise originally native to the island of Thavnair, but now found living throughout Eorzea.

5459.name: Tortoiseshell
5459.description: A shiny, semi-translucent material made from boiling the shell of a hawksbill tortoise.

5460.name: White Coral
5460.description:
A piece of sharp white coral native to the shallow seas all along Eorzea's coastlines.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5461.name: Blue Coral
5461.description:
A piece of sharp blue coral native to the shallow coastal regions of the Rhotano Sea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5462.name: Red Coral
5462.description:
A piece of sharp red coral, rarely found in any of Eorzea's five seas.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5463.name: Scallop Shell
5463.description: A tasty bivalve mollusk found in the cold waters of the Bloodbrine Sea. Its foot is considered a delicacy, while its shell is used for jewelry.

5464.name: Miter Shell
5464.description: Native to the Rhotano Sea, the vortex-shaped shell of this wavekin is prized by goldsmiths who use it to craft beautiful jewelry.

5465.name: Sunrise Tellin
5465.description: A tiny bivalve mollusk commonly harvested on the Pearl. Its pink shells are prized by goldsmiths who craft them into beautiful jewelry.

5466.name: Blacklip Oyster
5466.description:
A bivalve mollusk found in the warm waters of the Sea of Ash. On rare occasions, sand will become trapped inside the shell and gradually form into a black pearl.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

5467.name: Hedgemole Spine
5467.description: The remarkably lightweight, yet sharp, spine of a hedgemole.

5468.name: Cactuar Needle
5468.description: The sharp spine of a cactuar.

5469.name: Bone Ash
5469.description: The fine grey ash left over after cremating a body.

5470.name: Growth Formula Alpha
5470.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

5471.name: Growth Formula Beta
5471.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

5472.name: Growth Formula Gamma
5472.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

5473.name: Growth Formula Delta
5473.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

5474.name: Growth Formula Delta Concentrate
5474.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage. Now in concentrate!

5475.name: Enchanted Copper Ink
5475.description: Ink fortified with copper sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5476.name: Enchanted Iron Ink
5476.description: Ink fortified with iron sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5477.name: Enchanted Silver Ink
5477.description: Ink fortified with silver sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5478.name: Enchanted Mythril Ink
5478.description: Ink fortified with mythril sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5479.name: Enchanted Electrum Ink
5479.description: Ink fortified with electrum sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5480.name: Enchanted Gold Ink
5480.description: Ink fortified with gold sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5481.name: Enchanted Rose Gold Ink
5481.description: Ink fortified with rose gold sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

5482.name: Fish Oil
5482.description: A clear oil extracted from the fatty tissue of various fish.

5483.name: Jellyfish Humours
5483.description: A thick, viscid oil extracted from a variety of jellyfish known as the ocean cloud.

5484.name: Crab Oil
5484.description: A fragrant oil extracted from crabs.

5485.name: Linseed Oil
5485.description: An oil made by pressing flax seeds. Used for lubrication as well as in medicines.

5486.name: Shark Oil
5486.description: An odorless oil extracted from the fatty tissue of sharks.

5487.name: Distilled Water
5487.description: The distilling process has removed all impurities from this water.

5488.name: Muddy Water
5488.description: Cloudy water taken from a stagnant source.

5489.name: Quicksilver
5489.description: Liquid metal widely utilized by alchemists in the production of firesand and by smiths in the production of alloys.

5490.name: Vitriol
5490.description: A strong, viscous acid known to corrode almost any metal.

5491.name: Effervescent Water
5491.description: Naturally sparkling water bottled at the source.

5492.name: Beastkin Blood
5492.description: The warm blood of a beast. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

5493.name: Scalekin Blood
5493.description: The cold blood of a scaled creature. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

5494.name: Spoken Blood
5494.description: The warm blood of a bipedal sentient. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

5495.name: Viscous Secretions
5495.description: The viscous secretions of a slug.

5496.name: Acidic Secretions
5496.description: The acidic secretions of a sea hare.

5497.name: Formic Acid
5497.description: The pungent and corrosive secretion of an antling.

5498.name: Maple Sap
5498.description: An odorless and colorless liquid extracted from maple trees. Can be boiled down to make sweet maple sugar.

5499.name: Treant Sap
5499.description: The lifeblood of a living tree.

5500.name: Coal Tar
5500.description: An oily black liquid made from coal. Used in the coloring and waterproofing of leather and cloth, as well as in the production of firesand.

5501.name: Potash
5501.description: A mixture of plant ashes soaked in distilled water.

5502.name: Lime Sulphur
5502.description: An alchemical compound made by boiling a mixture of powdered limestone and sulphur.

5503.name: Animal Glue
5503.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the hides of various animals.

5504.name: Fish Glue
5504.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down various parts of fish and other wavekin.

5505.name: Horn Glue
5505.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down horns.

5506.name: Void Glue
5506.description: A powerful adhesive created by boiling down the flesh of various voidsent.

5507.name: Wing Glue
5507.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the leathery wings of bats, wyverns, and imps.

5508.name: Scale Glue
5508.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the hard scales of peistes and dragons.

5509.name: Latex
5509.description: The milky sap of a mature tree.

5511.name: Rubber Band
5511.description: A pliant, durable band made from rubber.

5512.name: Clear Glass Lens
5512.description: A hard flat lens made of uncolored glass.

5513.name: Potter's Clay
5513.description: Thick, sticky clay used to make cups, pots, and jars.

5514.name: Humus
5514.description: Nutrient-rich soil consisting of decaying leaves.

5515.name: Beeswax
5515.description: Fragrant yellow wax created by melting down beehives.

5516.name: Beehive Chip
5516.description: The nest of a honeybee, comprised of several hundred hexagonal chambers made of a waxy substance secreted by the vilekin.

5517.name: Lanolin
5517.description: A waxy yellow substance extracted from sheep wool and used in ointments as well as to prevent rusting.

5518.name: Rock Salt
5518.description: A large chunk of naturally occurring salt crystals. It is often ground into fine grains before being used to flavor and preserve food.

5519.name: Cinnabar
5519.description: This red mineral is used to create quicksilver, as well as potent sedatives.

5520.name: Chalk
5520.description: A soft, white powder made by heating seashells in a furnace.

5521.name: Saltpeter
5521.description: A translucent crystalline substance often used in making glass, firesand, and dyes.

5522.name: Natron
5522.description: A white powder used in alchemy as a deodorizer and leavening agent.

5523.name: Silex
5523.description: A pure white sand made up of finely ground silica.

5524.name: Alumen
5524.description: A white mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It also has deodorizing properties.

5525.name: Black Alumen
5525.description: A darker variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It lacks the deodorizing properties of its lighter counterpart.

5526.name: Grenade Ash
5526.description: Dark grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a grenade.

5527.name: Brimstone
5527.description: A natural sulphur occurring in volcanic regions around Eorzea.

5528.name: Bomb Ash
5528.description: Grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a bomb.

5529.name: Resin
5529.description: The viscous sap of a coniferous tree. It can be used to not only treat and strengthen wood and leather, but also as a powerful adhesive.

5530.name: Coke
5530.description: A hot-burning fuel created by destructively distilling raw coal.

5531.name: Animal Fat
5531.description: The foul-smelling fatty tissue of a beastkin.

5532.name: Hardened Sap
5532.description: A partially congealed ball of sticky tree sap.

5533.name: Garlean Rubber
5533.description: A lightweight rubber far more elastic than the common variety found in Eorzea.

5534.name: Tinolqa Mistletoe
5534.description: A variety of parasitic plant that is commonly found growing on trees in the Black Shroud.

5535.name: Matron's Mistletoe
5535.description: This variety of parasitic plant is named after the goddess Nophica as it appears to embrace the trees on which it grows.

5536.name: Mistletoe
5536.description: A poisonous, parasitic plant which survives by attaching itself to other larger plants. It is often gathered and put on display during regional winter festivals.

5537.name: Thavnairian Mistletoe
5537.description: A variety of parasitic plant that is commonly found growing on the stout acacia trees of Thavnair. The inhabitants of Thavnair's capital city of RadzatHan have a strange custom that states if two people meet underneath a sprig of mistletoe, they must each give the other one of their shoes.

5538.name: Yellow Ginseng
5538.description: A Far Eastern root used in various medicines.

5539.name: Lavender
5539.description: A fragrant purple flower found growing in coastal areas throughout Aldenard.

5540.name: Carnation
5540.description: A beautiful red flower often planted in public gardens or picked and put on display in houses. Large plantations of carnations can be found in and around Gridania.

5541.name: Belladonna
5541.description: A beautiful flower common in Aldenard from which a potent sleeping poison can be extracted.

5542.name: Chamomile
5542.description: A fragrant yellow flower found growing throughout Vylbrand.

5543.name: Mandrake
5543.description: The man-shaped root of a wild plant commonly found growing on Vylbrand.

5544.name: Lamp Marimo
5544.description:
A rare type of luminescent moss found on the bottom of lakes and in caves. Slight currents cause the moss to form into a ball as it grows.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

5546.name: Trillium Bulb
5546.description: If planted and tended with loving care, this bulb should grow into a lovely trillium plant.

5547.name: Vampire Plant
5547.description: This rare variety of parasitic plant is known to suck the lifeblood from all flora with which it comes in contact.

5548.name: Red Landtrap Leaf
5548.description: The thin, twitching leaf of a roseling.

5549.name: Blue Landtrap Leaf
5549.description: The thin, twitching leaf of a flytrap.

5550.name: Puk Wing
5550.description: The membranous wing of a puk. Often carried by young Lalafellin girls as a good-luck charm.

5551.name: Bat Wing
5551.description: The leathery wing of a bat.

5552.name: Imp Wing
5552.description: The membranous wing of an imp.

5553.name: Ahriman Wing
5553.description: The large, veined wing of an ahriman.

5554.name: Morbol Vine
5554.description: The squirming vine of a morbol.

5555.name: Ochu Vine
5555.description: The thick, leathery vine of an ochu.

5556.name: Jellyfish Cnida
5556.description: The poison-producing spines of a jellyfish.

5557.name: Jellyfish Umbrella
5557.description: The soft, gelatinous body of a jellyfish.

5558.name: Pudding Flesh
5558.description: A foul-smelling, gelatinous mass taken from a pudding.

5559.name: Moor Leech
5559.description: A bloodsucking leech. Used by barbers, chirurgeons, and chymists alike to drain the tainted humours from an ill patient.

5560.name: Grass Viper
5560.description: A deadly snake common in grasslands across Eorzea. Its venom is known to contain a potent bleeding poison.

5561.name: Bee Basket
5561.description: A tightly knitted wicker basket filled with a swarm of agitated honeybees.

5562.name: Tarantula
5562.description: A deadly forest spider from whose venom can be extracted a potent silencing poison.

5563.name: White Scorpion
5563.description: A rare albino scorpion, thought to be an ill omen by the early Dunesfolk tribes.

5564.name: Black Scorpion
5564.description: A deadly desert vilekin from whose venom can be extracted a potent paralyzing poison.

5565.name: Bloody Lance Head
5565.description: A blood-encrusted lance head found lodged in the thick hide of a great buffalo.

5566.name: Bloody Bardiche Head
5566.description: A blood-encrusted bardiche head found lodged in the thick hide of a great buffalo.

5567.name: Bloody Cesti Covers
5567.description: Blood-soaked cesti covers retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

5568.name: Bloody Bow Rim
5568.description: A bloodstained wooden bow rim retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

5569.name: Bloody Grimoire Binding
5569.description: A blood-soaked leather grimoire cover retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

5570.name: Mailbreaker Blade
5570.description: A sturdy darksteel blade used in the creation of mailbreakers.

5571.name: Avenger Grips
5571.description: A pair of tempered darksteel grips used in making avengers.

5572.name: Rampager Head
5572.description: A double-edged darksteel axe head used in the creation of rampagers.

5573.name: Obelisk Head
5573.description: A narrow darksteel head used in the creation of obelisks.

5574.name: Sarnga Limb
5574.description: A flexible bow limb carved from spruce used in the creation of Sarnga.

5575.name: Suspended Trillium Flower
5575.description: A trillium flower, preserved via alchemical agents. Used in the creation of trillium canes.

5576.name: Astrolabe Clinometer
5576.description: An astrally charged clinometer used in the creation of astrolabes.

5577.name: Vanya Silk Hat Lining
5577.description: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line a hat.

5578.name: Vanya Silk Robe Lining
5578.description: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line a robe.

5579.name: Vanya Silk Glove Lining
5579.description: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line gloves.

5580.name: Vanya Silk Crakow Lining
5580.description: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line crakows.

5581.name: Gryphonskin Shoulder Guards
5581.description: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on body armor to provide extra protection to the shoulders.

5582.name: Gryphonskin Shin Guards
5582.description: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on foot armor to provide extra protection to the shins.

5583.name: Gryphonskin Elbow Pads
5583.description: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on hand armor to provide extra protection to the elbows.

5584.name: Gryphonskin Knee Pads
5584.description: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on leg armor to provide extra protection to the knees.

5585.name: Darksteel Breastplate
5585.description: A darksteel breastplate, usually coupled with a matching backplate and worn over another piece of body armor, completing the set.

5586.name: Darksteel Gauntlet Plates
5586.description: A pair of darksteel plates used in the construction of gauntlets.

5587.name: Darksteel Couters
5587.description: Darksteel elbowguards used in the creation of heavy armor.

5588.name: Rose Gold Clasps
5588.description: Tiny rose gold clasps used to secure earrings to the wearer's ear.

5589.name: Rubber Sole
5589.description: Durable, shock-absorbent soles made from rubber.

5590.name: Tiny Crown
5590.description: A tiny golden crown used to decorate pastries.

5591.name: Black Odoshi Cord
5591.description: A thick, raven black cord used to securely fasten a kabuto to its wearer's head.

5592.name: Blue Odoshi Cord
5592.description: A thick, woad-blue cord used to securely fasten a kabuto to its wearer's head.

5593.name: Kabuto Mask
5593.description: Thin iron plating attached to a kabuto to not only protect the wearer's face, but to instill fear in all who behold the frightening visage it creates.

5594.name: Grade 1 Dark Matter
5594.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with simple items crafted from common materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-10.]

5595.name: Grade 2 Dark Matter
5595.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with relatively simple items crafted from common materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-20.]

5596.name: Grade 3 Dark Matter
5596.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with items crafted from standard materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-30.]

5597.name: Grade 4 Dark Matter
5597.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with expertly crafted items made from quality materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-40.]

5598.name: Grade 5 Dark Matter
5598.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with precisely crafted items made from high-quality materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-50.]

5605.name: Strength Materia II

5728.name: Terebinth
5728.description: This foul-smelling sap can be used to remove dyes quickly and easily. Remember to always use in a well-ventilated area.

5729.name: Snow White Dye
5729.description: A labor-saving white dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5730.name: Ash Grey Dye
5730.description: A labor-saving grey dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5731.name: Goobbue Grey Dye
5731.description: A labor-saving grey dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5732.name: Slate Grey Dye
5732.description: A labor-saving grey dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5733.name: Charcoal Grey Dye
5733.description: A labor-saving grey dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5734.name: Soot Black Dye
5734.description: A labor-saving black dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5735.name: Rose Pink Dye
5735.description: A labor-saving pink dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5736.name: Lilac Purple Dye
5736.description: A labor-saving purple dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5737.name: Rolanberry Red Dye
5737.description: A labor-saving red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5738.name: Dalamud Red Dye
5738.description: A labor-saving red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5739.name: Rust Red Dye
5739.description: A labor-saving red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

5867.description: A prophetic egg featuring a hastily sketched caricature of the First Archon, Radcliffe the Red. Age has left its shell in a most woebegone state.

5868.name: Deaspected Crystal
5868.description: This translucent crystal seems to have been completely drained of its elemental aspect.

5869.name: Deaspected Cluster
5869.description: This translucent crystal cluster seems to have been completely drained of its elemental aspect.

5870.name: Bombard Ash
5870.description: Grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a Bombard.

5871.name: Red Bombard Ash
5871.description: A red incendiary ash left by a Bombard upon its fiery death.

5872.name: Green Bombard Ash
5872.description: A green incendiary ash left by a Bombard upon its fiery death.

5873.name: Blue Bombard Ash
5873.description: A blue incendiary ash left by a Bombard upon its fiery death.

5874.name: Black Bombard Ash
5874.description: A black incendiary ash left by a Bombard upon its fiery death.

5880.name: Faded Page
5880.description: A slip of paper covered with arcane symbols and queer handwriting. Used by imperial operatives to identify the handwriting of the Twelve Archons.

5888.name: Peach Confetti
5888.description: This festive confetti consists of fragrant petals taken from special peach trees which only blossom for the duration of the Little Ladies' Day festivities.

5889.name: Cherry Confetti
5889.description: This festive confetti consists of fragrant petals taken from special cherry trees which only blossom for the duration of the Dance of the Five Petals festivities.

5890.name: Storm Tracer
5890.description: A handheld incendiary device distributed by the Maelstrom.

5891.name: Flame Tracer
5891.description: A handheld incendiary device distributed by the Immortal Flames.

5892.name: Serpent Tracer
5892.description: A handheld incendiary device distributed by the Order of the Twin Adder.

5893.name: Lominsan Sparkler
5893.description: This red-sparking festive firework is often distributed in Limsa Lominsa during citywide festivals and celebrations.

5894.name: Gridanian Sparkler
5894.description: This green-sparking festive firework is often distributed in Gridania during citywide festivals and celebrations.

5895.name: Ul'dahn Sparkler
5895.description: This blue-sparking festive firework is often distributed in Ul'dah during citywide festivals and celebrations.

5896.name: Magicked Prism (Harbor Herald)
5896.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by the Harbor Herald for promotional purposes.

5897.name: Magicked Prism (Mythril Eye)
5897.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by the Mythril Eye for promotional purposes.

5898.name: Magicked Prism (The Raven)
5898.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by The Raven for promotional purposes.

5899.name: Magicked Prism (Crimson Star)
5899.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used in the hamlet of Aleport for celebratory purposes.

5900.name: Magicked Prism (Emerald Star)
5900.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used in the Golden Bazaar for celebratory purposes.

5901.name: Magicked Prism (Indigo Star)
5901.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used in the hamlet of Hyrstmill for celebratory purposes.

5902.name: Bombard Bloom
5902.description: A festive handheld firework made from the ash of a Bombard.

5903.name: Magicked Prism (Maelstrom)
5903.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by Maelstrom for military purposes.

5904.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by the Order of the Twin Adder for military purposes.

5905.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by Immortal Flames for military purposes.

5946.name: Wet Bombard Ash
5946.description: Grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a Bombard.

5948.name: Militia Bow
5948.description: A simple-yet-sturdy longbow commonly used by militia archers throughout Eorzea.

5949.name: Militia Sword
5949.description: A simple-yet-durable shortsword commonly used by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5950.name: Militia Helm
5950.description: A simple-yet-durable helm commonly worn by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5951.name: Militia Gorget
5951.description: A simple-yet-durable gorget commonly worn by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5952.name: Militia Longboots
5952.description: A simple-yet-durable pair of boots commonly worn by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5953.name: Militia Leggings
5953.description: A simple-yet-durable pair of leggings commonly worn by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5954.name: Militia Poultice
5954.description: A simple-yet-effective herbal remedy used by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5955.name: Militia Rations
5955.description: Bland-yet-hearty provisions consumed by militiamen throughout Eorzea.

5995.name: Rope
5995.description: Rope made by spinning together several stalks of wheat straw.

5996.name: Brass Dish
5996.description: A serving dish made of solid brass.

5997.name: Silver Goblet
5997.description: A wine goblet made of solid silver.

5998.name: Tallow Candle
5998.description: A stout candle made from sheep fat.

5999.name: Beeswax Candle
5999.description: A stout candle made from hardened beeswax.

6000.name: Goblin Mask
6000.description: A leather mask that filters out bad odors, as well as most poisonous gases. Due to its odd shape, only goblins can wear it.

6003.name: Cherry Bomb
6003.description:
Summons a miniature recreation of a voidsent bomb, created via the thaumaturgical rendering of umbrally charged aetherial energy. Guaranteed never to self-destruct, or your gil back.

Use item to acquire the cherry bomb minion.

6004.name: Mammet #001
6004.description:
Summons a fully operational clockwork puppet built in a joint effort by the Alchemists' and Goldsmiths' Guilds.

Use item to acquire the mammet #001 minion.

6005.name: Wayward Hatchling
6005.description:
Summons a lost chocobo chick. Until he finds his real mother, you'll have to suffice.

Use item to acquire the wayward hatchling minion.

6141.name: Cordial
6141.description: A sweet, fermented concoction that instantly restores 300 GP (350 if the cordial is of high quality).

6142.name: Grilled Warmwater Trout
6142.description: A fresh warmwater trout sprinkled with rock salt and grilled to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6143.name: Grilled Raincaller
6143.description: A fresh raincaller sprinkled with rock salt and grilled over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6144.name: Dagger Soup
6144.description: After a light clear broth is taken from a freshly caught Navigator's dagger, the meat is removed from the bones and ground up into a paste. The paste is then rolled into tiny balls and returned to the broth, creating a hearty soup. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6145.name: Noble Grapes
6145.description: Lowland grapes crossbred over generations to produce maximum sweetness. Their bitter skin makes them unsuitable for eating off the vine, and they are better consumed as juice or wine.

6146.name: Mirror Apple
6146.description: A sweet yet sour variety of apples native to Coerthas. When polished, the skins become so shiny it is said one can see their own reflection in them. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6147.name: Honey Lemon
6147.description: This rare type of lemon native to the continent of Othard is so sweet, it can be eaten raw. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6148.name: Dzemael Tomato
6148.description: A rare crossbreed of ruby tomato developed and perfected by House Dzemael botanists.

6149.name: Night Milk
6149.description: Rich and creamy buffalo milk harvested immediately before the beast falls asleep. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

6150.name: Coeurl Meat
6150.description: A bloody strip of extra-lean coeurl meat.

6151.name: Cooking Sherry
6151.description: Fine Lominsan white wine fortified with grape spirit to increase alcohol content and improve its aroma, making it perfect for a variety of culinary dishes.

6152.name: Volcanic Rock Salt
6152.description: The red hue of this rock salt is said to come from the volcanic soil of O'Ghomoro.

6153.name: Filtered Water
6153.description: Water purified using a complex method of passing it through several layers of charcoal and rock.

6154.name: Voidsent Blood
6154.description: The bubbling blood of a voidsent. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

6158.name: Ifrit's Horn
6158.description: Torn from the head of the Lord of the Inferno himself, this night-black horn is still hot to the touch.

6159.name: Inferno Horn
6159.description: Torn from the head of the Lord of the Inferno himself, this night-black horn pulses with uncontrollably powerful fire-aspected energies.

6160.name: Garuda's Feather
6160.description: Ripped from the wings of the Lady of the Vortex herself, this feather generates a powerful gust each time it is waved.

6161.name: Vortex Feather
6161.description: Ripped from the wings of the Lady of the Vortex herself, this feather pulses with uncontrollably powerful wind-aspected energies.

6162.name: Titan's Heart
6162.description: Drawn forth from the chest of the Lord of Crags himself, this small stone weighs more than a grown Lalafell.

6163.name: Crag Heart
6163.description: Drawn forth from the chest of the Lord of Crags himself, this small stone pulses with uncontrollably powerful earth-aspected energies.

6173.name: Morbol Seedling
6173.description:
For the nonce, his breath is the worst of your problems.

Use item to acquire the morbol seedling minion.

6174.name: Tiny Rat
6174.description:
He may infest your granaries, and he may carry the plague, but he's simply too adorable to condemn to the life-ending jaws of a metal trap.

Use item to acquire the tiny rat minion.

6175.name: Baby Bun
6175.description:
Tastes great on salads and in stews.

Use item to acquire the baby bun minion.

6177.name: Bluebird
6177.description:
Known to retroactively bring good fortune to those who have already experienced good fortune.

Use item to acquire the bluebird minion.

6178.name: Wide-eyed Fawn
6178.description:
His mother was either lost in a terrible hunting accident...or perhaps is just lost.

Use item to acquire the wide-eyed fawn minion.

6179.name: Infant Imp
6179.description:
Hopes that one day, he will rule the seven hells. But for now, your backside will do.

Use item to acquire the infant imp minion.

6183.name: Gravel Golem
6183.description:
Only you stand between it and a hard place.

Use item to acquire the gravel golem minion.

6184.name: Wind-up Tonberry
6184.description:
Now with 100% less rancor.

Use item to acquire the wind-up tonberry minion.

6185.name: Tiny Tortoise
6185.description:
Will not carry you to an underwater kingdom if you ride on its back.

Use item to acquire the tiny tortoise minion.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

6186.name: Baby Raptor
6186.description:
Luckily for you, his teeth haven't all grown in...yet.

Use item to acquire the baby raptor minion.

6187.name: Baby Bat
6187.description:
Has yet to acquire a taste for blood.

Use item to acquire the baby bat minion.

6188.name: Tiny Bulb
6188.description:
Some questions, such as why this bulb can walk, are best left unanswered.

Use item to acquire the tiny bulb minion.

6189.name: Dust Bunny
6189.description:
Despite the striking similarities, spriggans are not related to rabbits. But they have been known to eat them.

Use item to acquire the dust bunny minion.

6190.name: Wind-up Dullahan
6190.description:
Warning: may contain sharp parts.

Use item to acquire the wind-up dullahan minion.

6191.name: Gigantpole
6191.description:
Yes, it can survive for hours on end without any water, and yes, it can fly. Your argument is invalid.

Use item to acquire the gigantpole minion.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

6192.name: Pudgy Puk
6192.description:
Don't ask what he has eaten to grow so plump.

Use item to acquire the pudgy puk minion.

6195.name: Smallshell
6195.description:
The mere sight of this wee wavekin may cause severe psychological trauma to those who spent years of their lives on faraway shores culling his relatives.

Use item to acquire the smallshell minion.

6198.name: Fledgling Dodo
6198.description:
Properly trained not to eructate, regurgitate, expectorate, or flatulate.

Use item to acquire the fledgling dodo minion.

6199.name: Coblyn Larva
6199.description:
Too dangerous to allow to grow any larger...too adorable to condemn to the furnace.

Use item to acquire the coblyn larva minion.

6200.name: Wind-up Aldgoat
6200.description:
No aldgoats were harmed in the making of this automaton.

Use item to acquire the wind-up aldgoat minion.

6203.name: Bite-sized Pudding
6203.description:
Though seemingly delicious, this spoonful of slime is not intended for consumption.

Use item to acquire the bite-sized pudding minion.

6204.name: Model Vanguard
6204.description:
An exact 1:9 scale replica of a ceruleum-powered magitek vanguard (imperial pilot action figure not included).

Use item to acquire the model vanguard minion.

6205.name: Demon Brick
6205.description:
We are all better off not knowing what arcane magicks animate this ordinary stone block.

Use item to acquire the demon brick minion.

6208.name: Slime Puddle
6208.description:
Fun for the whole family.

Use item to acquire the slime puddle minion.

6209.name: Kidragora
6209.description:
Even in space, everyone can hear this seedkin scream.

Use item to acquire the kidragora minion.

6213.name: Wind-up Airship
6213.description:
A fully operational model of the legendary vessel, the Invincible.

Use item to acquire the wind-up airship minion.

6214.name: Wind-up Qiqirn
6214.description:
As adorable as the real thing, without the ratty odor.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Qiqirn minion.

6475.description:

※One per estate only.

6476.name: Shroud Broadleaf

6477.name: Island Palm
6477.description: An island palm native to Vylbrand.

6478.name: Desert Ironwood
6478.description: An ironwood tree native to Thanalan.

6479.description: An uncommonly sturdy rock sourced from La Noscea. You break it, you buy it.

6480.name: Mossy Rock
6480.description: A rock of the unrolling persuasion, sourced from the Black Shroud.

6481.name: Campfire
6481.description: Share scary stories with your comrades over this authentic campfire.

6482.description: Keep the scorching sun at bay with this vast linen parasol.

6483.name: Lotus Parasol
6483.description: Part plant. Part ornament. All parasol.

6484.description: A round outdoor table crafted from walnut.

6485.description: A garden table boasting a mythril-reinforced surface.

6489.description: A barrel planter crafted from elm.

6490.name: Riviera Lamppost
6490.description: A lamppost of steel such as one might see lining a Lominsan street.

6491.name: Crofter's Wain
6491.description: A trusty four-wheeled wain crafted from ash, worn from generations of use. Legend goes that its former owner died pulling it through the snow-blasted mountain paths of Coerthas.

6492.name: Stump Stool
6492.description: Simplicity never goes out of style.

6494.name: Firewood
6494.description: Nothing exudes bucolic charm like a stack of firewood.

6495.name: Sylphic Lamp Tree
6495.description: Any sylph would feel at home beneath the gentle glow of this lamp tree.

6496.name: Sylphic Lamppost
6496.description: A quaint lamppost inspired by sylphic colors and curves.

6497.name: Cragsoul Lamp
6497.description:
An imposing garden lamp made using fragments of the primal Titan.

※One per estate only.

6498.name: Titanic Cragsoul Lamp
6498.description:
An imposing garden lamp made using fragments of the primal Titan─now with more glow!

※One per estate only.

6499.name: Wavesoul Fount
6499.description:
An ornamental fountain made using the barb of the primal Leviathan.

※One per estate only.

6500.name: Tidal Wavesoul Fount
6500.description:
An ornamental fountain made using the barb of the primal Leviathan─now with more glow!

※One per estate only.

6501.name: Dark Divinity Falleth
6501.description:
A monument commemorating the fall of Odin, made using the elder primal's mantle. Also serves to ward off evil.

※One per estate only.

6502.name: Savage Arc of Triumph
6502.description:
A memorial gate made using the fell blade of Phlegethon.

※One per estate only.

6503.name: Blue Coral Formation
6503.description: A luminescent blue coral found within the Sastasha Seagrot.

6504.name: Bertha Cannon
6504.description: A quad-barrel cannon engineered for counter-dragon warfare. As seen at the Stone Vigil.

6505.name: Cannonballs
6505.description: Cannonballs for use with the Bertha counter-dragon cannon. As seen at the Stone Vigil.

6506.name: Stone Vigil Beacon
6506.description: A watch beacon used by the knights of Ishgard. As seen at the Stone Vigil.

6507.name: Bloodblossoms
6507.description: A flowering ground cover plant that thrives in the suffocating confines of the Aurum Vale.

6508.name: Death's Fingers
6508.description: A pale white tree that thrives in the suffocating confines of the Aurum Vale.

6509.name: Turnkey's Cups
6509.description: A carnivorous cup-shaped plant often found growing in clusters, taken from the Thousand Maws of TotoRak.

6510.name: Pyrepods
6510.description: A brightly hued plant shaped like spiked bulbs, taken from the Thousand Maws of TotoRak.

6511.name: Ghostmaws
6511.description: A carnivorous plant featuring elongated purple leaves that terminate in a trap, taken from the Thousand Maws of TotoRak.

6512.name: Amdapori Beacon
6512.description: A watch beacon crafted in the ancient Amdapori style. As seen within Amdapor Keep.

7038.name: Fine Wax
7038.description: Superior-quality wax used in the maintenance of furnishings at Haukke Manor.

7039.name: Nymian Orb
7039.description: A magicked light-giving orb used by the long-lost Nymian civilization.

7040.name: Belah'dian Glass
7040.description: A round pane of glass excavated from ancient Belah'dian ruins.

7041.name: Blue Fox Hide
7041.description: The hide of a blue fox, prized in wintry regions for its warmth. Can be used to make garments and furnishings.

7042.name: Chinchilla Hide
7042.description: The unblemished hide of a chinchilla, prized in wintry regions for its warmth. Can be used to make garments and furnishings.

7043.name: Ahriman Tears
7043.description: Large teardrops harvested from an ahriman.

7045.name: Morbol Saliva
7045.description: Watery secretions harvested from the mouth of a morbol. Smells as foul as it sounds.

7046.name: Cutting Oil
7046.description: A lubricant used in the working of metal.

7047.name: Frosted Glass Lens
7047.description: A hard flat lens made of opaque glass.

7056.name: Starlight Barding
7056.description: A suit of chocobo armor as worn by those legendary birds said to carry gifts from the stars.

7059.name: Spiritbond Potion
7059.description: This concoction enhances the rate at which your equipment gains spiritbond. Duration: 180m

7064.name: Summoning Bell
7064.description:
A bell for summoning your retainer.

※One per estate only.

7065.name: Woodworking Bench
7065.description:
An on-estate crafting facility for carpenters. Temporarily increases maximum CP for carpenters level 80 or below.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7066.name: Smithing Bench
7066.description:
An on-estate crafting facility for blacksmiths. Temporarily increases maximum CP for blacksmiths level 80 or below.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7067.name: Armorcraft Forge
7067.description:
An on-estate crafting facility for armorers. Temporarily increases maximum CP for armorers level 80 or below.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7068.name: Goldsmithing Bench
7068.description:
An on-estate crafting facility for goldsmiths. Temporarily increases maximum CP for goldsmiths level 80 or below.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7069.name: Leatherworking Bench
7069.description:

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7070.name: Clothcraft Loom
7070.description:
An on-estate crafting facility for weavers. Temporarily increases maximum CP for weavers level 80 or below.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 2, 4, 6, and 8 facilities, respectively.

7073.name: Riviera Table Chronometer
7073.description: A precision instrument for telling time, designed in the riviera fashion. Suitable for table surfaces.

7074.name: Glade Wall Chronometer
7074.description: A precision instrument for telling time, designed in the glade fashion. Suitable for mounting on walls.

7075.name: Tonberry Round Table

7076.name: Tonberry Dining Table
7076.description: A rancorous dining table designed in a tonberry king motif.

7077.name: Tonberry Armchair
7077.description: A rancorous armchair designed in a tonberry king motif.

7079.description: A rancorous bookshelf designed in a tonberry king motif.

7083.name: Tonberry Oval Rug

7084.name: Lalafellin Step Stool
7084.description: A wooden step stool made to a Lalafell's measure.

7085.name: Stuffed Ahriman
7085.description: Although it doesn't fly, its petrifying gaze is certain to keep would-be burglars at bay.

7086.name: Ahriman Vase
7086.description: A wide-eyed vase designed in an ahriman motif, holding a leafy tree cutting.

7087.name: Carbuncle Round Table
7087.description: A fluffy and faithful round table designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7088.name: Carbuncle Armchair
7088.description: A trusty armchair designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7089.name: Carbuncle Desk
7089.description: A fluffy and faithful desk designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7090.name: Carbuncle Chair
7090.description: A fluffy and faithful chair designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7091.name: Carbuncle Wardrobe
7091.description: A fluffy and faithful wardrobe designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7092.name: Carbuncle Rug
7092.description: A fluffy and faithful rug woven in a Carbuncle motif.

7093.name: Carbuncle Chronometer
7093.description: A fluffy and faithful timepiece designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7094.name: Carbuncle Lantern
7094.description: A fluffy and faithful lantern designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7095.name: Admiral Portrait
7095.description: A commissioned portrait of Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn entitled Will of Iron. Original artist unknown.

7096.name: Sultana and Flame General Portrait
7096.description: A commissioned portrait of Nanamo Ul Namo and Raubahn Aldynn entitled Protectors of the Sultanate. Original artist unknown.

7097.name: Elder Seedseer Portrait
7097.description: A commissioned portrait of KanESenna entitled Tranquility Embodied. Original artist unknown.

7098.name: Looming Tonberry Screen
7098.description: A rancorous screen designed in a tonberry king motif. Is it just your imagination, or is he getting closer each time you look away?

7099.name: Tonberry Square Rug
7099.description: A rancorous square rug designed in a tonberry king motif.

7100.name: Projection Module
7100.description:
The wisdom of ancient Allag laid Eorzea to waste; now it creates dazzling displays in the comfort of your estate hall.

※One per estate only.

7101.name: Purification Module
7101.description:
The wisdom of ancient Allag laid Eorzea to waste; now it keeps your estate hall free of dust and other contaminants.

※One per estate only.

7102.name: Eorzean Map Table
7102.description: Many a military maneuver was deliberated around this map table, appropriated from the Stone Vigil.

7103.name: Dragon Piece
7103.description: A chess piece representing dragons. For use on the Eorzean map table.

7104.name: Wyvern Piece
7104.description: A chess piece representing wyverns. For use on the Eorzean map table.

7105.name: Vigil Piece
7105.description: A chess piece representing an Ishgardian stronghold. For use on the Eorzean map table.

7106.name: Temple Knight Piece
7106.description: A chess piece representing the Temple Knights. For use on the Eorzean map table.

7107.name: Dragoon Piece
7107.description: A chess piece representing the dragoons. For use on the Eorzean map table.

7108.name: Manor Harpsichord
7108.description: A haunting harpsichord custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7109.name: Manor Music Stool
7109.description: A haunting music stool custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7110.name: Manor Timpani
7110.description: A haunting timpani custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7111.name: Manor Marching Horn
7111.description: A haunting marching horn custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7112.name: Manor Cello
7112.description: A haunting cello custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7113.name: Manor Harp
7113.description: A haunting harp custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7114.name: Manor Music Stand
7114.description: A haunting music stand custom-made for Haukke Manor.

7115.name: Regal Letter Box
7115.description:
Does everything the moogle letter box does, but with more majesty!

※One per estate only.

7116.name: Carbuncle Garden Table
7116.description: A fluffy and faithful garden table designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7117.name: Carbuncle Garden Bench
7117.description: A fluffy and faithful garden bench designed in a Carbuncle motif.

7118.name: Riviera Striking Dummy
7118.description:
A striking dummy designed in the riviera fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

7119.name: Oasis Striking Dummy
7119.description:
A striking dummy designed in the oasis fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

7120.name: Glade Striking Dummy
7120.description:
A striking dummy designed in the glade fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

7121.name: Alps Striking Dummy
7121.description:
A striking dummy designed in the alps fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

7122.name: Sahagin Living Lamp
7122.description: Any Sahagin would feel at home by the gentle glow of this living lamp.

7123.name: Sahagin Hanging Larder
7123.description: The Sahagin typically hang their foodstuff on this treelike coral formation, the better to prevent its being swept away by the sea.

7124.name: Ixali Shelter
7124.description: A small and cozy shelter of Ixali design.

7125.name: Ixali Banner
7125.description: The mere sight of this banner instills any Ixal with courage.

7126.name: Automaton Digger
7126.description: An ingenious mining automaton created by the kobolds.

7127.name: Kobold Furnace
7127.description: A furnace made by the kobolds for alchemical purposes.

7128.name: Round Garden Patch
7128.description:
A garden patch with room for four beds.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 1, 2, and 3 garden patches, respectively.

7129.name: Oblong Garden Patch
7129.description:
A garden patch with room for six beds.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 1, 2, and 3 garden patches, respectively.

7130.name: Deluxe Garden Patch
7130.description:
A garden patch with room for eight beds. Comes complete with its own scarecrow.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 1, 2, and 3 garden patches, respectively.

7131.name: Country Interior Wall
7131.description: An interior wall designed in the country fashion.

7132.name: Stone Interior Wall
7132.description: An interior wall of smooth-cut stone.

7133.name: Storm Interior Wall
7133.description: Display your patriotic zeal with this Maelstrom-themed interior wall.

7134.name: Serpent Interior Wall
7134.description: Display your patriotic zeal with this Twin Adder-themed interior wall.

7135.name: Flame Interior Wall
7135.description: Display your patriotic zeal with this Immortal Flames-themed interior wall.

7136.name: Tiled Interior Wall
7136.description: An interior wall made from tiles of various shades of blue.

7137.name: Metal Interior Wall
7137.description: A futuristic wall featuring riveted metal plates.

7138.name: Arbor Interior Wall
7138.description: An interior wall that puts you in an idyllic arbor setting.

7139.name: Chocobo Interior Wall
7139.description: An interior wall for all the chocobo-lovers out there.

7140.name: Moogle Interior Wall
7140.description: An interior wall for all the moogle-lovers out there.

7141.name: Country Flooring
7141.description: Flooring designed in the country fashion.

7143.name: Storm Flooring
7143.description: Display your patriotic zeal with this Maelstrom-themed flooring.

7144.name: Serpent Flooring
7144.description: Display your patriotic zeal with this Twin Adder-themed flooring.

7148.description: Flooring that puts you in an idyllic arbor setting.
