7149.description: Flooring for all the chocobo-lovers out there.

7150.name: Moogle Flooring
7150.description: Flooring for all the moogle-lovers out there.

7151.name: Tonberry Chandelier
7151.description: A rancorous chandelier designed in a tonberry king motif.

7152.name: Sultana Portrait
7152.description: A commissioned portrait of Nanamo Ul Namo entitled Heart of Ul'dah. Original artist unknown.

7153.name: Material Supplier Permit
7153.description:
This permit allows the hiring of material suppliers on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

7154.name: Junkmonger Permit
7154.description:
This permit allows the hiring of junkmongers on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

7156.name: Mender Permit
7156.description:
This permit allows the hiring of menders on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

7157.name: White Raven Armor Fragment
7157.description: A fragment of the armor worn by Legatus Nael van Darnus of the Garlean Empire.

7158.name: Stone Vigil Lumber
7158.description: Sturdy lumber scavenged from the Stone Vigil.

7159.name: Leviathan's Barb
7159.description: Wrenched from the maw of the Lord of the Whorl himself, this razor-sharp barb is constantly slick with brine.

7160.name: Barb of the Whorl
7160.description: Wrenched from the maw of the Lord of the Whorl himself, this razor-sharp barb churns with the unbridled power of the sea.

7161.name: Kingly Whisker
7161.description: This whisker, imbued with the majesty of all moogle monarchs past and present, once belonged to Good King Moggle Mog, Twelfth of His Name.

7550.name: Egg Harness
7550.description: An egg-themed chocobo harness created in celebration of Hatchingtide.

7552.name: Tidal Barding
7552.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Leviathan, the Lord of the Whorl.

7559.name: Plush Cushion
7559.description:
Ever ready to shield your buttocks from the hardest of places.

Use item to acquire the plush cushion minion.

7564.name: Baby Opo-opo
7564.description:
The only thing he loves more than you is a juicy sprite apple.

Use item to acquire the baby opoopo minion.

7566.name: Minute Mindflayer
7566.description:
This mindflayer young delights folk with its cuteness even as it fills them with an inexplicable sense of dread.

Use item to acquire the minute mindflayer minion.

7567.name: Tight-beaked Parrot
7567.description:
For best results, summon while wearing an eyepatch.

Use item to acquire the tight-beaked parrot minion.

7568.name: Magic Broom
7568.description:
For safety reasons, do not fall asleep while it is at work.

Use item to acquire the magic broom minion.

7570.name: Steamed Catfish
7570.description: A hearty dish made by steaming a whole giant catfish in wine and spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7571.name: Popoto Pancakes
7571.description: A pancake dish made of ground Dalamud popotoes, served with puréed mirror apples. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7572.name: Roast Canard
7572.description: A canard breast roasted to perfection, drowned in a sweet and sour sauce made from two kinds of oranges. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7573.name: Sachertorte
7573.description: A divinely rich chocolate cake that features a fruity counterpoint by way of an apricot jam layer. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7574.name: Chilled Popoto Soup
7574.description: A refreshing soup made by blending popoto, leek, and sweet cream to a smooth consistency. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7575.name: Spinach Quiche
7575.description: A savory pastry made by baking a mixture of sautéed spinach and cream cheese within pie dough. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7579.name: Mossy Stone Sword
7579.description: A sword crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7580.name: Mossy Stone Axe
7580.description: An axe crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7581.name: Mossy Stone Claws
7581.description: A pair of claws crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7582.name: Mossy Stone Spear
7582.description: A spear crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7583.name: Mossy Stone Bow
7583.description: A bow crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7584.name: Mossy Stone Staff
7584.description: A staff crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7585.name: Mossy Stone Rod
7585.description: A rod crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

7586.name: Weathered Tome
7586.description: This weathered tome appears to have been a magical grimoire in a previous life.

7587.name: Faded Tome
7587.description: This faded tome appears to have been a magical grimoire in a previous life.

7588.name: Ferberite
7588.description: A jet black mineral with alluring luster.

7589.name: Native Gold
7589.description: A high-purity, naturally occurring nugget of gold.

7590.name: Scarlet Sap
7590.description: Its color reminiscent of blood, this sap is used in the working of aged lumber.

7591.name: Shroud Tea Leaves
7591.description: Picked from plants that grow wild in the Black Shroud, these leaves are extremely bitter and are not ideal for brewing tea.

7592.name: Apricot
7592.description: A variety of stone fruit borne over from the Near East. Its orange flesh is at once sweet and tart. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7593.name: La Noscean Leek
7593.description: A rare variety of leek, typically harvested young for a milder flavor.

7594.name: Young Cieldalaes Spinach
7594.description: This bunch of Cieldalaes spinach has been picked young to reduce bitterness.

7595.name: Blood Orange
7595.description: A rare variety of orange grown in La Noscea, named for its unusual red flesh. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7596.name: Petrified Log
7596.description: The passage of time has turned this log into stone.

7597.name: Scheelite
7597.description: A mysterious ore that glows intermittently.

7598.name: Raziqsand
7598.description: Discovered by a Far Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to harden gold.

7599.name: Saurian Skin
7599.description: The rare hide of a saurian.

7600.name: Cashmere Fleece
7600.description: Lustrous white wool sheared from a species of mountain goat prized for its fleece.

7601.name: Emery
7601.description: Powderized garnet used in the polishing of gemstones.

7602.name: Star Anise
7602.description: Originating from the Far East, this fragrant spice is shaped like eight-pointed stars.

7603.name: Dalamud Popoto
7603.description: Hailing also from the western continent, this cousin to the common popoto is lurid red in color.

7604.name: Royal Kukuru Bean
7604.description: A king among kukuru bean varieties, prized for its high nutritional value.

7605.name: Canard Breast
7605.description: A tender piece of meat taken from the breast of a farm-fattened duck.

7606.name: Ancient Lumber
7606.description: A length of lumber obtained by processing a petrified log.

7608.name: Saurian Leather
7608.description: A large piece of cured saurian skin.

7609.name: Cashmere Cloth
7609.description: Several yalms of cashmere cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

7620.name: Diluted Vitriol
7620.description: A flask of vitriol diluted with pure water.

7621.name: Glamour Dispeller
7621.description: This black prism absorbs the magical lights woven upon a glamoured piece of equipment, thus dispelling the optical illusion. Be fairly warned that dyes and company crests are also removed in the process.

7671.name: Clear Prism
7671.description: An uncolored, transparent prism used in the crafting of a glamour prism.

7678.name: Zalera
7678.description:
A king among angelfish, and lord of the waters of the Zephyr Drift.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7679.name: Beguiler Chub
7679.description:
A king among chubs, and lord of the waters of the Rogue River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7680.name: Oschon's Print
7680.description:
A king among Moraby flounder, and lord of the waters of Moraby Bay.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7681.name: Caterwauler
7681.description:
A king among dwarf catfish, and lord of the waters of the Mourning Widow.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7682.name: Crystal Perch
7682.description:
A king among glass perch, and lord of the waters of Woad Whisper Canyon.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7683.name: Moldva
7683.description:
A king among Ala Mhigan fighting fish, and lord of the waters of Springripple Brook.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7684.name: Junkmonger
7684.description:
A king among goosefish, and lord of the waters of Skull Valley.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

7685.name: Goldenfin
7685.description:
A king among coral butterflies, and lord of the waters of the Limsa Lominsa upper decks.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7686.name: Gigantshark
7686.description:
A king among silver sharks, and lord of the waters of Summerford.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

7687.name: Armorer
7687.description:
A rare variety of sea snail whose foot is covered in metallic scales. Lord of the waters of Swiftperch.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7688.name: Great Gudgeon
7688.description:
A king among gudgeon, and lord of the waters of the west Agelyss River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7689.name: Dark Knight
7689.description:
A king among dark bass, and lord of the waters of the Unholy Heir.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7691.name: Sabertooth Cod
7691.description:
A king among tiger cod, and lord of the waters of Candlekeep Quay.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7692.name: Dream Goby
7692.description:
A king among dusk gobies, and lord of the waters of upper Soot Creek.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7694.name: Dark Ambusher
7694.description:
A king among dark sleepers, and lord of the waters of Sweetbloom Pier.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7695.name: Judgeray
7695.description:
A magnificent specimen of stingray, a cartilaginous fish possessed of a razorsharp, poisonous stinger. Lord of the waters of Fallgourd Float.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7696.name: Bloody Brewer
7696.description:
A king among pipira, and lord of the waters of the lower Black Tea Brook.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7697.name: Faerie Queen
7697.description:
A queen among faerie bass, and supreme ruler of the waters of Empty Heart.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7698.name: Slime King
7698.description:
A king among brass loaches, and lord of the waters of lower Soot Creek.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7699.name: Blue Widow
7699.description:
A king among bluebell salmon, and lord of the waters of Murmur Rills.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7700.name: Ghost Carp
7700.description:
A king among tricolored carp, and lord of the waters of the Mirror.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7701.name: Carp Diem
7701.description:
A king among moat carp, and lord of the waters of the upper Black Tea Brook.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7702.name: Mud Pilgrim
7702.description:
A king among mudskippers, and lord of the waters of south Drybone.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7703.name: Old Softie
7703.description:
A king among bone crayfish, and lord of the waters of the Clutch.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7704.name: Marrow Sucker
7704.description:
A king among bone cleaners, and lord of the waters of north Drybone.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7705.name: Chirurgeon
7705.description:
A king among eunuch crayfish, and lord of the waters of the Vein.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7706.name: Mud Golem
7706.description:
A king among mudcrabs, and lord of the waters of the Footfalls.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7707.name: Octomammoth
7707.description:
A king among blue octopodes, and lord of the waters of the Limsa Lominsa lower decks.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7708.name: Matron Carp
7708.description:
A queen among maiden carp, and ruler of the waters of Whispering Gorge.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7709.name: High Perch
7709.description:
A king among La Noscean perch, and lord of the waters of the Nym River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7710.name: Syldra
7710.description:
A queen among leafy seadragons, and ruler of the waters of Cedarwood.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7711.name: Rivet Oyster
7711.description:
A king among Rothlyt oysters, and lord of the waters of Vesper Bay.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7712.name: Jacques the Snipper
7712.description:
A king among pebble crabs, and lord of the waters of the Moraby Drydocks.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7713.name: Stormdancer
7713.description:
A king among raincallers, and lord of the waters of the Jadeite Flood.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7714.name: Glimmerscale
7714.description:
A king among copperfish, and lord of the waters of Nophica's Wells.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7758.name: Grade 1 La Noscean Topsoil
7758.description: Grade 1 topsoil obtained in the La Noscean region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield higher quality crops.

7759.name: Grade 2 La Noscean Topsoil
7759.description: Grade 2 topsoil obtained in the La Noscean region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield higher quality crops.

7760.name: Grade 3 La Noscean Topsoil
7760.description: Grade 3 topsoil obtained in the La Noscean region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield higher quality crops.

7761.name: Grade 1 Shroud Topsoil
7761.description: Grade 1 topsoil obtained in the Black Shroud region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield more crops.

7762.name: Grade 2 Shroud Topsoil
7762.description: Grade 2 topsoil obtained in the Black Shroud region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield more crops.

7763.name: Grade 3 Shroud Topsoil
7763.description: Grade 3 topsoil obtained in the Black Shroud region. Increases the likelihood that plants will yield more crops.

7764.name: Grade 1 Thanalan Topsoil
7764.description: Grade 1 topsoil obtained in the Thanalan region. Increases the likelihood that plants will intercross with one another.

7765.name: Grade 2 Thanalan Topsoil
7765.description: Grade 2 topsoil obtained in the Thanalan region. Increases the likelihood that plants will intercross with one another.

7766.name: Grade 3 Thanalan Topsoil
7766.description: Grade 3 topsoil obtained in the Thanalan region. Increases the likelihood that plants will intercross with one another.

7767.name: Fish Meal
7767.description: A fertilizer made by taking dried Lominsan anchovies and grinding them into a fine powder.

7768.name: Halone Gerbera
7768.description: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Halone, the Fury.

7769.name: Azeyma Rose
7769.description: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Azeyma, the Warden.

7770.name: Nymeia Lily
7770.description: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Nymeia, the Spinner.

7771.name: Dress Material
7771.description: Pre-cut linen used in the sewing of a spring dress.

7772.name: Mariner Cotton Cloth
7772.description: Favored by sailors, this bundle of cotton cloth is resistant to wrinkles even when wet.

7773.name: Umbrella Fig
7773.description: An ornamental plant native to the islands of the south seas, given its name by Lalafellin clans who used its prodigious leaves in lieu of umbrellas.

7774.name: Jute
7774.description: Native to the islands of the south seas, the fibrous stem of this plant can be used to weave cloth.

7775.name: Glazenut
7775.description: The oil extracted from this nut is ideal for use as varnish.

7776.name: Broombush
7776.description: The dried stalks of this hardy shrub are commonly used in the making of brooms.

7794.name: Light Steel Plate
7794.description: A sheet of hammered light steel.

7795.name: Taffeta Cloth
7795.description: A soft and effulgent cloth originating from the southern lands.

7806.name: Tawny Latex
7806.description: Tawny in color, this rare variety of latex is yielded only by specific trees.

7807.name: Terminus Putty
7807.description: A powerful adhesive invented by Master Severian of the Alchemists' Guild, so named for being the putty to end all putty.

7808.name: Manor Varnish
7808.description: Used extensively at Haukke Manor, this varnish enhances the acoustic properties of musical instruments.

7809.name: Magicked Prism (Sunshine)
7809.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Produces a radiant light that envelops the user.

7810.name: Magicked Prism (Stardust)
7810.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Produces a shower of glittering stardust.

7894.name: Curiel Root
7894.description:
A parsnip-like tuber found growing on the windswept islands of the northern seas. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the root is often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases EXP earned by your chocobo companion.

7895.name: Sylkis Bud
7895.description:
An artichoke-like flower found growing on a majority of the Cieldalaes. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the meaty buds are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's attack potency.

7897.name: Mimett Gourd
7897.description:
A large fleshy squash brought back from the New World by Lominsan explorers. While too sweet for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the gourds are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's healing magic potency.

7898.name: Tantalplant
7898.description:
A vibrant purple vegetable commonly found growing in the Near East. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus these aubergines are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's maximum HP.

7900.name: Pahsana Fruit
7900.description:
A bright-red tomato-like fruit brought back from the New World by Lominsan explorers. While too tangy for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the fruits are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's enmity.

7902.name: Cupfish
7902.description:
A rare freshwater fish which spends the entirety of its life hiding in locations which rarely see the light of the sun.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7903.name: Meteor Survivor
7903.description:
A king among helmet crabs, and lord of the waters off the Salt Strand.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7904.name: Joan of Trout
7904.description:
A queen among trout, and lady of the waters of Fool Falls.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7905.name: Toramafish
7905.description:
A king among coeurlfish, and lord of the waters of Oakwood.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

7906.name: Fingers
7906.description:
A king among rock lobsters, and lord of the waters of Crescent Cove.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7907.name: The Assassin
7907.description:
A king among river crabs, and lord of the waters of the Sanctum of the Twelve.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7908.name: Vip Viper
7908.description:
A king among black eels, and lord of the waters of the upper Hathoeva River. Some claim that jerking up, up, down, down, left, right, left, and right on one's pole increases chances of landing this slippery specimen.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7909.name: The Greatest Bream in the World
7909.description:
A king among Bianaq bream, and lord of the waters off south Bloodshore.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7910.name: Dirty Herry
7910.description:
A king among Indigo herring. Go ahead. Make his day.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7911.name: Old Hollow Eyes
7911.description:
A king among plaguefish, and lord of the waters of Burnt Lizard Creek.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7912.name: Sylphsbane
7912.description:
A king among fall jumpers, and lord of the waters of Verdant Drop.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7913.name: Floating Boulder
7913.description:
A king among climbing perch, and lord of the waters of the lower Hathoeva River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7914.name: The Grinner
7914.description:
A king among Velodyna carp, and lord of the waters of the east Hathoeva River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7915.name: Shark Tuna
7915.description:
A king among ash tuna, and lord of the waters off Costa del Sol.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7916.name: Worm of Nym
7916.description:
A king among jade eels, and lord of the Bronze Lake shallows.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7917.name: Twitchbeard
7917.description:
An extremely rare cephalopod rumored to have ties to the legendary pirate king Mistbeard.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7918.name: The Warden's Wand
7918.description:
A king among trader eels, and lord of the waters of the Yugr'am River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7919.name: Spearnose
7919.description:
An extremely rare freshwater fish known for its unbelievably long mouth...er...nose.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7920.name: Levinlight
7920.description:
A king among spotted plecos, and lord of the waters of Everschade.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7921.name: The Sinker
7921.description:
A king among Yugr'am salmon.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7922.name: The Gobfather
7922.description:
A king among goblin perch, and lord of the waters of Goblinblood.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7923.name: Sweetnewt
7923.description:
An extremely rare amphibian that excretes a sweet-yet-toxic substance from its skin to teach would-be predators a deadly lesson.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7924.name: Bombardfish
7924.description:
A king among balloonfish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7925.name: The Salter
7925.description:
A king among spotted puffers.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7926.name: The Lone Ripper
7926.description:
A king among hammerhead sharks.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7927.name: King of the Spring
7927.description:
A king among Bronze Lake trout.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7928.name: Discobolus
7928.description:
A king among Paglth'an discus.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7929.name: Iron Noose
7929.description:
A king among ropefish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7931.name: Magic Carpet
7931.description:
A king among dune mantas.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7932.name: Daniffen's Mark
7932.description:
A king among seema.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7933.name: Charon's Lantern
7933.description:
A king among lamp marimo.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7934.name: The Green Jester
7934.description:
A king among clown loaches.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7935.name: Bloodbath
7935.description:
A king among monke onke.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7936.name: Son of Levin
7936.description:
A king among judgment staves.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7937.name: Thundergut
7937.description:
A king among thunderbolt sculpin.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7938.name: The Drowned Sniper
7938.description:
A king among archerfish.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7939.name: The Terpsichorean
7939.description:
A king among mitten crabs. When given the opportunity, he will, quite literally, cut a rug.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7940.name: Mirrorscale
7940.description:
A king among silverfish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7941.name: Helmsman's Hand
7941.description:
A king among sunfish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

7942.name: The Thousand-year Itch
7942.description:
A king among loyal plecos.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7943.name: Hannibal
7943.description:
A king among alligator garfish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7944.name: Dawn Maiden
7944.description:
A queen among crimson trout.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7945.name: Starbright
7945.description:
A king among kissing trout.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7946.name: The Matriarch
7946.description:
A queen among Abalathian smelt.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

7947.name: Shadowstreak
7947.description:
A king among southern pike.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7948.name: The Captain's Chalice
7948.description:
A king among nautiluses.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

7949.name: Anomalocaris
7949.description:
A king among rift sailors.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7950.name: Frilled Shark
7950.description:
An extremely rare breed of shark with a uniquely shaped maw hiding multiple rows of razor-sharp teeth.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

7951.name: Aetherlouse
7951.description:
The recent discovery of this vilekin-like denizen of the deep has given rise to fantastical theories that all land-dwelling creatures on Hydaelyn may once have come from the seas.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

7958.name: Riviera Wall Shelf
7958.description: Wall-mounted shelves designed to complement riviera residences.

7959.name: Gourmet Lunch
7959.description: A freshly prepared lunch, complete with a healthy green salad. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 14) +4% (Max 9) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7960.name: Gourmet Supper
7960.description: A multiple-course meal certain to impress all manner of dinner guests, whether invited or not. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 22) +4% (Max 15) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7961.name: Afternoon Tea Set
7961.description: Add a hint of sophistication to your residence with this elegant collection of ceramic ware. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Spell Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 22) +4% (Max 15) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7962.name: Assorted Fruit
7962.description: The world is better off oblivious of the fell magicks used to keep this basket of fruit eternally free of bruises and mold. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Direct Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 20) +4% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7963.name: Chilled Red
7963.description: Ice shards applied to the cooler's inner lining keep this bottle of Wineport's unfermented finest as cold as a Coerthan winter. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Piety Bonus: +4% (Max 5) +4% (Max 6) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

7964.name: The Five Ages
7964.description: Impress your friends with these beautiful leather-bound replicas of Lewphon of Sharlayan's crowning achievement in the field of history, theology, and astrology. Just do not allow those friends to open any of the volumes, as they are all blank.

7965.name: Classified Documents
7965.description: Need to convince a special someone that you are deeply involved in a tangled web of international intrigue, so that they might keep you company in your chambers on what most certainly could be your last night amongst the living? A couple of official-looking documents can only help your ignoble cause.

7966.name: Stuffed Goblin
7966.description: All attempts to remove the mask of this goblin replica have failed, so do not even consider trying it yourself.

7967.name: Ultima Weapon Miniature
7967.description: An expertly crafted replica of the Ultima Weapon. (Miniature Gaius van Baelsar sold separately.)

7969.name: Enquire Within
7969.description: A commissioned oil painting of realm-renowned agent of enquiry Hildibrand and his faithful assistant Nashu Mhakaracca. Original artist unknown.

7970.name: Wall Planter
7970.description: A simple wall-mounted planter, perfect for flowers or miniature shrubs.

7971.name: Encyclopedia Eorzea
7971.description: Impress your friends with these beautiful leather-bound replicas of naturalist Marcette Manne's comprehensive collection of knowledge. Just do not allow those friends to open any of the volumes, as they are all blank.

7972.name: Open Hearth
7972.description: A chimney-less hearth designed to resemble those popular in the Far East. Do not forget proper ventilation while using.

7973.name: Riviera Half Partition
7973.description: A partition designed in the riviera fashion, but reaching only less than halfway to the ceiling so as to provide privacy without making the room feel smaller.

7974.name: Potted Umbrella Fig
7974.description: A pruned and potted umbrella fig tree.

7975.name: Potted Dragon Tree
7975.description: A pruned and potted dragon tree. It is said that anyone in the presence of this breed of flora is unable to tell a lie, though it might also be that anyone in the presence of a dragon tree is unable to ask the hard questions.

7976.name: Model Star Globe
7976.description: A spherical map of the heavens based off of legendary Ishgardian astrologian Adaunel the Younger's lifetime of findings.

7977.name: Tatami Mat
7977.description: Woven from sweet-smelling rush grass, these rectangular floor mats are widely used in the Far Eastern land of Doma.

7978.name: Corner Counter
7978.description: A low counter-type table crafted in an L shape.

7979.name: Planter Partition
7979.description: A low partition outfitted with several planter pots.

7980.name: Plasma Lamp
7980.description:
A stylish floor lamp crafted from a rare Levin orb.

※One per estate only.

7981.name: Lord of Levin Lamp
7981.description:
A stylish floor lamp crafted from a large Levin orb─now with more snap, crackle, and pop!

※One per estate only.

7982.name: Emperor's Throne
7982.description:
Grant boons and make decrees in style while lounging in this near-perfect replica of Emperor Xande's throne.

※One per estate only.

7983.name: Riviera Doormat
7983.description: A welcome mat designed to complement riviera residences. Don't tread on me.

7984.name: Double Feather Bed
7984.description: Made from the feathers of forty-leven geese, this large bed can hold approximately eight children, four hound dogs, and a piggy stolen from the shed.

7985.name: Chocobo Pillar
7985.description: A decorative pillar designed to resemble a chocobo.

7986.name: Riviera Cushion
7986.description: A plush cushion upholstered in the riviera fashion.

7987.name: Glade Cushion
7987.description: A plush cushion upholstered in the glade fashion.

7988.name: Oasis Cushion
7988.description: A plush cushion upholstered in the oasis fashion.

7989.name: Chocobo Stable
7989.description:
A simple stable large enough for keeping and raising as many chocobos as you can imagine (if 512 is the maximum number you can imagine).

※One per estate only.

7990.name: Moonfire Lantern
7990.description: An outdoor lantern traditionally placed outside one's home for the duration of the Moonfire Faire.

7991.name: Ornamental Bamboo
7991.description: People hailing from the Far East claim that wishes written on small slips of parchment and tied to the bamboo will come true. (Magical wish parchment sold separately.)

7992.name: Rounded Shrub
7992.description: This leafy shrub has been expertly pruned and trimmed into a perfect sphere.

7993.name: Lattice Planter
7993.description: A wooden garden partition outfitted with planter pots.

7994.name: Water Lilies
7994.description: A ceramic pot filled with crystal-clear water and several water lilies.

7995.name: Garden Pond
7995.description: A decorative outdoor pond encircled by smooth stones.

7996.name: Cast-iron Cookpot
7996.description: A blackened pot perfect for hanging over a cookfire.

7997.name: Stepladder
7997.description: Because sometimes there are things even a Roegadyn cannot reach.

7998.name: Straight Stepping Stones
7998.description: Several flat smoothed stones arranged in a straight line.

7999.name: Curved Stepping Stones
7999.description: Several flat smoothed stones arranged in a curving pattern.

8000.name: Straight Stepping Stumps
8000.description: Several thinly cut cross sections of a massive tree trunk arranged to form a straight path.

8001.name: Curved Stepping Stumps
8001.description: Several thinly cut cross sections of a massive tree trunk arranged to form a curved path.

8002.name: Planter Box
8002.description: A rectangular wooden box filled with blooming wildflowers.

8003.name: Wooden Bucket
8003.description: A wooden bucket filled with crystal-clear water. Families in the Far East use these receptacles to chill fruit during the hot summer moons.

8004.name: Glade Hedgewall
8004.description: A living fence designed to complement glade residences. Mix and match at your own peril.

8005.name: Oasis Fence
8005.description: A decorated stone fence designed to complement oasis residences. Mix and match at your own peril.

8006.name: Riviera Fence
8006.description: A pointed iron fence designed to complement riviera residences. Mix and match at your own peril.

8007.name: Riviera Flora Interior Wall
8007.description: A flora-themed interior wall designed to complement riviera residences.

8008.name: Glade Flora Interior Wall
8008.description: A flora-themed interior wall designed to complement glade residences.

8009.name: Oasis Flora Interior Wall
8009.description: A flora-themed interior wall designed to complement oasis residences.

8010.name: Classic Interior Wall
8010.description: Experience luxury living with this interior wall which features an elegant pattern adored by the Ul'dahn elite.

8011.name: Striped Interior Wall
8011.description: These striped walls are guaranteed to make your room appear thin...or fat.

8012.name: Mosaic Interior Wall
8012.description: An intricate interior wall crafted from countless tiny pieces of ceramic fit together in breathtaking patterns.

8013.name: Bisque Flooring
8013.description: Simple, yet stylish, bisque flooring is perfect for the modern adventurer.

8014.name: Marble Flooring
8014.description: Carved from a single piece of beautiful marble, this floor is fit for a king (or queen).

8015.name: Ceramic Tile Flooring
8015.description: Specialty flooring that is cool to the touch and easy to clean.

8017.name: Bombard Lamp
8017.description: A massive lamp designed to resemble the villain of the Moonfire Faire─the Bombard.

8018.name: Throne Gem
8018.description: A brilliant bauble pried from the Emperor Xande's colossal seat of rule.

8019.name: Levin Orb
8019.description: A sphere of lightning-aspected energies encased in a transparent receptacle of hyperfused silica.

8020.name: Large Levin Orb
8020.description: A perfect sphere of overcharged lightning-aspected energies encased in a transparent receptacle of hyperfused silica.

8021.name: Rush Grass
8021.description: A durable sweet-smelling grass native to the Far East and used in the weaving of baskets and floor mats.

8022.name: Young Water Lily
8022.description: A unique type of flora which grows on inland ponds, its round, flat leaves creating a floating canopy on the water's surface.

8023.name: Pearl Roselle
8023.description: A milky white flower commonly found growing in the humid climes of the southern seas.

8024.name: Waterfowl Feather
8024.description: Unlike those of tree-dwelling cloudkin, waterfowl feathers are exceptional at trapping in heat while keeping out water.

8025.name: Floss Silk
8025.description: Silk that has been spun into lightweight balls that bear the appearance of cotton.

8026.name: Mist Silk
8026.description: Each strand of mist silk is twice as thin as regular silk, making it much more difficult to work with.

8027.name: Waterproof Cotton Cloth
8027.description: This soft cloth has been treated with a thin layer of resin to repel water.

8028.name: Polarized Glass
8028.description: Glass treated with a complex alchemical concoction to reduce glare.

8029.name: Wolfram Square
8029.description: A thin, tiny plate of hammered wolfram.

8043.name: Gallant Armor Augmentation
8043.description: Materials required to augment a set of gallant armor.

8044.name: Temple Attire Augmentation
8044.description: Materials required to augment a set of temple attire.

8045.name: Fighter's Armor Augmentation
8045.description: Materials required to augment a set of fighter's armor.

8046.name: Drachen Armor Augmentation
8046.description: Materials required to augment a set of drachen armor.

8047.name: Choral Attire Augmentation
8047.description: Materials required to augment a set of choral attire.

8048.name: Wizard's Attire Augmentation
8048.description: Materials required to augment a set of wizard's attire.

8049.name: Healer's Attire Augmentation
8049.description: Materials required to augment a set of healer's attire.

8050.name: Evoker's Attire Augmentation
8050.description: Materials required to augment a set of evoker's attire.

8051.name: Scholar's Attire Augmentation
8051.description: Materials required to augment a set of scholar's attire.

8142.name: Clear Demimateria I
8142.description:
A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an item by its maker during the crafting process.

Exchangeable for gil.

8143.name: Clear Demimateria II
8143.description:
A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an item by its maker during the crafting process.

Exchangeable for gil.

8144.name: Clear Demimateria III
8144.description:
A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an item by its maker during the crafting process.

Exchangeable for gil.

8145.name: Battlecraft Demimateria I
8145.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

8146.name: Battlecraft Demimateria II
8146.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

8147.name: Battlecraft Demimateria III
8147.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

8148.name: Fieldcraft Demimateria I
8148.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

8149.name: Fieldcraft Demimateria II
8149.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

8150.name: Fieldcraft Demimateria III
8150.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

8151.name: Demimateria of the Inferno
8151.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lord of the Inferno during its creation.

8152.name: Demimateria of the Vortex
8152.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lady of the Vortex during its creation.

8153.name: Demimateria of Crags
8153.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lord of Crags during its creation.

8154.name: Demimog Demimateria
8154.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Good King Moggle Mog XII during its creation.

8155.name: Mastercraft Demimateria
8155.description: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its exceptionally skilled maker during the crafting process.

8156.name: Unhidden Leather Map
8156.description: A detailed map recovered from the treasure coffer in which it was hidden...officially rendering it no longer hidden. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 50 recommended. ※Item level 70 recommended.

8157.name: Xelphatol Apple
8157.description: A bitter fruit found growing in the Ixali homelands. While typically avoided by the five races, and even the Ixal themselves, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to deepen the red hues of their feathers.

8158.name: Doman Plum
8158.description: A hard, bitter fruit found in the forests of Far Eastern Doma. While typically avoided by the five races, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to lighten the red hues of their feathers.

8159.name: Mamook Pear
8159.description: A bitter fruit found growing in the arid soils of Mamook. While typically avoided by the five races, and even the Mamool Ja themselves, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to deepen the green hues of their feathers.

8160.name: Valfruit
8160.description: A bitter berry found growing on the distant Isle of Val. While typically avoided by the five races, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to lighten the green hues of their feathers.

8161.name: O'Ghomoro Berries
8161.description: A bitter fruit found growing on the volcanic soil of O'Ghomoro. While typically avoided by the five races, and the kobolds themselves, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to deepen the blue hues of their feathers.

8162.name: Cieldalaes Pineapple
8162.description: A bitter fruit found growing on the Cieldalaes─a remote archipelago in the Rhotano Sea. While typically avoided by the five races, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to lighten the blue hues of their feathers.

8163.name: Han Lemon
8163.description: A foul, bitter fruit found growing on the Near Eastern island of Thavnair. While typically avoided by the residents of Radz-at-Han, it is a favorite amongst chocobos, and is known to restore feathers to their original hue.

8165.name: Krakka Root
8165.description: A bitter carrot-like root vegetable native to the Near East. While typically avoided by the five races, it is a favorite amongst chocobos.

8166.name: Thavnairian Onion
8166.description: A pungent, tear-inducing vegetable that thrives in the alkali sands of Near Eastern Thavnair. While typically avoided by the five races, it is a favorite amongst chocobos.

8167.name: Pearl Roselle Seeds
8167.description: Pearl roselle seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8168.name: Magicked Stable Broom
8168.description: Why entrust the sweeping of chocobo dung to a coinless pleb with a sick wife and two starving children when you can toss a bewitched broom into your personal stables and be done?

8169.name: Curiel Root Seeds
8169.description: Curiel root seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8170.name: Sylkis Bud Seeds
8170.description: Sylkis bud seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8171.name: Mimett Gourd Seeds
8171.description: Mimett gourd seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8172.name: Tantalplant Seeds
8172.description: Tantalplant seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8173.name: Pahsana Fruit Seeds
8173.description: Pahsana fruit seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8182.name: Krakka Root Seeds
8182.description: Krakka root seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8183.name: Thavnairian Onion Seeds
8183.description: Thavnairian onion seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8184.name: Onion Prince Seeds
8184.description: Onion Prince seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8185.name: Eggplant Knight Seeds
8185.description: Eggplant Knight seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8186.name: Garlic Jester Seeds
8186.description: Garlic Jester seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8187.name: Tomato King Seeds
8187.description: Tomato King seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8188.name: Mandragora Queen Seeds
8188.description: Mandragora Queen seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8192.name: Onion Prince
8192.description:
He would die 4 U. Or possibly cry 4 U. Or most likely make U cry. 4 U.

Use item to acquire the Onion Prince minion.

8193.name: Eggplant Knight
8193.description:
His childhood dream to become a wizard was frowned upon by his overbearing father.

Use item to acquire the Eggplant Knight minion.

8194.name: Garlic Jester
8194.description:
Every breath you take will act as a reminder that your pungent pal is right behind you.

Use item to acquire the Garlic Jester minion.

8195.name: Tomato King
8195.description:
Has issued a royal decree for the public defenestration of any and all who mistakenly claim the king is a vegetable.

Use item to acquire the Tomato King minion.

8196.name: Mandragora Queen
8196.description: Though wed to the Tomato King in a move to strengthen the bond of houses Tomato and Mandragora, the queen longs to steal away with her one true love─the Eggplant Knight. What will become of this forbidden romance!? Use item to acquire the Mandragora Queen minion and find out!

8199.name: Tiny Tapir
8199.description:
Natives of the New World claim that tapirs grow by devouring the dreams of their unsuspecting owners. And now you know what to expect.

Use item to acquire the tiny tapir minion.

8200.name: Nana Bear
8200.description:
Pundits claim bears to be the deadliest beasts in the realm. They obviously have never stared into this cute cub's nebulous eyes.

Use item to acquire the Nana bear minion.

8201.name: Miniature Minecart
8201.description:
Best when ridden in abandoned mines and temples of doom.

Use item to acquire the miniature minecart minion.

8202.name: Nutkin
8202.description:
That nutkins are infamous for being shy and timid creatures shows that this brave beastkin comes complete with a pair of iron acorns on him.

Use item to acquire the nutkin minion.

8205.name: Naughty Nanka
8205.description:
Like its parent, the ninki nanka, this slippery wavekin will breed like a rabbit if left unsupervised.

Use item to acquire the naughty nanka minion.

8214.name: Realm Reborn Red
8214.description: A special vintage of sparkling red wine prepared by master vintner Byrglaent of Wineport for the Rising, an annual celebration of Eorzea's rebirth.

8215.name: Magicked Prism (Meteor Survivor)
8215.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Produces a radiant light that projects images of the lesser moon Dalamud.

8216.name: Pinwheel
8216.description: A spinning firework popular in the Far East.

8570.name: Levin Barding
8570.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Ramuh, the Lord of Levin.

8572.name: Gysahl Greens Seeds
8572.description: Gysahl greens seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

8697.name: Flawless Band
8697.description: From this simple ring, a lifelong bond begins.

8716.name: Demonic Cookie
8716.description: Though this small baked treat provided by the Continental Circus appears to be a cookie, it is difficult to tell what on Hydaelyn it might contain. Consumption should probably be avoided.

8752.name: Imperial Goldfish
8752.description:
A king among goldfish.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

8753.name: The Old Man in the Sea
8753.description:
A king among Mazlaya marlin.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8755.name: Coelacanthus
8755.description:
A king among coelacanths.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8757.name: Seahag
8757.description:
A queen among dinichthys.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8758.name: Ignus Horn
8758.description:
A king among ignus snails.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

8759.name: Void Bass
8759.description:
A king among Ilsabardian bass.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8760.name: Cornelia
8760.description:
A champion among boxing plecos.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8761.name: Ninja Betta
8761.description:
A king among assassin betta.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

8762.name: Canavan
8762.description:
A king among morinabaligi.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8764.name: Pirate's Bane
8764.description:
A king among titanic saws.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8765.name: Ndendecki
8765.description:
A king among soft-shelled snapping turtles.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8766.name: Bat-o'-Nine-Tails
8766.description:
A king among vampire lamperns.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8767.name: Wootz Knifefish Zenith
8767.description:
A king among wootz knifefish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8769.name: Darkstar
8769.description:
A king among angry pike.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8770.name: Blue Corpse
8770.description:
A king among wandering sculpin.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8771.name: Mahar
8771.description:
A king among rhamphorhynchus.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8773.name: Magicked Mushroom
8773.description:
A king among mushroom crabs.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

8774.name: Giant Takitaro
8774.description:
A king among takitaro.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

8776.name: Blood Red Bonytongue
8776.description:
A king among bonytongue.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

8777.name: South Seas Armchair
8777.description: A plush chair designed in the south seas style.

8778.name: South Seas Couch
8778.description: An L-shaped couch designed in the south seas style.

8779.name: Riviera Canopy Bed
8779.description: A luxurious canopied bed designed in the riviera style.

8780.name: Glade Canopy Bed
8780.description: A luxurious canopied bed designed in the glade style.

8781.name: Oasis Canopy Bed
8781.description: A luxurious canopied bed designed in the oasis style.

8782.name: Potted Oliphant's Ear
8782.description: A broad-leafed perennial common on south seas islands such as the Cieldalaes. The shape of the leaf is said to resemble the ear of a legendary beast twice as tall as a Roegadyn and ten times as heavy.

8783.name: Shower Stand
8783.description: A simple indoor shower, perfect for cleansing the body and spirit after a long day of adventure.

8784.name: Head of the Dreadwyrm
8784.description:
An impressive objet d'art depicting the head of the dreadwyrm, Bahamut.

※One per estate only.

8785.name: Syrcus Tower
8785.description:
An expertly crafted representation of the ancient crystalline tower.

※One per estate only.

8786.name: Riviera Stool
8786.description: A quaint round stool designed in the riviera fashion.

8787.name: Glade Stool
8787.description: A quaint round stool designed in the glade fashion.

8788.name: Oasis Stool
8788.description: A quaint round stool designed in the oasis fashion.

8789.name: Armoire
8789.description:
A large wooden wardrobe in which sets of special gear may be stored.

※One per estate only.

8790.name: Masonwork Stove
8790.description: A handcrafted stone stove similar to the ones found in the homes of the realm's smallfolk.

8792.name: Empty Twinkleboxes
8792.description: A twinklebox without a present is like a child without a smile.

8793.name: Riviera Open-shelf Bookcase
8793.description: A backless bookshelf designed in the riviera fashion.

8794.name: Glade Open-shelf Bookcase
8794.description: A backless bookshelf designed in the glade fashion.

8795.name: Oasis Open-shelf Bookcase
8795.description: A backless bookshelf designed in the oasis fashion.

8796.name: Shipping Crate
8796.description: A sturdy wooden box once used to import exotics from across the boundless seas.

8797.name: Wine Barrel
8797.description: A wooden barrel once used to mature wine.

8798.name: Incensory
8798.description: A ceramic censer into which aromatic herbs and oils are inserted and then heated to produce a fragrant smoke.

8799.name: Sheep Dolls
8799.description: Two stuffed sheep─husband and wife─dressed in traditional Far Eastern garb.

8800.name: Hard Rice Cakes
8800.description: Known in the Far East as “kagami mochi,” these cakes are not traditionally eaten, but displayed before and during Heavensturn.

8801.name: Stuffed Qiqirn
8801.description: A handmade doll crafted to resemble a Qiqirn, and dressed in a festive Starlight Celebration outfit.

8802.name: Starlight Dodo
8802.description: A whole dodo stuffed with savory vegetables and slow-roasted on a spit. Often prepared near the end of the year as an offering to the Twelve. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: +4% (Max 3) Gear Durability Bonus: +1 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

8803.name: Pumpkin Basket
8803.description: A pumpkin-shaped basket filled with All Saints' Wake goodies.

8804.name: Starlight Cake
8804.description: Conceived by Bismarck chefs with far too much time on their hands, the Starlight cake is composed of layer after layer after layer...after layer of sweet, decadent heaven. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: +4% (Max 10) Gear Durability Bonus: +1 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

8805.name: Wall Lantern
8805.description: A rectangular oil lamp for indoor use.

8806.name: Manor Sofa
8806.description: An extravagant sofa crafted from the rarest wood and finest cloth obtainable; no expense was spared for this Haukke Manor original.

8807.name: Stuffed Mazlaya Marlin
8807.description: As magnificent as the day it was caught, but without the unpleasant stench of decay.

8808.name: Megalodon Jaws
8808.description: The sheer size of these jawbones adds credit to rumors that megalodons enjoy feeding on unwary swimmers, and will swallow them whole so as not to saturate the surrounding waters with blood, thereby alerting other nearby predators.

8809.name: Stuffed Takitaro
8809.description: No more half-hearted tales about the one that got away. This legend of this rare, elusive fish will live on in style above your mantle or in your den.

8810.name: Starlight Wreath
8810.description: A simple circle of evergreen branches hung on doors during the Starlight Celebration. While the tradition is fairly new, there already exist several theories as to how the practice started. Some believe the circle represents the symbolic beginning and end of a year, and in turn, our lives, while others claim it is merely easier to hang a ring than it is a straight branch.

8811.name: Towel Hanger
8811.description: Without a hanger, where would towels hang?

8812.name: Adventurers' Guild Aduyses
8812.description: A semi-complete collection of notices and timetables, warnings and wanted posters, found in Eorzea's many Adventurers' Guilds.

8813.name: Glade Doormat
8813.description: A lawn-green welcome mat designed to complement glade residences.

8814.name: Oasis Doormat
8814.description: A welcome mat designed to complement oasis residences.

8815.name: Large Woven Rug
8815.description: Try not to wipe your well-traveled feet on this luxurious import.

8816.name: Large Planter Box
8816.description: A deep rectangular box for planting flowers or vegetables.

8817.name: Riviera Path Light
8817.description: A small crystal-powered lantern designed in the riviera style used outdoors to light walkways.

8818.name: Glade Path Light
8818.description: A small crystal-powered lantern designed in the glade style used outdoors to light walkways.

8819.name: Oasis Path Light
8819.description: A small crystal-powered lantern designed in the oasis style used outdoors to light walkways.

8820.name: Glade Lamppost
8820.description: A lamppost of steel such as one might see lining a Gridanian street.

8821.name: Oasis Lamppost
8821.description: A lamppost of steel such as one might see lining an Ul'dahn street.

8822.name: Pumpkin Candlestand
8822.description: A decorated lamppost displayed during All Saints' Wake.

8823.name: Star-topped Starlight Sentinel
8823.description:
A potted fir, decorated with a star-shaped ornament at its apex.

※Only one Starlight sentinel may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

8824.name: Moon-topped Starlight Sentinel
8824.description:
A potted fir, decorated with a crescent moon-shaped ornament at its apex.

※Only one Starlight sentinel may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

8825.name: Sun-topped Starlight Sentinel
8825.description:
A potted fir, decorated with a sun-shaped ornament at its apex.

※Only one Starlight sentinel may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

8826.name: Snowman
8826.description: Garlean scholars have conducted extensive studies on the subject of why Eorzean snowmen are constructed of only two balls of snow rather than three─the number of choice throughout Ilsabard. The prevailing theory is that extensive studies should not have been conducted on said subject.

8827.name: Empty Gift Boxes
8827.description: A box without a gift is like a bird without a song.

8828.name: Kadomatsu
8828.description: A mini-tower of sliced bamboo and pine branches─the kadomatsu is a Far Eastern oddity traditionally displayed at homes and in temples for the duration of Heavensturn.

8829.name: Eerie Wallpaper
8829.description: Ready your estate for All Saints' Wake with this frightening-yet-festive interior wall covering.

8830.name: Starlight Interior Wall
8830.description: This wall bears a festive design certain to bring joy and cheer to all...until you finally get around to taking it down six moons later.

8831.name: Masonwork Interior Wall
8831.description: A sturdy wall of locally quarried stones.

8832.name: Masonwork Flooring
8832.description: A smooth stone floor guaranteed to stay cool in the summer and toe-numbingly cold in the winter.

8833.name: Checkered Flooring
8833.description: Give your estate a modern feel with this quality flooring's contemporary pattern.

8834.name: Iron Plate Flooring
8834.description: Hammered steel flooring for those seeking an imperial feel to their residence.

8835.name: Ice Chandelier
8835.description: A breathtaking ceiling fixture crafted using tears taken from the Lady of Frost herself.

8836.name: Diamond Chandelier
8836.description: An awe-inspiring ceiling fixture crafted using tears taken from the Lady of Frost herself and imbued with magicks ancient and forbidden.

8837.name: Expansion of Duties Permit
8837.description:
An amendment to existing retainer employment contracts allowing for dispatchment on privately owned properties.

※Cottage, house, and mansion gardens can accommodate 1, 2, and 3 retainers, respectively.

8838.name: Level 1 Aetherial Wheel Stand
8838.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds one grade 1 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

8841.name: Retainer Fantasia
8841.description:
Legend states that any who drink this mysterious liquid before lying down for the evening will awaken a new man (or woman).

Grants you a single opportunity to edit your retainer's appearance when speaking to a retainer vocate.

8844.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Confrontation
8844.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action The Heat of Battle (increased EXP earned through battle).

8845.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Productivity
8845.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Earth and Water (increased EXP earned through gathering).

8846.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Industry
8846.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Helping Hand (increased EXP earned through crafting).

8847.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Longeing
8847.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action A Man's Best Friend (increased EXP earned by companions).

8848.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Rivalry
8848.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Mark Up (increased Wolf Marks).

8849.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Company
8849.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Seal Sweetener (increased company seals).

8850.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Initiation
8850.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Brave New World (increased attributes for all Disciple of War or Magic members under level 25).

8851.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Capacity
8851.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Live off the Land (increased Gathering).

8852.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Observation
8852.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action What You See (increased Perception).

8853.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Efficiency
8853.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Eat from the Hand (increased Craftsmanship).

8854.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Precision
8854.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action In Control (increased Control).

8855.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Dedication
8855.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action That Which Binds Us (increased spiritbonding speed).

8856.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Nutriment
8856.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Meat and Mead (increased meal benefit duration).

8857.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Permanence
8857.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Proper Care (prolonged gear wear).

8858.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Swiftness
8858.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Fleet-footed (increased Sprint duration).

8859.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Pilgrimage
8859.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Reduced Rates (decreased teleportation fees).

9256.name: Ninja Garb Augmentation
9256.description: Materials required to augment a set of ninja garb.

9292.name: The Emperor's New Necklace
9292.description: Can only be seen by the most astute observers.

9293.name: The Emperor's New Earrings
9293.description: Can only be seen by the most astute observers.

9294.name: The Emperor's New Bracelet
9294.description: Can only be seen by the most astute observers.

9295.name: The Emperor's New Ring
9295.description: Can only be seen by the most astute observers.

9330.name: Triple Cream Coffee
9330.description: Freshly roasted ground coffee beans percolated to perfection and mixed with an equal amount of thick dairy cream. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9331.name: Bacon Bread
9331.description: Soft dough mixed with thick-sliced bacon and twisted into a pattern resembling a sheaf of wheat. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9332.name: Flint Caviar
9332.description: Salted eggs of the rare emperor fish. Often referred to as black diamonds, the eggs are a delicacy that can only be afforded by the wealthiest of connoisseurs. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9333.name: Shark Fin Soup
9333.description: The massive fin of a megalodon, boiled in a rich Far Eastern broth until soft and gelatinous. While not included in the soup, the remainder of the sharkflesh is salted and dried until rock hard, then shaved into paper-thin slices which, when boiled in hot water, create a savory soup that is the base of countless other recipes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9334.name: Haddock Dip
9334.description: A thick salty dip made from a purée of haddock, raw egg, and mashed popotoes. A favorite of Roegadyn tribes hailing from the north seas. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9335.name: Bacon Broth
9335.description: Though technically a soup, this Ixali dish consists mainly of large slabs of smoked bacon boiled with several other lesser ingredients. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9347.name: Fat Cat
9347.description:
Despite convincing research by top academics from around the realm and beyond, most Miqo'te scholars refuse to believe that there may be some ancestral connection between their race and cats (fat or not).

Use item to acquire the fat cat minion.

9348.name: Littlefoot
9348.description:
This particular yeti is content in knowing that bigger is not always necessarily better.

Use item to acquire the Littlefoot minion.

9349.name: Mummy's Little Mummy
9349.description:
While as cute as a button, remember, mummies are ultimately embalmed corpses damned to eternal thralldom in the land of the living. Have fun.

Use item to acquire the mummy's little mummy minion.

9350.name: Assassin Fry
9350.description:
There was an old betta who swallowed a fry. No one knows why it swallowed the fry, but for some reason, the fry can now fly.

Use item to acquire the assassin fry minion.

9355.name: Ice Barding
9355.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the Lady of Frost, Shiva.

9356.name: Quick-hardening Sealant
9356.description: A powerful adhesive developed and used by the Ehcatl Nine.

9357.name: Xelphatol Spring Water
9357.description: Slightly effervescent water bottled at a spring located deep in the heart of the Ixali homeland, Xelphatol. It has a light-blue tint and a distinctly metallic flavor.

9358.name: Wootz Ingot
9358.description: An ingot of smelted wootz alloy.

9359.name: Platinum Nugget
9359.description: A small nugget of impure platinum.

9361.name: Kirimu Leather
9361.description: A large piece of cured skin from the chimerical monstrosity Kirimu.

9362.name: Arachne Velveteen
9362.description: Thick cloth woven from the web of the chimerical monstrosity Arachne.

9363.name: Allagan Wootz Nugget
9363.description: A small chunk of the alloy used by the Allagan Empire to craft heavy armor.

9364.name: Allagan Leather
9364.description: A large piece of treated chimerical leather used by the Allagan Empire to craft light armor.

9365.name: Allagan Silk
9365.description: A spool of thick chimerical silk used by the Allagan Empire to craft mage robes.

9366.name: Borax
9366.description: This soft lusterless crystal is believed to stay the hands of corruption and is used in the preservation of organics.

9367.name: Arachne Web
9367.description: The wire-like web of the Allagan chimerical miscreation, Arachne.

9368.name: Wootz Ore
9368.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing naturally occurring wootz alloy.

9369.name: Raziqsap
9369.description: Developed by a Far Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to harden platinum.

9370.name: Dubbin
9370.description: A greasy mixture of wax, oil, and tallow used for waterproofing and softening leather, while helping maintain its luster.

9371.name: Smoked Bacon
9371.description: A large side of boar, cured and then smoked. It is widely accepted across Eorzea that “everything goes better” with this flavorful meat.

9372.name: Roasted Coffee Beans
9372.description: Seeds harvested from the coffee plants which grow in volcanic mountainous soils, and then slow-roasted over an indirect flame for several bells to remove bitterness and bring out flavor.

9373.name: Enchanted Platinum Ink
9373.description: Ink fortified with platinum sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

9374.name: Bloody Knife Blades
9374.description: A pair of blood-soaked blades retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

9375.name: Mossy Stone Daggers
9375.description: A pair of daggers crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. They are so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

9376.name: Allagan Catalyst
9376.description: Dubbed a “god in the machina” by those who first discovered it, modern scholars have yet to discover not only what the catalytic agent contains, but exactly how it functions, understanding only that the substance is required to strengthen the properties of certain materials.

9377.name: Ice Tear
9377.description: A glass-like shard retrieved from the fallen Lady of Frost.

9378.name: Diamond Tear
9378.description: A glass-like shard retrieved from the fallen Lady of Frost. It pulses with uncontrollably powerful ice-aspected energies.

9379.name: Syrcus Shard
9379.description: A remarkably transparent piece of Syrcus Tower's outer wall.

9380.name: Burning Auricle
9380.description: A crystallized fragment of the dreadwyrm Bahamut's burning heart.

9461.name: Misericorde Blades
9461.description: Deadly darksteel blades used in the creation of misericordes.

9462.name: Level 2 Aetherial Wheel Stand
9462.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds one grade 1 and one grade 2 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

9463.name: Level 3 Aetherial Wheel Stand
9463.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds one grade 1, one grade 2, and one grade 3 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

9464.name: Level 4 Aetherial Wheel Stand
9464.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds two grade 1, one grade 2, and one grade 3 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

9465.name: Level 5 Aetherial Wheel Stand
9465.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds two grade 1, two grade 2, and one grade 3 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

9466.name: Level 6 Aetherial Wheel Stand
9466.description:
A metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds three grade 1, two grade 2, and one grade 3 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

9510.name: Furnace Ring
9510.description: Fitted with a powerful eye of fire gemstone, this magicked band can instantly produce a white-hot flame at the command of its wearer.

9511.name: Perfect Firewood
9511.description: This expertly dried cypress exhibits a high pitch content which significantly improves its ability to burn long and hot.

9512.name: Perfect Mortar
9512.description: Despite the fact this mortar has been carefully crafted to withstand the creation of highly volatile zodium, chances are it will not survive the process.

9513.name: Perfect Pestle
9513.description: Despite the fact this pestle has been carefully crafted to withstand the creation of highly volatile zodium, chances are it will not survive the process.

9514.name: Perfect Vellum
9514.description: Meticulous pouncing has ensured that any ink applied to this dried calfskin will adhere without fail.

9515.name: Perfect Pounce
9515.description: An alchemical powder of a highly resinous texture used to not only prevent ink from spreading when applied to vellum, but to also maintain a high level of aetherial conductivity.

9516.name: Tailor-made Eel Pie
9516.description: The acetic odor emitted by this specially crafted pastry will turn away all but the most loyal of eel pie enthusiasts.

9517.name: Perfect Cloth
9517.description: A better balance of warp and weft has not been seen for centuries.

9518.name: Cypress Log
9518.description: A rough-cut log of cypress timber.

9519.name: Pumice
9519.description: Volcanic rock riddled with countless tiny holes which make the stone remarkably lighter than it appears. Parchment makers rub the pieces on vellum to prepare the pages for receiving ink.

9521.name: Belah'dian Silver
9521.description: Discovered buried deep within Belah'dian ruins, this surprisingly heat-resistant silver appears to have been tempered using a technique now lost to modern goldsmiths.

9522.name: Aged Eye of Fire
9522.description: A stone sphere elementally aspected to fire. A good polishing will be required to restore it to its former luster.

9523.name: Aged Spear Shaft
9523.description: Seasoned over countless years of use, this worn shaft may no longer be suitable for use in battle, but it will most definitely burn nicely in a fire.

9524.name: Aged Mortar Pieces
9524.description: A beautiful mortar that has, unfortunately, been split into several pieces. It is, however, not beyond repair─a testament to the skill of the original crafter.

9525.name: Aged Pestle Pieces
9525.description: A beautiful pestle that has, unfortunately, been split into several pieces. It is, however, not beyond repair─a testament to the skill of the original crafter.

9526.name: Aged Vellum
9526.description: A single sheet of what appears to be magicked uterine vellum torn from a quire bound within an ancient tome.

9527.name: Dried Ether
9527.description: Dry, flaky residue found at the bottom of a bottle of evaporated ether.

9528.name: Vintage Cooking Sherry
9528.description: Fine Lominsan white wine fortified with grape spirit and allowed to mature to the point of perfection, though the flavor may be too strong for weaker palates.

9529.name: Stained Cloth
9529.description: A beautiful piece of cloth that appears to have been dragged through the mud, dipped in sheep offal, and then forgotten in a latrine.

9530.name: Aged Ring
9530.description: An antiquated ring of unknown origin.

9531.name: Aged Spear
9531.description: An antiquated spear of unknown origin.

9532.name: Aged Mortar
9532.description: An antiquated mortar of unknown origin.

9533.name: Aged Pestle
9533.description: An antiquated pestle of unknown origin.

9534.name: Aged Grimoire
9534.description: An antiquated grimoire of unknown origin.

9535.name: Aged Phial
9535.description: An antiquated phial of unknown origin.

9536.name: Aged Decanter
9536.description: An antiquated decanter of unknown origin.

9537.name: Aged Robe
9537.description: An antiquated robe of unknown origin.

9615.name: Grade 1 Feed - Speed Blend
9615.description: A simple blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to slightly improve a race chocobo's maximum speed.

9616.name: Grade 2 Feed - Speed Blend
9616.description: A complex blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to improve a race chocobo's maximum speed.

9618.name: Grade 1 Feed - Acceleration Blend
9618.description: A simple blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to slightly improve a race chocobo's acceleration.

9619.name: Grade 2 Feed - Acceleration Blend
9619.description: A complex blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to improve a race chocobo's acceleration.

9621.name: Grade 1 Feed - Balance Blend
9621.description: A simple blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to slightly improve a race chocobo's cunning.

9622.name: Grade 2 Feed - Balance Blend
9622.description: A complex blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to improve a race chocobo's cunning.

9624.name: Grade 1 Feed - Endurance Blend
9624.description: A simple blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to slightly improve a race chocobo's endurance.
