9625.name: Grade 2 Feed - Endurance Blend
9625.description: A complex blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to improve a race chocobo's endurance.

9627.name: Grade 1 Feed - Stamina Blend
9627.description: A simple blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to slightly improve a race chocobo's stamina.

9628.name: Grade 2 Feed - Stamina Blend
9628.description: A complex blend of cereals and leafy greens believed to improve a race chocobo's stamina.

9653.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Confrontation
9653.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action The Heat of Battle II (increased EXP earned through battle).

9654.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Productivity
9654.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Earth and Water II (increased EXP earned through gathering).

9655.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Industry
9655.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Helping Hand II (increased EXP earned through crafting).

9656.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Longeing
9656.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action A Man's Best Friend II (increased EXP earned by companions).

9657.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Rivalry
9657.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Mark Up II (increased Wolf Marks).

9658.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Company
9658.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Seal Sweetener II (increased company seals).

9659.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Initiation
9659.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Brave New World II (increased attributes for all Disciple of War or Magic members under level 49).

9660.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Capacity
9660.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Live off the Land II (increased Gathering).

9661.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Observation
9661.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action What You See II (increased Perception).

9662.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Efficiency
9662.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Eat from the Hand II (increased Craftsmanship).

9663.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Precision
9663.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action In Control II (increased Control).

9664.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Dedication
9664.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action That Which Binds Us II (increased spiritbonding speed).

9665.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Nutriment
9665.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Meat and Mead II (increased meal benefit duration).

9666.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Permanence
9666.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Proper Care II (prolonged gear wear).

9667.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Swiftness
9667.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Fleet-footed II (increased Sprint duration).

9668.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Pilgrimage
9668.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Reduced Rates II (decreased teleportation fees).

9669.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Confrontation
9669.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action The Heat of Battle III (increased EXP earned through battle).

9670.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Productivity
9670.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Earth and Water III (increased EXP earned through gathering).

9671.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Industry
9671.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Helping Hand III (increased EXP earned through crafting).

9672.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Longeing
9672.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action A Man's Best Friend III (increased EXP earned by companions).

9673.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Rivalry
9673.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Mark Up III (increased Wolf Marks).

9674.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Company
9674.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Seal Sweetener III (increased company seals).

9676.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Capacity
9676.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Live off the Land III (increased Gathering).

9677.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Observation
9677.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action What You See III (increased Perception).

9678.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Efficiency
9678.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Eat from the Hand III (increased Craftsmanship).

9679.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Precision
9679.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action In Control III (increased Control).

9680.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Dedication
9680.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action That Which Binds Us III (increased spiritbonding speed).

9681.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Nutriment
9681.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Meat and Mead III (increased meal benefit duration).

9682.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Permanence
9682.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Proper Care III (prolonged gear wear).

9684.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Pilgrimage
9684.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Reduced Rates III (decreased teleportation fees).

9717.name: Pine Bonsai
9717.description: While some view this traditional Doman gardening technique as naught more than a reflection of man's arrogance in believing nature can be bent to his will, most simply find it a beautiful and calming form of art.

9718.name: Longcase Chronometer
9718.description: A precision instrument for telling time. Its towering silhouette adds a touch of gravitas to the ambience of any room.

9719.name: Oriental Bathtub
9719.description: A large bathtub designed in the Doman fashion.

9720.name: Frolicking Beasts
9720.description: A folding partition commonly found in Far East nations. Upon one side is a reproduction of an ancient Doman wall painting depicting a variety of beastkin in their natural habitat.

9722.name: Kotatsu Table
9722.description: A table designed in the Doman fashion. The underside has been treated with strange Eastern magicks to emit heat during the winter months.

9723.name: Wax Vegetables
9723.description: While far less nutritious than real vegetables, these wax replicas will look nicer in your pantry.

9724.name: Guildleve Counter
9724.description: A counter designed to replicate those found in Adventurers' Guilds across Eorzea. This model comes complete with a built-in light that can be used to illuminate leve plates.

9726.name: Glade Tea Set
9726.description: For the denizens of the Twelveswood, the consumption of tea is a means of relaxing the mind, allowing for uninhibited communion with nature. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Spell Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 12) +4% (Max 7) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9727.name: Riviera Supper
9727.description: While for most La Nosceans supper consists of huddling around a fire pit while sopping up a splash of rancid fish stew with a hunk of moldy bread, those who have found their fortune on the seas prefer a multiple-course extravaganza certain to leave even the most wealthy Ul'dahn speechless. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Determination Bonus: +4% (Max 4) +4% (Max 5) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9728.name: Oasis Breakfast
9728.description: Considered the most important of the day's seven meals (preceding both pre-midday mead and eleventh bell tarts), the Ul'dahn elite rarely miss this opportunity to gorge themselves before moving on to the next opportunity to gorge themselves. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 21) +4% (Max 13) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9729.name: Scattered Documents
9729.description: This pile of parchment appears to be pages taken from The Last Paean─a detailed account of the life and times of a legendary bard who traveled the realm bringing joy to all he met. Strewn across one's bureau, the documents give any library or study a heightened air of sophistication.

9730.name: Oriental Altar
9730.description: A miniature wooden altar hung in Doman houses, allowing people to worship the gods within the privacy of their own homes.

9731.name: Oriental Wall Scroll
9731.description: Upon this ornamental scroll is painted the Doman character “jin,” meaning “mankind.”

9732.name: Oriental Partition
9732.description: A partition designed in the Doman fashion, reaching to the ceiling and so sturdy that it may as well be a wall.

9733.name: Dead Man's Chest
9733.description: “If the man who once owned the chest is now dead, he won't mind anyone else using it.” Such was the logic employed when removing this sturdy treasure coffer from Sastasha.

9734.name: Oak Low Barrel Planter
9734.description: A barrel planter crafted from oak.

9735.name: Valentione's Cake
9735.description: A decadent chocolate cake emblazoned with the House Valentione coat of arms. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: +4% (Max 18) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9736.name: Royal Partition
9736.description: A luxurious partition designed to resemble those used in the sultana's palace.

9737.name: Order of Nald'thal Lectern
9737.description: A carved wooden podium not unlike the ones used by the Order of Nald'thal to deliver their sermons.

9738.name: Green Tea Set
9738.description: Far more bitter than its black counterpart, green tea is by far the beverage of choice in Far Eastern Doma. To offset the sharpness of its flavor, it is oft accompanied by something sweet, such as sticky rice cakes. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: +4% (Max 13) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

9739.name: Dried Well
9739.description: Have you dreamed of owning your very own well, but are plagued by one or more of the following psychological ailments: acrophobia, claustrophobia, aquaphobia, bathophobia, or cleithrophobia? Well fear no longer. This quality stone well, manufactured in Eorzea with 100% Eorzean materials, requires no hole to be dug, no ground to be sanctified, and no chain letters to be passed along to your dearest enemies.

9740.name: Oriental Striking Dummy
9740.description:
A striking dummy designed in the Doman fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

9741.name: Eastern Cherry Tree
9741.description: A variety of cherry tree from the Far East modified through generations of grafting and crossbreeding to bloom perpetually.

9742.name: Crimson Felt Mat
9742.description: A square sheet of crimson-colored felt upon which dolls are displayed for Little Ladies' Day.

9743.name: Flame of Passion
9743.description: Outdoor lighting certain to heat up any relationship.

9744.name: Wild Banana Tree
9744.description: A green, leafy tree transplanted from an island in the Cieldalaes. The word “banana” is actually a bastardization of “pamama,” the term used in the fruit's native habitat.

9745.name: Personal Astroscope
9745.description: A miniature astroscope used by aspiring astrologians to peer into the farthest reaches of the firmament.

9746.name: Riviera Garden Table Set
9746.description: A round outdoor table and matching chairs designed in the riviera fashion.

9747.name: Dodo's Nest
9747.description: Though their beady eyes and awkward walk give them an air of unintelligence, dodos are actually quite clever creatures. A mother dodo will, when creating a nest, first dry grass in the sun for several days before adding it to the pile, so as to prevent the growth of molds harmful to her offspring.

9748.name: Retainer Cartonnier
9748.description:
A wooden receptacle for use by retainers to store goods entrusted for sale while protecting them from the elements.
※Can only be placed outdoors.

9749.name: Retainer Counter
9749.description:
A wooden counter for use by retainers.
※Can only be placed outdoors.

9766.name: Spotted Interior Wall
9766.description: An interior wall bespeckled with a hypnotically random pattern of colorful dots certain to drive any sane man to his wit's end.

9767.name: Wavy Interior Wall
9767.description: An interior wall covered from top to bottom in colorful wavy lines certain to induce seasickness in even the most hardened sailor.

9768.name: Tatami Flooring
9768.description: Woven from sweet-smelling rush grass, tatami flooring is the perfect complement to any home furnished in the Doman fashion.

9769.name: Monochrome Flooring
9769.description: Marble floor tiling alternately colored black and white.

9770.name: Oasis Cobble Flooring
9770.description: Cobbles commonly used in Ul'dahn roadways and plazas.

9771.name: Star Chandelier
9771.description: Ceiling-mounted lighting expertly crafted to resemble the moon and stars.

10032.name: The Emperor's New Hat
10032.description: The most beautiful headwear you never have seen.

10033.name: The Emperor's New Robe
10033.description: The most beautiful robe you never have seen.

10034.name: The Emperor's New Gloves
10034.description: The most beautiful handwear you never have seen.

10035.name: The Emperor's New Breeches
10035.description: The most beautiful legwear you never have seen.

10036.name: The Emperor's New Boots
10036.description: The most beautiful footwear you never have seen.

10071.name: Model Magitek Bit
10071.description:
An exact 1:9 scale replica of a ceruleum-powered magitek bit (Ultima Weapon action figure not included).

Use item to acquire the model magitek bit minion.

10082.name: Paramour Barding
10082.description: A gaudy suit of chocobo armor designed for use during Valentione's Day celebrations.

10086.name: Tinker's Calm
10086.description: A tonic commonly used by Disciples of the Hand to increase focus, allowing for enhanced results when deconstructing complex creations.

10090.name: Splintered Chest
10090.description: This chest, rumored to have once been stored aboard the Haar─the flagship of the dread pirate Mistbeard─appears to have been not-so-gently pried open with a headsman's axe.

10091.name: Wild Banana Shoot
10091.description: Under the proper conditions, this seedling will grow into a tree almost ten fulms high, and produce upwards of four score bananas per season.

10092.name: Black Limestone
10092.description: When polished, this rare form of limestone closely resembles marble.

10093.name: Virgin Basilisk Egg
10093.description: While all eggs a basilisk lays contain traces of rare ore, the first egg laid in life is thought to contain the highest concentration, making it highly sought after by potion mixers and alchemists.

10094.name: Little Worm
10094.description: While commonly used as bait by fishers across the realm, little worms also make fine chocobo feed, providing a good source of protein for growing birds.

10095.name: Gregarious Worm
10095.description: A rare form of earthworm, these fat invertebrates also make fine chocobo feed, providing an excellent source of protein for growing birds.

10096.name: Rosemary
10096.description: A savory herb treasured for its ability to enhance focus and concentration.

10097.name: Yafaemi Wildgrass
10097.description: After gysahl greens, there's no other verdure a race chocobo would rather sink its beak into.

10098.name: Mazlaya Greens
10098.description: Once found growing all across the island of Mazlaya, this bright-green plant was almost completely wiped out when chocobos brought to the island by farmers devoured nearly every one they could find.

10099.name: Unaspected Crystal
10099.description: For reasons unknown to you, this crystal has completely lost its elemental charge.

10146.name: Better Crowned Pie
10146.description: A galette-style pie decorated with a golden crown and served at Ishgardian festivals. Baked using Talan's own special recipe. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

10156.name: Bronco-type Hull
10156.description: A reliable hull used in most Highwind Skyways airships.

10157.name: Invincible-type Hull
10157.description: A large hull adapted from those used in seafaring galleys.

10158.name: Enterprise-type Hull
10158.description: A hull designed by Cid for use in his personal airship the Enterprise.

10159.name: Invincible II-type Hull
10159.description: A modified version of the Invincible-type hull, redesigned to reduce wind resistance.

10160.name: Odyssey-type Hull
10160.description: The reinforced keel of this unique airship is specially tailored to long voyages.

10161.name: Tatanora-type Hull
10161.description: Named after the “father” of propeller-powered airships, the design used in this hull is certain to invoke a sense of inspiring nostalgia.

10162.name: Bronco-type Sail
10162.description: A simple yet highly durable sheet of thick canvas designed to serve both as a receptacle for lighter-than-air ceruleum gas, as well as a sail to assist propulsion.

10163.name: Invincible-type Propellers
10163.description: Airship lift is achieved by the rapid spinning of ceruleum-powered propellers mounted atop masts placed around the fore and aft decks.

10164.name: Enterprise-type Bladder
10164.description: The unique shape of this ceruleum gas bladder directs the flow of air around it, reducing wind resistance.

10165.name: Invincible II-type Propellers
10165.description: Speed and flight stability have been increased by adding auxiliary propulsive wings to the ship's masts.

10166.name: Odyssey-type Bladders
10166.description: Separate gas regulation control over each bladder allows for increased navigational efficiency.

10167.name: Tatanora-type Propellers
10167.description: Taking inspiration from the aether-manipulating flying fish found in the Sea of Clouds, these radical new propellers have been treated with wind-aspected crystals, allowing for increased lift.

10168.name: Bronco-type Forecastle
10168.description: The simply crafted front half of a Bronco-type airship, including the main deck and bowsprit.

10169.name: Invincible-type Forecastle
10169.description: The sturdily built front half of an Invincible-type airship, including the main deck, bowsprit, and a towering foremast.

10170.name: Enterprise-type Forecastle
10170.description: The front half of an Enterprise-type airship, including the main deck, bowsprit, and extra lighting to improve nighttime navigation.

10171.name: Invincible II-type Forecastle
10171.description: The front half of an Invincible II-type airship, including the main deck, bowsprit, and a towering foremast. Wooden parts have been replaced with lightweight metal to improve vessel durability.

10172.name: Odyssey-type Forecastle
10172.description: The front half of an Odyssey-type airship, including the main deck, bowsprit, an extended hold, and specially designed cooling pipes.

10173.name: Tatanora-type Forecastle
10173.description: The front half of a Tatanora-type airship, including the main deck, bowsprit, and banks for extra propellers.

10174.name: Bronco-type Aftcastle
10174.description: The simply crafted rear half of a Bronco-type airship, including the poop deck, ceruleum engine, tiller, and rudder.

10175.name: Invincible-type Aftcastle
10175.description: The sturdily built rear half of an Invincible-type airship, including the quarter and poop decks, tiller, rudder, ceruleum engine, and two propeller masts.

10176.name: Enterprise-type Aftcastle
10176.description: The rear half of an Enterprise-type airship, including the quarter and poop decks, tiller, rudder, ceruleum engine, and an all-purpose crane for extracting items, or on rare occasions, people in distress.

10177.name: Invincible II-type Aftcastle
10177.description: The rear half of an Invincible II-type airship, including the quarter and poop decks, tiller, rudder, ceruleum engine, and an all-purpose crane equipped with powerful claws.

10178.name: Odyssey-type Aftcastle
10178.description: The rear half of an Odyssey-type airship, including the poop deck, tiller, rudder, and an experimental aetherial propulsion engine.

10179.name: Tatanora-type Aftcastle
10179.description: The rear half of a Tatanora-type airship, including the quarter and poop decks, tiller, rudder, ceruleum engine, and tailplane for improved maneuverability.

10332.name: Battered Fish
10332.description: Deep-fried and accompanied by a generous portion of thick cut popotoes. Most delicious when sprinkled with a dash of malt vinegar. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

10335.name: Dark Matter Cluster
10335.description: This substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. Pieces this large are quite rare.

10345.name: MGS Interior Wall
10345.description: An interior wall of the same design as those used to furnish the Manderville Gold Saucer.

10346.name: Stained Crystal Interior Wall
10346.description: An interior wall fitted with countless colorful stained crystal panels.

10347.name: MGS Flooring
10347.description: Floorboards and carpeting of the same colorful design as those used to furnish the Manderville Gold Saucer.

10348.name: Monochrome MGS Flooring
10348.description: Black and white floorboards and carpeting of the same design as those used to furnish the Manderville Gold Saucer.

10349.name: Magnificent Mogdelier
10349.description: Marvelously majestic lighting worthy of a moogle king.

10350.name: Hive Ceiling Fan
10350.description:
A ceiling-mounted fan created with the wings of the Gnathic primal Ravana.

※One per estate only.

10351.name: Deep Hive Ceiling Fan
10351.description:
A ceiling-mounted fan created with the wings of the Gnathic primal Ravana. It literally hums with the Lord of the Hive's untamed power.

※One per estate only.

10361.name: Small Merchant's Walls
10361.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into an item shop.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

10362.name: Medium Merchant's Walls
10362.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into an item shop.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

10363.name: Large Merchant's Walls
10363.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into an item shop.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

10364.name: Small Eatery Walls
10364.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a restaurant.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

10365.name: Medium Eatery Walls
10365.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a restaurant.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

10366.name: Large Eatery Walls
10366.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a restaurant.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

10367.name: Small Outfitter's Walls
10367.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a gear shop.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

10368.name: Medium Outfitter's Walls
10368.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a gear shop.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

10369.name: Large Outfitter's Walls
10369.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a gear shop.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

10370.name: Small Arms Supplier's Walls
10370.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a weapon shop.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

10371.name: Medium Arms Supplier's Walls
10371.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a weapon shop.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

10372.name: Large Arms Supplier's Walls
10372.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a weapon shop.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

10373.name: Magitek Repair Materials
10373.description: Various materials used in the repair and maintenance of large-hulled airships and submersibles.

10386.name: Grade 6 Dark Matter
10386.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with precisely crafted items made from superior-quality materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-60.]

10942.name: Astral Silk Dress Gloves of Casting

12042.name: Heavenscracker
12042.description: An unexpected by-product of the Skysteel Manufactory's recent endeavors to develop a more volatile variety of firesand. Happy Moonfire Faire!

12049.name: Unicolt
12049.description:
Because two horns are not always better than one.

Use item to acquire the unicolt minion.

12051.name: Atrophied Atomos
12051.description:
Putting money where this voidsent's mouth is merely results in devoured money.

Use item to acquire the atrophied Atomos minion.

12052.name: Owlet
12052.description:
Who needs eyes in the back of their head when you can spin your head full circle?

Use item to acquire the owlet minion.

12053.name: Ugly Duckling
12053.description:
Will he turn into a graceful swan? Inquiring minds want to know.

Use item to acquire the ugly duckling minion.

12054.name: Gaelikitten
12054.description:
Rumors that the gods kill one of these adorable creatures every time a young man thinks pleasurable thoughts are unfounded.

Use item to acquire the gaelikitten minion.

12055.name: Clockwork Barrow
12055.description:
Take a load off your shoulders. You deserve it.

Use item to acquire the clockwork barrow minion.

12056.name: Lesser Panda
12056.description:
Lesser only in size to normal pandas. And in life expectancy. And intelligence. And fluffiness. Well, perhaps not fluffiness.

Use item to acquire the lesser panda minion.

12057.name: Page 63
12057.description:
A detailed recapitulation of the preceding sixty-two pages is not necessary to fully enjoy the content of the sixty-third.

Use item to acquire the page 63 minion.

12058.name: Iron Dwarf
12058.description:
He prefers the term “little iron person.”

Use item to acquire the iron dwarf minion.

12061.name: Gestahl
12061.description:
He's a cute puppy dog. Yes, he is. Yes, he is a cute puppy dog. A cute puppy dog, yes, he is. Awww, such a cute puppy dog... Yes...

Use item to acquire the Gestahl minion.

12062.name: Steam-powered Gobwalker G-VII
12062.description:
Gobwalker exhaust can be used to steam hams.

Use item to acquire the steam-powered gobwalker G-VII minion.

12069.name: Gold Rush Minecart
12069.description:
Unsurprisingly void of gold.

Use item to acquire the gold rush minecart minion.

12081.name: Highland Barding
12081.description: A suit of chocobo armor outfitted with multiple layers of leather and fur to protect its wearer from the elements.

12082.name: Expanse Barding
12082.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Bismarck, the Lord of the Mists.

12083.name: Hive Barding
12083.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Ravana, the Lord of the Hive.

12084.name: Alpine Chair
12084.description: A simple chair designed in the alpine style.

12085.name: Alpine Round Table
12085.description: A round table designed in the alpine fashion. Will seat twelve, but with some difficulty.

12086.name: Alpine Tea Set
12086.description: Add an air of nobility to your residence with this set of antique pewter. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Piety Bonus: +4% (Max 19) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12087.name: Stuffed Carbuncle
12087.description: The right paw of this plush Carbuncle is raised to beckon fortune into a household or place of commerce. Effectiveness varies.

12088.name: Oriental Breakfast
12088.description: The Domans break their fast with a simple, yet balanced meal consisting of rice and several small side dishes. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12089.name: Nameday Cake
12089.description: While not common amongst the poorer classes, many Eorzean highborn practice the custom of decorating a cake for family members celebrating their namedays. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Spell Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12090.name: Cake Tray
12090.description: A multi-tiered tray stacked with several varieties of luscious sweetcakes and tarts. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Direct Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12091.name: Oriental Supper
12091.description: Rather than large portions of one or two dishes, Doman suppers consist of one or two bites of several painstakingly prepared culinary creations served with a bowl of steamed rice. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Determination Bonus: +4% (Max 19) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12092.name: Riviera Lunch
12092.description: A freshly prepared lunch, complete with portions large enough to satisfy the meanest of appetites. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Tenacity Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 26) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12093.name: Oriental Wind Chime
12093.description: This small glass bell has a slip of parchment attached to its clapper which, when blown by the wind, causes the clapper to strike the rim.

12094.name: Toy Box
12094.description:
A toy box that is opened by sliding several interlocking pieces of wood.

※One per estate only.

12095.name: Glade Half Partition
12095.description: A partition designed in the glade fashion, but reaching only less than halfway to the ceiling so as to provide privacy without making the room feel smaller.

12096.name: Oasis Half Partition
12096.description: A partition designed in the oasis fashion, but reaching only less than halfway to the ceiling so as to provide privacy without making the room feel smaller.

12097.name: Cask Rack
12097.description: A rack allowing for the horizontal storage of multiple ale kegs or wine barrels.

12098.name: Display Stand
12098.description: A cylindrical stand designed for displaying various objets d'art and spoils of war.

12099.name: Miniature Gold Saucer
12099.description: A scale model of the Manderville Gold Saucer.

12100.name: Royal Plotting Table
12100.description: A replica of the table used in the Ul'dahn royal war room to conceive and confirm battle strategies.

12101.name: Round Banquet Table
12101.description: A large round table suitable for banquets, reunions, bacchanals, and other manner of large-scale social gatherings. Easily sits twelve to thirteen knights.

12102.name: Gold Saucer Corner Counter
12102.description: A low L-shaped counter-type table used in the Manderville Gold Saucer.

12103.name: Bearskin Rug
12103.description: For maximum romantic effect, place rug directly in front of a fireplace, light a few candles, and crack open a bottle of aged Ishgardian brandy.

12104.name: Gordian Bureau
12104.description:
A writing desk crafted from gears found inside the right arm of the mechanical fortress Alexander.

※One per estate only.

12105.name: Savage Gordian Bureau
12105.description:
A writing desk crafted from gears found inside the right arm of the mechanical fortress Alexander. Magicks imbued within the furnishing cause the bureau to emit a soft glow that, while no one can see, all believe is there.

※One per estate only.

12106.name: Gordian Chair
12106.description:
A chair crafted from gears found within the right arm of the mechanical fortress Alexander.

※One per estate only.

12107.name: Savage Gordian Chair
12107.description:
A chair crafted from gears found within the right arm of the mechanical fortress Alexander. Magicks imbued within the furnishing have been known to stimulate the backsides of those who sit on it for any extended period of time.

※One per estate only.

12108.name: Star Sapphire Music Box
12108.description: This expertly crafted music box plays only one half of a melody. Pair with a star ruby music box to complete the song.

12109.name: Star Ruby Music Box
12109.description: This expertly crafted music box plays only one half of a melody. Pair with a star sapphire music box to complete the song.

12110.name: Triple Triad Board
12110.description: An official Triple Triad tournament board. Placing one in an estate will allow residents to play matches without having to make the journey to the Gold Saucer.

12111.name: Expanse Fountain
12111.description:
An outdoor fountain created from the baleen of Bismarck, Lord of the Mists.

※One per estate only.

12112.name: Boundless Expanse Fountain
12112.description:
An outdoor fountain practically pulsing with magicks created from the baleen of Bismarck, Lord of the Mists.

※One per estate only.

12113.name: Topiary Moogle
12113.description: A specially bred shrub pruned to the shape of a merry moogle.

12114.name: Standing Signboard
12114.description: A V-shaped sign used by shop owners to inform passersby of items on sale within.

12115.name: Laundry Pole
12115.description: A long pole upon which wet laundry is hung to dry in the sun. Take care when drying smallclothes, for the realm is rife with codpiece thieves.

12214.name: Grade 1 Wheel of Recreation
12214.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Jackpot (increased MGP payout at the Manderville Gold Saucer).

12215.name: Grade 2 Wheel of Recreation
12215.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Jackpot II (increased MGP payout at the Manderville Gold Saucer).

12216.name: Grade 3 Wheel of Recreation
12216.description: A cylindrical wheel crafted from metal and aspected crystal which, when placed on a stand and spun repeatedly, accumulates an aetherial charge. When fully primed, the wheel can be used to initiate the company action Jackpot III (increased MGP payout at the Manderville Gold Saucer).

12220.name: Red Moko Grass
12220.description: A less-common variety of moko grass found growing predominantly in the northern mountainous regions of Aldenard.

12221.name: Cassia Log
12221.description: A rough-cut log of cassia timber. The sweet scent of its bark invokes memories of sweet buns and apple pie.

12222.name: Chemically Treated Chimera Hide
12222.description: The durability of this chimera hide has been enhanced using aetherochemical compounds formulated thousands of summers ago in an Allagan laboratorium.

12223.name: Raw Celestine
12223.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be celestine─a light-blue crystal that is often added to alloys.

12224.name: Vivianite
12224.description: A smoke-blue iron-rich ore often found growing within the fossilized bones of long-dead wavekin.

12225.name: Deep-red Crystal
12225.description: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

12226.name: Deep-red Cluster
12226.description: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

12227.name: Deep-green Crystal
12227.description: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

12228.name: Deep-green Cluster
12228.description: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

12229.name: Deep-blue Crystal
12229.description: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

12230.name: Deep-blue Cluster
12230.description: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

12231.name: Farreach Canvas
12231.description: Originally conceived by inhabitants of the sparsely settled Farreach to withstand the gale-force winds ceaselessly blowing on the Bloodbrine Sea, this rugged sailcloth is one of few materials suited to air travel.

12232.name: Cassia Lumber
12232.description: Processed cassia lumber. Even with its bark removed, the wood still harbors a faint sweet scent.

12233.name: High Allagan Chimera Leather
12233.description: A large piece of specially treated chimerical leather used by the Allagan Empire to craft high armor.

12234.name: Lupin Plot
12234.description:
Each plant will produce a “stalk” of violet flowers more than a fulm tall.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

12235.name: Explorer's Campfire
12235.description: All the essential culinary tools─camp stove, iron pot, and stump settle─for dining on the wild side.

12241.name: Timeworn Archaeoskin Map
12241.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 6 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 55 recommended.

12242.name: Timeworn Wyvernskin Map
12242.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 7 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 60 recommended.

12243.name: Timeworn Dragonskin Map
12243.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 8 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 60 full party (eight players) recommended.

12254.name: Gordian Gear
12254.description: A round cog removed from Alexander's Gordias sector.

12255.name: Large Gordian Gear
12255.description: A large round cog removed from Alexander's Gordias sector.

12256.name: Bismarck's Baleen
12256.description: Pulled from the Lord of the Mists's massive maw, this thick piece of keratinized tissue appears aspected to both wind and water.

12257.name: Expanse Baleen
12257.description: Pulled from the Lord of the Mists's massive maw, this thick piece of keratinized tissue bristles with the power of the endless skies.

12258.name: Ravana's Forewing
12258.description: Plucked from the Lord of the Hive's back, this remarkably light wing is impossible to tear despite its thinness.

12259.name: Hive Forewing
12259.description: Plucked from the Lord of the Hive's back, this remarkably light wing pulses with uncontrollably powerful aetherial energies.

12518.name: Mythrite Nugget
12518.description: A small nugget of impure mythrite.

12520.name: Hardsilver Nugget
12520.description: A small nugget of impure hardsilver.

12522.name: Aurum Regis Nugget
12522.description: A small nugget of impure aurum regis.

12523.name: Aurum Regis Ingot
12523.description: An ingot of smelted aurum regis.

12524.name: Titanium Nugget
12524.description: A small nugget of impure titanium.

12526.name: Adamantite Nugget
12526.description: A small nugget of impure adamantite.

12528.name: Mythrite Rivets
12528.description: Short mythrite pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

12529.name: Titanium Rivets
12529.description: Short titanium pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

12530.name: Adamantite Rivets
12530.description: Short adamantite pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

12531.name: Mythrite Sand
12531.description: Glowing sand consisting of tiny grains of mythrite.

12532.name: Hardsilver Sand
12532.description: Oily sand containing tiny grains of hardsilver.

12533.name: Aurum Regis Sand
12533.description: Violet sand containing tiny grains of aurum regis.

12534.name: Mythrite Ore
12534.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal mythrite.

12535.name: Hardsilver Ore
12535.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare alchemic metal hardsilver.

12536.name: Aurum Regis Ore
12536.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal aurum regis.

12537.name: Titanium Ore
12537.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal titanium.

12538.name: Adamantite Ore
12538.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal adamantite.

12539.name: Cloud Mica
12539.description: A decent-sized chunk of rock made up of what appears to be thousands of thin sheets of silver crystal compacted together into a single mass.

12540.name: Sun Mica
12540.description: A decent-sized chunk of rock made up of what appears to be thousands of thin sheets of golden crystal compacted together into a single mass.

12542.name: Tiger's Eye
12542.description: A golden brown jewel consisting of many colored layers. When polished, it resembles the eye of a tiger─a legendary beast believed to be the ancestor of the coeurl.

12543.name: Agate
12543.description: A cloudy pink jewel consisting of many colored layers.

12544.name: Star Ruby
12544.description: A red jewel that has been shaped and polished instead of faceted, creating the illusion of a six-pointed star within the stone.

12545.name: Star Sapphire
12545.description: A blue jewel that has been shaped and polished instead of faceted, creating the illusion of a six-pointed star within the stone.

12546.name: Opal
12546.description: A milky white jewel that, depending on the angle at which it is held, will exhibit a rainbow of color within the stone.

12547.name: Citrine
12547.description: A yellow jewel almost identical to topaz, but several times softer.

12550.name: Carnelian
12550.description: A translucent red jewel. Its relative softness makes it easy to carve, and it has been used by royalty throughout history for signet rings.

12551.name: Raw Larimar
12551.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be larimar.

12552.name: Raw Tiger's Eye
12552.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be tiger's eye.

12553.name: Raw Agate
12553.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be agate.

12554.name: Raw Star Ruby
12554.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star ruby.

12555.name: Raw Star Sapphire
12555.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star sapphire.

12556.name: Raw Opal
12556.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be opal.

12557.name: Raw Citrine
12557.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be citrine.

12558.name: Raw Chrysolite
12558.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be chrysolite.

12559.name: Raw Mormorion
12559.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be mormorion.

12560.name: Raw Carnelian
12560.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be carnelian.

12561.name: Cloud Mica Whetstone
12561.description: A whetstone carved from cloud mica. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

12562.name: Archaeornis Leather
12562.description: A large piece of cured archaeornis skin.

12563.name: Wyvern Leather
12563.description: A large piece of cured wyvern skin.

12564.name: Dhalmel Leather
12564.description: A large piece of cured dhalmel hide.

12565.name: Dragon Leather
12565.description: A large piece of cured dragon skin.

12566.name: Amphiptere Leather
12566.description: A large piece of cured amphiptere skin.

12567.name: Griffin Leather
12567.description: A large piece of cured griffin hide.

12568.name: Archaeornis Skin
12568.description: The tough hide of an archaeornis.

12569.name: Wyvern Skin
12569.description: The coarse hide of a wyvern.

12570.name: Dhalmel Hide
12570.description: The smooth hide of a dhalmel.

12571.name: Dragon Skin
12571.description: The thick scaly hide of a dragon.

12572.name: Amphiptere Skin
12572.description: The slick glossy hide of an amphiptere.

12573.name: Griffin Hide
12573.description: The leonine hide of a griffin.

12574.name: Bearskin
12574.description: The thick bushy hide of a bear.

12575.name: Yeti Fang
12575.description: The curved canine of a Coerthan yeti. You shudder to think how many throats were ripped open by this nail-like tooth.

12576.name: Dragon Fang
12576.description: The rapier-like fang of an ancient dragon. Some naturalists believe that the age of a dragon can be determined by horizontally slicing its tooth and counting the rings within.

12577.name: Griffin Talon
12577.description: The sharp curved talon of a griffin.

12578.name: Dark Chestnut Log
12578.description: A rough-cut log of dark chestnut timber.

12579.name: Birch Log
12579.description: A rough-cut log of birch lumber.

12580.name: Holy Cedar Lumber
12580.description: Processed cedar lumber purified with holy water.

12582.name: Hallowed Chestnut Lumber
12582.description: Processed dark chestnut lumber purified with hallowed water.

12584.name: Astral Birch Lumber
12584.description: Processed birch lumber treated so that its elemental aspect tips towards astral.

12585.name: Dark Chestnut Branch
12585.description: The thick branch of a dark chestnut tree.

12586.name: Birch Branch
12586.description: The thin branch of a birch tree.

12587.name: Wattle Bark
12587.description: This bark, when boiled down, produces large amounts of tannin─a substance used by leatherworkers to tan hides.

12588.name: Rainbow Cloth
12588.description: Several yalms of undyed rainbow cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

12589.name: Holy Rainbow Cloth
12589.description: Several yalms of rainbow cloth purified with holy water and wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

12590.name: Ramie Cloth
12590.description: Several yalms of undyed ramie cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

12591.name: Hallowed Ramie Cloth
12591.description: Several yalms of ramie cloth purified with holy water and wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

12592.name: Chimerical Felt
12592.description: Several yalms of soft undyed felt created by matting down several layers of hair taken from chimera manes.

12593.name: Astral Silk
12593.description: Several yalms of silk treated so that its elemental aspect would tip slightly towards astral.

12594.name: Rainbow Thread
12594.description: Multicolored yarn spun from rainbow cotton.

12595.name: Ramie Thread
12595.description: Strong, absorbent yarn spun from ramie.

12596.name: Crawler Silk
12596.description: Silk gathered from crawler cocoons and spun into a thin lustrous thread.

12597.name: Rainbow Cotton Boll
12597.description: A rare variety of cotton which produces fibers that change color depending on the angle at which light strikes them.

12598.name: Stalk of Ramie
12598.description: A variety of swift-growing grass native to the Near East. The stalks can be dried and processed into thin threads which, when spun together, can be woven into a cloth not unlike hemp.

12599.name: Chimera Mane
12599.description: The bristly mane of a biologically engineered monstrosity.

12600.name: Crawler Cocoon
12600.description: The sticky cocoon of a giant crawler.

12601.name: Enchanted Mythrite Ink
12601.description: Ink fortified with mythrite sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

12602.name: Enchanted Hardsilver Ink
12602.description: Ink fortified with hardsilver sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

12603.name: Enchanted Aurum Regis Ink
12603.description: Ink fortified with aurum regis sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

12604.name: Holy Water
12604.description: Water blessed by an anointed Halonic Orthodox priest. Used to exorcise most evil spirits from worldly items.

12605.name: Hallowed Water
12605.description: Water blessed by an anointed Halonic Orthodox priest. Used to exorcise evil spirits from worldly items.

12606.name: Astral Oil
12606.description: Refined oil with an unbalanced elemental aspect tipping towards astral.

12607.name: Growth Formula Epsilon
12607.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

12608.name: Growth Formula Zeta
12608.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

12609.name: Bear Fat
12609.description: This musky all-purpose oil is commonly used in tinctures as well as lamps.

12610.name: Crystal Glass
12610.description: This exceptionally transparent glass does not actually contain any crystal, but earns its name for being as clear as crystallized aether.

12611.name: Black Firesand
12611.description: A higher concentration of saltpeter makes this flammable powder slightly more explosive than normal firesand.

12612.name: Grade 1 Strength Dissolvent
12612.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12613.name: Grade 1 Dexterity Dissolvent
12613.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12614.name: Grade 1 Vitality Dissolvent
12614.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12615.name: Grade 1 Intelligence Dissolvent
12615.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12616.name: Grade 1 Mind Dissolvent
12616.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12617.name: Grade 2 Strength Dissolvent
12617.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12618.name: Grade 2 Dexterity Dissolvent
12618.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12619.name: Grade 2 Vitality Dissolvent
12619.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12620.name: Grade 2 Intelligence Dissolvent
12620.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12621.name: Grade 2 Mind Dissolvent
12621.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

12622.name: Draconian Potion of Strength
12622.description: This intoxicating concoction brewed from an ancient dragon recipe temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

12623.name: Draconian Potion of Dexterity
12623.description: This intoxicating concoction brewed from an ancient dragon recipe temporarily increases dexterity. Duration: 15s

12624.name: Draconian Potion of Vitality
12624.description: This intoxicating concoction brewed from an ancient dragon recipe temporarily increases vitality. Duration: 15s

12625.name: Draconian Potion of Intelligence
12625.description: This intoxicating concoction brewed from an ancient dragon recipe temporarily increases intelligence. Duration: 15s

12626.name: Draconian Potion of Mind
12626.description: This intoxicating concoction brewed from an ancient dragon recipe temporarily increases mind. Duration: 15s

12627.name: Dragon Scale
12627.description: This rock-hard scale can withstand the blow of a Roegadyn-wielded battleaxe.

12628.name: Deepeye Tears
12628.description: It would take at least twenty tears shed from a heartbroken Lalafellin maiden to equal the liquid volume of one deepeye tear.

12629.name: Dhalmel Saliva
12629.description: The odor of dhalmel saliva has been likened to that of the bloated corpse of a blue cheese artisan drowned in a Grand Company camp latrine and left to sit in the hot sun for a sennight.

12630.name: Dragon Blood
12630.description: Most likely the blood of a dragon. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

12631.name: Dravanian Spring Water
12631.description: Clear water taken from a spring in the foothills of Abalathia's Spine.

12632.name: Abalathian Spring Water
12632.description: Clear water taken from a spring on one of the many islets floating above Abalathia's Spine.

12633.name: Skyspring Water
12633.description: Crystal-clear water taken from a secluded spring located on a remote islet floating above the Sea of Clouds.

12634.name: Seventh Heaven
12634.description: A rare flower that has an elemental aspect tipped severely in the direction of astral.

12635.name: Gelato Flesh
12635.description: A quivering gelatinous lump of voidsent flesh neither cold nor sweet. Consumption is not recommended, even during times of starvation.

12636.name: Wyvern Wing
12636.description: The thick leathery wing of a wyvern.

12637.name: Icetrap Leaf
12637.description: The thin, twitching leaf of an icetrap.

12638.name: Coneflower
12638.description: Brought back from the New World in the west, this plant bearing large, horn-shaped flowers has been recently discovered to be effective in curing several different ailments.

12639.name: Cow Bitter
12639.description: This sweet-smelling perennial can be found growing in all of the Three Great Continents.

12640.name: Dandelion
12640.description: This common flower produces a globe of lightweight seeds that are carried remarkable distances when blown in the wind. While the stalk is filled with a toxic milky substance, the leaves and roots can be dried and brewed into medicinal infusions.

12641.name: Gaelicatnip
12641.description: A relative to pepper- and spearmint, gaelicatnip is an aromatic herb often brewed into teas. While it has no effect on the five races, the oil contained in the leaves is known to cause gaelicats and other normally aggressive feline beastkin to exhibit excessively playful behavior.

12642.name: Rue
12642.description: A low-growing shrub recognizable by its tiny yellow flowers and faint odor. The leaves contain a mild irritant that, when rubbed against the skin, may cause minor reddening and swelling.

12643.name: Coriander
12643.description: A highly fragrant herb. The leaves can be harvested and used in salads, or the plant can be allowed to bolt and the seeds gathered and used to spice ale.

12644.name: Aurum Regis Cylinder
12644.description: This small music box cylinder is studded with myriad pins arranged in a queer pattern. When placed in a music box and attached to the motor, the cylinder will rotate, causing the pins to strike the box's comb, creating music.

12645.name: Thavnairian Leather
12645.description: This leather has been tanned and treated using techniques from the Near Eastern island of Thavnair.

12646.name: Thavnairian Silk
12646.description: This silk has been spun from thread created by a worm found only on the Near Eastern island of Thavnair.

12647.name: Atomos Corpulence
12647.description: A small piece of throbbing flesh sliced from the devourer of worlds, Atomos.

12648.name: Steel Mainspring
12648.description: A coiled ribbon of steel commonly used in clockwork creations to perpetuate motion.

12649.name: Steel Wheel Bearing
12649.description: Several steel balls set into a polished metal ring. It is used to reduce friction, allowing a wheel to spin with little resistance.

12650.name: Lupin Seedling
12650.description: Its name meaning “wolf,” the lupin is a hardy plant resistant to the cold winds of the Eorzean north.

12651.name: Iron Giant Scrap
12651.description: A jagged sheet of plating fallen from the armor of an iron giant.

12652.name: Gobwalker Shielding
12652.description: Protective metal plating used in the fabrication of a magitek gobwalker G-VII.

12653.name: Far Eastern Coin
12653.description: An oblong coin of gold commonly used in the Far East for bribes.

12654.name: Toy Box Schema
12654.description: A detailed design document outlining the absurdly complex steps required to craft a toy box.

12655.name: Fine Alumen
12655.description: A yellowish mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. This particular variety exhibits some of the best deodorizing properties of all alumen.

12656.name: Shrub Seedling
12656.description: The seedling of a squat shrub favored by topiarists across the realm for its bright-green leaves and dense web of tiny branches.

12657.name: Magnanimous Mogcrown
12657.description: A gaudy moogle-sized crown crafted by moogles for use during moogle celebrations.

12658.name: Dusk Leather
12658.description: An especially dark variety of leather often used in formalwear and uniforms.

12670.name: Old World Striking Dummy
12670.description:
A striking dummy designed in the Sharlayan fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

12671.name: Sunflower Plot
12671.description:
The stalks of these bright-yellow flowers have been known to grow to heights of two or three yalms.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

12704.name: Stonefly Nymph
12704.description: Stonefly nymphs are constantly moving, making them easily discernible targets for poor-sighted fish. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

12705.name: Purse Web Spider
12705.description: This lightweight spider can distribute its weight over a large surface area, allowing it to “walk” on water without sinking. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

12706.name: Goblin Jig
12706.description: A metal lure designed by goblin fishers to vibrate rapidly, thus making it more appealing to hungry fish.

12707.name: Bladed Steel Jig
12707.description: An all-purpose fishing lure crafted by combining three smaller lures.

12708.name: Red Balloon
12708.description: A bright-red breed of balloon bug found floating at higher elevations than its duller cousins. Live bait for both skyfishing and cloudfishing. Up to nine hundred and ninety-nine red balloons can be stacked together.

12709.name: Magma Worm
12709.description: A small worm with a stone-like shell encasing its entire body, protecting it from the extreme temperatures of the molten lava in which it resides. Live bait for hellfishing.

12710.name: Fiend Worm
12710.description: Discovered almost simultaneously by three naturalists, this strange creature was also named the “demon worm” and the “goddess worm” until a best-two-out-of-three round of stone-parchment-shears settled the naming problem once and for all. Fiend worms are one of the few baits suitable for aetherfishing, as the vilekin will remain alive in the sludge even when submerged.

12711.name: Brute Leech
12711.description: A fat bloodsucking worm often found attached to large fish or the legs of wading fauna. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

12712.name: Giant Crane Fly
12712.description: A mosquito-like vilekin with uncharacteristically long legs. Often utilized by anglers for both cloud and skyfishing.

12713.name: Icepick
12713.description:
A freshwater fish adapted to survive in the cold waters of Coerthas. It earns its name from its long, beak-like mouth.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12714.name: Cloud Coral
12714.description:
A white, lightweight coral found growing on the floating islands above Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12715.name: Ice Faerie
12715.description:
A tiny “winged” slug commonly found in ice-ridden freshwater lakes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12716.name: Skyworm
12716.description:
A wingless worm that has somehow learned to fly.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12718.name: Coerthan Crab
12718.description:
A freshwater crustacean only found in the coldest of lakes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12719.name: Fanged Clam
12719.description:
When closed, the shells of this freshwater bivalve mollusk form a demonic rictus that will haunt your nightmares until the end of time. Possibly beyond.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12720.name: Lake Urchin
12720.description:
A freshwater urchin which survives by eating the sparse algal blooms in Twinpools.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12721.name: Whilom Catfish
12721.description:
A small, red catfish native to the Whilom River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12722.name: Blueclaw Shrimp
12722.description:
A freshwater shrimp native to the Whilom River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12723.name: Starflower
12723.description:
A flower-like mollusk found floating about the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12724.name: Glacier Core
12724.description:
A spherical creature found flying in the icy northern reaches of the Sea of Clouds bordering the Coerthas western highlands.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12725.name: Ogre Horn Snail
12725.description:
A freshwater mollusk with a twisted shell shaped like the horn of a voidsent ogre. Can only survive in warm temperatures, such as those found in hot springs.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12726.name: Sorcerer Fish
12726.description:
A freshwater fish believed by some to have the ability to wield fire spells.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12727.name: Hotrod
12727.description:
A freshwater fish native to the freshwater runoff of Abalathia's Spine. It is easily distinguishable by its long, ever-twitching whiskers.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12728.name: Maiboi
12728.description:
A thin freshwater fish commonly found in the floating lakes above Abalathia.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12729.name: Three-lip Carp
12729.description:
A large freshwater fish covered in gil-sized silver scales.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12730.name: Bullfrog
12730.description:
A stout, deep-voiced wavekin found throughout Abalathia's Spine.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12731.name: Cloudfish
12731.description:
A semi-transparent freshwater fish native to the lakes of legendary Voor Sian Siran.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12732.name: Mahu Wai
12732.description:
A cloud white mollusk found living on the underbelly of Abalathia's floating islets.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12733.name: Rock Mussel
12733.description:
A tiny freshwater bivalve mollusk native to the lukewarm waters of the Whilom River in the Dravanian forelands.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12734.name: Buoyant Oviform
12734.description:
The expression “when eggs fly” was commonly used throughout Eorzea to express the impossibility of something...that is until the discovery of this strange creature floating about the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12735.name: Whiteloom
12735.description:
A mushroom/loom-like flying fish native to the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12736.name: Blue Cloud Coral
12736.description:
A blue, lightweight coral found growing on the floating islands above Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12737.name: Seema Patrician
12737.description:
A fatty freshwater fish native to Twinpools.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12738.name: Ammonite
12738.description:
A giant cephalopod characterized by its spectacular dual-walled whorling shell.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12739.name: Bubble Eye
12739.description:
A freshwater fish found only in the pools and lakes of Abalathia's floating islets.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12740.name: Grass Carp
12740.description:
A freshwater fish native to the Hundred Throes, where it conceals itself in the churning waters of the myriad cataracts.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12741.name: Pipira Pira
12741.description:
A deadly freshwater fish which will tear away flesh with its razor-sharp teeth. Crossing the Whilom River barefoot is not recommended.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12742.name: Dravanian Squeaker
12742.description:
A peculiar breed of freshwater catfish that swims upside down. It was first discovered in Weston Waters.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12743.name: Kissing Fish
12743.description:
An adorable freshwater fish native to the waters of Eil Tohm.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12744.name: Mitre Slug
12744.description:
A flying slug native to the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12745.name: Lava Crab
12745.description:
This hard-shelled crustacean is one of few creatures on Eorzea which withstand the heat of molten lava.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12746.name: Storm Core
12746.description:
A spherical creature found in the upper atmospheric region of the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12747.name: Scholar Sculpin
12747.description:
A freshwater fish named after Thaliak, the Scholar.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12748.name: Gigant Grouper
12748.description:
A massive freshwater fish who lurks beneath the thick sheet of ice covering Ashpool.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12749.name: Vanuhead
12749.description:
A freshwater fish inhabiting the Eddies─an isolated lake found atop one of Abalathia's floating islets.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12750.name: Marble Oscar
12750.description:
A freshwater fish which prefers the heated pools of the Smoldering Wastes to the cooler waters of surrounding rivers.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12751.name: Lungfish
12751.description:
A highly evolved air-breathing wavekin found in the muddy biome near the Pappus Tree.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12752.name: Tigerfish
12752.description:
A striped freshwater fish native to the Quickspill Delta.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12753.name: Sky Faerie
12753.description:
A tiny transparent mollusk often seen in the skies near the Blue Window.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12754.name: Granite Crab
12754.description:
A thick-shelled crab capable of surviving the extreme temperatures of exposed lava pools.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12755.name: Aithon's Colt
12755.description:
A graceful glass-like creature that glides with ease through the lava coursing through Anyx Old within the belly of Sohm Al.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12756.name: Shipworm
12756.description:
A worm-like mollusk that lives in the fallen trees and ancient shipwrecks that litter the bottom of the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12757.name: Hedgemole Cricket
12757.description:
An amphibious vilekin found swarming about the Quickspill Delta.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12758.name: Mogpom
12758.description:
An algal sphere found collecting in the lone pool on the floating islet of Greensward.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12759.name: Magma Tree
12759.description:
A colony of tiny crystal-encased creatures found growing in the cavern of Mourn.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12760.name: Cloud Rider
12760.description:
A flying fish native to the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12761.name: Dravanian Bass
12761.description:
A large freshwater fish native to the Whilom River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12762.name: Coerthan Puffer
12762.description:
A rare freshwater puffer found only in northern Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12763.name: Snowcaller
12763.description:
A freshwater fish native to the gelid waters of Banepool.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12764.name: Dragonhead
12764.description:
A freshwater fish native to the Iron Feast. The skull on its head does not appear to be that of a dragon, but rather of a dragonfly.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12765.name: Mercy Staff
12765.description:
A freshwater fish that only becomes active when the land is beset by snowstorms.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12766.name: Rime Eater
12766.description:
A small floating jellyfish often seen in the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12767.name: Warmwater Bichir
12767.description:
A freshwater fish found in the heated pools of the Smoldering Wastes.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12768.name: Noontide Oscar
12768.description:
An albino marble oscar only found with consistency in the corrupted waters of Eil Tohm.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12769.name: Shadowhisker
12769.description:
A large freshwater fish found in the Hundred Throes.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12770.name: Gobbie Mask
12770.description:
An airborne cephalopod native to the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12771.name: Blue Medusa
12771.description:
A stinging jellyfish native to the corrupted waters near the Landlord Colony.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12772.name: Cindersmith
12772.description:
A heat-resistant mollusk found in the magma pools of Anyx Old.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12773.name: Bullwhip
12773.description:
A mutated fish surviving only in the aetherochemical pools of Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12774.name: Tiny Axolotl
12774.description:
An alien-like amphibian found living in the muddy flats near the Pappus Tree.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12775.name: High Allagan Helmet
12775.description:
An ancient breed of crab found in the aetherochemical pools of Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12776.name: Platinum Fish
12776.description:
A mutant breed of goldfish native to the aetherochemical pools of Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12777.name: Aether Eye
12777.description:
A freshwater fish found in the hydrothermal biome near the Pappus Tree.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12778.name: Azysfish
12778.description:
A mutant breed of fish named after the floating island on which it is found.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12779.name: Crystalfin
12779.description:
A colorfully finned freshwater fish found in the biome waters near the Pappus Tree.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12780.name: Sweetfish
12780.description:
A delicious (though unsweet) freshwater fish native to the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12781.name: Orn Butterfly
12781.description:
A freshwater fish native to the Orn Wild, yet also found in the Quickspill Delta of the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12782.name: Hundred Fin
12782.description:
A strangely maned freshwater fish found only in Weston Waters.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12783.name: Autumn Leaf
12783.description:
This freshwater fish native to the Thaliak River has an uncanny resemblance to fallen foliage.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12784.name: Manasail
12784.description:
A flying fish found in the skies near Tharl Oom Khash in the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12785.name: Sky Sweeper
12785.description:
A flying fish often seen in small flocks circling the Azys Lla Habisphere.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12786.name: Magma Louse
12786.description:
A beetle-like creature that can survive the extreme temperatures of the magma flows in Anyx Old.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12787.name: Cometoise
12787.description:
A slow-moving tortoise found in the magma flows near Halo.
