[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12788.name: Aetherochemical Compound #123
12788.description:
This biologically engineered biomass can be found on Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12789.name: Brown Bolo
12789.description:
A whip-like creature found in the skies surrounding Tharl Oom Khash in the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12790.name: Philosopher's Stone
12790.description:
A pink-shelled freshwater mollusk native to the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12791.name: Fountfish
12791.description:
A deadly breed of freshwater anglerfish found only on Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12792.name: Weston Bowfin
12792.description:
A large freshwater fish found in the Churning Mists' Weston Waters.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12793.name: Letter Puffer
12793.description:
A highly poisonous fish commonly found floating in the skies near the Landlord Colony.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12794.name: Star Faerie
12794.description:
A tiny transparent mollusk found only at a certain altitude in the lower Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12795.name: Gloaming Coral
12795.description:
A variety of cloud coral seen growing on the undersides of the floating islets that make up the Landlord Colony.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12796.name: Albino Octopus
12796.description:
A rarely seen freshwater cephalopod that favors the frigid waters of the Coerthas western highlands.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12797.name: Dragon's Soul
12797.description:
A small dragon-like creature that makes its home in the skies above and below the Landlord Colony in the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12798.name: Tornado Shark
12798.description:
A shark capable of riding tornados to extreme altitudes. A stage performance written by a Lominsan playwright on the subject of a tornado shark attack was voted the worst play of all time by the Eorzean Theatrical Society.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12799.name: Warballoon
12799.description:
A gargantuan floating jellyfish found in skies high above Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12800.name: Fossiltongue
12800.description:
A magma-dwelling cousin of the bonytongue.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12801.name: Proto-hropken
12801.description:
A manlike fish living in the aetherochemical pools of Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12802.name: Caiman
12802.description:
An amphibious scalekin with extended rows of sharp teeth and a nigh-insatiable appetite for fresh meat. Can be found primarily in the Dravanian forelands.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12803.name: Euphotic Pirarucu
12803.description:
A biologically engineered fish found in Azys Lla's Delta Quadrant.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12804.name: Illuminati Perch
12804.description:
A foul-smelling fish introduced to the Thaliak River by the Illuminati.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12805.name: Rudderfish
12805.description:
This eel-like flying fish with three pairs of thin wings is found throughout the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12806.name: Bomb Puffer
12806.description:
A balloon-like fish inhabiting the skies near the Azys Lla Habisphere.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12807.name: Mucous Minnow
12807.description:
A strange breed of minnow able to survive the corrupted waters of Azys Lla's aetherochemical pools.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12808.name: Unidentified Flying Biomass
12808.description:
Beyond the fact one can find it in the skies near the Habisphere, absolutely nothing is known about this lump of flying...something.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12809.name: Hospitalier Fish
12809.description:
A tiny freshwater fish that inhabits the warm spring waters of Dragonspit.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12810.name: Scorpionfly
12810.description:
A variety of flying shrimp believed only to live on and around the islets of the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12811.name: Rockclimber
12811.description:
A freshwater fish inhabiting the waters of the Azys Lla Delta Quadrant.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12812.name: Blood Skipper
12812.description:
An ugly fish found in and around the aetherochemical pools of the Azys Lla Alpha Quadrant.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12813.name: Cobrafish
12813.description:
A fanged fish native to the skies above Tharl Oom Khash.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12814.name: Moogle Spirit
12814.description:
A flat ray-like creature which spends its life riding the thermals occurring throughout the Sea of Clouds.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12815.name: Oil Eel
12815.description:
A slimy, finless creature that more closely resembles a worm than it does a fish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12816.name: Jeweled Jellyfish
12816.description:
A luminescent jellyfish capable of surviving within the pools of aetherochemical residue collecting on Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12817.name: Battle Galley
12817.description:
A freshwater fish native to all of Coerthas, but now primarily found in Ashpool.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12818.name: Yalm Lobster
12818.description:
A giant freshwater crustacean that primarily dwells beneath the boulders of the Quickspill Delta.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12819.name: Hinterlands Perch
12819.description:
A freshwater fish native to the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12820.name: Oven Catfish
12820.description:
A magma-dwelling fish found in the mountain flows of Mourn.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12821.name: Pteranodon
12821.description:
This flying scalekin can be seen scouting the lower reaches of the Churning Mists for insects and small birds.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12822.name: Winged Gurnard
12822.description:
A flying fish found in the skies around the Blue Window.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12823.name: Spring Urchin
12823.description:
A freshwater creature that prefers the warm waters released by the springs at Dragonspit.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12824.name: Cherry Trout
12824.description:
Once found across Coerthas and Dravania, this reddish variety of trout now only survives in the heated waters of Dragonspit.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

12825.name: Stupendemys
12825.description:
If a flying crystal-shelled tortoise cannot be seen as stupendous, nothing can.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12826.name: Black Magefish
12826.description:
The ability to wield powerful black magic is only this fish's second-most impressive characteristic, the ability to survive in scalding hot lava, the first.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12827.name: Barreleye
12827.description:
An exotic fish found only in the aetherochemical reservoirs on central Azys Lla's research vessel.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12828.name: Thunderbolt Eel
12828.description:
A narrow-bodied freshwater fish found in the pools flooding the Iron Feast, amongst other locations.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

12829.name: Catkiller
12829.description:
A large freshwater fish found lurking in the floating Abalathian lake known as the Eddies.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12830.name: Loosetongue
12830.description:
A giant freshwater cousin of the bonytongue found only in the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12831.name: Thaliak Caiman
12831.description:
A giant breed of caiman native to the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12832.name: Lavalord
12832.description:
A legendary lava-dwelling fish covered in thick armor and rumored to be the guardian of the gate of the Hell of Fire.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12833.name: Tupuxuara
12833.description:
An ancient wyvern still found living on the Habisphere, thousands of years after its creators perished in the calamity which destroyed their civilization.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12834.name: Vampiric Tapestry
12834.description:
A flying cephalopod that rarely strays from the skies near Mok Oogl Island.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12835.name: Storm Chaser
12835.description:
A flying fish native to the skies of Tharl Oom Khash.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

12836.name: Berserker Betta
12836.description:
A small, yet hostile freshwater fish found in small numbers in the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12837.name: Capelin
12837.description:
A tiny freshwater fish that dwells in Clearpool near Oakum Landing.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

12842.name: Ishgardian Tea
12842.description: Rather than adding milk to boiling water that has been infused with tea leaves, as is the fashion in lower Eorzea, Ishgardian tea is brewed by boiling yak milk and letting dried Coerthan tea leaves steep right into the hot liquid. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12843.name: Frozen Spirits
12843.description: A cool concoction made by fermenting cloud bananas and Old World figs, freezing them with ice crystals, then mashing and mixing the fruit into a slush-like consistency. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12844.name: Hot Chocolate
12844.description: A sweet beverage commonly drunk in the Holy See, but rarely seen in Foundation due to inability of most of Ishgard's poorer residents to procure the relatively rare and expensive ingredients. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12845.name: Fig Bavarois
12845.description: A ripe Old World fig encased in a lightly sweetened jelly. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12846.name: Sohm Al Tart
12846.description: A traditional Ishgardian cake made up of several stacked layers tapered to resemble Sohm Al, a peak sacred to the Dravanians. Ishgardians believe that devouring the mountain will grant them fortune in their struggle with the dragons. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12847.name: Marron Glace
12847.description: Chestnuts peeled and soaked in honey for several moons until the entire fruit is permeated with sweetness. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12848.name: Creme Brulee
12848.description: A vanilla-flavored egg custard drenched in a sweet syrup that is then heated with a fire crystal until a crisp brown shell is created. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12849.name: Kaiser Roll
12849.description: A round Ishgardian bread first made by Halonic monastics who, when brewing ale, would add barm and leftover malt to their daily loaves. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12850.name: Ishgardian Muffin
12850.description: Leavened bread that is cooked on a griddle rather than in an oven. Cornmeal is dusted on the dough before cooking to prevent sticking to the pan. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12851.name: Liver-cheese Sandwich
12851.description: Several slices of a ground liver loaf sandwiched between two halves of a kaiser roll. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12852.name: Almond Cream Croissant
12852.description: A flaky crescent-shaped pastry sliced in two and buttered with a sweet creamy paste made from almonds. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12853.name: Sauteed Porcini
12853.description: Fragrant porcini mushrooms sliced and sautéed in butter. Simple, yet elegant. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12854.name: Morel Salad
12854.description: A fresh green salad topped with sautéed morels. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12855.name: Grilled Sweetfish
12855.description: A simple dish created by piercing a lightly salted fresh sweetfish with a sharpened stick and slowly roasting it over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12856.name: Baked Pipira Pira
12856.description: A plump pipira pira wrapped with butter and porcini mushrooms and baked in an oven, the steam trapped in the leaf slowly cooking the fish to the perfect flakiness. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12857.name: Urchin Loaf
12857.description: Sea urchin corals mixed with mushrooms and herbs into a paste that is then placed back into the urchin shell and baked until hard. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12858.name: Cockatrice Meatballs
12858.description: Ground lean cockatrice meat hand rolled into bite-sized balls and fried in oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12859.name: Royal Eggs
12859.description: A breakfast dish consisting of an Ishgardian muffin sliced into halves and topped with salmon, a poached egg, and a creamy yellow sauce made from butter and egg yolks. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12860.name: Deep-fried Okeanis
12860.description: Thinly sliced okeanis fried in oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12861.name: Baked Onion Soup
12861.description: A hearty bouillon soup filled with sweet onions, covered with shredded cheese and baked in an oven until golden brown. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12862.name: Beet Soup
12862.description: Sliced magma beets and lean loaghtan meat slow-cooked with vegetables and served with a dollop of rich sour cream. A dish popular throughout Ishgard, though families in the Brume often use the meat of animals easier to find in the district's dark back alleys. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12863.name: Emerald Soup
12863.description: A bright-green soup made by cooking down emerald beans until they break down into a ghastly paste. Despised by children both high- and lowborn. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12864.name: Clam Chowder
12864.description: A milk-based soup made with various shellfish, but most often clams. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12865.name: Seafood Stew
12865.description: A simple stew made from available seafood boiled with tomatoes and spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12866.name: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
12866.description: Ground meat rolled in cabbage and boiled in broth. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12867.name: Dhalmel Gratin
12867.description: Several layers of thinly sliced dhalmel meat and vegetables covered in a creamy white sauce and baked. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12868.name: Stuffed Chysahl
12868.description: Ground okeanis stuffed into a large chysahl head and sprinkled with fresh chives. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12869.name: Dhalmel Fricassee
12869.description: Chopped and braised dhalmel meat cooked in a white stew. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12870.name: Snurbleberry Tart
12870.description: A colorful tart made with blood red snurbleberries. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12871.name: Gastornis Egg
12871.description: The hard-shelled egg of a gastornis.

12872.name: Okeanis Egg
12872.description: The soft-shelled, slime-covered, ever-so-slightly warm egg of an okeanis.

12873.name: Loaghtan Chump
12873.description: A marbled piece of meat taken from the rump of a loaghtan where the leg meets the loin.

12874.name: Dhalmel Meat
12874.description: A gristle-filled slice of meat that will require extensive simmering for it to be rendered palatable.

12875.name: Okeanis Tail
12875.description: When skinned, this slice of serpent-like meat almost appears edible.

12876.name: Cockatrice Thigh
12876.description: A lean slice of cockatrice meat good for flavorful broths.

12877.name: Pearl Sprouts
12877.description: Tiny cabbage-like vegetables native to the highlands of Coerthas.

12878.name: Cyclops Onion
12878.description: A giant yellow onion often found growing on Abalathia's Spine.

12879.name: Emerald Beans
12879.description: A deep-green legume recently discovered growing on the floating islets above the Sea of Clouds.

12880.name: Highland Wheat
12880.description: A variety of dark-colored wheat suited to the rocky soil, shorter days, and colder temperatures of the Coerthas highlands.

12881.name: Highland Flour
12881.description: Finely milled highland wheat. It has a rich, earthy aroma.

12882.name: Coerthan Tea Leaves
12882.description: Considerably smaller than Thanalan tea leaves, more than double the amount of Ishgardian tea leaves are required to brew a single cup of tea.

12883.name: Mist Dill
12883.description: A fragrant herb characterized by its thin leaves. It is used in both medicines and culinary dishes.

12884.name: Chives
12884.description: A thin green onion used in many Ishgardian dishes.

12885.name: Magma Beet
12885.description: A sweet, easy-to-grow tuber native to Abalathia's Spine, these deep-red beets are a staple in Ishgardian culinary culture.

12886.name: Heavenly Kukuru Powder
12886.description: A sweet, fragrant powder ground from high-quality kukuru beans imported from exotic lands at a great price. A delicacy only available to the Holy See's most privileged.

12887.name: Sesame Seeds
12887.description: A tiny seed rich in aromatic oil, sesame is native to Meracydia, and thought to have first been brought to Eorzea by migrating Miqo'te.

12888.name: Yak Milk
12888.description: The unique flavor of yak milk can be somewhat off-putting to those raised on cow or aldgoat milk. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12889.name: Heavens Lemon
12889.description: Possibly due to the increased sunlight it receives growing above the clouds, heavens lemons lack the acidity of normal sun lemons. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12890.name: Hollandaise Sauce
12890.description: A rich sauce created with butter, egg yolks, and a hint of lemon.

12891.name: Birch Sap
12891.description: A thin clear sap harvested from birch trees.

12892.name: Birch Syrup
12892.description: Birch sap boiled down to a thick, sweet syrup.

12893.name: Dark Chestnut
12893.description: The spine-encased fruit of the dark chestnut tree.

12894.name: Sour Cream
12894.description: A thick cream created by fermenting yak milk.

12895.name: Fermented Butter
12895.description: Slightly pungent butter allowed to ferment for several days after churning.

12896.name: Old World Fig
12896.description: A symbol of long life and femininity, this autumn fruit was originally brought from their homeland to Eorzea by the Sharlayans. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12897.name: Cloud Banana
12897.description: Though it resembles a tree, cloud bananas actually grow from an oversized herb. That does not, however, make them any less sweet. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12898.name: Morel
12898.description: This rare mushroom with an oblong webbed cap is highly sought after by culinarians the realm over.

12899.name: Porcini
12899.description: A large fragrant mushroom popular in Coerthan cuisine.

12900.name: Chysahl Greens
12900.description: Though nearly identical in shape and color to gysahl greens, chysahl greens have a deeper, earthier flavor that chocobos (and man) seem to prefer.

12901.name: Abalathian Rock Salt
12901.description: Mined from veins found in Abalathia's Spine, this pinkish salt has a high mineral content which adds depth to its flavor.

12902.name: Honeydew Almonds
12902.description: A sweet variety of rare white almonds.

12903.name: Dravanian Paprika
12903.description: A rare pepper that is more sweet than it is spicy.

12904.name: Snurbleberry
12904.description: This sweet, yet tart red berry is covered in tiny soft hairs that can be removed by lightly rubbing the fruit between one's palms. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

12905.name: Bouillon Cube
12905.description: Animal broth that has been reduced down to a paste and hardened into cubes which will keep for an extended duration.

12906.name: Oriental Soy Sauce
12906.description: Similar to Mun-Tuy sauce, this Far Eastern seasoning is made by fermenting soybeans in salt and then pressing the beans to collect the remaining savory liquid.

12907.name: Oriental Miso Paste
12907.description: Similar to Mun-Tuy paste, this Far Eastern seasoning is made by fermenting soybeans in salt.

12908.name: Vermicelli
12908.description: Thin noodles made with highland flour, eggs, water, and salt. These have been dried and will keep indefinitely.

12909.name: Mossy Stone Greatsword
12909.description: A greatsword crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

12910.name: Mossy Stone Cannon
12910.description: A hand cannon crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

12911.name: Mossy Stone Globe
12911.description: A star globe crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

12912.name: Celestine
12912.description: A light-blue crystalline mineral which, when ground and added to any flammable material, will cause it to burn red.

12913.name: Garlond Steel
12913.description: A lightweight form of steel developed by the eponymous chief engineer of the Garlond Ironworks.

12914.name: Deep-red Enchanted Ink
12914.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals.

12915.name: Superior Deep-red Enchanted Ink
12915.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals. The concentration of this bottle's contents appears to be remarkably high.

12916.name: Deep-green Enchanted Ink
12916.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals.

12917.name: Superior Deep-green Enchanted Ink
12917.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals. The concentration of this bottle's contents appears to be remarkably high.

12918.name: Deep-blue Enchanted Ink
12918.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals.

12919.name: Superior Deep-blue Enchanted Ink
12919.description: Fortifying ink with powder created by grinding down multi-aspected crystals has been found to improve aetherial conductivity several times more than ink fortified with common metals. The concentration of this bottle's contents appears to be remarkably high.

12931.name: Purified Coke
12931.description: A hot-burning fuel created by destructively distilling raw coal. This particular piece contains very few impurities, allowing for longer, hotter combustion.

12932.name: Raziqcoat
12932.description: Developed by a Near Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to treat and harden aurum regis.

12933.name: Dryad Sap
12933.description: A partially congealed ball of sticky sap extracted from a dryad.

12934.name: Moonbeam Silk
12934.description: A brilliant white silk spun by a rare breed of Eorzean spider.

12935.name: Odorless Animal Fat
12935.description: This gobbet of beastkin tissue does not exhibit the rancid odor most commonly associated with animal fat.

12936.name: Duskborne Aethersand
12936.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible during the day.

12937.name: Dawnborne Aethersand
12937.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a brilliant light discernible even at midday.

12938.name: Landborne Aethersand
12938.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced mineral matter.

12939.name: Leafborne Aethersand
12939.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced floral matter.

12940.name: Seaborne Aethersand
12940.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced sea life.

12941.name: Chalcocite
12941.description: A black metallic ore containing copper and traces of iron and saltpeter.

12942.name: Cuprite
12942.description: Though its appearance suggests it is a precious gem, this ore is actually a rare form of red translucent copper.

12943.name: Dravanian Mistletoe
12943.description: A variety of parasitic plant found growing on trees in the Churning Mists.

12944.name: Abalathian Mistletoe
12944.description: A variety of parasitic plant found growing on trees in the Sea of Clouds.

12945.name: Red Alumen
12945.description: A reddish variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It lacks the deodorizing properties of its lighter counterpart.

12966.name: Bright Fire Rock
12966.description: An uncut, unpolished stone imbued with aetheric fire energy.

12967.name: Bright Lightning Rock
12967.description: An uncut, unpolished stone imbued with aetheric lightning energy.

12968.name: Granular Clay
12968.description: Crumbly balls of reddish clay added to soil to improve both moisture retention and drainage.

12969.name: Peat Moss
12969.description: Soil created by thousands of years of decaying flora gathering on the bottom of marshes.

12970.name: Black Soil
12970.description: This rich, dark soil receives its color from a high concentration of organic matter.

12971.name: Highland Oregano
12971.description: Due to its higher oil content, highland oregano is preferred over other breeds of oregano by apothecaries and perfumeries across Eorzea.

12972.name: Furymint
12972.description: Named after the spear-like shape of its leaves, this variety of mint has a cooler, less biting flavor than its darker-leaved cousin peppermint.

12973.name: Clary Sage
12973.description: A fragrant herb used in medicines, perfumes, and cooking.

12991.name: Orthodox Barding
12991.description: A beautifully ornamented suit of plate armor worn by chocobos in the service of church officiants.

13003.name: Iron Giant Core
13003.description: The control unit of an iron giant.

13055.name: Steward Permit
13055.description:
This permit allows the hiring of stewards on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

13058.name: Coffin Lid
13058.description: Pried from the lid of a coffin, this plank of ancient wood is cold to the touch.

13059.name: Sephirot Sap
13059.description: Left behind by the Fiend, this lump of sap appears to pulse with aetheric energy.

13060.name: Fiend Sap
13060.description: Left behind by the Fiend, this lump of sap appears to induce growth in living organisms.

13061.name: Crystal Bell
13061.description:
One ring summons the crafter of coiffures to save you from your passé existence.

※One per estate only.

13062.name: Stuffed Succubus
13062.description: Take this All Saints' Wake-themed doll to bed at your own risk.

13063.name: Pumpkin Desk
13063.description: A pumpkin-themed desk designed with All Saints' Wake in mind.

13064.name: Starlight Ornament
13064.description: A wall decoration hung in homes during the Starlight Celebration.

13065.name: Twin Star Ornament
13065.description: A brilliant wall decoration hung in homes during the Starlight Celebration.

13066.name: Starlight Sentinel
13066.description: A potted conifer displayed in homes during the Starlight Celebration.

13067.name: Oriental Orange Basket
13067.description: Oriental oranges, while small, are far softer and sweeter than the oranges found growing in Eorzea. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: +4% (Max 6) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

13068.name: Paissa Doll
13068.description: A stuffed toy recently adopted for use in Heavensturn festivities.

13069.name: The Unending Journey
13069.description:
A full record of your past adventures, in one massive volume.

※One per estate only.

13070.name: Oriental Tea Set
13070.description: Bring a touch of the exotic to teatime with this collection of authentic Doman woodware. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Piety Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 27) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

13071.name: Manor Oven
13071.description: A large cooking oven designed in a similar fashion to the unit found in Haukke Manor's kitchens.

13072.name: Manor Counter
13072.description: A large counter designed in a similar fashion to the unit found in Haukke Manor's kitchens.

13073.name: Stack of Tomes
13073.description: A neatly assembled collection of works ranging from poetry to history. A tidy bibliophile's dream.

13074.name: Pile of Tomes
13074.description: A slightly strewn collection of works ranging from mythology to philosophy. A tidy bibliophile's nightmare.

13075.name: Oriental Round Table
13075.description: A low, circular table used for sitting on the floor.

13076.name: Mhachi Coffin
13076.description:
A faithful replica of a coffin discovered in the Void Ark.

※One per estate only.

13077.name: Funguar Chair
13077.description: A low stool designed to resemble a mushroom.

13078.name: Mahogany Partition Door
13078.description: A partition and door combination, reaching to the ceiling and so sturdy that it may as well be a wall.

13079.name: Pumpkin Chair
13079.description: The perfect partner for a pumpkin desk.

13080.name: Broken Heart Chair (Right)
13080.description: Half a heart. Also half a chair.

13081.name: Broken Heart Chair (Left)
13081.description: Half a heart. Also half a chair.

13082.name: Paramour Bed
13082.description: A plush heart-shaped bed far more sophisticated than those found on Limsa Lominsa's pleasure barges.

13084.name: Topiary Chocobo
13084.description: A specially bred shrub pruned to the shape of a chipper chocobo.

13088.name: Sephirot Root
13088.description:
A masterful objet d'art created using the sap of the Fiend. 

※One per estate only.

13089.name: Sephirot Tree
13089.description:
An imposing objet d'art of a sacred tree. 

※One per estate only.

13090.name: Oriental Grass Plot
13090.description:
A tall variety of wild grass with stalks that end in large silver tufts of wispy flowers.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

13091.name: Dravanian Down Tree
13091.description:
A unique species of flora found only growing in the Sea of Clouds. As its seeds do not take in soil from the lower realm, the trees must be planted and raised on sky islets before being transplanted.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

13092.name: Microscopically Small Mogwalls
13092.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a home fit for a moogle.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

13093.name: Middlingly Medium Mogwalls
13093.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a home fit for a moogle.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

13094.name: Monstrously Large Mogwalls
13094.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a home fit for a moogle.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

13095.name: Cob Inner Wall
13095.description: A rustic wall made of soil, straw, and lime.

13096.name: Manor Flooring
13096.description: Flooring similar in design to that used in Haukke Manor.

13097.name: Faerie Chandelier
13097.description: This delicate light fixture will remind you the wood is alive and always watching...

13114.name: General-purpose Pure White Dye
13114.description: A rare and expensive white dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13115.name: General-purpose Jet Black Dye
13115.description: A rare and expensive black dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13116.name: General-purpose Metallic Silver Dye
13116.description: A rare and expensive silver dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13117.name: General-purpose Metallic Gold Dye
13117.description: A rare and expensive gold dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13275.name: Paissa Brat
13275.description:
The eyes of a newborn paissa are said to see only the truth. The truth and food.

Use item to acquire the paissa brat minion.

13276.name: Wind-up Illuminatus
13276.description:
Comes complete with two hands, both blue as an Illuminati baby's bum.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Illuminatus minion.

13279.name: Hunting Hawk
13279.description:
She loves you more than life itself. She's had to.

Use item to acquire the hunting hawk minion.

13283.name: Korpokkur Kid
13283.description:
For best results, keep moist at all times.

Use item to acquire the korpokkur kid minion.

13284.name: Wind-up Ifrit
13284.description:
It doesn't bleed. You cannot kill it. (But you may discard it at your leisure.)

Use item to acquire the wind-up Ifrit minion.

13285.name: Thorne Dynasty Mantelshelf
13285.description: A special multi-tiered shelf widely used during the Thorne Dynasty to display ornamental dolls.

13354.name: Cold Knight's Cookfire
13354.description: A warm fire and a place to rest one's weary legs─two things every Ishgardian knight looks forward to after a long cold day of duty.

13355.name: Oriental Snowcave
13355.description: A tightly packed pile of snow hollowed out and formed into a tiny dwelling. A thin coating of eternal ice ensures the snowcave will never melt.

13589.name: Adamantite Francesca
13589.description: A small throwing axe forged from adamantite.

13590.name: Pterodactyl Strap
13590.description: A thin leather strap cut from the cured hide of a pterodactyl.

13591.name: Titanium Alloy Mirror
13591.description: The reflective surface on this mirror has been achieved through countless days of buffing and polishing.

13592.name: Titanium Alloy Square
13592.description: A thin, tiny plate of hammered titanium alloy.

13593.name: Dispelling Arrow
13593.description: Not actually an arrow, but rather a warding charm carved into the shape of one.

13594.name: Blessed Fletchings
13594.description: Arrow fletchings crafted from the large, rigid feathers of an eagle and then blessed by an anointed Halonic priest.

13595.name: Kingcake
13595.description: A festive ring-shaped cake baked from brioche dough.

13596.name: Moogle Miniature
13596.description: A small ceramic figurine bearing the likeness of a plump moogle.

13637.name: Max-Potion
13637.description: This spiritous concoction instantly restores a considerable amount of HP.

13638.name: Max-Ether
13638.description: Processed via the alchemical extraction of aetheric essence occurring in elemental crystals, the contents of this vial instantly restore a considerable amount of MP.

13708.name: General-purpose Pastel Pink Dye
13708.description: A rare and expensive pink dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13709.name: General-purpose Dark Red Dye
13709.description: A rare and expensive red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13710.name: General-purpose Dark Brown Dye
13710.description: A rare and expensive brown dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13711.name: General-purpose Pastel Green Dye
13711.description: A rare and expensive green dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13712.name: General-purpose Dark Green Dye
13712.description: A rare and expensive green dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13713.name: General-purpose Pastel Blue Dye
13713.description: A rare and expensive blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13714.name: General-purpose Dark Blue Dye
13714.description: A rare and expensive blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13715.name: General-purpose Pastel Purple Dye
13715.description: A rare and expensive purple dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13716.name: General-purpose Dark Purple Dye
13716.description: A rare and expensive purple dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13717.name: General-purpose Metallic Red Dye
13717.description: A rare and expensive red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13718.name: General-purpose Metallic Orange Dye
13718.description: A rare and expensive orange dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13719.name: General-purpose Metallic Yellow Dye
13719.description: A rare and expensive yellow dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13720.name: General-purpose Metallic Green Dye
13720.description: A rare and expensive green dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13721.name: General-purpose Metallic Sky Blue Dye
13721.description: A rare and expensive blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13722.name: General-purpose Metallic Blue Dye
13722.description: A rare and expensive blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13723.name: General-purpose Metallic Purple Dye
13723.description: A rare and expensive purple dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

13726.name: Iron Clapper
13726.description: A short piece of iron loosely affixed to the inside of a bell, causing it to ring when the clapper strikes the bell's wall.

13727.name: Functional Proto-hropken
13727.description:
A remarkably developed manlike fish living in the aetherochemical pools of Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

13728.name: Coerthan Clione
13728.description:
Though believed by scholars to be a distant cousin of the snail, this tiny transparent mollusk does not have a shell.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

13729.name: Dravanian Smelt
13729.description:
A tiny freshwater fish native to the lakes fed by runoff from the Slate Mountains.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

13730.name: Heavens Coral
13730.description:
A lightweight, sky blue coral found growing on the floating islands above Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

13731.name: Sunsail
13731.description:
A flying fish found in the skies near the Landlord Colony.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

13732.name: Goblin Bass
13732.description:
Introduced to the Thaliak River by goblins, this variety of voracious bass has driven native species to the brink of extinction.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

13733.name: Pterodactyl
13733.description: A winged scalekin native to the Diadem.

13734.name: Eurhinosaur
13734.description: A rare scalekin that utilizes its highly developed air bladder to float above the Sea of Clouds.

13736.name: Gem Marimo
13736.description: A bright-green variety of aquatic moss found on the bottom of lakes. Slight currents cause the moss to gather and form into a ball as it grows.

13737.name: Crown Trout
13737.description: A freshwater fish native to the Diadem.

13738.name: Retribution Staff
13738.description: A large freshwater fish native to the Diadem.

13739.name: Thief Betta
13739.description: An aggressive freshwater fish native to the Diadem.

13740.name: Goldsmith Crab
13740.description: A tiny freshwater crustacean native to the Diadem.

13742.name: Steamed Staff
13742.description: Not actually a staff, but a dish made from steaming a freshwater fish known as a retribution staff─a long, thin wavekin believed to be the cause of storms. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

13743.name: Sesame Cookie
13743.description: Tales of a blue monster who greedily devours these baked delights have frightened children across the realm for generations. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

13744.name: Wind Silk
13744.description: This silk is exposed to aetherial turbulence in order to strengthen its aspect to wind.

13745.name: Dinosaur Leather
13745.description: A large piece of cured dinosaur skin.

13746.name: Falconer's Hemp
13746.description: A double-weave variety of hemp used by falconers to protect themselves from the sharp talons of their raptors.

13747.name: Titanium Alloy Ingot
13747.description: A durable alloy created by smelting titanium with zinc.

13748.name: Cloud Cloth
13748.description: Soft, light cotton woven from rare cloud cotton bolls.

13749.name: Pterodactyl Leather
13749.description: A large piece of cured pterodactyl skin.

13750.name: Sphalerite
13750.description: A semi-translucent mineral containing large amounts of zinc and iron.

13751.name: Potters Stone
13751.description: A hard clay found exclusively on the islets of the Diadem. When fired in a kiln, the result is a brilliant white pottery.

13752.name: Royal Mistletoe
13752.description: A parasitic plant that is only found growing on the trees of the Diadem.

13753.name: Cloud Cotton Boll
13753.description: The cloud-like flower of a cotton plant native to the Diadem.

13754.name: Blood Pepper
13754.description: A deep red variety of dragon pepper so hot it is widely believed by Far Eastern cultures to drive away malignant spirits.

13755.name: Blood Pepper Seeds
13755.description: Blood pepper seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

13756.name: Dravanian Mote
13756.description: This lighter-than-air flora is unique to the Churning Mists.

13757.name: Oriental Grass Tuft
13757.description: A tall variety of grass common in the Far East.

13758.name: Cassia Block
13758.description: An expertly cut cube of fragrant cassia lumber.

13759.name: Tektite
13759.description: A type of naturally occurring glass first discovered after the Calamity which ushered in the Seventh Umbral Era.

13760.name: Eventide Jade
13760.description: A rare form of jade as red as a sunset.

13761.name: Fossilized Dragon Bone
13761.description: There is much debate amongst Eorzean scholars as to how much time must pass before a bone becomes fossilized. Some say a mere generation will suffice, citing evidence such as the proliferation of petrification magicks. Others believe it may take upwards of a thousand thousand years, casting doubts on the theories which state Hydaelyn was created a mere twenty thousand summers past.

13762.name: Periwinkle
13762.description: A mildly poisonous flower found across the Three Great Continents.

13763.name: Cloud Mushroom
13763.description: An aptly named fungus commonly found in the Sea of Clouds, wind providing a means of spore distribution from one islet to the next.

13764.name: Wind Widow
13764.description: A tiny poisonous spider that weaves sail-like webs used by the vilekin to traverse the Sea of Clouds.

13765.name: Old World Fig Seeds
13765.description: Old World fig seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

13766.name: Chive Seeds
13766.description: Chive seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

13767.name: Pearl Sprout Seeds
13767.description: Pearl sprout seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

13768.name: Coerthan Tea Seeds
13768.description: Coerthan tea seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

13775.name: The Emperor's New Fists
13775.description: The most beautiful pair of pugilist's arms you will never see.

13842.name: Replica High Allagan Grimoire of Casting

13843.name: Replica High Allagan Grimoire of Healing

13848.name: Replica High Allagan Circlet of Fending

13850.name: Replica High Allagan Gauntlets of Fending

13851.name: Replica High Allagan Trousers of Fending

13852.name: Replica High Allagan Sabatons of Fending

13853.name: Replica High Allagan Headgear of Maiming

13854.name: Replica High Allagan Cuirass of Maiming

13855.name: Replica High Allagan Gauntlets of Maiming

13856.name: Replica High Allagan Trousers of Maiming

13857.name: Replica High Allagan Sabatons of Maiming

13858.name: Replica High Allagan Headgear of Striking

13859.name: Replica High Allagan Cuirass of Striking

13860.name: Replica High Allagan Gauntlets of Striking

13861.name: Replica High Allagan Trousers of Striking

13862.name: Replica High Allagan Sabatons of Striking

13863.name: Replica High Allagan Mask of Aiming

13864.name: Replica High Allagan Coat of Aiming

13865.name: Replica High Allagan Gloves of Aiming

13866.name: Replica High Allagan Breeches of Aiming

13867.name: Replica High Allagan Boots of Aiming

13868.name: Replica High Allagan Circlet of Healing

13869.name: Replica High Allagan Coat of Healing

13870.name: Replica High Allagan Gloves of Healing

13871.name: Replica High Allagan Pantaloons of Healing

13872.name: Replica High Allagan Thighboots of Healing

13873.name: Replica High Allagan Mask of Casting

13874.name: Replica High Allagan Coat of Casting

13875.name: Replica High Allagan Gloves of Casting

13876.name: Replica High Allagan Breeches of Casting

13877.name: Replica High Allagan Boots of Casting

14003.name: Viltgance-type Hull
14003.description: A hull which utilizes a rigid, lightweight frame for a more stable flight.

14004.name: Viltgance-type Aetherwings
14004.description: The wings of a Viltgance-type airship, which adopt the same technology as Garlond Ironworks' manacutters in treating the wings with wind-aspected aether for buoyancy.

14005.name: Viltgance-type Forecastle
14005.description: The front half of a Viltgance-type airship, including the main deck and a sharp, narrow bow to balance air resistance.

14006.name: Viltgance-type Aftcastle
14006.description: The rear half of a Viltgance-type airship, with smaller aetherwings for supported buoyancy.

14007.name: Oldrose Seeds
14007.description:
Some say love, it is a river. Some say love, it is a flower. Plant these seeds and learn the truth.

※For use in planters.

14008.name: Riviera Vase
14008.description:
A vase decorated in the riviera fashion.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

14009.name: Glade Vase
14009.description:
A vase decorated in the glade fashion.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

14010.name: Oasis Vase
14010.description:
A vase decorated in the oasis fashion.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

14011.name: Red Pomace
14011.description: An all-natural fertilizer used to increase red pigment in flowers.

14012.name: Blue Pomace
14012.description: An all-natural fertilizer used to increase blue pigment in flowers.

14013.name: Mountain Pomace
14013.description: An all-natural fertilizer used to increase yellow pigment in flowers.

14045.name: Orchestrion
14045.description:
A furnishing that is sure to delight guests and residents alike, as they while away the hours listening to some of their favorite tunes.

※One orchestrion of any type per estate only.

14047.name: Stuffed Onion Prince
14047.description: Attempting to peel away the layers of what makes this plush prince so glum will leave you with less than you started out with. As well as a mess of fabric.

14048.name: Pudding Floor Lamp
14048.description: A slimy floor lamp designed in the likeness of a pudding.

14049.name: Pudding Throw Rug
14049.description: A slimy throw rug designed in the likeness of a pudding.

14050.name: Pudding Settee
14050.description: A slimy settee designed in the likeness of a pudding.

14051.name: Pudding Desk
14051.description: A slimy desk designed in the likeness of a pudding.

14052.name: Alpine Supper Set
14052.description: This warm array of comfort food has become a treat for special occasions amongst the commoner families of Ishgard, who have been known to save their coin for moons to procure the ingredients. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 29) +4% (Max 28) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14053.name: High House Supper Set
14053.description: An extravagant multiple-course meal enjoyed by the nobility of Ishgard on saint feast days and other ceremonious occasions. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Determination Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 27) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14055.name: Riviera Flowerpot
14055.description:
A garden planter designed in the riviera style.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 2, 3, and 4 planters, respectively. Private chambers and apartments can hold 2.

14056.name: Glade Flowerpot
14056.description:
A garden planter designed in the glade style.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 2, 3, and 4 planters, respectively. Private chambers and apartments can hold 2.

14057.name: Oasis Flowerpot
14057.description:
A garden planter designed in the oasis style.

※Small, medium, and large estates can hold 2, 3, and 4 planters, respectively. Private chambers and apartments can hold 2.

14058.name: Dinosaur Skull
14058.description: The crown of an ancient beast. While one may find it comical to stick his or her head in its mouth, collectors warn that its teeth are still razor-sharp and there have been unfortunate accidents.

14059.name: Dinosaur Skeleton
14059.description: The torso and legs of an ancient beast. Scholars are unsure why its modern cousins still have short arms, but they argue they must be of some merit in their hunting habits.

14060.name: Dinosaur Tailbone
14060.description: The tail of an ancient beast. Some believe that when struck with a mallet, the hollowed tailbones emit pleasant-sounding notes.

14061.name: Topiary Sabotender
14061.description: A specially bred shrub pruned to the shape of a scampering sabotender.

14062.name: Archon Egg Tower
14062.description: A Hatchingtide decoration with tiers of Archon eggs tirelessly hand-painted by the youngest of the Dreamers.

14063.name: Dandelion Plot
14063.description:
A tiny field of cheery dandelions that begs to be frolicked in.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

14064.name: Living Arch
14064.description: An aging stone bridge covered in ivy and moss. Perfect for the romantic rendezvous.

14065.name: Shishi-odoshi
14065.description:
A fountain from the Far East originally used to scare away creatures and neighbors come to nibble on garden patches. 

※Up to five may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

14066.name: Faust Striking Dummy
14066.description:
A striking dummy created by the Illuminati to train their ranks for combat.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

14068.name: Alpine Chandelier
14068.description: A sumptuous chandelier designed to complement alpine residences.

14069.name: Alpine Flooring
14069.description: Floorboards designed to complement alpine residences.

14070.name: Alpine Inner Wall
14070.description: An interior wall designed in the alpine fashion.

14071.name: Red Oldroses
14071.description:
A bunch of red oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14072.name: Blue Oldroses
14072.description:
A bunch of blue oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14073.name: Yellow Oldroses
14073.description:
A bunch of yellow oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14074.name: Green Oldroses
14074.description:
A bunch of green oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14075.name: Orange Oldroses
14075.description:
A bunch of orange oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14076.name: Purple Oldroses
14076.description:
A bunch of purple oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14077.name: White Oldroses
14077.description:
A bunch of white oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14078.name: Black Oldroses
14078.description:
A bunch of black oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14079.name: Rainbow Oldroses
14079.description:
A bunch of multicolored oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

14080.name: Sephirotic Barding
14080.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Sephirot, the Fiend.

14083.name: Zu Horn
14083.description: This horn of bone emits a howling blare that summons your trained zu mount.

14093.name: Wind-up Garuda
14093.description:
Hopefully she will not HEEHEE haha HEEE!!! too loudly in your ear.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Garuda minion.

14094.name: Wind-up Titan
14094.description:
Placing this wind-up Titan on an elevated surface may compel it to knock everything else to the ground. 

Use item to acquire the wind-up Titan minion.

14095.name: Wind-up Leviathan
14095.description:
Your flesh cannot feed this minion of the deep. 

Use item to acquire the wind-up Leviathan minion.

14098.name: Calca
14098.description:
Whether she is cute or creepy has been oft debated, but all agree it is best not to leave her to her own devices.  

Use item to acquire the Calca minion.

14100.name: Morpho
14100.description:
With blue wings practically glowing, this butterfly feels almost like a spirit. Almost. 

Use item to acquire the morpho minion.

14103.name: Fenrir Pup
14103.description:
This stray hoarhound pup is as feisty as the leader of his pack, and just as aloof. 

Use item to acquire the Fenrir pup minion.

14134.name: Spiced Cider
14134.description: A warmed jug filled with piquant apple juice mulled with zested ginger and cloves, complete with a stick of cinnamon. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14135.name: Apple Strudel
14135.description: A handful of chopped apples glazed with birch syrup are thinly wrapped in a warm flaky crust, topped with just a sprinkling of cinnamon. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14136.name: Peperoncino
14136.description: Noodles tossed in mature olive oil that has been infused with solstice garlic and dragon peppers. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14137.name: Boscaiola
14137.description: A hearty dish of chewy noodles, heaped with a generous portion of seasonal mushrooms and drowned in tomato sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14138.name: Loaghtan Steak
14138.description: A tough cut of loaghtan meat soaked in a marinade of paprika, sherry, and thyme and grilled over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14139.name: Oyster Confit
14139.description: A serving of succulent Coerthan oysters on the half shell, simmered in rich olive oil and seasoned with fresh spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14140.name: Angler Stew
14140.description: A thick, creamy stew brimming with tender chunks of fish, onions, and chives. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14141.name: Sweet Gnomefish
14141.description: A gnomefish boiled in sweet birch syrup. The glaze preserves the fish for days after cooking. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14142.name: Golden Apple
14142.description: A mildly sweet apple with a tart aftertaste, this rare fruit is highly sought after amongst bakers. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

14143.name: Solstice Garlic
14143.description: Favored by chefs for leaving one's breath scant of odor after a meal, this zesty garlic is often used in gourmet dishes.

14144.name: Mature Olive Oil
14144.description: A rich-tasting oil produced with pressed olives at the peak of ripeness.

14145.name: Loaghtan Fillet
14145.description: Taken from the upper loin of a domesticated loaghtan, this meat is tender enough that it does not require any preparation before cooking.

14148.name: Lumythrite Ore
14148.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be lumythrite.

14149.name: Eikon Iron Ingot
14149.description: An ingot of smelted iron blessed by a primal.

14150.name: Eikon Metal
14150.description: A heavy piece of unidentifiable metal blessed by a primal.

14151.name: Smithsonite Ore
14151.description: This slightly lustrous ore is characterized by its extremely high zinc content.

14152.name: Eikon Cloth
14152.description: Finely woven cloth blessed by a primal.

14153.name: Eikon Fiber
14153.description: Tightly spun thread blessed by a primal.

14154.name: Frost Cotton Boll
14154.description: A soft and fluffy variety of cotton named for its resemblance to morning hoarfrost.

14155.name: Eikon Leather
14155.description: A large piece of cured beastkin skin blessed by a primal.

14156.name: Eikon Hide
14156.description: The skin of a large, yet unidentifiable creature, blessed by a primal.

14157.name: Treated Camphorwood Lumber
14157.description: A processed length of camphor lumber, treated with an alchemical agent to harden the wood.

14158.name: Camphorwood Lumber
14158.description: Processed camphor lumber. Its piquant aroma remains years after harvesting, making it a favorite for use in armoires and furnishings.

14159.name: Camphorwood Log
14159.description: A rough-cut log of camphorwood timber.

14160.name: Camphorwood Branch
14160.description: The thick branch of a camphorwood tree.

14161.name: Camphor
14161.description: The waxy, crystallized remnants of a liquid drawn from steamed bits of camphorwood.

14164.name: Gobcraft Resin
14164.description: A synthetic resin created by the goblins to protect leatherwork and carpentry from the elements.

14171.name: Grade 3 Strength Dissolvent
14171.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

14172.name: Grade 3 Dexterity Dissolvent
14172.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

14173.name: Grade 3 Vitality Dissolvent
14173.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

14174.name: Grade 3 Intelligence Dissolvent
14174.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

14175.name: Grade 3 Mind Dissolvent
14175.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

14176.name: Max-Potion of Strength
14176.description: This extremely powerful concoction temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

14177.name: Max-Potion of Dexterity
14177.description: This extremely powerful concoction temporarily increases dexterity. Duration: 15s

14178.name: Max-Potion of Vitality
14178.description: This extremely powerful concoction temporarily increases vitality. Duration: 15s

14179.name: Max-Potion of Intelligence
14179.description: This extremely powerful concoction temporarily increases intelligence. Duration: 15s

14180.name: Max-Potion of Mind
14180.description: This extremely powerful concoction temporarily increases mind. Duration: 15s

14181.name: Blank Grade 1 Orchestrion Roll
14181.description: Blank spools of paper onto which scores of sheet music can be transcribed by means of perforation.

14182.name: Blank Grade 2 Orchestrion Roll
14182.description: Blank spools of paper onto which scores of sheet music can be transcribed by means of perforation.

14183.name: Blank Grade 3 Orchestrion Roll
14183.description: Blank spools of paper onto which scores of sheet music can be transcribed by means of perforation.

14184.name: High Mythrite Nugget
14184.description: A small nugget of impure lumythrite.

14186.name: Sewing Needle
14186.description: In the hands of a master weaver, this tiny needle carved from the horn of a beast can assist in the crafting of a dozen pairs of leggings in under a sennight.

14187.name: Griffin Leather Strap
14187.description: A thin leather strap cut from the cured hide of a griffin.

14188.name: Sewing Thread
14188.description: A spool of light, airy thread spun from frost cotton fibers.

14189.name: Powdered Horn
14189.description: A fine powder ground from the charred horn of an unidentifiable beast.

14190.name: Beastkin Horn
14190.description: The mud-caked horn of an unidentifiable beast.

14211.name: Amber Salamander
14211.description:
This freshwater amphibian is characterized by whorling patterns of deep amber across its moist skin.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

14212.name: Gnomefish
14212.description:
A decidedly ugly freshwater fish commonly found in and around the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

14213.name: Fleece Stingray
14213.description:
The white belly of this flying fish native to the skies above Coerthas is ofttimes mistaken for a cloud.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

14214.name: Nyctosaur
14214.description:
A tiny winged dragon only recently discovered in the Churning Mists.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

14215.name: Lava Snail
14215.description:
The lumpy shell of the lava snail is extremely heat resistant, protecting its tiny resident from otherwise unbearable temperatures.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

14216.name: Priestfish
14216.description:
A distant cousin of the monkfish, this ravenous resident of the lakes and swamps of Coerthas also possesses a luminescent proboscis which it uses to attract prey.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

14217.name: Coerthan Oyster
14217.description:
A bivalve mollusk native to the lakes of Coerthas, and prized as a delicacy by Ishgardian nobles.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

14218.name: Oliphant's Trunk
14218.description:
Extended exposure to the unclassifiable aetherochemicals tainting the pools in which this fishlike creature lives has contributed to the abnormal development of its mouth and jaw.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

14219.name: Mountain Kraken
14219.description:
A massive freshwater squid found in the lakes of Coerthas.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

14220.name: Armored Catfish
14220.description:
This large freshwater fish is covered in thick armor-like scales which protect it from the jaws of hungry bears and yetis.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

14268.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Another Round. The faint scent of sweet liquor lingers on the parchment.

14269.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music retrieved from the Dravanian forelands.

14270.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music retrieved from the Sea of Clouds.

14721.name: Eikon Leather Leg Guards of Maiming

14726.name: Eikon Leather Leg Guards of Striking

14900.name: Stuffed Eggplant Knight
14900.description: Designed with the most complicated pattern of the plush Mandragoras, this knight will protect your castle by day, and woo the queen by night. (Mandragora Queen sold separately.)

14901.name: Stuffed Garlic Jester
14901.description: This stuffed jester may fill your heart with childish glee, but too much cuddling and you will reek to high heavens.

14902.name: Stuffed Tomato King
14902.description: Having no kingdom to call his own, this stuffed plush will be more than willing to rule your realm with his adorable little green fist.

14903.name: Stuffed Mandragora Queen
14903.description: This adorable plush doll comes complete with a fabric flower and tiny hooks on the hands that can be attached to her secret lover. (Eggplant Knight sold separately.)

14931.name: Antique Rug
14931.description: Someone, many decades past, paid a considerable sum for this expertly woven floorpiece.

14932.name: Antique Leather
14932.description: An attestation to its quality, this leather remains supple and uncracked despite its age.

14933.name: Tincalconite
14933.description: A pure white mineral closely related to borax.

14934.name: Dinosaur Fossil
14934.description: The lithified remains of a dinosaur long deceased.

14935.name: Galvanized Garlond Steel
14935.description: A lightweight form of steel developed by the eponymous chief engineer of the Garlond Ironworks. This particular sample has been treated to increase hardness.

14936.name: Faust Armor Plating
14936.description: A heavy square of body armor removed from the Illuminati-constructed battlemachina Faust.

14937.name: Powdered Merman Horn
14937.description: This mysterious powder is claimed to have been ground from the horn of a merman, prompting the question, do mermen have horns? Regardless of its origins, the powder has been proven to be decidedly potent.

14955.name: Lumythrite Sand
14955.description: Glowing sand consisting of tiny grains of lumythrite.

14956.name: Whitefrost Cotton Boll
14956.description: Despite their delicate appearance, the fibers of the whitefrost cotton flower are deceptively durable.

14957.name: Old-growth Camphorwood Log
14957.description: A glance at a cross section of this log reveals that a mere glance isn't enough to count the hundreds, perhaps thousands, of rings present.

15098.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Weaponry
15098.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to a weapon, augments the weapon's strength.

15099.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Headgear
15099.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15100.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Body Gear
15100.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15101.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Hand Gear
15101.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15102.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Leg Gear
15102.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15103.name: Allagan Aetherstone - Foot Gear
15103.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15104.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Weaponry
15104.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to a weapon, greatly augments the weapon's strength.

15105.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Headgear
15105.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, greatly augments the gear's strength.

15106.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Body Gear
15106.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, greatly augments the gear's strength.

15107.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Hand Gear
15107.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, greatly augments the gear's strength.

15108.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Leg Gear
15108.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, greatly augments the gear's strength.

15109.name: High Allagan Aetherstone - Foot Gear
15109.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, greatly augments the gear's strength.

15143.name: Staggered Shelf
15143.description: A bookshelf with crannies of various sizes, designed in the Doman fashion.

15144.name: Washbasin
15144.description: An elegant, stand-alone sink for washing up before dinner. And you will wash up before dinner.

15145.name: Stuffed Bear
15145.description: If you can catch him unawares, you may see him picnic on his holiday.

15146.name: Alpine Breakfast
15146.description: A simple but hearty breakfast oft supped upon by Temple Knights before taking their morning tilts. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Tenacity Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 27) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

15147.name: Hat Stand
15147.description: A hat stand designed in the alpine fashion.

15148.name: Ashtray
15148.description: A clay bowl for the neat disposal of fogweed ash. For the adventurer who likes to unwind between battles without getting soot on the furniture.

15149.name: Indirect Lighting
15149.description:
A footlight focused in a single direction for dramatic theatrical effect.

※Up to two may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

15150.name: Indirect Stand Lighting
15150.description:
A standing light focused in a single direction for a dramatic theatrical effect.

※Up to two may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

15151.name: Chirurgeon's Curtain
15151.description: A large hanging cloth used to provide a patient and his caregiver privacy.

15152.name: Nidhogg Miniature
15152.description:
A statuette depicting the great wyrm, Nidhogg (Azure Dragoon not included).

※One per estate only.

15157.name: Beach Chair
15157.description: A brightly striped lounging space for beachgoers, elevated to keep sand from finding its way into trunks.

15158.name: Morning Glory Plot
15158.description:
Brilliant purple flowers that will follow the sun as it makes its journey across the morning sky.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

15159.name: Large Garden Pond
15159.description: A large decorative outdoor pond encircled by mossy stones.

15160.name: Oriental Wood Bridge
15160.description: An arched bridge colored brilliant vermilion using traditional Far Eastern lacquering techniques.

15161.name: Oriental Deck
15161.description: A roofed, wooden deck with a Far Eastern aesthetic. Perfect for stoically fanning yourself on humid summer days.

15164.name: Sharlayan Flooring
15164.description: Elegant marbled flooring capable of transforming any estate into a bastion of enlightenment.

15165.name: Bluesky Interior Wall
15165.description: A cheery interior wall for those who wish their skies to be forever blue.

15425.name: Rolanberry Shaved Ice
15425.description: A heaping mound of the purest ice harvested from atop the mountains of Coerthas, shaved and drizzled in multicolored rolanberry syrup. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

15427.name: Horde Barding
15427.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the great wyrm Nidhogg.

15436.name: Wind-up Ramuh
15436.description:
He's silently judging you.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Ramuh minion.

15437.name: Wind-up Shiva
15437.description:
Renounce the hatreds that consume you, and she will scatter them like sawdust into the wind.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Shiva minion.

15440.name: Calamari
15440.description:
Use item to acquire the calamari minion.

(Or is it a trap!?)

15441.name: Baby Brachiosaur
15441.description:
The greatest adventure ever born.

Use item to acquire the baby brachiosaur minion.

15447.name: Dwarf Rabbit
15447.description:
He may have a penchant for nibbling at your neighbor's garden patches.

Use item to acquire the dwarf rabbit minion.

15567.name: The Law of Levin First Edition

15626.name: Fat Purse
15626.description:
A king among Coerthan puffers, and lord of the waters of Riversmeet.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

15627.name: The Impaler
15627.description:
A king among spring urchins, and lord of the waters of Dragonspit.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

15628.name: La Reale
15628.description:
A galleon among battle galleys, and dreadnaught of the waters of Ashpool.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

15629.name: Scaleripper
15629.description:
A king among shadowhiskers, and lord of the waters of the Hundred Throes.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15630.name: The Dreamweaver
15630.description:
A king among warmwater bichirs, and lord of the waters of the Smoldering Wastes.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15631.name: Meteortoise
15631.description:
A king among cometoises, and lord of the waters of Mourn.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15632.name: The Ewer King
15632.description:
A king among hinterlands perch, and lord of the waters of the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15633.name: Vidofnir
15633.description:
A king among noontide oscars, and lord of the waters of Eil Tohm.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

15634.name: The Soul of the Martyr
15634.description:
A king among dragon's souls, and lord of the waters of the Landlord Colony.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15635.name: Inkfish
15635.description:
A king among bubble eyes, and lord of the waters of Voor Sian Siran.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

15636.name: The Second One
15636.description:
A king among tornado sharks, and lord of the waters of the Blue Window.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15637.name: Augmented High Allagan Helmet
15637.description:
A king among high Allagan helmets, and lord of the waters of the Alpha Quadrant.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

15638.name: Aphotic Pirarucu
15638.description:
A king among euphotic pirarucu, and lord of the waters of the Delta Quadrant.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

15645.name: Luminous Fiber
15645.description: Glass fiber strengthened using alchemic components.

15646.name: Meteorite
15646.description: A glossy rock of sable black said to have fallen from the heavens.

15647.name: Crystallized Sap
15647.description: Tree sap that has crystallized and hardened into a small cluster.

15648.name: Light-kissed Aethersand
15648.description: Carefully selected granules of crystal. Despite being clear, when viewed under light, they shine a brilliant white.

15649.name: Glass Fiber
15649.description: Thinly spun glass remarkably resistant to high temperatures.

15650.name: Heavensegg Soup
15650.description: A beaten heavensegg is gradually poured into a boiling soup, thickening into wisps across the bacon and vegetables. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

15651.name: Pasta Ortolano
15651.description: A plate of sautéed eggplant and zucchini mixed into soft pasta and drizzled with a rich tomato sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

15652.name: Heavensegg
15652.description: A premium chicken's egg, named for its distinguishable shell tinged blue as the heavens.

15653.name: Nidhogg's Scale
15653.description: A dragon scale pulsating with dark energies. Believed to have fallen from the great wyrm, Nidhogg.

15775.name: Tier 1 Aquarium
15775.description:
A circular glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.

15776.name: Tier 2 Aquarium
15776.description:
A rectangular glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.

15777.name: Tier 3 Aquarium
15777.description:
A rectangular glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.

15778.name: Tier 4 Aquarium
15778.description:
A rectangular glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can hold 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.
