15855.name: Althyk Lavender Seeds
15855.description: Althyk lavender seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15856.name: Voidrake Seeds
15856.description: Voidrake seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15857.name: Althyk Lavender
15857.description: A fragrant variety of lavender rarely found in the arid lowland regions of Thanalan.

15858.name: Voidrake
15858.description: Given its bizarre shape and extreme toxicity, this root is thought to have originated from the void.

15865.name: Firelight Seeds
15865.description: Firelight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15866.name: Icelight Seeds
15866.description: Icelight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15867.name: Windlight Seeds
15867.description: Windlight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15868.name: Earthlight Seeds
15868.description: Earthlight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15869.name: Levinlight Seeds
15869.description: Levinlight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15870.name: Waterlight Seeds
15870.description: Waterlight shrub seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

15908.name: Neo Aetherstone - Headgear
15908.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15909.name: Neo Aetherstone - Body Gear
15909.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15910.name: Neo Aetherstone - Hand Gear
15910.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15911.name: Neo Aetherstone - Leg Gear
15911.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15912.name: Neo Aetherstone - Foot Gear
15912.description: An Allagan device that, when affixed to gear, augments the gear's strength.

15945.name: Pellitory
15945.description: A fine powder ground from dried mountain daisies. The pungent smoke emitted when burned as an incense is believed to repel all manner of vilekin.

15950.name: Chocobo Cottage Walls
15950.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love for chocobos transcends mundane aesthetic sensibilities.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

15951.name: Chocobo House Walls
15951.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love for chocobos transcends mundane aesthetic sensibilities.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

15952.name: Chocobo Mansion Walls
15952.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love for chocobos transcends mundane aesthetic sensibilities.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

15956.name: Compact Level 6 Aetherial Wheel Stand
15956.description:
A small metal stand upon which aetherial wheels are placed and spun to charge. Holds three grade 1, two grade 2, and one grade 3 wheel.
※One stand per estate only.

15957.name: Tiny Bronco Miniature
15957.description: A made-to-scale model of a Bronco-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15958.name: Invincible Miniature
15958.description: A made-to-scale model of an Invincible-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15959.name: Enterprise Miniature
15959.description: A made-to-scale model of an Enterprise-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15960.name: Invincible II Miniature
15960.description: A made-to-scale model of an Invincible II-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15961.name: Odyssey Miniature
15961.description: A made-to-scale model of an Odyssey-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15962.name: Tatanora Miniature
15962.description: A made-to-scale model of a Tatanora-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15963.name: Viltgance Miniature
15963.description: A made-to-scale model of a Viltgance-type airship, expertly crafted by Garlond Ironworks engineers.

15964.name: Sophia Miniature
15964.description:
A statuette depicting the Meracydian goddess, Sophia. (Barbelo statuette suspiciously missing.)

※One per estate only.

15965.name: Alexander Miniature
15965.description:
An expertly crafted replica of the primal Alexander. (Arms, cuffs, and burdens included.)

※One per estate only.

15967.name: Stuffed Calca
15967.description: What every impressionable toddler needs in her toy box. Psychosomatic trauma increased tenfold when paired with a stuffed Brina.

15968.name: Stuffed Brina
15968.description: What every impressionable toddler needs in her toy box. Psychosomatic trauma increased tenfold when paired with a stuffed Calca.

15969.name: Mammet Lantern
15969.description: A stout table lantern designed to resemble an automaton mammet.

15970.name: Mounted Box Shelf
15970.description: Several interconnected boxes hung on walls to store knickknacks, gewgaws, and other assorted miscellany.

15971.name: Knightly Round Table
15971.description: A handcrafted replica of the table at which the Heavens' Ward hold conclave.

15974.name: Mounted Bookshelf
15974.description: A large bookshelf commonly found in private libraries.

15975.name: Great Gubal Floor Lamp
15975.description: A tall, standing lamp of the same design as the light fixtures found in the Great Gubal Library.

15976.name: Combed Wool Rug
15976.description: A plush throw rug so soft, it will have your guests swearing they tread upon the very Sea of Clouds.

15977.name: Spirits Collection
15977.description: Several half-filled bottles of rare potables certain to impress any crapulent callers.

15981.name: Autumnal Maple Tree
15981.description: A young maple tree transplanted at the moment its leaves began turning red, and magicked so that it might remain in this state for all eternity (or until the spell weakens).

15982.name: Autumnal Ginkgo Tree
15982.description: A young ginkgo tree transplanted at the moment its leaves began turning yellow, and magicked so that it might remain in this state for all eternity (or until the spell weakens).

15983.name: Maple Leaf Pile
15983.description: This near-perfect pile of meticulously gathered maple leaves simply begs passersby to throw all self-restraint to the wind and take the plunge.

15984.name: Ginkgo Leaf Pile
15984.description: This near-perfect pile of meticulously gathered ginkgo leaves simply begs passersby to throw all self-restraint to the wind and take the plunge.

16013.name: Crystal Chandelier
16013.description: The aether contained within the crystals used to construct this magnificent lighting fixture emits an ethereal glow which enhances the mood of any hall or parlor.

16014.name: Palace of the Dead Flooring
16014.description: Flooring designed using reports penned by those fortunate enough to return from their expeditionary missions into the Palace of the Dead...with their sanity intact.

16015.name: Palace of the Dead Interior Wall
16015.description: An interior wall designed using reports penned by those fortunate enough to return from their expeditionary missions into the Palace of the Dead...with their sanity intact.

16016.name: Viola Seeds
16016.description:
And there is pansies, that's for thoughts. And there is pansy seeds, that's for growing pansies.

※For use in planters.

16017.name: Red Violas
16017.description:
A bunch of red violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16018.name: Blue Violas
16018.description:
A bunch of blue violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16019.name: Yellow Violas
16019.description:
A bunch of yellow violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16020.name: Green Violas
16020.description:
A bunch of green violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16021.name: Orange Violas
16021.description:
A bunch of orange violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16022.name: Purple Violas
16022.description:
A bunch of purple violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16023.name: White Violas
16023.description:
A bunch of white violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16024.name: Black Violas
16024.description:
A bunch of black violas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16025.name: Rainbow Violas
16025.description:
A bunch of multicolored violas, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

16026.name: Potting Soil
16026.description: Standard-grade earth for growing plants and vegetables. Exhibits absolutely no standout properties.

16065.name: Brooklet Tank Trimmings
16065.description:
An assortment of items used to outfit an aquarium that it might resemble a babbling forest brooklet.

[For use in any tier aquarium.]

16066.name: Southern Sea Tank Trimmings
16066.description:
An assortment of items used to outfit an aquarium that it might resemble the shallows of the tropical southern seas.

[For use in any tier aquarium.]

16557.name: Sophic Barding
16557.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Sophia, the Goddess.

16558.name: Abigail Barding
16558.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to fulfill your lifelong desire to see a chocobo dressed like a scullery maid.

16564.name: Night Pegasus Whistle
16564.description: A small ebon ocarina that, when played, emits a rainbow of sound that summons forth a night pegasus.

16568.name: Dress-up Thancred
16568.description:
Take a walk on Thancred's wild side...but with fewer nutkins.

Use item to acquire the dress-up Thancred minion.

16570.name: Dress-up Alisaie
16570.description:
Now 120% more discernable from the wind-up Alphinaud minion.

Use item to acquire the dress-up Alisaie minion.

16572.name: Shaggy Shoat
16572.description:
This adorable piglet will gore your heart and leave you yearning for more.

Use item to acquire the shaggy shoat minion.

16573.name: Wind-up Edda
16573.description:
Because true love never dies.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Edda minion.

16673.name: Star Velvet Long Gloves of Healing

16679.name: Star Velvet Long Gloves of Casting

16703.name: Modern Aesthetics - Samsonian Locks
16703.description:
The realm's premier publication on beauty and fashion, this specific copy of Modern Aesthetics covers, in detail, methods for styling longer hair.

Use to unlock a new hairstyle at the aesthetician.
Unavailable to Viera and Hrothgar.

16704.name: Materia Melder Permit
16704.description:
This permit allows the hiring of materia melders on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

16705.name: Heavy Metal Ingot
16705.description: An ingot of smelted wolfram alloy.

16706.name: Scintillant Ingot
16706.description: An ingot of smelted luminium ore.

16707.name: Star Velvet
16707.description: Tufted fabric with extremely short pile rendering it smooth to the touch. This rare velvet's thin fibers grant it a unique glossiness from which it earns its name.

16708.name: Hemicyon Leather
16708.description: A large piece of cured hemicyon hide.

16709.name: Heavenly Eggnog
16709.description: A decadently creamy concoction crafted from raw eggs, thick cream, honey, and─if you are feeling adventurous─a healthy splash of a dark spiced rum. A favorite in Ishgard's Vault. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16710.name: Flaugnarde
16710.description: A baked pudding filled to bursting with ripened apples and dusted with fragrant spices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16711.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
16711.description: Tender wheat noodles slathered in a rich sauce made from egg yolks and pungent cheese. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16712.name: Wildwood Scrambled Eggs
16712.description: Fragrant mushrooms sautéed in a generous pat of creamery butter and served upon a bed of fluffy eggs, scrambled to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16713.name: Spaghetti Pescatore
16713.description: Common fare of fisherfolk across Eorzea's southwestern coasts, the sauce used in this pasta dish consists of a wide variety of fresh local seafood─from fish to mollusk. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16714.name: Loaghtan Cordon Bleu
16714.description: Lean loaghtan chops sliced horizontally, stuffed with a thick slice of cheese, breaded, and fried to a golden brown. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16715.name: Priestly Omelette
16715.description: While similar to a regular omelette, this recipe perfected in the Vault's kitchens calls for a fistful of shredded cheese and mushrooms to further enhance the dish's richness. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

16716.name: Supramax-Potion of Strength
16716.description: This unthinkably powerful concoction temporarily increases strength. Duration: 15s

16717.name: Supramax-Potion of Dexterity
16717.description: This unthinkably powerful concoction temporarily increases dexterity. Duration: 15s

16718.name: Supramax-Potion of Vitality
16718.description: This unthinkably powerful concoction temporarily increases vitality. Duration: 15s

16719.name: Supramax-Potion of Intelligence
16719.description: This unthinkably powerful concoction temporarily increases intelligence. Duration: 15s

16720.name: Supramax-Potion of Mind
16720.description: This unthinkably powerful concoction temporarily increases mind. Duration: 15s

16721.name: Star Cotton Boll
16721.description: A rare variety of cotton which produces nitid fibers that, when struck by light, coruscate like the very stars in the heavens.

16722.name: Brown Mushroom
16722.description: An earthen fungus that can commonly be found sprouting beneath trees growing in the Churning Mists.

16723.name: Noble Sage
16723.description: A fragrant herb used in medicines, perfumes, and cooking. Its deep blue flowers set it apart from its cousin, clary sage.

16724.name: Tungstite
16724.description: A bright-yellow mineral formed by the weathering of scheelite.

16725.name: Luminium Ore
16725.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal luminium.

16726.name: Zeolite Ore
16726.description: A porous silicate that adsorbs poisons, making it invaluable in myriad alchemical and medical concoctions.

16727.name: Titanium Carbide
16727.description: Titanium that has been ground to a powder and carbonized via extreme heat.

16728.name: Scintillant Nugget
16728.description: A small nugget of impure luminium.

16729.name: Invisible Silk
16729.description: Silk so thin, it is barely discernable with the naked eye, despite proving as tensile as normal silken thread. Only silkworms bred under strict conditions will produce such fiber.

16730.name: Hemicyon Hide
16730.description: The thick bristly hide of an ancient breed of canine believed unchanged for seven Astral Eras.

16731.name: Goblacquer
16731.description: A protective sealant created by goblins and used to protect wood from rot and water damage, as well as provide it a lustrous sheen.

16732.name: Goblinol
16732.description: A potent solvent created by goblins and known for its biting odor said to resemble unrefined ceruleum.

16733.name: Demicrystal
16733.description: Aetherial residue seeped forth from spiritbound weapons.

16734.name: Sweet Cream Milk
16734.description: Fat-rich milk taken from buffaloes raised in a controlled, stress-free environment.

16735.name: Stone Cheese
16735.description: Gas which forms during the fermentation process creates hollow bubbles throughout this otherwise hard, flavorful cheese.

16742.name: Dimorphodon
16742.description:
This rarely seen winged scalekin is thought to be lord of the skies adjacent the Sohm Al summit.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

16743.name: Basking Shark
16743.description:
The basking shark's characteristic colossal maw makes it the de facto lord of the skies near Mok Oogl Island.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

16744.name: Allagan Bladeshark
16744.description:
Only found near the Flagship in Azys Lla, the bladeshark is an alpha predator with few enemies─a true lord of the skies.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

16745.name: Hailfinder
16745.description:
A king among rime eaters, and lord of the skies near Greytail Falls.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

16746.name: Flarefish
16746.description:
A king among sorcerer fish, and lord of the waters of the unfrozen pond.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

16747.name: Twin-tongued Carp
16747.description:
A king among three-lip carp, and lord of the waters of the Whilom River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

16748.name: Madam Butterfly
16748.description:
A queen among Orn butterflies, and lady of the waters of the Quickspill Delta.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

16749.name: Moggle Mogpom
16749.description:
A king among mogpoms, and lord of the skies near Greensward.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

16750.name: Cirrostratus
16750.description:
A king among fleece stingrays, and lord of the skies off Cloudtop.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

16751.name: Hraesvelgr's Tear
16751.description:
A king among Aithon's colts, and lord of the lava pools of west Mourn.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

16752.name: Aetherochemical Compound #666
16752.description:
A king among aetherochemical compounds, and lord of the aetherochemical spill.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

16753.name: Hundred-eyed Axolotl
16753.description:
A king among tiny axolotls, and lord of the waters near the Pappus Tree.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

16754.name: Bobgoblin Bass
16754.description:
A king among goblin bass, and lord of the waters of the middle Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

16756.name: Merciless
16756.description:
A queen among mercy staves, and lady of the waters of Banepool.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

※Up to two may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

17004.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into paissa paradise.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

17005.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a paissa paradise.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

17006.description:

17013.name: Zurvan Miniature
17013.description:
A statuette depicting the Meracydian god, Zurvan. (Fetters conveniently missing.)

※One per estate only.

17014.name: Diabolos Miniature
17014.description:
A statuette depicting the high voidsent, Diabolos. (Feels too heavy to be hollow.)

※One per estate only.

17015.name: Scathach Miniature
17015.description:
A statuette depicting the high voidsent, Scathach. (Guaranteed to cast a shadow, even in complete darkness.)

※One per estate only.

17019.name: Plundered Treasure
17019.description: Because nothing says “high class” like a hundred gold coin replicas sprawled about your floor.

17021.name: Riviera Breakfast
17021.description: An eggcellent way to start your day. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 28) +4% (Max 27) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

17023.name: Paissa Floor Lamp
17023.description: The complete hide of a skinned paissa, cured and then molded into a quaint lampshade...or at least that is what one might think when first viewing this intricately crafted lamp. (No paissas were harmed in the creation of this furnishing.)

17024.name: Merchant's Shelf
17024.description: When a merchant needs somewhere to stack his wares.

17025.name: Ivy Pillar
17025.description: The vibrant vines curling about this marble-like pillar have been treated with elemental magicks so that they require no water, never brown, and never grow.

17028.name: White Partition
17028.description: A simple white wall to provide the purest form of privacy.

17030.name: Topiary Paissa
17030.description: An evergreen shrub, tightly cropped to resemble an adorable paissa.

17031.name: Moongrass Plot
17031.description:
A sweet-smelling plant with delicate flowers that blossom only when kissed by the light of the moon.

※Up to ten flower plots may be placed in a single garden, regardless of type.

17032.name: Fortemps Manor Interior Wall

17034.name: White Interior Wall

17035.name: Tribunal Flooring

17036.name: Pendant Lamp Planter

17569.name: Peteinosaur Leather
17569.description: A large piece of cured peteinosaur skin.

17570.name: Cloud Mythril Ore
17570.description: Extended exposure to the extreme aetherial currents found on and near the Diadem have somehow altered the mythril contained in this piece of rock.

17571.name: Stormcloud Cotton Boll
17571.description: Extended exposure to the extreme aetherial currents found on and near the Diadem have somehow altered the fibers of this otherwise ordinary cloud cotton.

17572.name: Zurvanite Carapace Fragment
17572.description: A blazing fragment retrieved from the protective armor of Zurvan, the Demon.

17573.name: Void Matter
17573.description: Little is known about this deceptively heavy substance save that its origins lie not in this world.

17574.name: Flannel
17574.description: Sturdy cloth woven with two varieties of thread─wool and cotton.

17577.name: Bishopfish
17577.description:
An archbishop among priestfish, and lord of the waters of Clearpool.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17578.name: Captain Nemo
17578.description:
A king among ammonites, and lord of the waters of Banepool.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

17579.name: Paikiller
17579.description:
A king among catkillers, and lord of the waters of the Eddies.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17580.name: Ceti
17580.description:
A king among oliphant's trunks, and lord of the skies near the Hyperstellar Downconverter.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17581.name: Crystal Pigeon
17581.description:
A king among stupendemys, and lord of the skies near the Habisphere.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17582.name: Thunderscale
17582.description:
A king among amber salamanders, and lord of the waters of the Iron Feast.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17583.name: Riddle
17583.description:
A king among magma lice, and lord of the magma flows in Anyx Old.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17584.name: The Lord of Lords
17584.description:
A king among lavalords, and unquestioned ruler of the magma flows near Halo.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17585.name: The Speaker
17585.description:
A king among armored catfish, and lord of the waters of the upper Thaliak River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17586.name: Thousand Fin
17586.description:
A king among hundred fins, and lord of the pools of Weston Waters.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17587.name: Bloodchaser
17587.description:
A king among storm chasers, and lord of the skies near Tharl Oom Khash.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17588.name: Problematicus
17588.description:
A colossal magma-dwelling fish and legend of the lava pools near Halo.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17589.name: Opabinia
17589.description:
A rarely seen Allagan abomination rumored to dwell in the aetherochemical pools collecting on the Flagship in Azys Lla.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

17590.name: Armor Fish
17590.description:
A massive glowing freshwater fish found living in the Thaliak River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

17591.name: Sea Butterfly
17591.description:
Though oft referred to as king of the skies near Mok Oogl Island, to claim this floating mollusk is elusive would be a gross understatement.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

17592.name: Charibenet
17592.description:
Lord of the waters of Clearpool, Charibenet is (was) one of the largest, most voracious ice faeries to ever be captured.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

17593.name: Raimdellopterus
17593.description:
The moogles of Moghome say that one can live his entire life without ever witnessing a raimdellopterus descend from the upper reaches of Tharl Oom Khash. They also say that some moogles spend a lot of their lives sleeping.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

17594.name: Peteinosaur
17594.description: A winged scalekin recently discovered in the skies near the Diadem.

17689.name: Crownbrush
17689.description: A fragrant herb most commonly found on the floating islands of the Diadem. Uses include the removal of unpleasant odors from boots, the removal of unpleasant odors from gauntlets, and the removal of unpleasant odors from codpieces.

17723.name: Near Eastern Antique Component Materials
17723.description: Various materials necessary to craft Near Eastern antique components.

17724.name: Coerthan Souvenir Component Materials
17724.description: Various materials necessary to craft Coerthan souvenir components.

17725.description: Various materials necessary to craft Maelstrom materiel components.

17729.description: Various materials necessary to craft heartfelt gift components.

17730.description: Various materials necessary to craft orphanage donation components.

17731.name: Hingan Cottage Permit (Mokuzo)
17731.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style cottage in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 200 furnishing items.
※Small plot of land required.

17732.name: Hingan Cottage Permit (Nanpu)
17732.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style cottage in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 200 furnishing items.
※Small plot of land required.

17733.description:

※Can hold up to 200 furnishing items.
※Small plot of land required.

17734.name: Hingan House Permit (Mokuzo)
17734.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style house in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 300 furnishing items.
※Medium plot of land required.

17735.name: Hingan House Permit (Nanpu)
17735.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style house in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 300 furnishing items.
※Medium plot of land required.

17736.name: Hingan House Permit (Kura-zukuri)
17736.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style house in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 300 furnishing items.
※Medium plot of land required.

17737.name: Hingan Mansion Permit (Mokuzo)
17737.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style mansion in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 400 furnishing items.
※Large plot of land required.

17738.name: Hingan Mansion Permit (Nanpu)
17738.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style mansion in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 400 furnishing items.
※Large plot of land required.

17739.name: Hingan Mansion Permit (Kura-zukuri)
17739.description:
Allows the construction of a Hingan-style mansion in Shirogane.

※Can hold up to 400 furnishing items.
※Large plot of land required.

17835.name: Timeworn Gaganaskin Map
17835.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 9 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 70 recommended.

17836.name: Timeworn Gazelleskin Map
17836.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 10 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 70 full party (eight players) recommended.

17837.name: Grade 7 Dark Matter
17837.description:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with precisely crafted items made from high-quality materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-80.]

17847.name: Ambient Waves Orchestrion Roll
17847.description: Music roll of the soothing crash of waves. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

17848.name: Ambient Birdsong Orchestrion Roll
17848.description: Music roll of the soothing twitter of wild birds. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

17849.name: Ambient Rainfall Orchestrion Roll

17850.name: Ambient Cricketsong Orchestrion Roll

17864.name: Faded Copy of Revelation
17864.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music retrieved from the Pool of Tribute.

17865.name: Faded Copy of Beauty's Wicked Wiles
17865.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music retrieved from Emanation.

17953.name: Carbuncle Bed
17953.description: This quaint pallet will never betray you a good night's sleep.

17954.name: Table Orchestrion
17954.description:
All the music from your world, all in the palm of your...table.

※One orchestrion of any type per estate only.

17955.name: Mounted Flower Vase
17955.description:
Is your table cluttered with ashtrays, deathmouse pelts, or forbidden tomes, leaving little to no room to display those beautiful begonias? This wall-adorning vase would like a word with you.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

17956.name: Stuffed Dhalmel
17956.description: One of the tallest beastkin known on Eorzea, the dhalmel is almost as majestic in your living room as it is in the wild. Almost.

17957.name: Stuffed Gagana
17957.description: A majestic gagana, gutted, tanned, and stuffed, so as not to wrinkle the noses of your houseguests.

17958.name: Oriental Pipe Box
17958.description: A pipe box of Far Eastern design, complete with an ashtray and compartments for several varieties of tobacco.

17959.name: Oriental Dressing Case
17959.description: A dressing case of Far Eastern design, featuring a large mirror of polished metal and countless compartments for jewelry and sundry maquillage.

17960.name: Doman Partition
17960.description: A partition of traditional Doman design for use in both homes and places of business.

17961.name: Lakshmi Miniature
17961.description:
A statuette depicting the Lady of Bliss, Lakshmi. (Qalyana chieftainess unsurprisingly missing.)

※One per estate only.

17962.name: Susano Miniature
17962.description:
A statuette depicting the Lord of the Revel, Susano. (Legendary blade Ame-no-Murakumo included. Second “O” missing, and nowhere to be found.)

※One per estate only.

17965.name: Stuffed Edda
17965.description: Go ahead. Try and convince yourself that the reason this stuffed doll weighs considerably more than similar toys is because her heart is full to bursting with love.

17967.name: Oriental Sushi Lunch
17967.description: An exotic Far Eastern dish of sweet, vinegared rice, raw fish, and marine flora prepared to stimulate not only the tongue, but the eyes. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 35) +4% (Max 36) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

17968.name: Oriental Soba Lunch
17968.description: An exotic Far Eastern dish of earthy buckwheat noodles eaten by dipping them into a chilled broth of soy sauce and fish stock. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 35) +4% (Max 36) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

17969.name: Oriental Udon Lunch
17969.description: An exotic Far Eastern dish of thick flour noodles swimming in a hot broth of soy sauce and fish stock. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Spell Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 34) +4% (Max 36) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

17970.name: Oriental Rice Ball Lunch
17970.description: A simple Far Eastern dish consisting of hand-shaped balls of lightly salted rice wrapped in dried seaweed. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Determination Bonus: +4% (Max 35) +4% (Max 36) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

17971.name: Easel
17971.description: A three-legged wooden frame upon which a painting may be placed to cozen your kith and kin into believing you were responsible for the masterpiece.

17972.name: Elixir Bottle
17972.description: An empty glass receptacle that dreams of being full once more.

17973.name: Zabuton Cushion
17973.description: A thin square pillow common in Hingashi where denizens of the Far Eastern nation prefer to sit upon the floor than employ chairs.

17974.name: White Half Partition
17974.description: An unadorned partition, reaching only less than halfway to the ceiling so as to provide privacy without making the room feel smaller.

17977.name: Unmoving Maneki Moogle
17977.description: This charming knickknack is designed after the maneki neko, a Far Eastern cat fetish whose uplifted paw is believed to beckon fortune to its owner's establishment.

17978.name: Matanga Lamp
17978.description: Much like the maneki neko (or moogle, for that matter), the Matanga lamp is also believed to bring fortune to any and all who might place them inside their homes.

17979.name: Stuffed Khloe
17979.description: A tiny rendition of the already tiny Khloe Aliapoh, seeker of a thousand tales.

17981.name: Ixion Trophy
17981.description:
A slightly suggestive objet d'art that will ever remind you of your dominance over the mythic steed.

※One per estate only.

17982.name: Eastern Pine
17982.description: A surprisingly old pine tree, meticulously trimmed for years by trained botanists to remain relatively small, yet maintain the air of a lofty sentinel.

17983.name: Eastern Teahouse Bench
17983.description: A wooden folding bench and accompanying papercraft umbrella similar to those found at Hingan teahouses.

17984.name: Topiary Carbuncle
17984.description: A specially bred shrub pruned to the shape of a curious Carbuncle.

17985.name: Moai Statue
17985.description: A giant stone head carved to resemble drawings found in an unknown sailor's diary that one day washed up on the eastern shores of Othard.

17986.name: Dataqi Standard
17986.description: A brightly dyed banner bearing the ancestral mark of the Dataq tribe.

17987.name: Gyr Abanian Striking Dummy
17987.description:
A striking dummy designed in the Gyr Abanian fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

17988.name: Topmast Interior Wall
17988.description: An interior wall designed to complement Topmast apartments.

17989.name: Lily Hills Interior Wall
17989.description: An interior wall designed to complement Lily Hills apartments.

17990.name: Sultana's Breath Interior Wall
17990.description: An interior wall designed to complement Sultana's Breath apartments.

17991.name: Topmast Flooring
17991.description: Floorboards designed to complement Topmast apartments.

17992.name: Lily Hills Flooring
17992.description: Floorboards designed to complement Lily Hills apartments.

17993.name: Sultana's Breath Flooring
17993.description: Floorboards designed to complement Sultana's Breath apartments.

17994.name: House Fortemps Chandelier
17994.description: A faithful replica of the grand chandelier found in Fortemps Manor.

17995.name: Ruby Sea Tank Trimmings
17995.description:
An assortment of items used to outfit an aquarium that it might resemble the deadly waters of the Ruby Tide.

[For use in any tier aquarium.]

17996.name: Daisy Seeds
17996.description:
Daisy, Daisy. Give me your answer, do. Go half crazy waiting for these godsdamned seeds to bloom.

※For use in planters (built for two).

17997.name: Red Daisies
17997.description:
A bunch of red daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

17998.name: Blue Daisies
17998.description:
A bunch of blue daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

17999.name: Yellow Daisies
17999.description:
A bunch of yellow daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18000.description:
A bunch of green daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18001.name: Orange Daisies
18001.description:
A bunch of orange daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18002.name: Purple Daisies
18002.description:
A bunch of purple daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18003.name: White Daisies
18003.description:
A bunch of white daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18004.name: Black Daisies
18004.description:
A bunch of black daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18005.name: Rainbow Daisies
18005.description:
A bunch of multicolored daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

18032.name: Stygian Ash
18032.description: The charred remnants of a malevolent spirit known to possess the bodies of the dead. Detested by the legendary beast Ixion. Duration: 30s

18050.name: High Steel Scale Mail of Fending

18056.name: High Steel Scale Mail of Maiming

18243.name: Ruby Cotton Fingerless Gloves of Casting

19123.name: Blade of Revelry
19123.description: The blade from a sword used by the Lord of the Revel himself. Despite being long removed from its hilt, the steel still shudders with unseen magicks.

19124.name: Blissful Shroud
19124.description: A long sheet of translucent cloth taken from the robes worn by the Lady of the Bliss. In addition with being unnaturally lightweight, the shroud tingles the skin when touched.

19501.name: Ornate True Griffin Chestpiece of Striking

19502.name: Ornate Indigo Ramie Tabard of Aiming

19503.name: Ornate True Griffin Chestpiece of Scouting

19504.name: Ornate Indigo Ramie Robe of Healing

19505.name: Ornate Indigo Ramie Robe of Casting

19757.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Turban of Crafting

19758.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Doublet of Crafting

19759.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Gloves of Crafting

19760.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Bottoms of Crafting

19761.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Shoes of Crafting

19762.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Turban of Gathering

19763.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Coat of Gathering

19764.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Gloves of Gathering

19765.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Bottoms of Gathering

19766.name: Augmented Ala Mhigan Shoes of Gathering

19767.name: Carbuncle Cottage Walls
19767.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love of their loyal Carbuncle companions transcends a simple pat on the head or scratch under the chin.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

19768.name: Carbuncle House Walls
19768.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love of their loyal Carbuncle companions transcends a simple pat on the head or scratch under the chin.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

19769.name: Carbuncle Mansion Walls
19769.description:
A set of four walls designed for those whose love of their loyal Carbuncle companions transcends a simple pat on the head or scratch under the chin.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

19807.name: Doman Tea
19807.description: An after-supper beverage naturally sweetened with dried persimmons. Widely popular in the Far East. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19808.name: Loquat Juice
19808.description: A thick, orange juice freshly squeezed from ripe loquats. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19809.name: Buckwheat Tea
19809.description: A dark, nutty infusion made from steeping buckwheat kernels in boiling water. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19810.name: Steppe Tea
19810.description: A thick, creamy beverage popular on the Azim Steppe made from steeped fermented tea leaves and a generous helping of dzo milk. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19811.name: Baklava
19811.description: A traditional Near Eastern pastry made of a sweetened paste of chopped nuts and honey sandwiched between layers of thin unleavened dough. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19812.name: Jellied Compote
19812.description: Stewed fruit rendered firm with gelatin, then chilled and cut into bite-sized squares. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19813.name: Persimmon Pudding
19813.description: A rich steamed dessert made with puréed persimmons and eggs. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19814.name: Chirashi-zushi
19814.description: One of many varieties of the Hingan dish sushi, this iteration consists of a full bowl of sweet vinegared rice topped with various items such as thinly sliced omelet, salted fish eggs, dried gourd, stewed mushrooms, and other local fare. Commonly eaten at celebratory events. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19815.name: Persimmon Leaf Sushi
19815.description: One of many varieties of the Hingan dish sushi, this iteration consists of sweet vinegared rice topped with fish, pressed into a narrow rectangle, and finally wrapped in green persimmon leaves. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19816.name: Popoto Soba
19816.description: Buckwheat noodles steeped in savory broth and topped with a starchy paste created by grinding a raw mountain popoto. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19817.name: Shorlog
19817.description: Heavily spiced dzo meat charred to perfection over an open flame. Common fare amongst the nomadic steppe tribes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19818.name: Pork Kakuni
19818.description: Thick slices of succulent Koshu pork slow cooked in a sweet, savory sauce. If prepared properly, the meat literally melts in your mouth. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19819.name: Jerked Jhammel
19819.description: Thin slices of tough jhammel meat salted and dried to preserve for long journeys. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19820.name: Egg Foo Young
19820.description: Succulent crab legs folded into a fluffy omelette and topped with a thick, savory sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19821.name: Onigara-yaki
19821.description: A lobster split in half lengthwise, slathered with a heavily seasoned sauce, and grilled in its shell over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19822.name: Grilled Turban
19822.description: A live horned turban cooked in its shell with a splash of soy sauce and rice wine. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19823.name: Boiled Amberjack Head
19823.description: The head of an amberjack boiled in a soy-based sauce with thick-sliced daikon radish. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19824.name: Steamed Grouper
19824.description: A large Zekki grouper steamed whole, then doused in fragrant boiling oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19825.name: Sweet and Sour Frogs' Legs
19825.description: Chunks of meaty steppe bullfrog legs, breaded and deep-fried, then tossed in a sweet and tangy vinegar-based glaze with fresh colorful vegetables. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19826.name: Tempura Platter
19826.description: A selection of seafood and vegetables dipped in batter and lightly fried in oil. A Hingan delicacy. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19827.name: Stewed River Bream
19827.description: River bream topped in a sauce made by thickening the broth in which the fish was stewed. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19828.name: Charred Charr
19828.description: Heather charr sprinkled with salt and blackened over an open flame. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19829.name: Miso Dengaku
19829.description: Stiff tofu squares and vegetables impaled on a stick and slathered in a sweet miso sauce then roasted over hot coals. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19830.name: Jhammel Moussaka
19830.description: A Near Eastern casserole made from a spiced jhammel and eggplant mincemeat topped with creamy mashed popotoes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19831.name: Gameni
19831.description: A hodgepodge of boldly sliced tubers, mushrooms, and hornbill tenders, stewed slowly in a soy-based broth. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19832.name: Steppe Salad
19832.description: A salad of various seasonal tubers tossed lightly in a rice vinegar dressing. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19833.name: Crab Croquette
19833.description: Rich, buttery crab legs blended with fluffy mashed vegetables, rolled into a ball, covered in bread crumbs, and fried to a crispy, golden brown. Best served slathered in a sweet sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19834.name: Miso Soup with Tofu
19834.description: A Far Eastern staple, often eaten multiple times a day, this soup is made by mixing miso paste with light fish stock. Bite-sized cubes of tofu are added near the end of preparation to ensure the pieces retain their shape. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19835.name: Fish Stew
19835.description: A salty broth containing balls of finely ground fish paste. A common dish in Far Eastern coastal settlements. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19836.name: Pork Stew
19836.description: This Far Eastern take on a campsite mainstay features thinly sliced pork belly and various root vegetables in a piping hot miso-based soup. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19837.name: Warrior's Stew
19837.description: A simple stew commonly made of diced dzo chuck and whatever vegetables are readily available. A popular dish amongst the nomadic tribes of the Azim Steppe. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19838.name: Kasha
19838.description: Buckwheat kernels boiled in bouillon to form a soft, hearty porridge. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19839.name: Nomad Meat Pie
19839.description: Ground dzo chuck and various steppe vegetables wrapped in buttery dough and deep-fried in oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19840.name: Tea Brick
19840.description: The fermenting of tea leaves is common practice in the Far East where tea is consumed multiple times a day. Fermentation is thought to enhance flavor while dulling the leaves' natural bitterness. Fermented leaves are pressed into bricks to save space when shipping.

19842.name: Firm Tofu
19842.description: A traditional source of protein in the Far East, tofu is made from curdled soy bean extract.

19843.name: Rice Vinegar
19843.description: One of Far Eastern cuisine's five main seasonings, rice vinegar is slightly more sweet and mild than Aldenard's vinegars of popoto or apple.

19844.name: Beet Sugar
19844.description: A sweetener made by juicing sugar beets and then boiling the extract down until all the water has evaporated, leaving only a fine, grey powder.

19845.name: Cooking Sake
19845.description: Far Eastern rice wine prepared with other ingredients for use in cooking. Often added to seafood dishes to remove unpleasant aromas.

19846.name: Cottonseed Oil
19846.description: Cooking oil pressed from ruby cotton seeds. Its high flash point and lack of odor make it ideal for deep-frying.

19847.name: Nigari
19847.description: A coagulant naturally found in seawater, commonly used in the Far East to make tofu.

19848.name: Algae Salt
19848.description: A briny salt harvested by sun-drying then burning sea algae.

19849.name: Koshu Sticky Rice
19849.description: Unlike the drier varieties common in Aldenard and Ilsabard, this particular strand of Far Eastern rice becomes extremely sticky when cooked.

19850.name: Buckwheat Kernels
19850.description: A nutty grain that can be substituted for flour in breads and noodles. Found across the Three Great Continents, but grown in abundance in the heart of Gyr Abania.

19851.name: Loquat
19851.description: A sweet yet slightly tangy fruit with a thin skin and a fleshy orange interior. Can be found in the warmer valleys of Gyr Abania. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19852.name: Othardian Plum
19852.description: A greenish pink plum common across the eastern continent of Othard. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19853.name: Kudzu Root
19853.description: The root of the quick-growing kudzu vine is dug up and processed into kudzu powder which serves as a substitute for animal-based gelatins in Far Eastern desserts. It also is believed to exhibit healing properties, and can be found in most Hingan and Doman apothecaries.

19854.name: Doman Eggplant
19854.description: While just as brilliantly purple, this Far Eastern cousin of the wizard eggplant is noticeably thinner, and thus requires less time to cook.

19855.name: Daikon Radish
19855.description: The spicy daikon radishes of Othard are known to grow as long and thick as a grown Hyur's forearm.

19856.name: Sugar Beet
19856.description: These tubers can be several times sweeter than most fruit, and as such are commonly processed into sugar for sweetening cakes and other confections.

19857.name: Jhammel Ginger
19857.description: Jhammel ginger's bulbous, aromatic roots can be sliced fresh and added to stews and seafood dishes to remove gaminess, ground and steeped in hot water to cure head colds, or dried and ground into a powder to use as a spice for breads and cookies.

19858.name: Gyr Abanian Carrot
19858.description: Gyr Abanian carrots are not only longer, but a far deeper orange─nay, crimson─than those grown in central and western Eorzea.

19859.name: Green Leek
19859.description: Similar to green onions in flavor, the leeks of Gyr Abania are several times thicker, and far more piquant.

19860.name: Bamboo Shoot
19860.description: If removed from the ground when less than a fulm in length, bamboo shoots can be peeled and the fleshy interior eaten. A popular ingredient in Far Eastern stews and stir-fries.

19861.name: Mountain Popoto
19861.description: Crisp mountain popotoes contain high quantities of starch that create a viscous paste when the tubers are ground. This paste can be eaten raw, fried into cakes, or added to stews for thickening.

19862.name: Soybeans
19862.description: These emerald legumes grow two to three beans per pod on stout bushes that are ready for harvest in the early fall. The beans are most often pressed into the milk which is used to make tofu, or fermented into various savory pastes and sauces.

19863.name: Shiitake Mushroom
19863.description: These fungi native to the Far East are rarely eaten raw, the majority of those harvested dried, then used to make soup stock.

19864.name: Cumin Seeds
19864.description: A pungent spice that can be used in seed form, or ground into a powder, enhancing the aroma tenfold.

19865.name: Lotus Root
19865.description: Though they appear solid from the outside, the cylindrical root nodules of the lotus flower are riddled with holes, possibly to accommodate for the waterlogged environments in which the plant grows.

19866.name: Sun Cabbage
19866.description: The sweet, tightly packed leaves of Othardian sun cabbages are deceptively sweet, making them perfect in salads or stews.

19867.name: Fennel
19867.description: With an aroma similar to licorice, both the stalks and the seeds of this Othardian herb can be used to enhance the flavor of exotic Far Eastern dishes.

19868.name: Gyr Abanian Wheat
19868.description: A close cousin to highland wheat, Gyr Abanian wheat has been improved by Ala Mhigan farmers over generations to increase both flavor and yield.

19869.name: Persimmon
19869.description: A hard, orange fruit common in eastern Othard. It is well known that seven summers must pass before a newly planted persimmon tree will bear fruit. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19870.name: Persimmon Leaf
19870.description: While not edible, the leaves of the persimmon tree are oft used in the preservation of other food.

19871.name: Gyr Abanian Mineral Water
19871.description: Clear water taken from a mountain spring on the eastern end of Abalathia's Spine.

19872.name: Crescent Spring Water
19872.description: Clear, odorless water taken from one of the many springs found on Othard's Fanged Crescent.

19873.name: Dzo Chuck
19873.description: The unbearably tough shoulder meat of a steppe dzo.

19874.name: Hornbill Tenderloin
19874.description: A lean piece of meat taken from under the short ribs of an Othardian hornbill.

19875.name: Jhammel Haunch
19875.description: Heavy salting and spicing are methods commonly employed to remove the oft overpowering gaminess of this beastkin flesh.

19876.name: Koshu Pork
19876.description: A dark-haired variety of swine bred on Hingashi's Koshu island. Its carefully selected diet is believed to render its meat tender and its fat flavorful.

19877.name: Gagana Egg
19877.description: The massive egg of a gagana.

19878.name: Steppe Milk
19878.description: Compared to that of an aldgoat, marid, or deathmouse, the milk of a steppe dzo is high in fat and flavor. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

19879.name: Ama Nori
19879.description: This edible seaweed can be consumed raw, or dried into paper-like squares and wrapped around sticky rice.

19880.name: Ruby Tide Kelp
19880.description: A distant cousin of malm kelp, Ruby Tide kelp is harvested and dried in the sun to enhance flavor. Squares of the seaweed are cut and steeped in boiling water to create one of the savory broths used in Hingan cuisine.

19881.name: Gem Algae
19881.description: A variety of algae found in the Ruby Sea, commonly harvested for its salt.

19882.name: Competent Craftsman's Tea
19882.description: This infusion brewed from the powdered horn of a powerful beastkin is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

19883.name: Commanding Craftsman's Tea
19883.description: This infusion brewed from the powdered horn of a powerful beastkin is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

19884.name: Cunning Craftsman's Tea
19884.description: This infusion brewed from the powdered horn of a powerful beastkin is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

19885.name: Potent Spiritbond Potion
19885.description: This sweet-smelling concoction enhances the rate at which your equipment gains spiritbond. Duration: 180m

19886.name: Infusion of Strength
19886.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases strength, but for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

19887.name: Infusion of Dexterity
19887.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases dexterity, but for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

19888.name: Infusion of Vitality
19888.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases vitality, but for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

19889.name: Infusion of Intelligence
19889.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases intelligence, but for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

19890.name: Infusion of Mind
19890.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases mind, but for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

19891.name: Grade 1 Reisui of Strength
19891.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19892.name: Grade 1 Reisui of Dexterity
19892.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19893.name: Grade 1 Reisui of Vitality
19893.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19894.name: Grade 1 Reisui of Intelligence
19894.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19895.name: Grade 1 Reisui of Mind
19895.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19896.name: Grade 2 Reisui of Strength
19896.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19897.name: Grade 2 Reisui of Dexterity
19897.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19898.name: Grade 2 Reisui of Vitality
19898.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19899.name: Grade 2 Reisui of Intelligence
19899.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19900.name: Grade 2 Reisui of Mind
19900.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

19901.name: Enchanted Koppranickel Ink
19901.description: Ink fortified with koppranickel sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

19902.name: Enchanted Durium Ink
19902.description: Ink fortified with durium sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

19903.name: Enchanted Palladium Ink
19903.description: Ink fortified with palladium sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

19904.name: Growth Formula Eta
19904.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

19905.name: Growth Formula Theta
19905.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

19906.name: Beetle Glue
19906.description: An adhesive substance created by grinding down the chitinous carapaces of beetles and mixing it with heated pine resin.

19907.name: Ala Mhigan Salt Crystal
19907.description: These pinkish crystals grow naturally on the shores of Loch Seld.

19908.name: Pine Resin
19908.description: A sticky substance secreted by pine trees when their limbs are cut.

19909.name: Persimmon Tannin
19909.description: A translucent liquid extracted from persimmon wood by steeping it in hot water. Used in the tanning of raw animal hides.

19910.name: Gyr Abanian Alumen
19910.description: A brownish variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It is only found in the mountains of Eastern Aldenard.

19911.name: Yanxian Parsley
19911.description: This Far Eastern perennial has a biting aroma that even many Othardians find off-putting.

19912.name: Alyssum
19912.description: This annual is coveted by perfumers for its honey-sweet aroma.

19913.name: Nagxian Cudweed
19913.description: Though recognized as a weed, this winter annual is edible and will oft be harvested in the late months for use in various Doman and Hingan dishes.

19914.name: Chickweed
19914.description: Though recognized as a weed, this winter annual is edible and will oft be harvested in the late months for use in various Doman and Hingan dishes.

19915.name: Nipplewort
19915.description: Named for the protruding buds from which its bright-yellow flowers bloom, nipplewort is a common winter annual whose leaves are gathered for use in Othardian cuisine.

19916.name: Windtea Leaves
19916.description: When steeped in boiling water, the leaves of this rare perennial change color, turning a bright bluish green.

19917.name: Holy Basil
19917.description: A herb with an aroma so heavenly, it will cleanse both your soul and your palate of ill flavors (or so say merchants who would see you buy their stock).

19918.name: Hallowed Basil
19918.description: A herb with an aroma so heavenly, the gods themselves must have blessed it (or so say merchants who would see you buy their stock).

19919.name: Muud Suud Horn
19919.description: The curved horn of a muud suud.

19920.name: Gazelle Horn
19920.description: The twisted horn of a gazelle.

19921.name: Dzo Horn
19921.description: The massive ebon horn of a steppe dzo.

19922.name: Moth Scales
19922.description: The powdery scales of a giant moth's wing.

19923.name: Bombfish Spine
19923.description: A single adult bombfish can have as many as a thousand of these lightweight-yet-sturdy spines jutting from its body.

19924.name: Rhino Beetle Carapace
19924.description: The thick chitinous head of a rhino beetle, complete with eyes, antennae, and mandibles.

19930.name: Beech Log
19930.description: A rough-cut log of beech timber.

19931.name: Larch Log
19931.description: A rough-cut log of larch timber.

19932.name: Persimmon Log
19932.description: A rough-cut log of persimmon timber.

19933.name: Zelkova Log
19933.description: A rough-cut log of zelkova timber.

19934.name: Torreya Log
19934.description: A rough-cut log of torreya timber.

19935.name: Scarlet Urushi
19935.description: This glossy red coating, made from the sap of the lacquer tree, is used to both color and preserve wooden crafts.

19936.name: Beech Branch
19936.description: The thick branch of a beech tree.

19937.name: Torreya Branch
19937.description: The thick branch of a torreya tree.

19938.name: Koppranickel Nugget
19938.description: A small nugget of impure koppranickel.

19939.name: High Steel Nugget
19939.description: A small nugget of impure high steel.

19941.name: High Steel Ingot
19941.description: An ingot of smelted high steel.

19942.name: Durium Nugget
19942.description: A small nugget of impure durium.

19943.name: Oroshigane Ingot
19943.description: An ingot of Doman iron, smelted using Far Eastern techniques.

19945.name: Tama-hagane Ingot
19945.description: An ingot of Doman steel, smelted using Far Eastern techniques.

19946.name: Palladium Nugget
19946.description: A small nugget of impure palladium.

19950.name: Koppranickel Sand
19950.description: Amber-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of koppranickel.

19951.name: Koppranickel Ore
19951.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal koppranickel.

19952.name: Durium Sand
19952.description: Jade-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of durium.

19953.name: Doman Iron Ore
19953.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal Doman iron (also known as mochi iron for its resemblance to the Far Eastern rice cakes).

19954.name: Durium Ore
19954.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal durium.

19955.name: Doman Iron Sand
19955.description: Metallic sand consisting of tiny grains of Doman iron.

19956.name: Palladium Sand
19956.description: Silver-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of palladium.

19957.name: Molybdenum Ore
19957.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal molybdenum.

19958.name: Palladium Ore
19958.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal palladium.

19959.name: Chromite Ore
19959.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal chromium.

19960.name: Domacoat
19960.description: Not to be outdone by their Near Eastern counterparts who perfected the aurum regis-hardening agent, Raziqcoat, several Far Eastern alchemists have joined together to create Domacoat─a substance capable of hardening palladium.

19961.name: Bone Charcoal
19961.description: Not actually created from bones, this hot-burning fuel is the result of baking coal in an airless furnace at an extremely high temperature.

19966.name: Imperial Jade
19966.description: Also known as “true jade,” this milky green stone is coveted by the Far Eastern elite.

19968.name: Raw Triphane
19968.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be triphane.

19969.name: Raw Kyanite
19969.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be kyanite.

19970.name: Raw Star Spinel
19970.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star spinel.

19971.name: Raw Azurite
19971.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be azurite.

19972.name: Raw Imperial Jade
19972.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be imperial jade.

19973.name: Raw Rhodonite
19973.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be rhodonite.

19974.name: Bloodhempen Cloth
19974.description: Several yalms of undyed, bright-red bloodhempen cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

19975.name: Bloodhempen Yarn
19975.description: Coarse yarn spun from bloodhemp fiber.

19976.name: Bloodhemp
19976.description: A common grass found growing throughout Othard. From its stalks, bloodhempen yarn is created.

19977.name: Ruby Cotton Cloth
19977.description: Several yalms of undyed ruby cotton cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

19978.name: Ruby Cotton Yarn
19978.description: Light yarn spun from ruby cotton.

19979.name: Ruby Cotton Boll
19979.description: The fibrous flower of a rare cotton plant that only grows under the Ruby Sea. As such, Eorzean scholars insist that the flora is in no way related to normal cotton, and is instead a unique variety of sea kelp.

19980.name: Kudzu Cloth
19980.description: Several yalms of undyed kudzu cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

19981.name: Kudzu Thread
19981.description: Thick, fibrous yarn spun from kudzu vines.

19982.name: Kudzu Vine
19982.description: If allowed to grow unchecked, a single kudzu plant can cover an acre of forest in less than a single summer, blocking the sun from the plants it envelops. A large swath of the outer Black Shroud currently finds itself being slowly suffocated by the invasive weed.

19983.name: Steppe Serge
19983.description: Several yalms of undyed steppe serge wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

19984.name: Worsted Yarn
19984.description: Soft, water-absorbent yarn spun from multiple varieties of hair sheared from beastkin of the Azim Steppe.

19985.name: Halgai Mane
19985.description: The regal mane of a halgai.

19986.name: Manzasiri Hair
19986.description: The long brown hair of a steppe manzasiri.

19987.name: Twinsilk
19987.description: Though exhibiting a similar luster as normal silk, twinsilk is far more durable and resistant to discoloring.

19988.name: Twinthread
19988.description: A thin lustrous thread woven from countless silken strands pulled from a rare highland twincoon.

19989.name: Twincoon
19989.description: A massive cocoon spun by not one, but multiple highland erucas.

19990.name: Rhea Cloth
19990.description: Cloth woven from the plant rhea. Due to the complexity of the spinning process, there are very few clothcrafters in the world who can produce this weave, making it extremely rare. Most known samples are in the possession of Far Eastern royalty.

19991.name: Rhea
19991.description: A variety of ramie better suited to the climes of Far Eastern Othard.

19992.name: Doman Weave
19992.description: Hempen cloth woven using age-old methods passed down for countless generations by Doman clothiers.

19993.name: Gagana Leather
19993.description: A large piece of cured gagana skin.

19994.name: Gyuki Leather
19994.description: A large piece of cured gyuki hide.

19995.name: Tiger Leather
19995.description: A large piece of cured tiger skin.

19996.name: Marid Leather
19996.description: A large piece of cured marid hide.

19997.name: Gazelle Leather
19997.description: A large piece of cured gazelle hide.

19998.name: True Griffin Leather
19998.description: A large piece of cured true griffin hide.

19999.name: Gagana Skin
19999.description: The rough skin of a majestic gagana.

20000.name: Gyuki Hide
20000.description: The smooth hide of a devilish gyuki.

20001.name: Tiger Skin
20001.description: The striped skin of a ferocious tiger.

20002.name: Marid Hide
20002.description: The thick hide of a mammoth marid.

20003.name: Gazelle Hide
20003.description: The bristly hide of a steppe gazelle.

20004.name: True Griffin Hide
20004.description: The downy hide of a true griffin.

20005.name: Forbidden Wax
20005.description: Forbidden in many markets for the nefarious means with which it is extracted, this wax is cherished by leatherworkers for the luster it brings to tanned hides when applied.

20006.name: Diatomite
20006.description: Geological scholars claim that this sedimentary stone is actually comprised of the shells of thousands upon thousands of tiny sea creatures.

20007.name: Slate
20007.description: Unlike other sedimentary stone, slate has been compressed under the weight of mountains for so long that it is surprisingly hard, making it ideal for whetstones and grinding stones.

20008.name: Slate Whetstone
20008.description: A whetstone carved from slate. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

20009.name: Schorl
20009.description: A blackish mineral possibly containing trace amounts of the precious stone tourmaline.

20010.name: Perlite
20010.description: A strange, pearlescent volcanic rock that expands tenfold upon heating in a kiln or forge.

20011.name: Almandine
20011.description: A garnet-like mineral that, due to its extreme hardness, is used in grinding wheels.

20012.name: Doman Yellow
20012.description: A soft, clay-like soil believed to be formed of compacted yellow dust carried on the wind from faraway lands.

20013.name: Dusklight Aethersand
20013.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible at gloaming.

20014.name: Dawnlight Aethersand
20014.description: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible at dawn.

20015.name: Everbright Aethersand
20015.description: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

20016.name: Everborn Aethersand
20016.description: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

20017.name: Everdeep Aethersand
20017.description: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

20018.name: Liopleurodon
20018.description:
Though king of the five seas and beyond, scholars classify the liopleurodon with scalekin rather than wavekin.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

20019.name: Ala Mhigan Ribbon
20019.description:
A freshwater fish named for its long, ribbon-like fins that it uses to both attract prey and distract predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20020.name: Yanxian Barramundi
20020.description:
This large carnivorous specimen is native to the southeastern reaches of the One River where the waters run slow and deep.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20021.name: Seraphim
20021.description:
The beauty of this small freshwater fish native to Yanxia is oft compared to the angels of ancient eastern scripture.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20022.name: Blackfin Snake Eel
20022.description:
Like most saltwater eels, the blackfin snake eel of the Ruby Sea is a nocturnal hunter.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20023.name: Tail Mountains Minnow
20023.description:
These tiny fish commonly found in the many shallow tributaries feeding into the upper One River rarely grow beyond a few ilms in length.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20024.name: Sweatfish
20024.description:
Despite their small size, sweatfish prefer the swift rapids of the One River's northern tributaries for the cover it provides them from predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20025.name: Rock Saltfish
20025.description:
By no means the most winsome of wavekin, the rock saltfish has adapted to survival in the saline waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20026.name: Comet Minnow
20026.description:
Near the bottom of the food chain, swift-swimming comet minnows serve as food for many of the larger fish that swim the waters of the Hathoeva and Velodyna rivers.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20027.name: Doman Grass Carp
20027.description:
This common variety of freshwater carp is found up and down the One River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20028.name: Samurai Fish
20028.description:
Named after the Hingan warriors whose grace and elegance in battle resemble the means by which this wavekin swims the turbid depths of the One River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20029.name: Golden Cichlid
20029.description:
This bright-yellow fish is native to Gyr Abania and found in both the Hathoeva and Velodyna rivers, sometimes as far west as East End.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20030.name: Hak Bitterling
20030.description:
A small-yet-plump fish most commonly found in Hak Khaal, one of the One River's many narrow steppe tributaries.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20031.name: Yat Goby
20031.description:
The Yat goby is an eel-like bottom dweller named after the Azim Steppe tributary in which it is most commonly found.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20032.name: Ruby Meagre
20032.description:
Similar to a bass in appearance and flavor, the similarities end there, with this variety of meagre preferring the coastal waters of the Ruby Sea and the Glass Ocean to fresher rivers and lakes.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20033.name: Greenstream Loach
20033.description:
This distant relative to the carp can be found hunting the waters of the Hathoeva and Velodyna rivers.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20034.name: Tawny Wench Shark
20034.description:
Some say this Ruby Sea shark earned its name from sailors long out of port who, upon seeing the shark's pale skin cresting above the waves, would reminisce of their favorite pleasure boat courtesan.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20035.name: Whitehorse
20035.description:
This queer horse-like wavekin swims upright, using two tiny fins near its head to slowly swim through the waters of extreme salinity it calls home.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20036.name: Killifish
20036.description:
This freshwater specimen of minuscule proportions can be found in almost any river and lake from central to eastern Othard.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20037.name: Coeurl Snake Eel
20037.description:
Scholars are divided as to whether this wavekin native to the Ruby Sea and Glass Ocean is in fact a snake or an eel.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20038.name: Zekki Grouper
20038.description:
Groupers gather in swift currents of the Ruby Sea and the Rasen Kaikyo to feed on the abundant life drawn to the area.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20039.name: Saltshield Snapper
