20039.description:
This violent scalekin has the jaws of a carpenter's vise. Many a careless fisher has lost a fingertip or three when navigating the snapper-rich waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20040.name: Sculptor
20040.description:
Remarkably similar in appearance to a shark, it is believed this salt lake fish periodically exposes its dorsal fin above the water's surface to frighten land predators such as bears.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20041.name: Pearl-eye
20041.description:
Prehistoric drawings of this salt lake fish have been discovered on cave walls throughout Gyr Abania, suggesting that this particular species has endured at least six umbral eras.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20042.name: Abalathian Bitterling
20042.description:
The Abalathian bitterling's ivory white skin easily distinguishes it from its silver cousins also found in the freshwater rivers and lakes of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20043.name: Steelshark
20043.description:
One of only a few freshwater sharks discovered in Eorzea, the steelshark can primarily be found in the rivers and lakes of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20044.name: Tao Bitterling
20044.description:
Though a cousin to the Hak bitterling, the waters of Tao Khaal have taken the Tao bitterling on a slightly different evolutionary path.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20045.name: Idle Goby
20045.description:
This large goby uses its natural black and brown mottling to conceal itself in the sandy bed of the Slow Wash.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20046.name: River Barramundi
20046.description:
Called “akame” or “red eye” in the Far East for the unique color of this freshwater fish's optical organs.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20047.name: Mirage Chub
20047.description:
This freshwater fish is known to change the color of its skin come spawning season.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20048.name: Harutsuge
20048.description:
This saltwater fish has a distinct crimson coloring that makes it popular amongst aquarium owners.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20049.name: Steelhead Trout
20049.description:
A delicious, fatty freshwater fish native to the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20050.name: Heather Charr
20050.description:
A unique variety of freshwater charr found only in the waters near Heather Falls.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20051.name: Silken Koi
20051.description:
A plump freshwater wavekin with pearlescent scales and a name that sounds better than the fish tastes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20052.name: Yellow Prismfish
20052.description:
The pale yellow glow emitted by this freshwater fish is believed to be caused by unbalanced levels of aspected aether in the wavekin's humours.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20053.name: Blue Prismfish
20053.description:
The pale blue glow emitted by this freshwater fish is believed to be caused by unbalanced levels of aspected aether in the wavekin's humours.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20054.name: Hanatatsu
20054.description:
Similar to the sea horse, the hanatatsu swims “standing,” though instead of resembling a beast of burden, this saltwater fish has taken on the appearance of a sprig of coral.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20055.name: Broken Crab
20055.description:
A wildly misnamed freshwater crab with a highly durable carapace.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20056.name: Gyr Abanian Trout
20056.description:
This succulent pink-fleshed fish commonly found in the Hathoeva and Velodyna rivers will oft command a high price in local markets.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20057.name: Bloodsipper
20057.description:
This freshwater crustacean is widely found in lakes and marshes across the Three Great Continents.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20058.name: Miounnefish
20058.description:
This feisty freshwater fish is found throughout the Black Shroud.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20059.name: Monk Betta
20059.description:
This freshwater betta is native to the lakes and marshes of eastern Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20060.name: Electric Catfish
20060.description:
This massive whiskered wavekin can be found lurking in the calm, turbid lakes and marshes of eastern Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20061.name: Pagan Pirarucu
20061.description:
Though only ever seen by fishers who spend more time telling tales in taverns than actually fishing, the pagan pirarucu can supposedly be found in the highland lakes and swamps of eastern Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20062.name: Temple Carp
20062.description:
A freshwater fish commonly found in the lakes and marshes dotting the eastern end of Abalathia's Spine.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20063.name: Gilfish
20063.description:
The Far Eastern gilfish was first introduced to Eorzea by Othardian merchants hoping their platinum sheen would make them attractive to wealthy nobles. Now the freshwater fish can be found in rivers and lakes across the realm.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20064.name: Balloon Frog
20064.description:
A hardy amphibian found in the relatively warm-watered lakes of eastern Abalathia's Spine. The plump legs make for a fine meal.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20065.name: Lantern Marimo
20065.description:
A rare type of luminescent moss found in the lightless depths of Far Eastern lakes, as well as in caves. Slight currents cause the moss to form into a ball as it grows.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20066.name: Death Loach
20066.description:
This particular variety of loach can be found in the lakes, rivers, and swamps of northern Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20067.name: Grymm Crab
20067.description:
A succulent freshwater crab remarkably found only in the Peaks lake of Grymm.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20068.name: Enid Shrimp
20068.description:
A succulent freshwater shrimp remarkably found only in the Peaks lake of Enid.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20069.name: Invisible Crayfish
20069.description:
The pristine white shell of this freshwater crustacean makes it nigh invisible when the wavekin is hiding amongst rocks or sand of a similar hue.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20070.name: Rapids Jumper
20070.description:
A lifetime of swimming against strong-yet-slow river currents has left this freshwater fish bereft of most fatty flesh.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20071.name: Abalathian Salamander
20071.description:
An amphibian commonly found living in the myriad lakes and swamps of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20072.name: Adamantite Bichir
20072.description:
A freshwater fish native to the wetlands of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20073.name: Meditator
20073.description:
Possessed of the unique ability to survive for extended periods out of water, the meditator will periodically “bathe” on the banks of the rivers and lakes in which it resides.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20074.name: Deemster
20074.description:
A freshwater fish so enormous, even the legends sung of the elusive wavekin do not do it justice.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20075.name: Stonytongue
20075.description:
This distant cousin to the Coerthan bonytongue can be found dwelling in the freshwater lakes and rivers of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20076.name: Bull's Bite
20076.description:
A small carnivorous fish found solely in the isolated Gyr Abanian pond known as the Bull's Bath.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20077.name: Peeping Pisces
20077.description:
This freshwater fish is possessed of an eye on both the top and bottom of its head, allowing it to simultaneously spy threats above and below the water, should the need arise.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20078.name: Scimitarfish
20078.description:
Not a swordfish, but a sword-like fish found in the rivers of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20079.name: Gigant Bass
20079.description:
An aptly named freshwater fish native to the rivers of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20080.name: Nhaama's Boon
20080.description:
One of the rare fish found in the Nhaama Desert's even rarer freshwater oases.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20081.name: Cave Killifish
20081.description:
These small fries found primarily in the caves of Gyr Abania rarely grow to more than one or two ilms.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20082.name: Bone Melter
20082.description:
This lake snail feeds by attaching itself to the bones of drowned animals.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20083.name: Fallen Leaf
20083.description:
The still waters of Dimwold are teeming with these fish who, to the untrained eye, appear naught more than fallen leaves.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20084.name: Falling Star
20084.description:
This glowing orb is actually a colony of rare luminescent algae found in the caves of eastern Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20085.name: Capsized Squeaker
20085.description:
This odd, whiskered fish is found only in the sheltered waters of the Comet's Tail.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20086.name: Nirvana Crab
20086.description:
The backs of these freshwater crabs are adorned with colorful colonies of water-resistant fungus.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20087.name: Velodyna Grass Carp
20087.description:
This variety of grass carp is most often found in the northeastern Eorzean river from which it earns its name.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20088.name: Black Velodyna Carp
20088.description:
One of several varieties of carp found in the Velodyna River, this particular species is immediately recognizable from its pitch-black skin.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20089.name: Rhalgr's Bolt
20089.description:
This eel-like freshwater fish has been blessed with the capacity to emit an electric charge that can prove deadly to smaller wavekin.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20090.name: Highland Perch
20090.description:
Once common throughout the Gyr Abanian highlands, overfishing has relegated the remainder of the species to Mirage Creek.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20091.name: Gravel Gudgeon
20091.description:
This freshwater fish will bury itself deep in the gravel-littered beds of rivers, making it a difficult catch.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20092.name: Grinning Anchovy
20092.description:
These small saltwater fish swim in massive schools, using their sheer numbers to ensure that even if a few stragglers are swallowed, the species will endure.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20093.name: Glass Herring
20093.description:
This common silver fish will travel back and forth between the Ruby Sea and the Glass Ocean searching for food.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20094.name: Hellyfish
20094.description:
The abundance of these translucent amorphs to the volcanic island of Hells' Lid was an invitation to an ill-conceived moniker, most likely given by a rum-soaked pirate.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20095.name: Ruby Coral
20095.description:
A piece of sharp crimson coral, widely found throughout the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20096.name: Sapphire Coral
20096.description:
A piece of sharp azure coral, widely found throughout the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20097.name: Bone Coral
20097.description:
A piece of sharp milky white coral, widely found throughout the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20098.name: Butterfly Fish
20098.description:
One of few brightly colored fish native to the Ruby Tide.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20099.name: Dafu
20099.description:
Its sheer dominance over other life in the Ruby Sea has earned this sizable wavekin the title “dafu,” or literally, the top dog...er, fish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20100.name: Swordfish
20100.description:
Fishers seeking to land ocean-dwelling swordfish must take care not to accidentally impale themselves on the wavekin's serrated blade-like maw.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20101.name: Leaf Tatsunoko
20101.description:
At a glance, one might mistake this queerly shaped denizen of the Ruby Sea for an errant piece of seaweed.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20102.name: Glass Flounder
20102.description:
This flat bottom dweller spends most of its life skittering about the floors of the Glass Ocean, but can also be found in the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20103.name: Zekki Gator
20103.description:
This giant shark regularly hunts the waters of the coast of the Isle of Zekki, and has been known to attack the pirates and fishers who frequent its strands.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20104.name: Daio Squid
20104.description:
A rarely seen giant squid, thought to be the inspiration for 35% of all pirate chanties sung on the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20105.name: Koromo Octopus
20105.description:
A highly elusive giant octopus, so rarely seen that not a single pirate chanty sung on the Red Sea mentions the poor cephalopod.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20106.name: Gliding Fish
20106.description:
A unique saltwater fish that will jump from the water to evade predators, using its pectoral fins to glide across the ocean surface.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20107.name: Globefish
20107.description:
A saltwater fish that will puff its spike-laden body to bursting to protect itself when provoked.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20108.name: Fan Clam
20108.description:
The shell of this bivalve mollusk is ribbed like the “uchiwa” hand fans used by Hingan festival-goers in summer.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20109.name: Blockhead
20109.description:
A saltwater fish as stubborn as its name suggests. It is pure coincidence that it also has a hard bony plate protecting its tiny brain.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20110.name: Glass Tuna
20110.description:
One of the most popular ingredients in Hingan sushi, the giant Glass tuna are thought to follow the strong ocean currents for thousands of malms in their lifetime.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20111.name: Doman Crayfish
20111.description:
These tiny freshwater crustaceans can be found in relative abundance in the flooded rice paddies of Yanxia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20112.name: Ruby Shrimp
20112.description:
One of the most common shrimp found in the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20113.name: Striped Fugu
20113.description:
Similar to the globefish, the fugu will puff up its body to frighten away potential predators. Those who do not heed the wavekin's warning and devour it anyway will most certainly succumb to the lethal poison found in the fugu's flesh.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20114.name: Raitonfish
20114.description:
A large freshwater fish named for the levin-manipulating technique mastered by the ninja of Doma.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20115.name: Blank Oscar
20115.description:
The body of this rare freshwater fish is entirely void of pigment.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20116.name: Dragonfish
20116.description:
Despite the insistence of Yanxian villagers, the freshwater dragonfish is ten parts fish, zero parts dragon.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20117.name: Lordly Salmon
20117.description:
Just as do the salmon of Eorzea, the steely blue salmon of the Far East spend their lives in the sea before returning to the freshwater rivers where they were born to spawn and die.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20118.name: Yanxian Koi
20118.description:
A mottled freshwater carp of middling size native to the southern reaches of the One River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20119.name: Kotsu Zetsu
20119.description:
A large, slow-swimming freshwater fish found primarily in Yanxia's Plum Spring.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20120.name: Longhair Catfish
20120.description:
Though named for its lengthy whiskers, this catfish's most ready feature is not its mustache, but the wavy scale-like patterns on its back.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20121.name: Plum Gazer
20121.description:
Those seeking to land a plum gazer must travel to the secluded Plum Spring, hidden deep in Yanxia's Gensui Chain.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20122.name: Pandamoth
20122.description:
This regal freshwater fish has a distinct white and black mottling which, while giving the wavekin an air of majesty, also makes it easy to spot by predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20123.name: Doman Trout
20123.description:
An extremely common fish found throughout Yanxia, and a popular dish amongst the realm's residents.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20124.name: Doman Eel
20124.description:
A thin freshwater eel that can be found living amongst the reeds growing in the Valley of the Fallen Rainbow.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20125.name: Brassfish
20125.description:
This brightly colored freshwater fish of Far Eastern origin is a favorite amongst aquarium owners.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20126.name: Othardian Trout
20126.description:
A freshwater fish found in rivers across the entire Othardian continent.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20127.name: Zagas Khaal
20127.description:
A freshwater fish extremely common to many of the One River's northern tributaries. Its name literally translates to “river fish.”

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20128.name: Steppe Skipper
20128.description:
A swift freshwater fish that, when swimming near the surface of the One River tributaries in which it is commonly found, appears to skip through the rivers' reeds.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20129.name: Dry Steppe Skipper
20129.description:
A small freshwater fish found in the arid southern grasslands bordering the Nhaama Desert.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20130.name: Sun Bass
20130.description:
This violent fish native to the Azim Steppe prefers the calm waters of a lake or wetland to the swift-moving currents of a river.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20131.name: Skytear
20131.description:
The skytear can be found in the quick-flowing shallow rapids near a river's source rather than in the deeper, slow-moving waters downstream.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20132.name: Dawn Crayfish
20132.description:
A red-shelled freshwater crustacean found in abundance in the lakes and rivers of the Azim Steppe.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20133.name: Dusk Crayfish
20133.description:
A white-shelled freshwater crustacean found in abundance in the lakes and rivers of the Azim Steppe.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20134.name: Bowfish
20134.description:
This swift-moving freshwater fish can be found up and down the One River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20135.name: Jade Sculpin
20135.description:
Highly developed scales and spines set this sculpin apart from its western counterparts.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20136.name: Padjali Loach
20136.description:
A horn-shaped fish native to the dark bogs of Dimwold.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20137.name: Nogoi
20137.description:
A common variety of koi found in almost every region on Othard.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20138.name: Curtain Pleco
20138.description:
This freshwater fish has a billowy, curtain-like dorsal fin that it uses to confuse predators.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20140.name: Hardscale
20140.description:
A freshwater cousin of the lightscale with scales as hard as its name suggests.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20141.name: Eastern Pike
20141.description:
The massive eastern pike is technically classified as a freshwater fish. The breed, however, can survive the brackish waters of the Hathoeva and Velodyna river deltas.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20142.name: Wraithfish
20142.description:
This freshwater fish native to the bogs of Dimwold will oft conceal itself beneath the planks of the Wraithwalk for protection.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20143.name: Little Perykos
20143.description:
As is the case with the little Thalaos, the little Perykos is anything but small. Though normally only found in the Indigo Deep, this lord of the North Isle of Endless Summer can sometimes be found swimming in the five seas and beyond...yet for what reason, no one knows.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20144.name: Wentletrap
20144.description:
A tiny Ruby Sea mollusk with a beautiful spiral shell that is sought by jewelry makers across the Far East.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20145.name: Black Boxfish
20145.description:
This saltwater cousin to the puffers changes color several times during its development, and it is only in the final years of adulthood that it bears the hue from which it earns its moniker.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20146.name: Glass Manta
20146.description:
This denizen of the Glass Ocean is one of the largest fish of its type ever recorded.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20147.name: Regal Silverside
20147.description:
According to Hingan fishers, it was not until the past twenty summers that the regal silverside began appearing in their nets. It is popular opinion that the fish may have been introduced via bilge water dumped by foreign trade bulks.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20148.name: Snowflake Moray
20148.description:
A saltwater fish that exhibits a peculiar symbiotic relationship with spiny lobsters.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20149.name: Hoppfish
20149.description:
While “hopping” out of the water will aid this saltwater species in escaping larger fish, the action attracts flocks of hungry seagulls that will harry the schools for entire turns of the sun.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20150.name: Lightscale
20150.description:
A freshwater cousin of the hardscale with scales as light as its name suggests.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20151.name: Grass Fugu
20151.description:
This highly poisonous saltwater fish can survive for long periods of time in freshwater rivers, and can, on occasion, be found as far as ten malms upstream.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20152.name: Giant Eel
20152.description:
An eel's size is proportional to the amount it eats. The giant freshwater eels of the One River eat...a lot.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20153.name: Kamina Crab
20153.description:
While abundant in the sea, hermit crabs are quite rare in fresh water, possibly due to the lack of available homes. The kamina crab is one example.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20154.name: Spider Crab
20154.description:
The spider crab's spindly legs carry the deep-sea crustacean hundreds of malms across their migratory routes.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20155.name: Little Dragonfish
20155.description:
The elongated forehead of this saltwater species is compared to the nose of a tengu─a legendary birdlike creature of Far Eastern legend.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20156.name: Black Fanfish
20156.description:
This saltwater wavekin uses both the size and color of its fins to its advantage, allowing it to, for all intents and purposes, disappear in the darker depths of the sea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20157.name: Zebra Shark
20157.description:
Unlike those of the mystical zebra, the pronounced “stripes” upon this wavekin's back are more accurately compared to a tiger's spots.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20158.name: Nophica's Comb
20158.description:
The sharp, bone-like protrusions on this carnivorous mollusk's massive shell give it the comb-like appearance from which it earns its name.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20159.name: Warty Wartfish
20159.description:
This sluggardly wartfish native to the One River somehow has more warts than a common wartfish, if that can be believed.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20160.name: Common Whelk
20160.description:
It would not be called a common whelk if this whelk was not found as abundantly as it is across the whole of Othard.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20161.name: Hairless Barb
20161.description:
This impossibly monstrous freshwater fish grew impossibly monstrous despite a diet of mostly river grasses.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20162.name: Hatchetfish
20162.description:
The Ruby Sea hatchetfish earns its name from its overgrown head which, if you squint hard enough, might appear similar to the head of a timberlord's hatchet.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20163.name: Threadfish
20163.description:
This spindly saltwater fish spurns the colder currents of the north in favor of the warm waters along Othard and Ilsabard's southern coasts.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20164.name: Garden Eel
20164.description:
Garden eels spend most of their lives buried in sandy sea bottoms, emerging only to hunt and to mate.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20165.name: Eastern Sea Pickle
20165.description:
Named for its shape and not its flavor, this repugnant sluglike mass is found throughout the Glass Ocean and Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20166.name: Brindlebass
20166.description:
This enormous saltwater bass can be highly territorial, devouring anything and everything that passes through its chosen demesne.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20167.name: Demon Stonefish
20167.description:
A saltwater wavekin commonly avoided by fishers due to the extreme amount of toxins found in its flesh.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20168.name: Armored Crayfish
20168.description:
A deep-red relative of the Doman crayfish.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20169.name: Bighead Carp
20169.description:
A dark-scaled carp found in the One River, easily identified by its queer downward-pointing eyes.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20170.name: Zeni Clam
20170.description:
Named after an ancient Far Eastern currency, this bivalve mollusk is most commonly found in the lakes and rivers of Yanxia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20171.name: Corpse-eater
20171.description:
A large carnivorous wavekin that dwells in the warm currents of the southern seas.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20172.name: Ronin Trevally
20172.description:
This large variety of trevally is given the name ronin for its tendency to journey the warm southern seas in solitude.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20173.name: Toothsome Grouper
20173.description:
The most delicious of saltwater groupers...if the merchants selling it for thrice the price of a regular grouper are to be believed.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20174.name: Horned Turban
20174.description:
The shell of this warm-water sea mollusk is twisted like the turbans worn by the dhalmel drivers of Thavnair.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20175.name: Ruby Sea Star
20175.description:
These spiny five-limbed invertebrates survive by feeding on the flesh of dead fish fallen to the sea floor.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20176.name: Gauntlet Crab
20176.description:
These giant crabs hide themselves amongst the plants that grow on a river's bed, the moss growing on their claws used as camouflage.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20177.name: Hermit Goby
20177.description:
A decent-sized fish found in the One River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20178.name: Skythorn
20178.description:
An ancient breed of freshwater fish found with little frequency in the One River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20179.name: Swordtip
20179.description:
One of the most widespread squid species on Hydaelyn.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20180.name: False Scad
20180.description:
A common saltwater fish doing its best scad impression.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20181.name: Snow Crab
20181.description:
Snow crabs live in deep waters, scurrying hither and thither across the ocean floor in search of carrion.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20182.name: Red-eyed Lates
20182.description:
A saltwater fish found in both the Glass Ocean and the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20183.name: Common Bitterling
20183.description:
This freshwater fish is found on both the Othardian east coast and in Shishu─the Hingan island upon which sits Kugane.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20184.name: Fifty-summer Cod
20184.description:
This long-living freshwater cod is commonly found in the One River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20185.name: Nagxian Mullet
20185.description:
A thin, eel-like fish native to Nagxia, but found throughout the One River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20186.name: Redcoat
20186.description:
A large, reddish orange fish with distinctively enormous eyes to help it see in the murky depths of the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20187.name: Yanxian Tiger Prawn
20187.description:
This Far Eastern crustacean has not only the stripes, but also the ferocity of a Yanxian tiger.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20188.name: Tengu Fan
20188.description:
The tengu fan, named for its round, flat shape, will emit electric shocks from its body when threatened. Though the shocks cannot kill, they do stun, affording the fish ample opportunity to flee.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20189.name: Star Turban
20189.description:
When viewed from the side, this sea mollusk's shell looks like a turban; however, when viewed from above, its radiating spines give it the appearance of a twinkling star.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20190.name: Blue-fish
20190.description:
A delicious freshwater fish with the most jejune moniker of all the One River's aquatic denizens.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20191.name: Steppe Bullfrog
20191.description:
Steppe bullfrogs can be found across both Yanxia and Nagxia and are easily identifiable by their deep, bellowing mating croaks.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20192.name: Cavalry Catfish
20192.description:
This large, aggressive freshwater fish will “charge” most anything moving, regardless of its size.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20193.name: Redfin
20193.description:
Second only to the blue-fish in mediocrity of monikers, the freshwater redfin of the One River─unsurprisingly─has bright-red fins.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20194.name: Moondisc
20194.description:
A cousin of the sundisc, the moondisc also features celestial patterns upon its body, though its are decidedly brighter to serve as camouflage in the white-bedded waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20195.name: Bleached Bonytongue
20195.description:
Similar to most wavekin that have taken up residence in Loch Seld, the bleached bonytongue is almost entirely white.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20196.name: Salt Shark
20196.description:
The salt shark has an elongated body that it can bend like an eel, allowing it to navigate Loch Seld's obstacle-strewn lakebed in search for prey.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20197.name: King's Mantle
20197.description:
Very few species of octopus have been discovered in Loch Seld, but those that have─such as the king's mantle─are magnificently monstrous.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20198.name: Sea Lamp
20198.description:
This variety of sea anemone emits a soft green glow when its tentacles are disturbed.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20199.name: Amberjack
20199.description:
This large saltwater predator can be found in the waters off both the eastern and western coasts of Hingashi.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20200.name: Cherry Salmon
20200.description:
Though dubbed a salmon, this particular variety does not journey downstream to the sea, spending its entire life in the river where it was born.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20201.name: Yu-no-hana Crab
20201.description:
Hingan folklore has that all hot springs were once dug from the ground by these hardy crustaceans.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20202.name: Dotharli Gudgeon
20202.description:
This freshwater fish commonly found in the upper One River is also known as the Mol gudgeon, the Kahkoli gudgeon, the Dataqi gudgeon, the Horo gudgeon, and after whichever other Xaela tribe that insists their ancestors first caught the species.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20203.name: River Clam
20203.description:
A small bivalve mollusk found living in the sands of the One River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20204.name: Grass Shark
20204.description:
Grass sharks are massive, their size rivaling that of even the Glass Ocean's greatest predators─an amazing feat considering grass sharks live their entire lives in the confines of the One River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20205.name: Typhoon Shrimp
20205.description:
The typhoon shrimp is one of only a few shrimp species that can survive the toxically salty waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20206.name: Rock Oyster
20206.description:
This bivalve mollusk grows in abundance on boulders and statues submerged in Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20207.name: Salt Urchin
20207.description:
The white coloring of the salt urchin's spines make them difficult to see on Loch Seld's colorless lakebed. Those who choose to wade through the shallows should always take care to protect their feet.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20208.name: Carpenter Crab
20208.description:
A carpenter crab's claws are powerful enough to cut through solid wood. Whether or not a carpenter crab has ever constructed something from that wood remains unconfirmed.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20209.name: Spiny Lobster
20209.description:
This massive crustacean found in both the Ruby Sea and the Glass Ocean is considered a delicacy in the Far East, and is a luxury oft too extravagant for any but the richest of nobles to partake in.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20210.name: Mitsukuri Shark
20210.description:
There is no doubt that the mitsukuri shark's most defining feature is its katana-like mouth and the tales it has spawned of poor fishers being impaled.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20211.name: Doman Bubble Eye
20211.description:
A variety of bubble eye goldfish selectively bred by Doman royalty for innumerable generations.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20212.name: Dragon Squeaker
20212.description:
There are many theories as to why this remarkable breed of One River squeaker swims tail first, yet most have been dismissed as feeble attempts to explain what simply cannot be explained, such as why the sky is blue or why tides come in and the tides go out.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20213.name: Dawn Herald
20213.description:
Though smaller than the dusk herald, the dawn herald is as commonly found in the waters of the One River as its close cousin.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20214.name: Salt Cellar
20214.description:
An ashen-shelled snail found throughout Loch Seld. Cooking the gastropods in their shells with garlic and herbs is the preferred method of consumption.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20215.name: White Sturgeon
20215.description:
The white sturgeon is believed by some scholars to simply be normal sturgeons exhibiting albinism─a rare trait that became common once all the darker sturgeons were poached from Loch Seld on account of them being easy to see.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20216.name: Tithe Collector
20216.description:
One of Loch Seld's largest native species.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20217.name: Bashful Batfish
20217.description:
The unique shape and coloration of the batfish makes this denizen of the Ruby Sea a highly sought-after specimen amongst collectors.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20218.name: River Bream
20218.description:
Unlike sea breams, this quirky cousin will travel back and forth 'twixt the brackish waters of a river's delta and the fresher waters upstream.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20219.name: Snipe Eel
20219.description:
The snipe eels of the One River will never grow plumper than an ilm or two in diameter, but can stretch to several yalms in length.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20220.name: Cherubfish
20220.description:
A rare freshwater fish native to Yanxia and the Azim Steppe.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20221.name: Dusk Herald
20221.description:
The dusk herald is a fair-sized fish commonly found in the One River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20222.name: Glaring Perch
20222.description:
This freshwater perch is found up and down the One River.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20223.name: Abalathian Pipira
20223.description:
While given the modifier Abalathian, this particular pipira will not be found in the Spine's western or even central regions, preferring the biting salty waters of the Lochs.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20224.name: Steel Loach
20224.description:
The steel loach's scintillant silver body reflects sunlight in a manner that makes the fish difficult to spot in its native Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20225.name: Ivory Sole
20225.description:
The whitish grey skin of this large flatfish allows it to hide itself on the bottom of Loch Seld with such efficiency that for years Ala Mhigans thought the species extinct.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20226.name: Motley Beakfish
20226.description:
A striped carnivore that hunts the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20227.name: Thousandfang
20227.description:
A rare, sea-dwelling scalekin infamous for its gaping maw lined with multiple rows of blade-like teeth, though official observations by scholars put the fang count at no more than a few score.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20228.name: Ichthyosaur
20228.description:
Let not its dolphin-like appearance fool you. The ichthyosaur is a ravenous scalekin that feeds on squid, fish, and the occasional man overboard.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20229.name: Sailfin
20229.description:
A unique freshwater fish featuring astonishingly overgrown dorsal and anal fins.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20230.name: Fangshi
20230.description:
An extremely rare freshwater fish whose face is covered in countless whisker-like protrusions.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20231.name: Flamefish
20231.description:
This large freshwater fish's skin features brilliant streaks of fiery yellow and orange.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20232.name: Fickle Krait
20232.description:
Special glands within the fickle krait's body create a deadly poison feared by fishers and coveted by assassins.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20233.name: Eternal Eye
20233.description:
This tiny species' skin exhibits a violet hue rarely seen in freshwater fish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20234.name: Soul of the Stallion
20234.description:
A rare white freshwater fish believed to harbor the soul of a once-proud steppe stallion.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20235.name: Flood Tuna
20235.description:
The descendants of sea tuna believed by scholars to have arrived in Loch Seld during the great flood that ended the Fifth Astral Era.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20236.name: Mercenary Crab
20236.description:
This heavily armored crab is one of few species adapted to the hypersalinated waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

20237.name: Ashfish
20237.description:
A pigmentless fish found solely in Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20238.name: Silken Sunfish
20238.description:
A rare breed of sunfish that can survive only in waters exhibiting extreme salinity.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20239.name: Mosasaur
20239.description:
An aggressive scalekin native to the saline waters of Loch Seld.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

20270.name: Nagxian Silk
20270.description: A light, billowy silk woven using traditional methods of the Nagxian people.

20271.name: Ratanhia Leaves
20271.description: Leaves of a low-growing shrub native to the plains of Nagxia. The leaves contain high concentrations of tannin, an ingredient necessary in tanning leather.

20272.name: Taoist's Wool
20272.description: Despite supposedly being woven countless generations past, this cloth appears as it was crafted yesterday.

20273.name: Nagxian Leather
20273.description: A beastkin hide tanned using traditional Nagxian methods.

20310.name: Imitation Square Window
20310.description: The next best thing to a real window, without all the fuss.

20311.name: Castellum Velodyna Painting
20311.description: A painting of Castellum Velodyna based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20312.name: Gyr Kehim Painting
20312.description: A painting of Gyr Kehim based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20313.name: Schism Painting
20313.description: A painting of Schism based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20314.name: Castrum Oriens Painting
20314.description: A painting of Castrum Oriens based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20315.name: Dimwold Painting
20315.description: A painting of Dimwold based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20316.name: Djanan Qhat Painting
20316.description: A painting of Djanan Qhat based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20317.name: Peering Stones Painting
20317.description: A painting of the Peering Stones based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20318.name: Hidden Tear Painting
20318.description: A painting of Hidden Tear based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20319.name: Coldhearth Painting
20319.description: A painting of Coldhearth based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20320.name: Nyunkrepf's Hope Painting
20320.description: A painting of Nyunkrepf's Hope based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20321.name: Ala Gannha Painting
20321.description: A painting of Ala Gannha based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20322.name: Specula Imperatoris Painting
20322.description: A painting of Specula Imperatoris based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20323.name: Arms of Meed Painting
20323.description: A painting of the Arms of Meed based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20324.name: Ziggurat Painting
20324.description: A painting of the Ziggurat based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20325.name: Emprise Painting
20325.description: A painting of Emprise based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

20524.name: Castaway Chocobo Chick
20524.description:
Currently without a name. “Wilson” recommended.

Use item to acquire the castaway chocobo chick minion.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20525.name: Odder Otter
20525.description:
Is there anything odder than an otter who lives out of water?

Use item to acquire the odder otter minion.

20528.name: Tiny Tatsunoko
20528.description:
If the Hingan word for sea horse is tatsunoko, would that make this a sea pony? Your little sea pony?

Use item to acquire the tiny tatsunoko minion.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

20529.name: Bombfish
20529.description:
He will give you an offer that can't be defused.

Use item to acquire the bombfish minion.

20530.name: Bom Boko
20530.description:
An adorable raccoon dog pup with a big heart and even bigger testicles.

Use item to acquire the Bom Boko minion.

20531.name: Road Sparrow
20531.description:
This house sparrow's home is on the road. Sparrow.

Use item to acquire the road sparrow minion.

20533.name: Dress-up Yugiri
20533.description:
One Yugiri is never enough.

Use item to acquire the dress-up Yugiri minion.

20536.name: Mock-up Grynewaht
20536.description:
Bwahahahaha!

Use item to acquire the mock-up Grynewaht minion.

20537.name: Wind-up Namazu
20537.description:
Half cat. Half fish. All fish.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Namazu minion.

20538.name: Ivon Coeurlfist Doll
20538.description:
Technically “Coeurlpaw.” 

Use item to acquire the Ivon Coeurlfist minion.

20539.name: Wind-up Chimera
20539.description:
Crafted by piecing together the remnants of unsold automata.

Use item to acquire the wind-up chimera minion.

20541.name: Magitek Avenger F1
20541.description:
Avenger, assembled!

Use item to acquire the magitek avenger F1 minion.

20542.name: Ghido
20542.description:
There is most likely a logical explanation as to why this aged turtle can navigate the skies. Most likely.

Use item to acquire the Ghido minion.

20544.name: Wind-up Khloe
20544.description:
Because there is nothing wrong with a fully automated mechanical reconstruction of a young girl of three and ten summers.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Khloe minion.

20545.name: Wind-up Susano
20545.description:
If the Kojin believe that within every item resides a deity, then who exactly resides inside this automaton?

Use item to acquire the wind-up Susano minion.

20546.name: Wind-up Lakshmi
20546.description:
Your, your, your serpentine.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Lakshmi minion.

20547.name: Wind-up Bismarck
20547.description:
The hairiest whale you will see this fortnight.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Bismarck minion.

20558.name: Reveler's Barding
20558.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Susano, the Lord of the Revel.

20560.name: Blissful Barding
20560.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Lakshmi, Lady of Bliss.

20613.name: Salmon Roe
20613.description: The ruby red eggs of salmon returning upriver to spawn. Bait for freshwater fishing.

20614.name: Nightcrawler
20614.description: These fat earthworms that feed above ground in the small hours of the night have been known to grow up to two full fulms in length. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

20615.name: Midge Larva
20615.description: The bright-red coloring of this undeveloped midge makes it an easy target for sharp-eyed fish. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

20616.name: Silkworm
20616.description: The plump, cream-colored larva of a silkworm moth. Live bait for salt lake fishing.

20617.name: Live Shrimp
20617.description: A tiny, twitching sea shrimp. Live bait for ocean fishing.

20618.name: Bream Lure
20618.description: A lure for bream made by attaching rubber fins to a heavy lead ball.

20619.name: Suspending Minnow
20619.description: A plug lure made to resemble a minnow. Effective in attracting freshwater fish from both surface and floor.

20675.name: Stonefly Larva
20675.description: Stonefly larvae─while extremely effective at catching certain varieties of fish─are difficult to find and near impossible to farm. As such, they command exorbitant prices at market. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

20676.name: Blue Bobbit
20676.description: A large predatory sea worm. Live bait for ocean fishing.

20723.name: Small Shirogane Castle Walls
20723.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a traditional Hingan castle.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

20724.name: Medium Shirogane Castle Walls
20724.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a traditional Hingan castle.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

20725.name: Large Shirogane Castle Walls
20725.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a traditional Hingan castle.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

20726.name: Hingan Desk
20726.description: Known in the Far East as a “fuzue,” this low desk is meant to be used while sitting on the ground.

20727.name: Hingan Sitting Table
20727.description: Known in the Far East as a “zataku,” this low table is meant to be used while sitting on the ground.

20728.name: Hingan Bench
20728.description: A simple wooden bench designed in the Hingan fashion.

20729.name: Hingan Chair
20729.description: A plush chair designed in the Hingan fashion.

20730.name: Hingan Sofa
20730.description: A plush sofa designed in the Hingan fashion.

20731.name: Hingan Bed
20731.description: A sturdy bed made from pine and designed in the Hingan fashion.

20732.name: Hingan Sideboard
20732.description: A low, multi-drawered chest designed in the Hingan fashion.

20733.name: Hingan Wardrobe
20733.description: A wooden wardrobe designed in the Hingan fashion.

20734.name: Hingan Bookshelf
20734.description: An exquisitely crafted bookshelf designed in the Hingan fashion.

20735.name: Hingan Cupboard
20735.description: A wooden cupboard designed in the Hingan fashion.

20736.name: Hingan Open-shelf Bookcase
20736.description: A backless bookshelf designed in the Hingan fashion.

20737.name: Hingan Oven
20737.description: An earthen oven designed in the Hingan fashion.

20738.name: Hingan Fire Pit
20738.description: An indoor-use square fire pit complete with teapot and hanger.

20739.name: Paper Partition
20739.description: A partition made of thin white paper glued to a simple wooden lattice frame. Provides only a fleeting promise of privacy.

20740.name: Bamboo Planter
20740.description: A short, square planter made for growing bamboo.

20741.name: Hingan Andon Lamp
20741.description: A small cubic lamp commonly placed on desks and tables.

20742.name: Hingan Chochin Lantern
20742.description: A round paper lantern with a handle attached for easy transportation.

20743.name: Hingan Wall Scroll
20743.description: This ornate scroll features a famous poem written in ancient Hingan.

20744.name: Decorative Wall Fan
20744.description: A colorful Hingan folding fan meant for display on one's wall.

20745.name: Kimono Hanger
20745.description: A wooden rack for displaying kimono.

20746.name: Crimson Coral Object
20746.description: A chunk of rare crimson coral mounted for display on your desk, sideboard, mantle, or commode.

20747.name: Kotetsu Replica
20747.description: An adequately crafted imitation of a legendary Hingan katana.

20748.name: Hingan Armor Display
20748.description: A full set of ancient Hingan armor.

20749.name: Hingan Brushes
20749.description: A pair of calligraphy brushes of varying thickness.

20750.name: Hingan Scroll
20750.description: There is nothing like a scroll to impress your friends and intimidate your enemies.

20751.name: Porcelain Vase
20751.description: An extremely fragile vase of Hingan design.

20752.name: Fool's Portal
20752.description: A highly detailed painting made to look like an actual round window.

20753.name: Imitation Stained Crystal Ornament
20753.description: A colorful wall ornament made from glass instead of crystals.

20754.name: Shinryu's Wing
20754.description:
A replica of the legendary worm's wing made from scales of the creature itself. Will look amazing on any wall, providing there is sufficient space for this massive tribute.

※One per estate only.

20756.name: Eggplant Knight Flower Vase
20756.description:
A playful vase resembling the Mandragoras's knight.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

20757.name: Garlic Jester Flower Vase
20757.description:
A playful vase resembling the Mandragoras's jester.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

20758.name: Mandragora Queen Flower Vase
20758.description:
A playful vase resembling the Mandragoras's queen.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

20759.name: Onion Prince Flower Vase
20759.description:
A playful vase resembling the Mandragoras's prince.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

20760.name: Tomato King Flower Vase
20760.description:
A playful vase resembling the Mandragoras's king.

Select flowers can be displayed within.

20772.name: Far Eastern Willow
20772.description: A cutting from a Far Eastern willow. For display in gardens.

20773.name: Toro Lantern
20773.description: Wood lanterns such as the toro are commonplace in gardens across the island nation of Hingashi.

20774.name: Sunken Treasure Tank Trimmings
20774.description:
An assortment of items used to outfit an aquarium that it might resemble a hoard of sunken pirate treasure.

[For use in any tier aquarium.]

20791.name: Cloudsbreath
20791.description: Lack of imagination has led to most white flowers found growing in the skybound regions of Dravania and Abalathia to be named after clouds, this specimen featuring winglike leaves being no exception.

20792.name: Cloudsbreath Seeds
20792.description: Cloudsbreath seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

20793.name: Royal Fern
20793.description: The broad fronds of this brilliant green variety of fern are believed to be imbued with heavenly magicks.

20794.name: Royal Fern Sori
20794.description: Royal fern spores suitable for garden cultivation.

20795.name: Brightlily Seeds
20795.description:
When planted in nutrient-rich soil, these large black seeds will grow into vibrant lily plants more than several fulms high.

※For use in planters.

20796.name: Red Brightlilies
20796.description:
A bunch of red brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

20797.name: Blue Brightlilies
20797.description:
A bunch of blue brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

20798.description:
A bunch of yellow brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

A bunch of green brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

20800.description:
A bunch of orange brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

A bunch of multicolored brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

21042.name: Shinryu Barding
21042.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble Shinryu, fearsome dragon of legend.

21052.name: Flying Chair
21052.description: Quite unmistakably a chair that flies. Guaranteed to support the weight of even the most muscular of Roegadyn.

21055.name: Wind-up Hien
21055.description:
Be proud, my new owner. Be proud.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Hien minion.

21057.name: Wind-up Ravana
21057.description:
Low on low he stands, gazing up to see.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Ravana minion.

21058.name: Mameshiba
21058.description:
Who let the newborn miniature Far Eastern canine specimen out? Who, who, who, who, who!?

Use item to acquire the mameshiba minion.

21059.name: Tengu Doll
21059.description:
And you know what they say about the size of a doll's nose.

Use item to acquire the tengu doll minion.

21060.name: Wind-up Matanga
21060.description:
This is not Matanga. Matanga is graceful.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Matanga minion.

21063.name: Axolotl Eft
21063.description:
Because there truly is nothing more adorable than an oddly Lalafellin face on the body of a moist, frilled salamander.

Use item to acquire the axolotl eft minion.

21064.name: Koala Joey
21064.description:
Shows no signs of stress or crotch rot, so hug away.

Use item to acquire the koala joey minion.

21065.name: Wind-up Shinryu
21065.description:
Exhibits an almost preternatural urge to hide in treasure chests and guard powerful weapons.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Shinryu minion.

21082.name: Gyr Abanian Alchemic
21082.description: An alchemical potation born in the Near East, and perfected in Gyr Abania.

21083.name: Ala Mhigan Burdet
21083.description: A composite fabric made using Gyr Abanian materials and Garlean know-how.

21084.name: Snailfish Oil
21084.description: Thick, pungent oil cold-pressed from the writhing corpse of a deep-water snailfish.

21085.name: Gyr Abanian Spring Water
21085.description: Cold, clear mountain water harvested from hidden springs located in the highlands of Gyr Abania.

21086.name: Azim Cotton Boll
21086.description: The white of Azim cotton is so bright that some compare it to staring at the sun itself.

21087.name: Sermon-worthy Meuniere
21087.description: A thick fillet of salmon breaded with flour and fried in rich butter. So succulent, it is said a certain Othardian church has deemed it holy. Which church, no one seems to recall. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

21088.name: Chawan-mushi
21088.description: Whisked egg mixed with fish broth, meats, and seasonal vegetables, then steamed until hardened into a savory pudding. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

21089.name: Secret Recipe Broth
21089.description: A clear, briny broth made by boiling down fish. There really is no secret.

21090.name: Shinryu's Scale
21090.description: Large, chitinous scale that once protected the legendary dragon, Shinryu (albeit not very well).

21174.name: Cardinalfish
21174.description:
A freshwater fish easily recognizable for its vivid black and white stripes.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

21175.name: Rockfish
21175.description:
Despite the insistence of fishers raised on colorful local folklore, the massive knob atop this freshwater fish's head does not contain hidden treasure.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

21176.name: Ukiki
21176.description:
Its Hingan name roughly translating to “floating tree,” this variety of Eastern sunfish neither floats nor is a tree.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

21177.name: Violet Prismfish
21177.description:
The pale violet glow emitted by this freshwater fish is believed to be caused by unbalanced levels of aspected aether in the wavekin's humours.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

21178.name: Guppy
21178.description:
This tiny fish once found throughout the Three Great Continents has been harvested to near extinction, and is now prized by pisciculturists.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

21179.name: Ichimonji
21179.description:
Named after a blade appearing in Hingan legend, the ichimonji has a long, protruding mouth lined with countless razor-like teeth.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

21180.name: Snailfish
21180.description:
This unique saltwater fish has not a scale on its entire body.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

21193.name: Salt & Pepper Seal
21193.description:
What a seal, what a mighty good seal.

Use item to acquire the salt & pepper seal minion.

21199.name: Material Supplier Permit A-3
21199.description:
This permit allows the hiring of material suppliers on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21200.name: Junkmonger Permit A-3
21200.description:
This permit allows the hiring of junkmongers on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21201.name: Mender Permit A-3
21201.description:
This permit allows the hiring of menders on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21205.name: Hannish Wool
21205.description: An improved variety of Thavnairian wool conceived by the RadzatHan Weavers' Guild.

21206.name: Thavnairian Wool
21206.description: A coarse woolen cloth made from large gauge yarn. A historically important cloth in Thavnair's textile trade.

21207.name: Hingan Partition
21207.description: A partition designed in the Hingan fashion, reaching to the ceiling and so sturdy it may as well be a wall.

21274.description: Music roll of the soothing chittering of insects. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

21298.name: Faded Copy of The Worm's Tail
21298.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music for The Worm's Head and The Worm's Tail. The composer is unknown.

21301.name: Crimson Pepper
21301.description: A pungent spice with just a hint of bitterness behind its bite.

21792.name: Shark-class Bow
21792.description: Comprising the front end of a shark-class submersible, this bow has been reinforced to double as a battering ram for subduing unruly sea creatures.

21793.name: Shark-class Bridge
21793.description: Comprising the top of a shark-class submersible, the bridge houses all of the equipment necessary for the vessel's crew to navigate the unplumbed depths of the Ruby Sea and beyond.

21794.name: Shark-class Pressure Hull
21794.description: Comprising the center of a shark-class submersible, this ovoid hull is multi-walled to stabilize and maintain pressure within so that the vessel's crew does not succumb to the crushing weight of the waters it navigates. Several sturdy rudder fins serve to increase maneuverability.

21795.name: Shark-class Stern
21795.description: Comprising the rear end of a shark-class submersible, this stern contains the unique independent engine which propels the craft.

21796.name: Unkiu-class Bow
21796.description: Unlike the bows of most submersibles, the unkiu-class model is outfitted with rudder fins usually relegated to the stern.

21797.name: Unkiu-class Bridge
21797.description: Designed by the Onishishu─a collective of skilled Far Eastern craftsmen─this submersible bridge differs dramatically in build from those built in the West.

21798.name: Unkiu-class Pressure Hull
21798.description: Comprising the center of an unkiu-class submersible, this ovoid hull is multi-walled to stabilize and maintain pressure within so that the vessel's crew does not succumb to the crushing weight of the waters it navigates. Supplemental propulsion engines have been affixed to the sides to increase underwater speed.

21799.name: Unkiu-class Stern
21799.description: Comprising the rear end of an unkiu-class submersible, this stern contains a double propeller engine.

21800.name: Glamour Prism
21800.description:
This crystalline prism captures the likeness of a piece of equipment and projects it onto another object of comparable form and function.

[Necessary to project glamours.]

21806.name: Ornate True Linen Coat of Striking

21807.name: Ornate True Linen Jacket of Aiming

21808.name: Ornate True Linen Jacket of Scouting

21809.name: Ornate True Linen Robe of Healing

21810.name: Ornate True Linen Robe of Casting

21811.name: Futon Mattress
21811.description: Common in the Far East, futons are thin down-filled mattresses laid directly on the floor instead of upon a frame. After use, they are generally rolled up and stored in a closet until needed again.

21813.name: Odder Otter Lantern
21813.description: An indoor lantern designed to resemble the oddest of otters.

21815.name: Moogle Wall Chronometer
21815.description: When faced with the dilemma of adorning his wall with a normal chronometer or a chronometer carved in the adorable likeness of a moogle, it is said the dread (though most likely nonexistent) pirate Mustbeard replied with a hearty “arrr” and found room for both.

21816.name: Byakko Sideboard
21816.description:
A round desk carved to resemble Byakko, one of the mystic Four Lords of the Far East.

※One per estate only.

21817.name: Byakko Throne
21817.description:
A regal throne, fit for a king...or emperor that also happens to be a giant white tiger.

※One per estate only.

21822.name: Bread Basket
21822.description: Aromatic loaves of freshly baked bread fill this wicker basket to the brim. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Tenacity Bonus: +4% (Max 12) +4% (Max 8) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

21823.name: Stuffed Alpha
21823.description: A charming recreation of the chocobo Alpha, filled with the feathers of a fowl less fortunate.

21824.name: House Borel Tea Set
21824.description: A faithful replication of the selfsame set used every morning by Aymeric de Borel himself. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 12) +4% (Max 8) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

21825.name: Royal Dowager Tea Set
21825.description: The design used on this quaint porcelain tea set is based off a passage in an ancient literary work on Halicarnassus, Queen of Dimension Castle. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 12) +4% (Max 8) Gear Durability Bonus: +2 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

21826.name: Brick Interior Wall
21826.description: An interior wall built with genuine kiln-fired bricks.

21827.name: Mounted Cupboard
21827.description: A space-saving cupboard that can be mounted anywhere there is a wall.

21828.name: Vegetable Basket
21828.description: The vegetables contained within this basket have not been approved for consumption. Dine at your own risk.

21829.name: Open Partition
21829.description: A low partition cut with a hole to provide estates with the illusion of more space than actually exists.

21830.name: Counter Cart
21830.description: An island for kitchens designed to resemble those carts used by hawkers in city markets.

21833.name: Carbuncle Bathtub
21833.description: A small tub crafted to resemble a summoner's best friend. Just large enough for two.

21834.name: Chirurgeon's Essentials
21834.description: From scalpels to saws, panaceas to placebos, this basic set of medical devices has everything the unlicensed surgeon needs.

21835.name: Kitchen Hanger
21835.description: Save space in your cupboards for liquor and fruitcake by hanging all your kitchen appliances from hooks.

21836.name: Hanya Mask
21836.description: A frightening mask of Far Eastern design. Perfect for children's bedrooms and nurseries.

21839.name: Stage Panel
21839.description: A large white panel used by acting troupes as a simple backdrop for plays.

21840.name: Stuffed Ananta
21840.description: Those without a deathly fear of snakes claim this plush doll to be one of the most beautiful ever crafted. Most ophidiophobes, however, would beg to differ.

21841.name: Tier 1 Metal Aquarium
21841.description:
A small, reinforced glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.

21842.name: Tier 2 Metal Aquarium
21842.description:
A reinforced glass tank that, when filled with water, can serve as a home for select wavekin caught in the wild. The higher an aquarium's tier, the larger the specimens that can be kept within.
※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 aquariums, respectively.

21843.name: Eorzean Lantern
21843.description: Not one to be humbled by craftsmen of the East, a prominent Eorzean lamp maker conceived this fixture he hopes will become the new standard in home and garden lighting.

21844.name: Bomb Stove
21844.description: A cast-iron wood stove designed after a fateful encounter with a voidsent bomb.

21845.name: Hingan Pillar
21845.description: A decorative pillar designed in the Hingan fashion.

21846.name: Stack of Documents
21846.description: What better way to tell unwanted visitors, “can't you see I'm busy?” than by strewing stacks of important-looking documents all about your humble abode?

21854.name: Hokonin Permit
21854.description:
This permit allows the hiring of Hingan servants known as “hokonin” on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21855.name: Allagan Resupply Node Permit
21855.description:
This permit allows the renting of Allagan resupply nodes on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21856.name: Allagan Commerce Node Permit
21856.description:
This permit allows the renting of Allagan commerce nodes on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21857.name: Allagan Repair Node Permit
21857.description:
This permit allows the renting of Allagan repair nodes on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21858.name: Allagan Housekeeping Node Permit
21858.description:
This permit allows the renting of Allagan housekeeping nodes on the estate.

※Private chambers (apartments), cottages, houses, and mansions can host 4, 6, 8, and 10 vendors, respectively.

21864.name: Corner Hedge Partition
21864.description: A low-growing hedge, expertly pruned and trimmed into the shape of an L.

21865.name: Bamboo Copse
21865.description: A controlled cluster of bamboo cut from a Yanxian forest for display in private gardens.

21866.name: Hingan Hot Spring
21866.description: Scalding water tapped from the very bowels of the land, and collected in a quaint rock pool certain to draw the envy of neighbors.

21867.name: House Borel Interior Wall
21867.description: A wall that matches the design of those used in Aymeric de Borel's very manor.

21868.name: White Marble Flooring
21868.description: Smooth, elegant floor tiling made of polished marble.

21869.name: Classic Chandelier
21869.description: A lavish light fixture that hearkens to days long past.

21875.name: Tulip Bulbs
21875.description:
Several hard, brown bulbs the size of a gigantoad's eye.

※For use in planters.

21876.name: Red Tulips
21876.description:
A bunch of red tulips, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

21877.name: Blue Tulips
21877.description:
A bunch of blue tulips, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

21878.name: Yellow Tulips
21878.description:

21879.description:

21880.name: Orange Tulips
21880.description:

21881.name: Purple Tulips
21881.description:

21883.name: Black Tulips
21883.description:

21884.name: Rainbow Tulips
21884.description:
A bunch of multicolored tulips, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

21885.description: An oil painting of the Destroyer based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

21886.description: An oil painting of Bloodstorm based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

21899.name: Imperial Hypersonic Assault Craft L-XXIII Oil Painting
21899.description: An oil painting of the Imperial Hypersonic Assault Craft LXXIII based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

21900.name: Mol Iloh Oil Painting
21900.description: An oil painting of Mol Iloh based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

21901.name: Moai Statue Oil Painting
21901.description: An oil painting of a moai statue based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

21911.name: White Whittret
21911.description:
Once you pop...

Use item to acquire the white whittret minion.

21915.name: Wind-up Magnai
21915.description:
Ever in search of true love.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Magnai minion.

21916.name: Private Moai
21916.description:
It's watching you. Watching you. Watching you.

Use item to acquire the private moai minion.

21917.name: Wind-up Mithra
21917.description:
Opinions on how Miqo'te rate compared to their supposed ancestors are best kept to oneself.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Mithra minion.

21918.name: Wind-up Fafnir
21918.description:
Protective eyewear highly recommended.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Fafnir minion.

21919.name: The Prince of Anemos
21919.description:
Cute and cudgely.

Use item to acquire the Prince of Anemos minion.

21920.name: Byakko Cub
21920.description:
Got to be the fuzziest.

Use item to acquire the Byakko cub minion.

21921.name: Aurelia Polyp
21921.description:
Lighter than air─er...water.

Use item to acquire the aurelia polyp minion.

21922.name: The Gold Whisker
21922.description:
Beckons you to enter his barrel of sin, but don't go in.

Use item to acquire the Gold Whisker minion.

21924.name: Byakko Barding
21924.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the Far Eastern auspice Byakko.

22307.name: Byakko's Mane
22307.description: The brilliant white mane of the Far Eastern white tiger of legend. He probably won't miss it.

22308.name: Alpha's Feather
22308.description: A single yellow feather fallen from the chocobo Alpha.

22389.name: Mirage Mahi
22389.description:
A sizable catch found primarily in the freshwater highland rivers of Gyr Abania.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

22390.name: Triplespine
22390.description:
A deadly saltwater breed that protects itself with a pair of needle-like fins and a nigh-impenetrable coat of translucent scales.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

22391.name: Alligator Snapping Turtle
22391.description:
This land turtle can easily be identified by both its pointed shell and its powerful bite.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

22392.name: Redtail
22392.description:
A large freshwater fish that has─surprise─a distinct red tail fin.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

22393.name: Usuginu Octopus
22393.description:
This crafty cephalopod can be found all along the Ruby Sea coastline─usually in the belly of some Hingan fisher who has eaten the creature raw and with a splash of soy sauce and citrus.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

22394.name: Saltmill
22394.description:
The saltmill is believed to be an ancient sea specimen which adapted to life in hypersalinated waters after being transplanted into Loch Seld after the Sixth Umbral Calamity.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

22395.name: Bonsai Fish
22395.description:
From afar, this freshwater fish can appear to be a piece of floating woodland debris. Up close, it looks like a fish.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

22396.name: Ribbon Eel
22396.description:
A unique petal-shaped maw and ribbon-like body distinguish this saltwater eel from more common varieties.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

22397.name: Red Prismfish
22397.description:
The pale red glow emitted by this freshwater fish is believed to be caused by unbalanced levels of aspected aether in the wavekin's humours.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

22398.name: Elder Gourami
22398.description:
Despite the beard-like ventral fins which give this freshwater wavekin an aged look, gourami only have an average lifespan of three to five summers.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

22412.name: Thavnairian Resin
22412.description: A long-lasting synthetic resin concocted by Radz-at-Han's finest alchemists. Used as both an adhesive as well as a varnish.

22413.name: Thavnairian Abrasive
22413.description: A coarse-grained abrasive concocted by Radz-at-Han's finest alchemists. Used to restore the luster of even the most corroded metals.

22414.name: Thavnairian Cotton
22414.description: A traditional Near Eastern weave that keeps its wearer cool while protecting her from the harsh rays of the sun.

22415.name: Thavnairian Alumen
22415.description: Quarried from Thavnair's towering sea cliffs, this mineral is prized by leatherworkers for its use in tanning hides.

22416.name: Thavnairian Adhesive
22416.description: Countless Hannish alchemists have chosen death over revealing the secret recipe of this odorless paste used in the creation of some of the island nation's most valuable armor.

22417.name: Nightsteel Ore
22417.description: Iron ore that has been exposed to the waters of a mineral spring, and undergone significant changes to both color and chemical makeup.

22418.name: Silvergrace Ore
22418.description: A sizable piece of rock containing traces of a precious metal known as silvergrace.

22419.name: Black Willow Log
22419.description: A rough-cut log of black willow timber.

22420.name: Hingan Flax
