25077.description: Music roll for Ultima's Perfection. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

25086.name: Faded Copy of From the Dragon's Wake
25086.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for From the Dragon's Wake.

26156.name: Ovim Wool Muffed Met of Healing

26162.name: Ovim Wool Muffed Met of Casting

26529.name: Cryptomeria Log
26529.description: A rough-cut log of cryptomeria timber.

26531.name: Pure Titanium Ore
26531.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing titanium of exceptional quality.

26532.name: Pure Titanium Plate
26532.description: A thin, tiny plate of the purest titanium.

26727.description: Cannot be melded onto a piece of equipment past the first advanced materia melding slot.

26739.name: Quicktongue Materia VIII
26739.description: Cannot be melded onto a piece of equipment past the first advanced materia melding slot.

26744.name: Timeworn Gliderskin Map
26744.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 11 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 80 recommended.

26745.name: Timeworn Zonureskin Map
26745.description: This bottle holds a timeworn map classified as risk-reward grade 12 among treasure hunters. ※Use the action Decipher to extract the map and examine its contents. ※Level 80 full party (eight players) recommended.

26782.name: Magicked Bed
26782.description: This flying furnishing eliminates the need to get up in the morning─or ever. Modern magic put to good use at last!

26787.name: Black Hayate
26787.description:
Gaze upon the visage of a ruthless killer.

Use item to acquire the black hayate minion.

26788.name: Chameleon
26788.description:
Marvel as it melts into your surrounds...and then panic as you realize you cannot find it again.

Use item to acquire the chameleon minion.

26789.name: Wind-up Fuath
26789.description:
Markedly less murderous than the real thing.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Fuath minion.

26790.name: Armadillo Bowler
26790.description:
Possessed of a superior sense of balance.

Use item to acquire the armadillo bowler minion.

26793.name: Clionid Larva
26793.description:
Small on size but massive on appetite.

Use item to acquire the clionid larva minion.

26798.name: Wind-up Omega-M
26798.description:
Irrational behavior detected. Further observation required.

Use item to acquire the wind-up Omega-M minion.

26799.name: Wind-up Omega-F
26799.description:
Combat role allocation test initiated. Analyzing...

Use item to acquire the wind-up Omega-F minion.

26801.name: Tiny Echevore
26801.description:
Its tail tastes like nectar...but you wouldn't know such things.

Use item to acquire the tiny echevore minion.

26802.name: Sharksucker-class Insubmersible
26802.description:
Warning: do not immerse.

Use item to acquire the sharksucker-class insubmersible minion.

26803.name: Shoebill
26803.description:
An unflappable bird possessed of a regal air...or perhaps simply a condescending one.

Use item to acquire the shoebill minion.

26806.name: Forgiven Hate
26806.description:
Having repented its sins, it poses no danger.

Use item to acquire the forgiven hate minion.

27268.name: Walnut Interior Wall
27268.description: A rustic interior wall of simple wooden boards.

27269.name: Brick Flooring
27269.description: Flooring of evenly laid red brick that calls to mind urban spaces.

27270.name: Crystarium Chandelier
27270.description: A bright and elegant ceiling light identical to those found throughout the Crystarium.

27271.name: Lily Floor Lamp
27271.description: This elegant lamp, its natural motifs rendered in polished and painted metal and glass, will make a master of white magic feel right at home.

27272.name: Lily Wall Lamp
27272.description: The reason that the sight of one of these warmly glowing light fixtures puts those with a penchant for healing so very much at ease will ever remain a mystery to people not versed in the secrets of white magic.

27273.name: Marble Arch Partition
27273.description: A large white partition with a marble-carved arch creating a portal through the center.

27274.name: Simple Curtain
27274.description: A yellow curtain gathered with a polished wooden fastener.

27276.name: Butterfly Specimen
27276.description: One of Il Mheg's many brilliant butterflies, mounted for display.

27277.name: Grocery Bag
27277.description: All manner of foodstuffs could be inside this plain brown shopping bag. ...Hopefully they did not require refrigeration.

27278.name: Hunting Supplies
27278.description: The requisite weapons and traps for a foray into the wilds.

27279.name: War Chest
27279.description: The requisite defensive and offensive accoutrements for combat.

27280.name: Imitation Stained Crystal Pane
27280.description: Though this is neither real crystal nor a real windowpane, the rear lighting makes it appear sumptuous all the same.

27281.name: Marble Partition
27281.description: A cream-colored partition with a white marble baseboard.

27282.name: Crystarium Bench
27282.description: A wrought-iron seat identical to those found throughout the Crystarium.

27283.name: Potted Orange Tree
27283.description: A small citrus tree in an elegant wrought-iron vessel.

27284.name: Crystarium Stove
27284.description: A warmly glowing iron kitchen stove.

27285.name: Crystarium Kitchen Hanger
27285.description: This wall-mounted hanger provides easy access to pots and pans for use in cooking or punctuating one's statements with loud clanging noises.

27286.name: Crystarium Teapot
27286.description: This metal teapot comes with a serving tray, cup, and jar of tea leaves for your convenience.

27287.name: Ruby Crystal Boule
27287.description: A mounted sample of the luminous red crystals that grow uninhibited on the sea floor.

27288.name: Crystarium Wall Chronometer
27288.description: Rather unfortunately for those attempting to get anywhere on time, this chronometer features a mesmerizing pattern and pendulum.

27291.name: Crystarium Mechanical Till
27291.description: A convenient clockwork contraption for the counting and keeping of currency.

27292.name: Stuffed Fuath
27292.description: The manufacturer of this plush toy assures you that the gleam in its button eye is “mischievous” rather than “murderous.”

27293.name: Antique Vessels
27293.description: These remarkably well-preserved vessels, retrieved from their lengthy slumber on the sea floor, probably belong in a museum. Oh well.

27294.name: Decadent Fruit Platter
27294.description: A branching golden vessel harboring enough fruit to feed two Crystarium families or one Eulmoran hedonist for several days. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Piety Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27295.name: Sandwich Basket
27295.description: A picnic's worth of scrumptious sandwiches, aesthetically arranged. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Skill Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 2) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27296.name: Wooden Handrail
27296.description: This railing can be used to ensure that none will fall into the stairwell unless you push them.

27297.name: Misplaced Eyeglasses
27297.description: As the person to whom these eyeglasses belonged is now without eyeglasses, he will likely never be able to find them again and is probably wandering around bumping into things at this very moment.

27298.name: Carpet of Flowers
27298.description: A circular patch of rug upon which colorful flowers have been enchanted to grow. Not recommended for those with seasonal allergies.

27299.name: Blades of Innocence
27299.description:
A wall-mounted trophy that quite conclusively indicates your victory over Innocence, greatest of the Lightwardens.

※One per estate only.

27300.name: Titania Shadow Box
27300.description:
A glimmering wall-mounted decoration featuring a pair of wings acquired in the Dancing Plague.

※One per estate only.

27312.name: Crystarium Umbrella Stand
27312.description: A dark-blue vessel containing one umbrella of a style popular in the Crystarium.

27313.name: Stuffed Clionid
27313.description: Whether this plush toy can actually restore its owner to good health as is rumored is unclear, but it certainly does look as if it would like to.

27314.name: Fallen Tree
27314.description: The perfect yard ornament for those who wish to issue a reminder to passersby that they too shall someday fall and be reclaimed by the earth.

27315.name: Crystarium Striking Dummy
27315.description:
A striking dummy designed in the Crystarium fashion.

※Up to three dummies may be placed in a single estate, regardless of type.

27320.name: Hydrangea Seeds
27320.description:
Plants from these seeds will burst into bloom in brightly colored clusters─like fireworks in your very own home, without the danger of burning down your very own home.

※For use in planters.

27321.name: Red Hydrangeas
27321.description:
A bunch of red hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27322.name: Blue Hydrangeas
27322.description:
A bunch of blue hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27323.name: Yellow Hydrangeas
27323.description:
A bunch of yellow hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27324.name: Green Hydrangeas
27324.description:
A bunch of green hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27325.name: Orange Hydrangeas
27325.description:
A bunch of orange hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27326.name: Purple Hydrangeas
27326.description:
A bunch of purple hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27327.name: White Hydrangeas
27327.description:
A bunch of white hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27328.name: Black Hydrangeas
27328.description:
A bunch of black hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27329.name: Rainbow Hydrangeas
27329.description:
A bunch of multicolored hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

27410.name: Crystarium Tetra
27410.description:
This small freshwater fish raised in the Crystarium is, appropriately, a shade of blue resembling that of the Crystal Tower.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27411.name: Laxan Carp
27411.description:
Despite what the name may imply, this variety of freshwater fish can be found in multiple locations in the Crystarium.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27412.name: Asteroidea
27412.description:
This variety of starfish is a deep blue and shimmers like a comet's tail.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27413.name: Jacketed Snail
27413.description:
This peculiar, though curiously endearing, gastropod is draped in layers of membrane.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27414.name: Lover's Flower
27414.description:
Despite the petal-like appearance of their appendages, presenting a fistful of these mollusks to one's sweetheart is not recommended.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27415.name: Sinspitter
27415.description:
This Crystarium freshwater fish is in fact much prettier than its crude name implies.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27416.name: Wandering Catfish
27416.description:
This variety of catfish was named not for any particular propensity for travel, but rather after its home─the Wandering Stairs.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27417.name: Crystal Knife
27417.description:
A slim, metal-colored freshwater fish from the Crystarium.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27418.name: Skeletonfish
27418.description:
The flesh of this diminutive freshwater fish is so pale as to be translucent.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27419.name: Milky Coral
27419.description:
White coral commonly found near the city of Eulmore.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27420.name: Gravel Mussel
27420.description:
These shellfish are often scooped up by residents of the Derelicts to supplement their meager diets.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27421.name: Crimson Sea Spider
27421.description:
Hopefully picking this up wasn't how you learned of the existence of sea spiders. If it was─surprise! Sea spiders are real.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27422.name: Bonefish
27422.description:
These unappetizing specimens proliferate in the Derelicts, where residents have little choice but to scrape what flesh they can from them.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27423.name: Eulmore Butterfly
27423.description:
A brightly colored and riotously patterned fish that looks right at home in the gaudy environs of Eulmore.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27424.name: Red Hammerhead
27424.description:
Despite its whimsical appearance, this shark is nevertheless perfectly capable of biting one's face off if provoked.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

27425.name: Hard Candy
27425.description:
A glossy ball of moss found in Lakeland. Does not, in fact, taste like candy.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27426.name: Water Ball
27426.description:
A rotund, white freshwater fish found in Lakeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27427.name: Abyssal Snail
27427.description:
This gastropod sports an unusual purple shell.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27428.name: Clean Saucer
27428.description:
In its natural habitat, this fish spends most of its time deep below the surface, skipping itself across the lakebed.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27429.name: Rabbit Skipper
27429.description:
It is said that this fish's frolicsome nature gave rise to its name─though it is entirely possible that scholars retroactively came up with this explanation to conceal the fact that they simply named it after the first white thing that came to mind.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27430.name: Xanthic Bass
27430.description:
This unusually vivid freshwater bass has scales of yellow and burnt orange.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27431.name: Albino Caiman
27431.description:
A naturally pure white caiman.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27432.name: Platinum Guppy
27432.description:
This beautiful freshwater fish was given its name by the Crystal Exarch, if rumors are to be believed.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27433.name: Misty Killifish
27433.description:
The body of this freshwater fish is semi-transparent, like a thin fog over the sea.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27434.name: Albino Rock Crab
27434.description:
A bright white crab snared in Lakeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27435.name: Snakeskin Discus
27435.description:
This variety of vividly patterned freshwater fish is oft spotted near Sullen.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27436.name: Albino Garfish
27436.description:
Its ghostly color and threatening size makes encountering this sort of garfish a uniquely alarming experience for folk fishing in the Source.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27437.name: Vicejaw
27437.description:
An armor-plated fish found near the Isle of Ken, as vicious as it is ancient.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

27438.name: Skulleater
27438.description:
A bone white freshwater lobster from Kholusia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27439.name: Toffee Snail
27439.description:
A snail native to Kholusia. Though its shell is much more appetizing, its flesh is the only edible bit.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27440.name: Watts Trout
27440.description:
A frankly unremarkable species of trout found in Watts River.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27441.name: Hucho Taimen
27441.description:
This placid freshwater fish displays a distinct preference for calm currents.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27442.name: Winged Hatchetfish
27442.description:
A freshwater fish with an oversized belly, commonly found in the upper reaches of Watts River.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27443.name: Noble's Fan
27443.description:
Some say that this Kholusian fish looks just like a fan. Others say, more specifically, that it looks like a fan with the capacity to feel murderous rage.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27444.name: Zebra Catfish
27444.description:
This catfish was named for its beautiful black-and-white pattern, reminiscent of the zebras occasionally pictured in storybooks.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27445.name: Sepia Sole
27445.description:
A remarkably flat freshwater fish found in Kholusia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27446.name: Shellfracture Kelp
27446.description:
This variety of leafy kelp grows to incredible size off the southern coast of Kholusia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27447.name: Blood Cloud
27447.description:
Seen distantly from a boat, this jellyfish could be mistaken for the reflection of a red airship above─or the gory aftermath of a violent underwater encounter.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27448.name: Kholusian Flounder
27448.description:
A flat fish living off the coast of Kholusia.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27449.name: South Kholusian Cod
27449.description:
This common saltwater fish is a staple food for Kholusian locals.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27450.name: Razorfish
27450.description:
This tiny saltwater fish swims with its head facing down toward the depths.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27451.name: Rose Shrimp
27451.description:
This pink crustacean is both delicious and plentiful, resulting in its frequent use in a variety of Vrandtic dishes.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27452.name: Shapeshifter
27452.description:
This octopus sports a mesmerizing black-and-white pattern, and is unnervingly skilled at both disguising itself and manipulating objects with its dextrous arms.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27453.name: Minstrelfish
27453.description:
The urge to play this shark like a lute is best resisted.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27454.name: Kholusian Wrasse
27454.description:
A knobbly-headed fish native to the oceans surrounding Kholusia.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27455.name: Weedy Seadragon
27455.description:
This ocean-dweller could easily be mistaken for a clump of fallen autumn leaves.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27456.name: Henodus
27456.description:
This ancient species, in modern times sighted only in the vicinity of Cracked Shell Beach, bears significant similarities to the tortoise.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27457.name: Spearhead Squid
27457.description:
A reddish cephalopod with a pointed head.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27458.name: Shadow Crab
27458.description:
This dark grey crab dwells in eastern Amh Araeng─or did until someone poached it.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27459.name: Desert Dustfish
27459.description:
This variety of fish can be found frolicking amidst the sands of Amh Araeng.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27460.name: Hornhelm
27460.description:
This sand-dwelling fish in fact boasts not merely one, but three hornlike protrusions.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27461.name: Web-footed Sand Gecko
27461.description:
The minute pieces of webbing between this gecko's toes help to propel it across dry sands.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27462.name: Sand Egg
27462.description:
This peculiar creature was found rolling its way across the sands despite having no visible means of propulsion.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27463.name: Amber Lamprey
27463.description:
A blood red eel native to the Fields of Amber.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27464.name: Desert Saw
27464.description:
Those already alarmed by the sight of this fish's vicious-looking fins protruding from the sands will be discomfited to know that its teeth are equally pointy.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27465.name: Garik Crab
27465.description:
One of a species of crabs native to western Amh Araeng.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27466.name: Nabaath Manta
27466.description:
This manta is able to glide effortlessly through sandy hill and valley in its desert home.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27467.name: Thorned Lizard
27467.description:
One of several varieties of lizards that inhabit the desert sands of Amh Araeng.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

27468.name: Spotted Blue-eye
27468.description:
A large-finned killifish found in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27469.name: Official Ball
27469.description:
This rotund freshwater fish is native to Il Mheg─much to its misfortune.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27470.name: Grey Skipper
27470.description:
This variety of skipper is found all across Il Mheg, where it, paradoxically, stands out like a sore thumb due to its dull color.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27471.name: Pixie Fish
27471.description:
The coloration of this fish reminds you of one pixie in particular. (They assure you there is no relation.)

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27472.name: Blood-eyed Frog
27472.description:
This small amphibian boasts bright-red eyes, but overall is still much less weird than a Fuath.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27473.name: Cherry Herring
27473.description:
This freshwater fish was named for its color─presumably by someone poorly versed in specific shades of red.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27474.name: Wimple Carp
27474.description:
A striped freshwater fish found in Handmirror Lake.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27475.name: Lemonfish
27475.description:
A speckled, bright-yellow freshwater fish.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27476.name: Rebel
27476.description:
In spite of─or perhaps to spite─its diminutive size, this freshwater wavekin can often be seen swimming upstream.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27477.name: Wild Red Betta
27477.description:
A distinctly colored betta native to Longmirror Lake.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27478.name: Spotted Ctenopoma
27478.description:
This fish's scales feature an eye-catching pattern in shades of brown.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27479.name: Cerulean Loach
27479.description:
This bright blue fish can be found in aquatic environs throughout Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27480.name: Golden Lobster
27480.description:
This massive lobster is so shiny that one could be forgiven for mistaking it for a gaudy decoration at first sight.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27481.name: Toadhead
27481.description:
A dazed-looking fish found in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27482.name: Clawbow
27482.description:
This type of crab is native to the Rak'tika Greatwood, and was doubtless named by the Viis.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27483.name: Black Tri-star
27483.description:
A spotted freshwater fish found at Lozatl's Conquest.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27484.name: Robber Crab
27484.description:
A member of an omnivorous and aggressive species of hermit crab.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27485.name: Darkroot
27485.description:
A black eel native to Woven Oath.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27486.name: Yellow Pipira
27486.description:
A tiny-yet-fierce fish from the Rak'tika Greatwood.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27487.name: Oathfish
27487.description:
One of a species of fish farmed by the Children of the Everlasting Dark...who will not be best pleased to find it has been poached.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27488.name: Night's Bass
27488.description:
It is thought that this variety of bass was originally bred in Voeburt, and only later introduced to Rak'tika.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27489.name: Rak'tika Trout
27489.description:
A member of a species of trout that thrives in the bough-sheltered waters of the Greatwood.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27490.name: Clown Tetra
27490.description:
A freshwater fish patterned with broad black stripes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27491.name: Eryops
27491.description:
A massive and ancient amphibian found solely in Lake Tusi Mek'ta.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27492.name: Diamond Pipira
27492.description:
A freshwater fish with gleaming silver-white scales.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27493.name: Silver Kitten
27493.description:
A catfish caught at Mjrl's Regret─much to its own regret, probably.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27494.name: Darkdweller
27494.description:
A sinister-looking cave dweller native to Woven Oath.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27495.name: Deep Purple Coral
27495.description:
A sharp piece of stinging coral. Handle with care, or not at all.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27496.name: Sycorax
27496.description:
A silvery bivalve mollusk found in the Tempest.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27497.name: Stormfish
27497.description:
A grey wavekin native to the Tempest.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27498.name: Azure Sea Spider
27498.description:
A spindly-legged creature that, among other things, breathes through its porous exoskeleton.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27499.name: Caliban
27499.description:
A hulking, prehistoric wavekin that dwelt in the Tempest.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27500.name: Hoodwinker
27500.description:
A large, ovular saltwater fish with charming blue-and-white coloration.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27501.name: Bubble Angler
27501.description:
The see-through flesh of this bizarre anglerfish makes it all the more disturbing to look at.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27502.name: Ondo Harpoon
27502.description:
A sharp-nosed shark native to the Tempest.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27503.name: Ondobane
27503.description:
This shark, native to the Tempest, is voracious, territorial, and massive─which savvy fishers may recognize as the worst combination of traits for a shark to have.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

27504.name: Stippled Eel
27504.description:
A carnivorous eel covered with a complex and colorful pattern.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27505.name: Seatrap
27505.description:
A deceptively delicate-looking anemone native to the Tempest.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27506.name: Ancient Shrimp
27506.description:
An old, old shrimp with long, reaching pincers, arisen from the dark depths of the sea after untold centuries.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27507.name: Yeti Crab
27507.description:
This pale deep-sea crustacean is entirely covered in fine white cilia.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27508.name: Aapoak
27508.description:
Ancient relatives of the nautilus, aapoak are colloquially known as “crawling gems” for their rainbow-colored shells.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27509.name: Cyan Sea Devil
27509.description:
A fiendishly clever horned octopus easily identifiable by its bright blue coloration.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27510.name: Pancake Octopus
27510.description:
Though they make a valiant effort, members of this species of octopus never manage to look quite as sinister as any of their fellow deep-sea dwellers.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27511.name: Maneater Clam
27511.description:
A bivalve mollusk with a shell that resembles nothing so much as rows of vicious teeth.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27512.name: Stargazer
27512.description:
A deep-sea fish with a penchant for concealing itself among the sediment on the sea floor.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27513.name: Sweetflesh Oyster
27513.description:
The only defense that this particularly delicious variety of oyster has against being devoured is its thick shell.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27514.name: Rainbow Shrimp
27514.description:
As the coloration of these cousins to the mantis shrimp is entirely in the shell, consuming vast quantities of them will not, unfortunately, make its predators rainbow-colored in turn.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27515.name: Predator
27515.description:
Quite literally everyone who has seen one of these Tempest-dwelling ancients open its maw has regretted the experience within moments.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27516.name: Grey Carp
27516.description:
A common carp native to Lakeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27517.name: Lilac Goby
27517.description:
A small, brightly colored freshwater fish native to Lakeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27518.name: Purple Ghost
27518.description:
This particular species of freshwater fish has unusual organs that can produce powerful jolts of electricity. Rubber gloves recommended.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27519.name: Lakelouse
27519.description:
If it looks like a vilekin, and crawls like a vilekin, it's...actually an arthropod with a robust exoskeleton.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27520.name: Gazing Glass
27520.description:
This semi-transparent sphere harvested from the depths of the Source is actually a living creature─or was, before being unceremoniously torn from the water it requires to survive.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27521.name: Source Octopus
27521.description:
A bright-purple cephalopod native to the Source.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27522.name: Elven Spear
27522.description:
An aggressively territorial freshwater fish.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27523.name: Shade Gudgeon
27523.description:
This timid wavekin's skin has been turned ghostly pale by overexposure to unbalanced aether.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27524.name: Lakethistle
27524.description:
A rare and fascinating wavekin that acquires oxygen via pulmonary respiration rather than gills.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27525.name: Platinum Bream
27525.description:
A shimmering, silvery fish.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27526.name: Wardenfish
27526.description:
This massive undersea guardian was found stalking the depths around the Isle of Ken.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27527.name: Finned Eggplant
27527.description:
Though its name is apt in terms of shape and coloration, this wavekin is considerably larger than all but the most freakishly oversized of eggplants.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27528.name: Skykisser
27528.description:
A cloud-colored, highly social fish native to Lakeland.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27529.name: Viola Clam
27529.description:
The delicate color and shape of this bivalve mollusk's shell make it reminiscent of a wind-kissed flower when seen through rippling water.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27530.name: Geayi
27530.description:
This wavekin is instantly recognizable by the two bold black stripes that stand out starkly against its otherwise pale scales.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27531.name: Noblefish
27531.description:
An elegantly shaped freshwater wavekin.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27532.name: Misteye
27532.description:
Whether this ancient wavekin was always blind or if its eyes have simply been clouded by time is a riddle that no still-living person can answer.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27533.name: Lakeland Cod
27533.description:
A member of a particularly large species of cod.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27534.name: Little Bismarck
27534.description:
Fishers who wish to keep all of their remaining limbs intact would do well to remember that the name of this wavekin is not indicative of diminutive size─almost all creatures are “little” compared to Bismarck.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27535.name: Bothriolepis
27535.description:
A primeval wavekin found in the Source.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27536.name: Big-eye
27536.description:
A colorful freshwater fish native to Il Mheg.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27537.name: Jenanna's Tear
27537.description:
This bivalve mollusk was named in honor of a long-suffering queen of Voeburt.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27538.name: Daisy Turban
27538.description:
These gastropods' sunny yellow shells have tricked spearfishers with poor eyesight into forgetting they were underwater on more than one occasion.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27539.name: Shade Axolotl
27539.description:
Like most creatures native to Il Mheg, this amphibian is just odd enough to cause one to look twice.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27540.name: Little Flirt
27540.description:
A gastropod named for the heart-shaped pink marking on its head.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27541.name: Peallaidh
27541.description:
This peculiar wavekin wears a perpetually inscrutable expression.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27542.name: Voeburt Bichir
27542.description:
An ancient wavekin native to what is now Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27543.name: Poecilia
27543.description:
A freshwater wavekin with bright coloration resembling that of many pixies.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27544.name: Gilded Batfish
27544.description:
A diminutive and delicate-looking freshwater fish found in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27545.name: Petalfish
27545.description:
A pale pink-and-blue wavekin that calls to mind a single flower petal adrift upon the water.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27546.name: Mirrorfish
27546.description:
A freshwater wavekin native to Il Mheg known for its reflective scales.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27547.name: Glass Eel
27547.description:
The long, thin body of this freshwater wavekin is a deep, glossy blue.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27548.name: Voeburt Salamander
27548.description:
A large amphibian of a species long native to the area that is now Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27549.name: Bedskipper
27549.description:
This variety of freshwater fish can be found reveling in the ponds and streams of the fae's gardenlike home.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27550.name: Dandyfish
27550.description:
The eccentric reddish purple of this wavekin's fins gave rise to its teasing appellation.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27551.name: Sauldia Ruby
27551.description:
A spherical, gemlike creature found in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27552.name: Mock Pixie
27552.description:
In a kinder world, this creature might have become a member of the fae. In this one, it seems to have made it less than halfway there.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27553.name: Hunter's Arrow
27553.description:
This prehistoric creature was found lurking in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27554.name: Fuathgobbler
27554.description:
Does this large wavekin native to Il Mheg actually feed on Fuath? One can only hope.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27555.name: Paradise Crab
27555.description:
The shell of this unusual crab is covered with mushrooms of such bright and appealing colors that they almost seem to be screaming, “Eat me!”

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27556.name: Saint Fathric's Ire
27556.description:
A stinging anemone native to Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27557.name: Queensgown
27557.description:
A freshwater fish named for its fabulously frilly fins.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27558.name: Flowering Kelpie
27558.description:
This wavekin, which bizarrely resembles a sinister supernatural horse rendered in petal-pink, could only have originated in Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27559.name: Ghoulfish
27559.description:
The flesh of this Il Mheg native's head is transparent, rendering its bright-purple innards visible to all who gaze upon it─whether they like it or not. 

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27560.name: Measan Deala
27560.description:
A lemon yellow freshwater fish native to Il Mheg.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27561.name: Dohn Horn
27561.description:
This creature's striped shell features several shades of vibrant green reminiscent of the foliage of Dohn Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27562.name: Aquabloom
27562.description:
This creature's delicate, flower-like appearance succeeds admirably in disguising the fact that it is, essentially, a slug.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27563.name: Jester Fish
27563.description:
A freshwater wavekin with colorful fins and bulging eyes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27564.name: Blue Lightning
27564.description:
This unusual wavekin is remarkably hydrodynamic.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27565.name: Maidenhair
27565.description:
The sweeping, golden fins of this freshwater wavekin might, in autumn, be mistaken for fallen leaves from the tree that is its namesake.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27566.name: Blue Mountain Bubble
27566.description:
The fins of this rotund fish, native to Longmirror Lake, are suggestive of butterfly wings.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27567.name: Elder Pixie
27567.description:
A gastropod with bright green markings and appendages resembling wings.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27568.name: Ankle Snipper
27568.description:
Freshwater crabs of this species native to the Rak'tika Greatwood are not known for their discrimination in what they clamp with their claws when they are surprised, threatened, or merely in a bad mood.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27569.name: Treescale
27569.description:
These bivalve mollusks are often found nestled between underwater roots in the Rak'tika Greatwood.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27570.name: Ronkan Pleco
27570.description:
This variety of pleco bears ivory stripes in a pattern suggestive of the veins on a leaf.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27571.name: Gourmand Crab
27571.description:
Though this crab is omnivorous in the sense that it will eat both flesh and plant matter, this should not be taken to mean that it does not have a discerning palate.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27572.name: Gatorl's Bead
27572.description:
This species of blood red freshwater wavekin inhabits the ponds and marshes of the Rak'tika Greatwood.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27573.name: Diamondtongue
27573.description:
This ancient breed of wavekin is prized for the way in which its scales glimmer in the light.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27574.name: Hermit's Hood
27574.description:
A tiny mollusk native to Lake Tusi Mek'ta.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27575.name: Hermit Crab
27575.description:
This species of crab is known for its cowardice and incredibly specific shell preferences.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27576.name: Megapiranha
27576.description:
A specimen belonging to a vicious species that seems to have survived largely unchanged since time immemorial.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27577.name: Everdark Bass
27577.description:
This species was allegedly bred by the Voeburtites in their homeland before making its way to the Rak'tika Greatwood.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

27578.name: Lozatl Pirarucu
27578.description:
A large freshwater wavekin native to the Rak'tika Greatwood.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27579.name: Anpa's Handmaid
27579.description:
A large, silvery wavekin that features in Ronkan myth.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

27580.name: Viis Ear
27580.description:
These sea slugs are generally content to let the current carry them where it will.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27581.name: Rak'tika Goby
27581.description:
Their odd shape and placement make this striped fish's fins its most unique feature.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

27582.name: Fruit Worm
27582.description: A nascent wriggler torn from the fragrant fruit's flesh in which it hatched. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

27583.name: Moyebi Shrimp
27583.description: Conveniently enough, the sickly tinge this shrimp has taken on from the algae it eats makes it no less appetizing to other creatures in the aquatic food chain. Live bait for ocean fishing.

27584.name: Desert Dessert Frog
27584.description: A charming dunefishing lure carved from plain wood to pose as a sweet treat for sandfish.

27585.name: Marble Nymph
27585.description: The unnervingly pale larva of a stonefly. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

27586.name: Jerked Ovim
27586.description: A sun-dried strip of ovim flesh. Fishers love it─fish do too. Live bait for dunefishing.

27587.name: Robber Ball
27587.description: A soft ball of robber crab flesh and sunset flour paste. Processed bait for freshwater fishing.

27588.name: Short Bill Minnow
27588.description: An ocean fishing lure that looks and moves like a tiny, bright fish.

27589.name: Baitbugs
27589.description: A box full of wriggling water insects. Appetizing. Live bait for freshwater fishing.

27590.name: Squid Strip
27590.description: A thin piece of cephalopod flesh. Live(ish) bait for ocean fishing.

27591.name: Freshwater Boilie
27591.description:
A hard, round ball incorporating multiple highly effective baits─designed by fishers, for fishers. All-purpose bait for freshwater fishing, dunefishing, and cloudfishing.

Has no effect on certain fish.

27592.name: Saltwater Boilie
27592.description:
A hard, round ball incorporating multiple highly effective baits─designed by fishers, for fishers. All-purpose bait for ocean fishing, dunefishing, and cloudfishing.

Has no effect on certain fish.

27683.name: White Oak Log
27683.description: A rough-cut log of white oak timber.

27684.name: Miracle Apple Log
27684.description: A rough-cut log of miracle apple timber.

27685.name: White Ash Log
27685.description: A rough-cut log of white ash timber.

27686.name: Sandteak Log
27686.description: A rough-cut log of sandteak timber.

27687.name: Lignum Vitae Log
27687.description: A rough-cut log of lignum vitae timber.

27688.name: Sandalwood Log
27688.description: A rough-cut log of sandalwood timber.

27695.name: Multifaceted Varnish
27695.description: A single coat of this all-in-one sealant, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can strengthen, protect, and polish any wooden surface to which it is applied.

27696.name: Truegold Sand
27696.description: Bright sand that shines like the sun, consisting of tiny grains of truegold.

27697.name: Truegold Ore
27697.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal truegold, both harder and more colorful than standard gold.

27698.name: Bluespirit Ore
27698.description: A sizable hunk of the remarkably aether-rich mineral known as bluespirit.

27699.name: Manasilver Sand
27699.description: Sand that moves almost as a liquid, consisting of tiny grains of manasilver.

27700.name: Titancopper Sand
27700.description: Varicolored sand consisting of tiny grains of titanium and copper.

27701.name: Titancopper Ore
27701.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing a naturally occurring mixture of titanium and copper.

27702.name: Dimythrite Sand
27702.description: Darkly glowing sand consisting of tiny grains of dimythrite.

27703.name: Dimythrite Ore
27703.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing what appears to be dimythrite.

27704.name: Tungsten Ore
27704.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal tungsten.

27705.name: Prismstone
27705.description: This peculiar type of stone shines with all the colors of the rainbow.

27706.name: Deepgold Nugget
27706.description: A small nugget of impure deepgold.

27707.name: Stonegold Nugget
27707.description: A small nugget of impure stonegold.

27710.name: Manasilver Nugget
27710.description: A small nugget of impure manasilver.

27711.name: Bluespirit Tile
27711.description: A thin slab of cut and polished bluespirit.

27712.name: Titanbronze Nugget
27712.description: A small nugget of impure titanbronze alloy.

27714.name: Dwarven Mythril Ingot
27714.description: An ingot of smelted dwarven mythril.

27715.name: Dwarven Mythril Nugget
27715.description: A small nugget of impure dwarven mythril.

27716.name: Tungsten Steel Ingot
27716.description: An ingot of smelted tungsten steel.

27717.name: Prismatic Ingot
27717.description: A thin slab of cut and polished prismstone.

27718.name: Multifaceted Abrasive
27718.description: This all-in-one abrasive, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can be used to both sand metals and polish them to a lustrous sheen.

27719.name: Multifaceted Resin
27719.description: This all-in-one resin, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can be used as either an adhesive or protective varnish as necessary.

27726.name: Raw Hematite
27726.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be hematite.

27727.name: Raw Diaspore
27727.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be diaspore.

27728.name: Raw Lazurite
27728.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be lazurite.

27729.name: Raw Triplite
27729.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be triplite.

27730.name: Raw Petalite
27730.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be petalite.

27731.name: Raw Onyx
27731.description: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be onyx.

27732.name: Smilodon Skin
27732.description: The sleek hide of a smilodon.

27733.name: Green Glider Skin
27733.description: The glistening veridian hide of a glider.

27734.name: Atrociraptor Skin
27734.description: The coarse hide of an atrociraptor.

27735.name: Zonure Skin
27735.description: The resilient hide of a zonure.

27736.name: Sea Swallow Skin
27736.description: The slippery hide of a sea swallow.

27737.name: Chalicotherium Skin
27737.description: The short-haired hide of a giant odd-toed ungulate.

27738.name: Smilodon Leather
27738.description: A large piece of cured smilodon skin.

27739.name: Green Glider Leather
27739.description: A large piece of cured green glider skin.

27740.name: Atrociraptor Leather
27740.description: A large piece of cured atrociraptor skin.

27741.name: Zonure Leather
27741.description: A large piece of cured zonure skin.

27742.name: Sea Swallow Leather
27742.description: A large piece of cured sea swallow skin.

27743.name: Chalicotherium Leather
27743.description: A large piece of cured chalicotherium skin.

27744.name: Multifaceted Alumen
27744.description: This all-in-one alumen, refined and modified in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, is used to tan and deodorize hides.

27745.name: Bright Linen Cloth
27745.description: Several yalms of undyed white fabric.

27746.name: Bright Linen Yarn
27746.description: Sturdy yarn spun from bright linen.

27747.name: Bright Flax
27747.description: This flowering plant, hardy enough to grow in harsh climes, has a stalk that can be used in the spinning of a naturally white yarn.

27748.name: Iridescent Silk
27748.description: Not only does this fabric have a lustrous sheen, it also shimmers with hints of myriad colors.

27749.name: Iridescent Silk Thread
27749.description: Shimmering thread spun from iridescent cocoons.

27750.name: Iridescent Cocoon
27750.description: This worm-spun cocoon reflects a rainbow's worth of colors in the light.

27751.name: Pixie Cotton
27751.description: A soft fabric woven from pixie floss.

27753.name: Pixie Floss Boll
27753.description: The brilliantly white flower of an unusual variety of cotton plant.

27754.name: Ovim Wool
27754.description: Resilient fabric woven with the hair of the mountain-dwelling ovim.

27755.name: Ovim Wool Yarn
27755.description: Coarse yarn spun from ovim fleece.

27756.name: Ovim Fleece
27756.description: Long, lustrous hair shorn from an ovim.

27757.name: Dwarven Cotton
27757.description: This thick-yet-supple variety of cotton is the traditional cloth of the dwarven people─which makes it the best cloth, as far as said people are concerned.

27758.name: Dwarven Cotton Thread
27758.description: Versatile thread spun from dwarven cotton bolls.

27759.name: Dwarven Cotton Boll
27759.description: Flowers of the coincidentally short-stalked dwarven cotton plant are used by the people bearing the same name to create everything from undergarments to beards.

27760.name: Ethereal Silk
27760.description: This sheen of this oft-sought, rarely found silk is at once both foreign and familiar.

27761.name: Ethereal Cocoon
27761.description: As difficult to lay hands upon as bubbles on the water, from these cocoons can be spun a rare type of silk.

27762.name: Multifaceted Cotton Cloth
27762.description: This multi-purpose cloth, created through collaborative efforts by the Mean's various facets, is soft, supple, and durable.

27763.name: Hoptrap Leaf
27763.description: The thin, twitching leaf of a hoptrap.

27764.name: Silkmoth Scales
27764.description: The powdery scales of a silkmoth's wing.

27765.name: Growth Formula Iota
27765.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

27766.name: Enchanted Truegold Ink
27766.description: Ink fortified with truegold sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

27767.name: Grade 1 Strength Alkahest
27767.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27768.name: Grade 1 Dexterity Alkahest
27768.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27769.name: Grade 1 Vitality Alkahest
27769.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27770.name: Grade 1 Intelligence Alkahest
27770.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27771.name: Grade 1 Mind Alkahest
27771.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27772.name: Enchanted Manasilver Ink
27772.description: Ink fortified with manasilver sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

27773.name: Vampire Cup Vine
27773.description: The thick, leathery vine of a vampire cup.

27774.name: Vampire Vine Sap
27774.description: Sap harvested from the vampire vine─thankfully not the color of blood.

27775.name: Starch Glue
27775.description: An adhesive substance created by boiling down assorted plant matter.

27776.name: Extra Effervescent Water
27776.description: Naturally sparkling water bottled at the source. Do not shake before opening.

27777.name: Refined Natron
27777.description: A pure white powder with no trace of impurity. Used in alchemy as a deodorizer and leavening agent.

27778.name: Growth Formula Kappa
27778.description: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

27779.name: Sweet Alyssum
27779.description: This plant that blooms with myriad tiny flowers smelling of honey.

27780.name: Fernleaf Lavender
27780.description: A fragrant herb with notched leaves.

27781.name: Enchanted Dimythrite Ink
27781.description: Ink fortified with dimythrite sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

27782.name: Underground Spring Water
27782.description: Clear, sweet water bottled at its subterranean source.

27783.name: Lime Basil
27783.description: A herb that smells strongly of citrus.

27784.name: Tiger Lily
27784.description: A variety of tall-growing lily, the bulbs of which can be used in various medicines.

27785.name: Light Gerbera
27785.description: A type of gerbera named for its bright white flowers.

27786.name: Tincture of Strength
27786.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases strength for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27787.name: Tincture of Dexterity
27787.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases dexterity for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27788.name: Tincture of Vitality
27788.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases vitality for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27789.name: Tincture of Intelligence
27789.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases intelligence for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27790.name: Tincture of Mind
27790.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases mind for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27791.name: Grade 2 Strength Alkahest
27791.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27792.name: Grade 2 Dexterity Alkahest
27792.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27793.name: Grade 2 Vitality Alkahest
27793.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27794.name: Grade 2 Intelligence Alkahest
27794.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27795.name: Grade 2 Mind Alkahest
27795.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

27796.name: Multifaceted Alchemic
27796.description: This alchemical concoction, created through collaborative efforts by the Mean's various facets, can be put to myriad uses─not all of them safe or recommended.

27797.name: Lorikeet Down
27797.description: Soft plumes plucked from a lorikeet.

27798.name: Island Wolf Fang
27798.description: A sharp canine tooth that once belonged to an island wolf.

27799.name: Cubus Flesh
27799.description: Not only does this flesh have an unpleasant texture, it also smells horrendous.

27800.name: Hydrozoan Umbrella
27800.description: The soft, gelatinous body of a hydrozoan.

27801.name: Hard Mudstone
27801.description: A particularly dense stone comprised of layers of river silt compressed down over thousands of generations.

27802.name: Hard Mudstone Whetstone
27802.description: A hard stone for sharpening tools made of metal or...less hard stone.

27803.name: Volcanic Tuff
27803.description: Volcanic ash compacted by pressure and time into firm stone.

27804.name: Tuff Whetstone
27804.description: A volcanic stone used for sharpening tools.

27805.name: Gale Rock
27805.description: As the name suggests, this variety of stone is more strongly aspected than typical wind rock.

27806.name: Solarite
27806.description: A deceptively plain stone that, when cracked, momentarily erupts with bright light.

27807.name: Shade Quartz
27807.description: Several small pieces of dark unpolished quartz.

27808.name: White Clay
27808.description: Crumbly balls of white clay added to soil to improve both moisture retention and drainage.

27809.name: Sweet Marjoram
27809.description: A herb cultivated for both its medicinal uses and pleasant fragrance.

27810.name: Bog Sage
27810.description: The azure flowers of this plant brighten the landscape when in bloom, but its true value is in its leaves.

27811.name: Chiaroglow Aethersand
27811.description: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter.

27812.name: Scuroglow Aethersand
27812.description: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter.

27813.name: Agedeep Aethersand
27813.description: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

27814.name: Agewood Aethersand
27814.description: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

27815.name: Ageflow Aethersand
27815.description: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

27816.name: White Oak Branch
27816.description: The thick branch of a white oak tree.

27817.name: Yellow Alumen
27817.description: A more colorful version of the typically white mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides.

27818.name: Purple Carrot
27818.description: A dark purple root vegetable with a reddish stalk, differing somewhat in vitamin content from the orange carrot.

27819.name: Harcot
27819.description: A particularly fragrant variety of apricot.

27820.name: Frantoio
27820.description: This olive cultivar can be used to produce a large amount of high-quality cooking oil.

27821.name: Amber Cloves
27821.description: This sweet spice made from the dried floral buds is used both as flavoring and in essential oils.

27822.name: Russet Popoto
27822.description: An easy-to-peel variety of popoto with thin skin and a high starch content.

27823.name: Curly Parsley
27823.description: This fancifully frilly parsley has an unobtrusive flavor that makes it perfect for use in otherwise bland dishes or as a garnish.

27824.name: Garden Beet
27824.description: This common root vegetable doubles as a source of inexpensive sugar.

27825.name: Blood Tomato
27825.description: The slight acidity of this bright tomato is guaranteed to whet one's appetite, making it a long-standing favorite of tavern owners throughout Norvrandt.

27826.name: Royal Grapes
27826.description: The flavor of these cultivated grapes has been intensified using a special bacteria. Though unpleasant to eat whole, they are suitable for juicing and fermentation.

27827.name: Night Pepper
27827.description: A dark aromatic spice used in cooking as well as pickling.

27829.name: Creamtop Mushroom
27829.description: A bulbous white mushroom that grows wild in forests.

27830.name: Bomba Rice
27830.description: This short-grain rice is more absorbant than other varieties and does not clump together when cooked.

27831.name: Pixie Apple
27831.description: A powerfully sweet variety of apple.

27832.name: Upland Wheat
27832.description: This staple grain was grown at high elevation.

27833.name: Broad Beans
27833.description: These large, spring green beans are easy to cultivate, and have served as a staple food for millennia.

27834.name: Gianthive Chip
27834.description: A normal-sized piece of a massive hive created by a giant honey bee swarm.

27835.name: Lemonette
27835.description: A tiny lemon replete with sour juice.

27836.name: Peppermint
27836.description: This refreshing herb is suitable for use in cooking, essential oils, and tea.

27837.name: Coffee Beans
27837.description: Beans that, with some effort, will become grounds suitable for brewing fragrant coffee.

27838.name: Frantoio Oil
27838.description: Oil extracted from frantoio olives, suitable for cooking and certain medicinal concoctions.

27839.name: Garden Beet Sugar
27839.description: A sweetener made by boiling down the juice extracted from garden beets.

27840.name: Squid Ink
27840.description: This sticky, stygian liquid─decidedly an acquired taste─was harvested from a spearhead squid.

27842.name: Golden Honey
27842.description: This shimmering, pure-gold honey comes courtesy of the giant honey bee.

27843.name: Night Vinegar
27843.description: A high-quality distilled vinegar made from royal grapes.

27844.name: King Salmon
27844.description: King salmon, able to reach more than twice the size of their cousins, are so scarce that only a select group of dedicated fishers have been granted permission to catch and keep them.

27845.name: Robe Lettuce
27845.description: So named for its supposed resemblance to a faerie tale sorcerer's robes, this variety of lettuce grows at altitude and is known for its crisp leaves.

27846.name: Kriollo Kukuru Bean
27846.description: This variety of kukuru bean is hard to cultivate, and therefore coveted by gourmands─regardless of how little difference to the taste of the end product it actually makes.

27847.name: Pixieberry
27847.description: A dainty, capricious variety of fruit─one can never quite be sure whether any given berry will be mild, sweet, or tart.

27848.name: Dzo Tenderloin
27848.description: A superior carving of meat from a carefully raised domestic dzo.

27849.name: Sheep Casings
27849.description: Intestine casings for use in cooking.

27850.name: Rail Tenderloin
27850.description: A lean piece of meat stripped from an island rail.

27851.name: Lorikeet Egg
27851.description: The delicate egg of the rainbow lorikeet.

27852.name: Ovim Meat
27852.description: A large, marbled slab of meat cut from the loin of a mountain-dwelling ovim.

27853.name: Grilled Rail
27853.description: The succulent tenderloin of an island rail, seared to savory perfection and garnished with garlic and rock salt. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27854.name: Purple Carrot Juice
27854.description: A hearty and healthful beverage prepared from the pulp of purple carrots and pixie apples. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27855.name: Caramels
27855.description: Beet sugar, melted butter, and cream are blended, then chilled and molded to form these bite-sized chewy candies. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27856.name: Broad Bean Soup
27856.description: A rich, flavorful soup of stewed broad beans and juicy chunks of rail meat. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27857.name: Spaghetti al Nero
27857.description: A tangy dish of thin noodles tossed with squid ink and blood tomato sauce that has the unfortunate side effect of turning your teeth jet black. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27858.name: Broad Bean Salad
27858.description: This nourishing salad of broad beans, purple carrots, and lettuce is dressed lightly with frantoio oil and parsley. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27859.name: Grilled Platinum Bream
27859.description: A single platinum bream, seasoned simply with rock salt and grilled to a golden brown to seal in all the juices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27860.name: Baguette
27860.description: This rustic loaf of bread exudes the appetizing aroma of upland wheat. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27861.name: Blood Tomato Juice
27861.description: Ripe, pulpy tomatoes have been crushed and mixed with fresh fruit juice to create this blood red beverage. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27862.name: Pixie Apple Pie
27862.description: A flaky, buttery crust surrounds a sweet compote of stewed pixie apples flavored with a hint of cinnamon. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27863.name: Nut Bake
27863.description: A veritable sackful of luscious seeds and nuts went into this sweet and tasty pastry. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27864.name: Blood Tomato Salad
27864.description: The dark vinegar topping this salad draws out the flavors of each fresh vegetable without overpowering them. Unless you have poured too much on, that is. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27865.name: Mushroom Saute
27865.description: The rich, creamy texture of this dish comes not from the hearty creamtop mushrooms, but from the specially selected butter in which they have been cooked to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27866.name: Sausage Links
27866.description: Though this is a surprisingly difficult dish to master, as the casings that hold in the rich blend of flavors can easily split during cooking, the resulting greasy, salty links are well worth the effort─particularly if said effort is someone else's. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27867.name: Roast Ovim
27867.description: A carefully presented selection of the finest ovim cutlets, accompanied with a serving of popotoes and a delicately seasoned sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27868.name: Mushroom Skewer
27868.description: The creamtop mushrooms take center stage in this simple yet filling dish, though the blood tomatoes and ramhorn zucchinis perform admirably in supporting roles. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27869.name: Baked Megapiranha
27869.description: The fearsome megapiranha makes for a succulent main course, served with a delightfully simple butter sauce. Better to eat a piranha than be eaten by one. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27870.name: Peppered Popotoes
27870.description: A pleasing plate of popotoes peppered and prepared to perfection, playing pleasurably on the palate. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27871.name: Popotoes au Gratin
27871.description: Though the wonderfully flavorsome russet popotoes are undoubtedly the star attraction, it is arguably the cream cheese that steals the show with its distinctive flavor. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27872.name: Masala Chai
27872.description: The Coerthan tea leaves may provide the base, but it's the cinnamon and Amber cloves that add the signature sweet and aromatic flavor to this traditional beverage. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27873.name: Risotto al Nero
27873.description: While the squid ink may give this dish a somewhat outlandish appearance, the other ingredients are remarkably simple, and the various flavors combine beautifully to create an unforgettable culinary experience that must be tasted to be believed. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27874.name: Espresso con Panna
27874.description: The surprising addition of sour cream may catch some off guard, but they will invariably be won over by the subtle harmonies of this rich blend. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27875.name: Mist Spinach Saute
27875.description: Fresh, flavorful mist spinach tossed in creamy butter until tender, topped with a drizzle of vinegar. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27876.name: Blood Bouillabaisse
27876.description: A rich stew of sweet shellfish steeped with spices in a thick tomato-based broth. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27877.name: Paella
27877.description: A hearty dish of seafood and rice infused with spices and enriched by a hint of wood smoke from the open fire over which it was cooked. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27878.name: Coffee Biscuit
27878.description: A buttery biscuit with a subtle coffee flavor. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27879.name: Ovim Cordon Bleu
27879.description: An indulgent meal of tender ovim meat wrapped around gooey cheese, battered and panfried in oil to give it its crispy, golden brown shell. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27880.name: Lemonade
27880.description: An incomparably refreshing blend of sour lemonette juice and sweet golden honey. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27881.name: Jellied Harcot
27881.description: A chilled dessert of sweet harcot boiled with sugar and mixed with gelatin to give it a pleasing texture. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27882.name: Oysters on the Half Shell
27882.description: A large plate of delectable raw sweetflesh oysters paired with refreshing lemon slices. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27883.name: Creamy Salmon Pasta
27883.description: Filling homemade pasta topped with tender, flaky salmon and fresh spinach, all smothered in a rich, creamy sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27884.name: King Salmon Meuniere
27884.description: A fillet of soft, delectable salmon coated in flour and fried in rich butter comprises this simple-yet-indulgent dish. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27885.name: Popoto Salad
27885.description: A creamy side dish of eggs, colorful vegetables, and hearty russet popotoes. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27886.name: Robe Lettuce Salad
27886.description: Fresh, crisp robe lettuce garnished with a drizzle of delectable frantoio oil. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27887.name: Pixieberry Tea
27887.description: A perfectly steeped cup of aromatic, sweet-and-tart tea. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27888.name: Pixieberry Cheesecake
27888.description: Rich, indulgent cheesecake swirled through with a ribbon of sweet pixieberry sauce. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27889.name: Kukuru Rusk
27889.description: The slightly bitter notes in the kukuru butter used to make this crisp bread give it its distinctive mellow sweetness. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27890.name: Lemon Curd Sachertorte
27890.description: A rich cake of indulgent chocolate accented with the perfect amount of tart lemon curd. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27891.name: Rare Roast Beef
27891.description: The finest quality dzo, seared lightly to add a note of smokiness to the still-bleeding meat's naturally savory flavor, and topped with a drizzle of salty au jus. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27892.name: Exquisite Beef Stew
27892.description: Tender, juicy chunks of savory dzo and hearty popoto simmered in a thick, comforting broth. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

27893.description: Music roll for The Dark Which Illuminates the World. Use to add to your orchestrion list.
