27918.description: Music roll for Insatiable. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

27921.name: Faded Copy of What Angel Wakes Me
27921.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for What Angel Wakes Me.

27922.name: Faded Copy of Insanity
27922.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Insanity.

27951.name: Dancing Wing
27951.description: A gossamer fae wing, liberated from its owner in the Dancing Plague.

27952.name: Immaculate Wingblade
27952.description: A lethal-looking piece of one of the Lightwarden Innocence's wings.

27953.name: Fine Glass Fiber
27953.description: This incredibly thinly spun glass is well suited to enhancing water resistance.

27954.name: Coarse Saltpeter
27954.description: A translucent crystalline substance often used in making glass, firesand, and dyes.

27955.name: Crimson Firesand
27955.description: The use of coarse saltpeter makes this flammable powder slightly more volatile than normal firesand.

27957.name: Competent Craftsman's Syrup
27957.description: This thick medicinal concoction is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

27958.name: Commanding Craftsman's Syrup
27958.description: This thick medicinal concoction is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

27959.name: Cunning Craftsman's Syrup
27959.description: This thick medicinal concoction is believed to improve crafting efficiency. Duration: 15m

27960.name: Superior Spiritbond Potion
27960.description: This medicinal concoction greatly enhances the rate at which your equipment gains spiritbond. Duration: 180m

27968.name: Highland Spring Water
27968.description: Mineral-rich water bottled at its high-elevation source.

27974.name: Steer Hide
27974.description: A large piece of thick and durable steer hide.

27975.name: Indigo Cloth
27975.description: This fabric makes clothing both durable and difficult to notice dirt and stains upon. ...Not that anyone is advising never washing your trousers, mind you.

27976.name: Fireglass Leather
27976.description: A piece of cured leather with a sheen so glossy it's nearly reflective.

27977.name: Enchanted Elm Lumber
27977.description: A cutting of wizened elm, processed into smooth lumber by magic.

27986.name: Titania Barding
27986.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the pixie king Titania.

27987.name: Innocence Barding
27987.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the Lightwarden Innocence.

27994.name: Nightworld Silver Piece
27994.description:
Currency minted long before the Flood. Whatever design its face may have once borne is now entirely lost to time.

Exchangeable for gil.

27995.name: Grade 2 Tincture of Strength
27995.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases strength for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27996.name: Grade 2 Tincture of Dexterity
27996.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases dexterity for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27997.name: Grade 2 Tincture of Vitality
27997.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases vitality for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27998.name: Grade 2 Tincture of Intelligence
27998.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases intelligence for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

27999.name: Grade 2 Tincture of Mind
27999.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases mind for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

28061.name: Blinding Indigo Orchestrion Roll
28061.description: Music roll for Blinding Indigo. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28062.name: Nightworld Bronze Piece
28062.description:
Currency minted long before the Flood. Whatever design its face may have once borne is now entirely lost to time.

Exchangeable for gil.

28065.name: Loose Pendant
28065.description:
A king among Crystarium tetra, and lord of the waters that flow through the Crystarium Personal Suites.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28066.name: Winged Dame
28066.description:
A queen among Eulmore butterflies, and lady of the waters that surround the Derelicts.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28067.name: The Unforgiven
28067.description:
A king among albino rock crabs, and lord of the waters of the great lake known as the Source.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28068.name: Bronze Sole
28068.description:
A king among sepia sole, and lord of the waters of Sharptongue Drip.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28069.name: The Horned King
28069.description:
A king among hornhelms, and lord of the River of Sand.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

28070.name: The Sound of Fury
28070.description:
A king among wild red betta, and lord of the waters of Longmirror Lake.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28071.name: Priest of Yx'Lokwa
28071.description:
A high priest among eryops, and lord of the waters of Lake Tusi Mek'ta.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

28072.name: Starchaser
28072.description:
A king among stargazers, and lord of the waters of Purpure.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28124.name: Dhalmel Whistle
28124.description: This appropriately lengthy wind pipe calls a dhalmel loping to your side.

28125.name: Albino Karakul Horn
28125.description: This horn of carved...horn emits a tone to which your albino karakul is well attuned.

28126.name: Eulmoran Inner Wall
28126.description: A deep scarlet interior wall with a slightly rough texture for those estate owners who wish to recreate the opulence of Eulmore.

28127.name: Eulmoran Marble Flooring
28127.description: Smooth, elegant floor tiling made of deep green marble.

28128.name: Eulmoran Chandelier
28128.description: A bright and elegant ceiling light identical to those found throughout Eulmore.

28131.name: Indoor Oriental Garden
28131.description: A miniaturized version of a traditional Far Eastern garden, complete with stone bridge, bamboo, and deer scarer.

28132.name: Oriental Chawan-mushi Lunch
28132.description: A piping hot bowl of the classic Far Eastern dish, with a wealth of vegetables and other delicious ingredients hiding within the egg custard. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Spell Speed Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

28133.name: Oasis Wall-mounted Fountain
28133.description: A wall-mounted fountain that sends water tumbling into the decorative dish below, reminiscent of the desert abodes found throughout Thanalan.

28134.name: Flooring Mat
28134.description: A large, square mat made from long wooden planks, perfect for decorating interior floors. It can be dyed in a variety of colors to match any sort of décor.

28136.name: Golden Ewer
28136.description: A decorative metallic ewer that will bring a touch of decadence to any interior.

28137.name: Dishware
28137.description: A full set of dishes, washed and all.

28139.name: Imitation Long Window
28139.description: Its size and ability to illuminate your abode despite merely being mounted on your wall are sure to impress your guests.

28140.name: Imposing Ishgardian Shelf
28140.description: An exceedingly large frame that is so heavy it must be placed on the floor, rather than mounted on a wall. It features a striking image of Ishgard, so true to life that you can almost feel an icy chill exuding from the painting.

28141.name: Stuffed Hraesvelgr
28141.description: As few homeowners have the space to accommodate a member of the first brood, this stuffed version of Hraesvelgr has been created especially for those who enjoy the sensation of an ancient dragon observing their every move.

28142.name: Misplaced Mog Slippers
28142.description: These delightful slippers can be placed─or misplaced─almost anywhere inside your home, allowing you to enjoy gazing at a prize pair of pom-poms whenever you please.

28143.name: Basket of Flowers
28143.description: A simple basket of blooms that will work wonders in brightening up your home, despite not requiring a great deal of space.

28144.name: Hades Trophy
28144.description: An ominous reminder of an unforgettable encounter with Hades, featuring a hefty base and ever-ominous purple aura.

28145.name: Ale Tap
28145.description: Despite being able to be placed on top of almost any interior surface, it is capable of producing a stream of delicious ale whenever you please.

28146.name: Allagan Tomestone of Frivolity
28146.description: While this particular tomestone does not appear to have any function whatsoever, it does add a dash of Allagan style to your interior. Be careful where you place it, however, as it will be even more useless if you accidentally step on it.

28147.name: Tabletop Hat Stand
28147.description: Comes complete with its own orange, wide-brimmed hat, which unfortunately appears to be stuck to the stand with rather strong adhesive.

28148.name: Vanity Mirror
28148.description: This gold-framed mirror reflects your true self. Your true self apparently glows in a rather unsettling fashion.

28149.name: Necklace Display Stand
28149.description: This stand can be placed on almost any surface, though it is only capable of displaying one type of necklace, which cannot be removed.

28150.name: Empty Boxes
28150.description: Though they take up rather a lot of floor space, this pile of boxes gives the impression that you have a host of admirers willing to shower you with gifts─which is surely more than worth the increased difficulty of walking through your home.

28151.name: Set of Liquor Bottles
28151.description: Having a comprehensive selection of unopened drinks is a sign of good taste and restraint. These seven bottles of varying colors and sizes will add a touch of class wherever you place them, except for beside your bed, perhaps.

28154.name: Log Partition
28154.description: A partition designed in the style of a rustic cottage, reaching to the ceiling and so sturdy it may as well be a wall.

28160.name: Vegetable Garden
28160.description: An enormous patch of soil for growing vegetables, complete with a selection of verdant crops.

28161.name: Cedar Tree
28161.description: A towering cedar tree that retains its vibrant green throughout the year.

28162.name: Armorer's Stall
28162.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at armorer whenever the mood takes you.

28163.name: Weaponsmith's Stall
28163.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at weaponsmith whenever the mood takes you.

28164.name: Jeweler's Stall
28164.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at jeweler whenever the mood takes you.

28165.name: Florist's Stall
28165.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at florist whenever the mood takes you.

28166.name: Baker's Stall
28166.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at baker whenever the mood takes you.

28167.name: Fruiterer's Stall
28167.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at fruiterer whenever the mood takes you.

28168.name: Greengrocer's Stall
28168.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at greengrocer whenever the mood takes you.

28169.name: Bookseller's Stall
28169.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at bookseller whenever the mood takes you.

28170.name: Enchanter's Stall
28170.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at enchanter whenever the mood takes you.

28171.name: Butcher's Stall
28171.description: Place this stall in your garden to play at butcher whenever the mood takes you.

28172.name: Trader's Cottage Walls
28172.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a trader's shop.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

28173.name: Trader's House Walls
28173.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a trader's shop.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

28174.name: Trader's Mansion Walls
28174.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a trader's shop.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

28175.name: Campanula Seeds
28175.description:
These seeds grow into what are commonly known as “bellflowers,” which are said to be edible. Good to know if one were to find oneself with a lack of victuals but an abundance of these dainty blooms.

※For use in planters.

28176.name: Red Campanulas
28176.description:
A bunch of red campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28177.name: Blue Campanulas
28177.description:
A bunch of blue campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28178.name: Yellow Campanulas
28178.description:
A bunch of yellow campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28179.name: Green Campanulas
28179.description:
A bunch of green campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28180.name: Orange Campanulas
28180.description:
A bunch of orange campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28181.name: Purple Campanulas
28181.description:
A bunch of purple campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28182.name: White Campanulas
28182.description:
A bunch of white campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28183.name: Black Campanulas
28183.description:
A bunch of black campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28184.name: Rainbow Campanulas
28184.description:
A bunch of multicolored campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28612.name: Ballroom Etiquette - The Winsome Wallflower
28612.description: An illustrated not-quite-instruction manual that is nevertheless instructive in warding off potential dance partners─and looking good doing so. Use to learn the /lean emote.

28615.name: Modern Aesthetics - Modern Legend
28615.description:
The realm's premier publication on beauty and fashion, this specific copy of Modern Aesthetics covers, in detail, techniques on styling oneself to resemble the hero of the world's oldest fable.

Use to unlock a new hairstyle at the aesthetician.
Unavailable to Viera and Hrothgar.

28616.name: Hades Barding
28616.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to commemorate Hades.

28618.name: Bacon Bits
28618.description:
Tastes like bacon...if bacon and clay taste the same to you.

Use item to acquire the bacon bits minion.

28620.name: Mystic Weapon
28620.description:
Only slightly cursed.

Use item to acquire the mystic weapon minion.

28621.name: Meerkat
28621.description:
Keeps an eye out for danger while basking in the sun.

Use item to acquire the meerkat minion.

28622.name: Miniature White Knight
28622.description:
Aids in the purging of sickness. Or not.

Use item to acquire the miniature white knight minion.

28624.name: Domakin
28624.description:
Close, but not a warrior with the body of a mortal and soul of a dragon.

Use item to acquire the domakin minion.

28626.name: Little Leannan
28626.description:
Doesn't see you as food. Yet.

Use item to acquire the little leannan minion.

28627.name: Wind-up Hobgoblin
28627.description:
Crafted in the likeness of your mother...or so certain dwarves would say.

Use item to acquire the wind-up hobgoblin minion.

28628.name: Cerberpup
28628.description:
With three wet little noses and three sets of adorable staring eyes, what's not to love? Aside from all of the teeth, obviously.

Use item to acquire the Cerberpup minion.

28631.name: Hades's Auracite
28631.description: A small chip of the auracite in which Hades was sealed. May you keep it close, and ever remember.

28634.name: Metal Spinner
28634.description: This particularly clever invention relies on a fish's natural tendency to snag its face on spinning, jagged objects.

28635.name: Greatwood Planter
28635.description: Botanists would no doubt be fascinated and confused in equal measure by this inexplicably effervescent potted plant.

28637.name: Lakeland Chair
28637.description: A chair in the classical elven style.

28638.name: Lakeland Table
28638.description: A table in the classical elven style.

28639.name: Leather Sofa
28639.description: This sofa is so luxurious that you will never want to get up─and nor will you be able to on those particularly warm days when your skin practically fuses to it.

28642.name: Wooden Deck
28642.description: A large, rectangular section of wooden decking, complete with low fences, flower baskets, and a table laid with tea for two.

28663.name: Painting of the Rotunda
28663.description: A painting of the Rotunda based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28664.name: Painting of Musica Universalis
28664.description: A painting of Musica Universalis based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28700.description: A painting of Lozatl's Conquest based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28701.description: A painting of Fanow based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28703.description: A painting of the Ondo Cups based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28704.name: Painting of the Workbench
28704.description: A painting of the Workbench based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28705.name: Painting of Where the Dry Return
28705.description: A painting of Where the Dry Return based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28706.name: Painting of Purpure
28706.description: A painting of Purpure based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28707.name: Painting of Amaurot
28707.description: A painting of Amaurot based off notes compiled from your sightseeing log.

28714.name: Alumina Whetstone
28714.description: A whestone carved from alumina. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

28715.name: Pliable Glass Fiber
28715.description: This thinly spun glass is remarkably resistant to breakage, even when handled by a particularly clumsy craftsman.

28716.name: Sandalwood Sap
28716.description: A partially congealed ball of sticky sap extracted from a sandalwood tree.

28717.name: Beryllium Ore
28717.description: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal beryllium.

28718.name: Sublime Solution
28718.description: Whatever it does, it does it sublimely.

28719.name: Sweetmeat Mussel
28719.description:
A variety of mussel with coloring so stygian that it appears almost to have been steeped in shadow. A mussel of darkness, if you will.
...Become what you mussel.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28720.name: Mejillones al Ajillo
28720.description: A sumptuous serving of delectable mussels smothered in an oily garlic sauce, each one a perfectly bite-sized burst of flavor. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

28721.name: Arros Negre
28721.description: Though the squid ink makes for an unusual appearance, its contribution to this dish's flavor profile is undeniable─ it blends with several herbs and spices to complement the buttery mussels and hearty rice for an immensely satisfying culinary experience. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

28724.name: Crafter's Delineation
28724.description: A detailed outline of complex crafting techniques. One delineation is consumed when using the Careful Observation specialist action.

28765.name: Skybuilders' Yew Log
28765.description: The distinct lack of trees is one of many problems the first people to settle in Ishgard chose to ignore, making this otherwise commonplace material─sourced from the East Shroud─extremely valuable.

28766.name: Skybuilders' Iron Ore
28766.description: While this may look much like any other iron ore found in middle La Noscea, there are subtle differences that only an expert in the field will recognize. The name, for one, is considerably longer.

28767.name: Skybuilders' Fine Sand
28767.description: This sand gathered in central Thanalan is not only fine, but extremely well behaved, choosing to stay in one closely knit lump while jostling alongside the rest of your possessions.

28768.name: Skybuilders' Hemp
28768.description: Though this hardy plant can grow almost anywhere, the snow-blasted precipices of Ishgard have so far proven too steep a challenge for it to overcome. This particular specimen was harvested in lower La Noscea, an environment far more conducive to plant life─or any sort of life, for that matter.

28769.name: Skybuilders' Ash Log
28769.description: Ash! A-Ah! Savior of the Firmament!♪

28770.name: Skybuilders' Rock Salt
28770.description: Although upper La Noscea seems rather a distant location from which to source something as simple as salt, the Ishgardians are nothing if not particular in their tastes.

28771.name: Skybuilders' Electrum Ore
28771.description: The electrum ore found in upper La Noscea is believed to be far better suited to the skybuilders' needs than any other variety. Were anyone to ask them why, they would, in most cases be met with a response along the line of, “Because it just is.”

28772.name: Skybuilders' Iron Sand
28772.description: The tradition of measuring powdered substances in units of “pinches” has been the cause of many arguments, largely due to differences in finger size between the various races. Folk in eastern Thanalan, where this sample was gathered, have been known to ask Lalafells to measure when selling, and Roegadyn when buying, for obvious reasons.

28773.name: Skybuilders' Flax
28773.description: It is a well known fact among botanists that the flax in the South Shroud is superior to every other kind, for reasons far too complicated and boring for anyone else to care about.

28774.name: Skybuilders' Spring Water
28774.description: Having only traveled the relatively short distance from the Coerthas central highlands to Ishgard, this spring water is still remarkably fresh, though the icy chill threatens to freeze it inside the bottle.

28775.name: Skybuilders' Camphorwood Log
28775.description: Few members of the mortal races are equipped to make the perilous journey to the Churning Mists, and those who do normally hope to have more than a log or two to show for their troubles.

28776.name: Skybuilders' Straw
28776.description: Why the skybuilders would specify that their straw be brought from the Dravanian forelands is anyone's guess. Perhaps the smell helps their chocobos sleep more peacefully?

28777.name: Skybuilders' Hardsilver Ore
28777.description: The time spent mining this ore in the Dravanian hinterlands would perhaps have seemed less arduous if you had the faintest idea how the skybuilders plan to use it.

28778.name: Skybuilders' Mythrite Sand
28778.description: You have a sneaking suspicion that you may have lost some of the sand during the return journey from the Sea of Clouds, though the amount you have in your possession should still suffice.

28779.name: Skybuilders' Tea Leaves
28779.description: The thought of happy skybuilders drinking delicious tea was the only motivation you needed as you risked life and limb gathering these leaves in the Sea of Clouds.

28780.name: Skybuilders' Dravanian Spring Water
28780.description: There are easier places to collect spring water than the Dravanian forelands, though it seems your personal safety is not especially high on the skybuilders' list of concerns.

28781.name: Skybuilders' Urunday Log
28781.description: Compared to most places in Gyr Abania, the Peaks has more than its fair share of trees, so who would object to you taking a few logs? Bloodthirsty Qiqirn and rampaging ruud suuds, that's who. Or perhaps they just see you as an easy meal?

28782.name: Skybuilders' Nightsteel Ore
28782.description: The Ruby Sea is not especially well known as a prime location for mining, though those who are nautically minded can uncover all sorts of rare and unique treasures. Whether the skybuilders choose to turn this into fine jewelry or something more mundane, like a tea strainer, remains to be seen.

28783.name: Skybuilders' Adder
28783.description: Venomous snakes are something of a rarity in Ishgard, so the skybuilders have ordered that some be delivered from the Azim Steppe to help improve morale. Workers displaying a lack of enthusiasm will be given some time in “the pit” to rediscover their commitment to the cause.

28784.name: Skybuilders' Molybdenum Ore
28784.description: While the Lochs are better known as a source of salt, the rich veins of ore are drawing in miners from far and wide.

28785.name: Skybuilders' Horsetail
28785.description: Yanxia is rich in both flora and fauna, and horsetail forms a major part of the diet of many grazing creatures.

28786.name: Skybuilders' Ala Mhigan Rock Salt
28786.description: When an Ishgardian culinarian stated that her latest dish needed a pinch of salt, the skybuilders sought out the very best, though perhaps more than a single pinch would be required to make the lengthy journey to the Lochs worthwhile.

28787.name: Skybuilders' Ruby Sea Water
28787.description: While water from the Ruby Sea may not sound particularly appealing, this was actually brought from a small freshwater spring on one of the surrounding islands. Drinking this is unlikely to result in life-threatening dehydration.

28788.name: Skybuilders' Durium Sand
28788.description: A pinch of anything tends not to be an awful lot, though this particular sand from the Azim Steppe is apparently worth more than its weight in gold.

28789.name: Skybuilders' Vine
28789.description: Quite why a particular type of vine that can only be found in the Azim Steppe is necessary to the skybuilders' plans has yet to be explained. Perhaps they are planning to surprise you with a work of surpassing genius? Or perhaps not.

28790.name: Skybuilders' White Ash Log
28790.description: Obviously, none of the skybuilders has even heard of the Rak'tika Greatwood, though the specific qualities they seek in their timber can most easily be found in the white ash trees that grow there.

28791.name: Skybuilders' Reef Rock
28791.description: If a porous rock from the bottom of the ocean is required in the rebuilding of Ishgard, then so be it. Your job is to mine, not question the reasoning behind such dubious demands.

28792.name: Skybuilders' Truegold Ore
28792.description: Why submit a boring chunk of gold ore when you can bring one all the way from Il Mheg instead?

28793.name: Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
28793.description: This cotton must be very special indeed for you to bring it all the way from Lakeland in the First. You can only hope that the skybuilders appreciate you going the extra malm. And traveling to another world.

28794.name: Skybuilders' Dawn Lizard
28794.description: One day, this poor lizard is chasing other, smaller scurrying creatures across the desert plains of Amh Araeng, and the next, it is being transported to another world and dragged lashing and kicking to Ishgard. The chances of the cold-blooded scalekin being content in its frozen new surroundings are slim at best, and you can only hope that the skybuilders are grateful to you for supplying a miserable and motionless lizard.

28795.name: Skybuilders' Wheat
28795.description: Were the other contributors to hear that you traveled to Amh Araeng in the First simply to procure wheat, they would think you are just trying to show off.

28796.name: Skybuilders' Truegold Sand
28796.description: The isle of Kholusia is known by the inhabitants of Norvrandt to have the very finest of gold sand. Whether this is up to the impossibly high standards of the skybuilders will only become apparent when it is submitted for inspection.

28797.name: Skybuilders' Highland Spring Water
28797.description: Any water gathered from Il Mheg is likely to have been enchanted by either the pixies or the Fuath, though that is a problem for the skybuilders, not you, to worry about.

28798.name: Skybuilders' Resin
28798.description: Thankfully, the resin appears to have suffered no ill effects during your return from the Rak'tika Greatwood, meaning that it is still a gelatinous blob with seemingly no practical application whatsoever.

28878.description: Music roll for Knowledge Never Sleeps. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28879.name: Masquerade Orchestrion Roll
28879.description: Music roll for Masquerade. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28884.description: Music roll for A Hopeless Race. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28888.description: Music roll for The Grand Cosmos. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28890.description: Music roll for A Fierce Air Forceth. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28891.name: A Fine Air Forbiddeth Orchestrion Roll
28891.description: Music roll for A Fine Air Forbiddeth. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28893.name: Safety in Numbers Orchestrion Roll
28893.description: Music roll for Safety in Numbers. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28895.name: City Ruins (Rays of Light) Orchestrion Roll
28895.description: Music roll for City Ruins (Rays of Light). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28896.name: The Sound of the End Orchestrion Roll
28896.description: Music roll for The Sound of the End. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28898.name: Alien Manifestation Orchestrion Roll
28898.description: Music roll for Alien Manifestation. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28899.name: Song of the Ancients (Atonement) Orchestrion Roll
28899.description: Music roll for Song of the Ancients (Atonement). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28900.name: Bipolar Nightmare Orchestrion Roll
28900.description: Music roll for Bipolar Nightmare. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28901.name: Weight of the World (Prelude Version) Orchestrion Roll
28901.description: Music roll for Weight of the World (Prelude Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

28904.name: Faded Copy of Invincible
28904.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Hades's theme, Invincible.

28905.name: Shell Leather
28905.description: A particularly glossy and durable variety of leather, the production of which is no mean feat.

28906.name: Skysteel Ingot
28906.description: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this block of metal. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to see around corners.

28907.name: Skysteel Leather
28907.description: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this piece of leather. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to hear sounds before they are made.

28908.name: Skysteel Cloth
28908.description: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this bolt of cloth. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to smell a person's thoughts from a malm away.

28909.name: Skybuilders' Cocoon
28909.description: While there seems to be an endless supply of these in Yanxia, why anyone would actually want them is unclear. They have a taste to match their appearance, in other words, revolting.

28910.name: Skybuilders' Sea Salt
28910.description: The ocean depths are dark and full of horrors... But also, rather a good location to harvest salt. Just watch out for the horrors.

28916.name: Skybuilders' Toad
28916.description: What is worse than being born a toad? Being born a toad and then carried against your wishes from your home in western Thanalan to icy Ishgard, where if you don't freeze to death, are likely to be chopped up and boiled in a pot. That is what is worse. Much worse, in fact.

28917.name: Ufiti Horn
28917.description: A horn that emits a primal sound that summons forth your hulking ufiti.

28925.name: The Jaws of Undeath
28925.description:
A king among vicejaws, and lord of the waters of the Isle of Ken (one notable exception aside).

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

28926.name: White Ronso
28926.description:
A king among zebra catfish, and lord of the waters of lower Watts River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28927.name: Ambling Caltrop
28927.description:
A king among thorned lizards, and lord of the Hills of Amber.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

28928.name: Fae Rainbow
28928.description:
A capricious queen among spotted blue-eyes, and lady of the waters of the Jealous One.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28929.name: Black Jet
28929.description:
A king among black tri-stars, and lord of the waters of the Lozatl.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28930.name: Ondo Sigh
28930.description:
A king among bubble anglers, and lord of the waters of the Flounders' Floor.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28931.name: Small Angler's Canvas
28931.description: A tiny blank canvas on which an ink print of some aquatic creature or another might be rendered, complete with frame.

28932.name: Medium Angler's Canvas
28932.description: A modest blank canvas on which an ink print of some aquatic creature or another might be rendered, complete with frame.

28933.name: Large Angler's Canvas
28933.description: A robust blank canvas on which an ink print of some aquatic creature or another might be rendered, complete with frame.

28934.name: Extra Large Angler's Canvas
28934.description: An imposing blank canvas on which an ink print of a truly enormous aquatic creature might be rendered, complete with frame.

28937.name: Galadion Goby
28937.description:
Amateur anglers are advised to familiarize themselves with the difference between the Merlthor and Galadion gobies as early as possible, as devotees of both varieties tend to become rather heated when one is (understandably) mistaken for the other.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28938.name: Galadion Chovy
28938.description:
“What makes a Galadion chovy distinct from other Lominsan anchovies?” Depends on who's asking.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28939.name: Rosy Bream
28939.description:
The sunset coloring of these inhabitants of Galadion Bay makes them just as appealing to other predators as to anglers, leaving them somewhat beleaguered as a rule.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28940.name: Tripod Fish
28940.description:
Many a seafarer has lain awake contemplating the cursed knowledge that, as its name implies, this fish can indeed stand on its fins. 

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

28941.name: Sunfly
28941.description:
A brightly colored fish that swims merrily through the Strait of Merlthor...or did.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

28942.name: Tarnished Shark
28942.description:
Like a long-neglected antique, perhaps this shark just needs some love to become the perfect addition to afternoon tea parties. Alas, no one has yet volunteered to be the first to find out.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

28947.name: Hyacinth Bulbs
28947.description:
Each bulb is the nascent and substantially more hideous form of the many-flowered hyacinth.

※For use in planters.

28948.name: Red Hyacinths
28948.description:
A bunch of red hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28949.name: Blue Hyacinths
28949.description:
A bunch of blue hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28950.name: Yellow Hyacinths
28950.description:
A bunch of yellow hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28951.name: Green Hyacinths
28951.description:
A bunch of green hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28952.name: Orange Hyacinths
28952.description:
A bunch of orange hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28953.name: Purple Hyacinths
28953.description:
A bunch of purple hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28954.name: White Hyacinths
28954.description:
A bunch of white hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28955.name: Black Hyacinths
28955.description:
A bunch of black hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28956.name: Rainbow Hyacinths
28956.description:
A bunch of multicolored hyacinths, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

28957.name: Half-timbered Cottage Walls
28957.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a quaint mercantile establishment.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

28958.name: Half-timbered House Walls
28958.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a quaint mercantile establishment.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

28959.name: Half-timbered Mansion Walls
28959.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to transform their estate into a quaint mercantile establishment.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

28960.name: Rough Stone Interior Wall
28960.description: An imposing interior wall of haphazardly arranged hunks of stone.

28961.name: Rough Stone Flooring
28961.description: Unpolished flagstone─for everyone's favorite seedy tavern ambience.

28962.name: Wooden Chandelier
28962.description: Ideal for swinging on with roguish grace─though do try not to burn the place down.

28963.name: Moogle Round Table
28963.description: A charmingly rustic wooden table, attended by a trio of musical (though unmoving) moogles.

28964.name: Modern Mogseat
28964.description: Those who sit in this chair may be unable to get up again, but consider─will they really need to?

28965.name: Cosmetics Box
28965.description: This enormous case is replete with enough paints and powders to satisfy an entire Eorzean theater troupe─or one Eulmoran dame.

28967.name: Wine Rack
28967.description: Nice vintage you've got there. Be a shame if someone were to...quaff it.

28968.name: Rope Stanchion
28968.description: A set of velvety ropes for your queue management needs.

28970.name: Dish Rack
28970.description: A spacious box in which to dry dishware, with accompanying mat for glasses.

28971.name: Garment Rack
28971.description: Featuring the latest in Ishgardian fashion...which is generally traditional Ishgardian fashion.

28972.name: Amaurot Wall Lamp
28972.description: A metallic fixture of the sort popular in the Amaurot of Emet-Selch's recollection.

28973.name: Manor Dressing Table
28973.description: A haunting dressing table custom-made for Haukke Manor. ...In retrospect, Lady Amandine wasn't very subtle about the whole voidsent issue.

28974.name: Cheese Collection
28974.description: Why in the gods' name would a person amass such an amount of cheese? A peculiar obsession? A craving that transcends all reason? Some manner of cheese-related divination known only to a forbidden sect? Whatever the reason, one can only hope that the results are still saleable.

28975.name: Oldrose Wall Planter
28975.description: A riot of vibrant red and pale pink blooms within this quaint wall-mounted box.

28976.name: Folded Futon
28976.description: Put it away─quick, before the guests see!

28977.name: The Bismarck
28977.description: Impressive enough to bear the name of Limsa's premier culinary establishment as its own, this is the sort of sandwich one eats off of a nice plate. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Tenacity Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

28978.name: Devil's Salad Bowl
28978.description: A pleasant mix of crisp greens topped by satisfying and zesty deviled eggs. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

28979.name: Lord Commander Portrait
28979.description: A commissioned portrait of Ser Aymeric entitled The Scion of House Borel. Original artist unknown.

28980.name: Golden Crystal Boule
28980.description: A mounted sample of the luminous yellow crystals that grow uninhibited on the sea floor.

28981.name: Cosmos Partition
28981.description: A partition design to evoke the grandeur and magnificence of the Grand Cosmos.

28982.name: Wooden Table
28982.description: Now there is one less tree in the woods, and one more table in your room.

28983.name: Picnic Basket
28983.description: Includes everything required for a sunlit meal in the outdoors.

28984.name: First Chair's Trumpet
28984.description: Designed in homage to a legendary trumpeter, its majesty may someday inspire someone to finally pick up that instrument they have been meaning to learn.

28985.name: Sunflower Bouquet
28985.description: A bouquet sure to brighten any room it is in.

28986.name: Cutting Board
28986.description: Perfect for cutting all manner of vegetables on. Also suitable for placing already cut vegetables on.

28987.name: Open Book
28987.description: Opened to the page revealing the most impressively wordy words entirely by accident.

28988.name: Milk Carton
28988.description: A paper milk carton, fortunately lacking an illustration of someone's face on the side.

28989.name: Azure Dragoon Portrait
28989.description: A commissioned portrait of Ser Estinien entitled simply Azure. Original artist unknown.

28990.name: Cosmos Decoration
28990.description: Be transported to the majestic Grand Cosmos without stepping foot from your room.

28991.name: Used Banquet Table
28991.description: There's no telling how many banquets have been eaten off of this table.

28992.name: Steppe Bed
28992.description: Sleep as soundly as the nomadic peoples of the Azim Steppe do.

28994.name: Ruby Weapon Bust
28994.description:
The heart of this Garlond Ironworks scale replica of a select portion of the Ruby Weapon pulsates menacingly. Accept no substitutes.

※One per estate only.

28995.name: Apron Rack
28995.description: Every literally or figuratively butterfingered chef needs a good apron or two.

28998.name: Dohn Trellis
28998.description: Make even the fae jealous with this trellis, designed to evoke the verdant splendor of Dohn Mheg.

28999.name: Lakeland Elf Tree
28999.description: Elf trees are in such high demand that some are grown for the express purpose of being cut down and sold.

29000.name: Lakeland Flower Garden
29000.description: Lakeland's most arresting flowers right in your own home.

29401.name: Ruby Plating
29401.description: A hunk of crimson metal torn from the Ruby Weapon.

29402.name: Ruby Barding
29402.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble the Ruby Weapon.

29403.name: Machinist Barding
29403.description: Chocobo barding designed to pair well with machinist's garb.

29492.name: Grade 3 Tincture of Strength
29492.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases strength for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

29493.name: Grade 3 Tincture of Dexterity
29493.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases dexterity for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

29494.name: Grade 3 Tincture of Vitality
29494.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases vitality for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

29495.name: Grade 3 Tincture of Intelligence
29495.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases intelligence for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

29496.name: Grade 3 Tincture of Mind
29496.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases mind for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

29497.name: Ovim Meatballs
29497.description: Savory, round chunks of minced ovim meat accented with a lingonberry sauce that's sweet yet tart. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29498.name: Mors
29498.description: A traditional beverage brewed from the extract of fermented lingonberries. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29499.name: Lemon Waffle
29499.description: Crispy on the outside and moist on the inside, this baked delight with a distinctive texture has a slight hint of citrus. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29500.name: Honey Croissant
29500.description: A flaky, decadent pastry sweetened with rich, golden honey. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29501.name: Sausage and Sauerkraut
29501.description: Aromatic, herb-seasoned meat and pickled cabbage come together in a mouthwatering combination. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29502.name: Stuffed Highland Cabbage
29502.description: This traditional dish of minced meat seasoned and packed inside leafy highland cabbage, then stewed in a light broth, is sure to warm you up on the coldest of nights. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29503.name: Pickled Herring
29503.description: Succulent chunks of platinum herring marinated in vinegar and topped with finely sliced lemonette to give it a hint of tang. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29504.name: Herring Pie
29504.description: Chunks of seasoned herring baked into a flaky crust that's been shaped like a fish so as to inform the eater to expect savory instead of sweet. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29505.name: Farmer's Breakfast
29505.description: This simple-yet-delightful dish of popotoes and lightly scrambled eggs will fill you up before a day of tilling the fields. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29506.name: Silkie Pudding
29506.description: The distinctively smooth texture and rich taste of this lightly sweet, boiled dessert will have your mouth watering. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

29507.name: Lingonberry
29507.description: Plump, ripe, and bursting with flavor. Perfect for jams and sweet treats.

29508.name: Strong Flour
29508.description: While there may be nothing particularly strong about it in its present state, the difference soon becomes clear when using it to bake bread.

29509.name: Highland Cabbage
29509.description: Some particularly hardy Highlanders have been seen to grasp a cabbage in one hand and take great bites from it, though this is not recommended.

29510.name: Platinum Herring
29510.description: Other than the rather fancy name, this species is extraordinarily ordinary.

29511.name: Silkie Egg
29511.description: The breed of chicken that lays these eggs is known for its incredibly voluminous plumage. The eggs, on the other hand, are entirely indistinguishable from that of any other chicken.

29661.name: Oddly Specific Petrified Log
29661.description: Whence this fossilized wood is sourced is for Skysteel engineers to specify, and you to never find out.

29662.name: Oddly Specific Iron Sand
29662.description: It is unclear what precise qualities make this particular sort of granulated metal so desirable, but presumably the old blacksmiths' adage, “Don't get iron sand in your eye. Seriously. Don't,” still applies, so probably best not look too closely.

29663.name: Oddly Specific Iron Ore
29663.description: Not your granddad's iron ore. Or perhaps specifically your granddad's iron ore. Who's to say?

29664.name: Oddly Specific Uncut Gemstone
29664.description: A mineral chunk of the precise luster, color, cleavage, and lumpiness requested.

29665.name: Oddly Specific Skin
29665.description: Someone knows what sort of skin this is, and really, isn't that what matters?

29666.name: Oddly Specific Cotton
29666.description: If cotton's fluffiness were rated on a scale of one to one thousand, which it absolutely is not─by anyone other than Nimie, at any rate─this would rate exactly nine hundred and eighty-seven.

29667.name: Oddly Specific Quartz
29667.description: If you look really, really, really close, you can see the difference between this and the sort of quartz that can be bought from a street urchin for a single shiny gil. Maybe.

29668.name: Oddly Specific Seeds
29668.description: These seeds have been closely inspected for quality. And other things.

29680.name: Mahogany Aqueduct
29680.description: Reliable and stylish irrigation well suited to residential properties.

29681.name: Crystallized Coral
29681.description: This crystallized mass of coral matches almost any color scheme one could imagine.

29682.name: White Screen
29682.description: That this screen always maintains its sterling whiteness speaks to the quality of its construction.

29683.name: Siphon Coffee Brewer
29683.description: Many a connoisseur have sworn off all other methods of making coffee after trying a single sip of a cup made with this one.

29684.name: Fat Cat Wall Chronometer
29684.description: This convenient timekeeping device will always remind you when it is time to eat─unless, of course, it is time for your pets to eat, in which case you will be repeatedly reminded long before you have the chance to consult your timepiece.

29685.name: Bomb Cauldron
29685.description: Crafted with painstaking attention to detail, put this cauldron in any room to terrify guests and pets alike.

29686.name: Ronkan Rocking Chair
29686.description: A rocking chair representing Ronkan resourcefulness and resilience.

29687.name: Brick Garden Wall
29687.description: A portion of brick wall that would complement nearly any garden, be it full of flowers or full of more subdued plant life.

29714.name: Ragworm
29714.description:
A marine worm that slithers about in the rocks dotting the ocean floor. Effective for luring small fish.

※Only for use in Ocean Fishing.

29715.name: Krill
29715.description:
A species of krill commonly found in the Rhotano Sea. Effective for luring medium-sized fish.

※Only for use in Ocean Fishing.

29716.name: Plump Worm
29716.description:
A species of worm that grows fat on the nutrients swirling about in the currents of the Rhotano Sea. Effective for luring large fish.

※Only for use in Ocean Fishing.

29717.name: Versatile Lure
29717.description: A lure developed by the Fishermen's Guild specifically for novice anglers. Can be used on land or at sea.

29718.name: Tossed Dagger
29718.description:
Often seen skimming the waves, shimmering like a blade in flight.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29719.name: Jasperhead
29719.description:
Sought for the gemlike objects that form in their stomachs, not in their heads, as the name might suggest.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29720.name: Merlthor Lobster
29720.description:
As ubiquitous as they are delicious. A staple of seafood cuisine across Eorzea.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29721.name: Heavenswimmer
29721.description:
Easily spotted from afar due to their bright coloration, although sightings in the oceans surrounding Eorzea are scarce due to their unusual migratory patterns.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29722.name: Ghoul Barracuda
29722.description:
Despite its considerable size, this ocean-dweller chooses to feast on the flesh of the dead rather than expend effort pursuing live prey.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29723.name: Leopard Eel
29723.description:
As per its namesake, it occupies a position fairly close to the top of the food chain, but is still forced to flee from larger and more dangerous predators.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29724.name: Marine Bomb
29724.description:
Known more for its tendency to explode with rage in a figurative sense rather than a literal one, as its name might suggest.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29725.name: Momora Mora
29725.description:
Unlike the Lalafell from whom its name derives, this ocean-drifter is far from diminutive.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29726.name: Merlthor Butterfly
29726.description:
Highly sought by aquarium owners for its vivid coloration, this increasingly rare species is arguably worth its weight in gold.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29727.name: Gladius
29727.description:
A fish named after a sword─or was the sword named after the fish?

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29728.name: Rhotano Wahoo
29728.description:
Though it seems harmless enough at first glance, this fish has been rendered all but inedible by its highly poisonous diet. The taste is said to be exquisite by those brave enough to try it, however.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29729.name: Rhotano Sardine
29729.description:
Usually seen traveling in large schools, these rather plain fish possess the group mentality of a flock of sheep─that is, to follow whoever is in front and, lacking that, just keep moving forward until something with big teeth appears. Then all hells break loose.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29730.name: Deep Plaice
29730.description:
The name provides a useful hint as to the areas of the ocean this creature usually inhabits.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29731.name: Crimson Monkfish
29731.description:
An angler never forgets the first time they reel in one of these deep-sea demons, no matter how hard they try.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29732.name: Lampfish
29732.description:
Sought more for its roe than its meat. Thankfully its lack of muscular mass in comparison to the size of its body makes for an easy catch.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29733.name: Ogre Eel
29733.description:
Even when it finds itself dangling from an angler's line, its only thought is to consume as much flesh as possible, which causes many a fisher to cast it back into the sea in sheer panic.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29734.name: Cyan Octopus
29734.description:
Hunted for the copious amounts of ink it produces, the vast majority of which is spilled upon its capture. As a result, anglers with bright blue hands are a common sight around Galadion Bay.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29735.name: Chrome Hammerhead
29735.description:
Differentiated from similar species by its unique coloration, which gives it a certain metallic sheen.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29736.name: Floefish
29736.description:
This small, almost entirely defenseless fish forms an important link in the food chain─one quite near to the bottom.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29737.name: Megasquid
29737.description:
One does not earn a name like “megasquid” by being small and unassuming, which this aquatic abomination certainly is not.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29738.name: Oschon's Stone
29738.description:
Seemingly living up to its namesake, this heavy and largely immobile wavekin spends most of its life on the ocean floor. It feeds by opening its mouth and waiting for curious prey to swim inside. 

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29739.name: La Noscean Jelly
29739.description:
It was named as part of a movement to expunge the word “fish” from “jellyfish,” for reasons pertaining to consistency and accuracy, although this has met with little success thus far.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29740.name: Shaggy Seadragon
29740.description:
Almost indistinguishable in appearance from the seaweed on which it feeds. It must take care not to overeat and thereby destroy its own hiding place from predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29741.name: Net Crawler
29741.description:
Unlike most crabs, the main source of edible meat is found in the legs. The torso is often discarded as it mostly consists of hard gristle and unappetizing...matter.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29742.name: Dark Nautilus
29742.description:
Known for its ability to survive on aether alone, researchers are willing to part with huge sums of gil for live samples.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29743.name: Elder Dinichthys
29743.description:
Swims about the Strait of Merlthor as though it owns the place─a claim which few of the other inhabitants are in any position to dispute.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29744.name: Drunkfish
29744.description:
If you had a face like this, you'd look sad, too.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29745.name: Little Leviathan
29745.description:
Even a greatly scaled-down (pun very much intended) version of the Lord of the Whorl is more than a match for all but the most experienced fishers.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29746.name: Sabaton
29746.description:
Strangely for a mollusk, its body is covered in hard scales in addition to the more common shell. Many predators will steer clear of them simply because they are a bother to eat.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29747.name: Shooting Star
29747.description:
One's chances of seeing an actual shooting star are greater than that of being able to observe one of these rare wavekin in its natural habitat.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29748.name: Hammerclaw
29748.description:
While most wavekin object quite strongly to being caught on a hook, these crustaceans make life especially difficult for anglers in retaliation. If they are not pinching fingers, they are flailing wildly with their heavy claws, both of which most fishers should and do go to great lengths to avoid.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29749.name: Heavenskey
29749.description:
Due to being highly poisonous, it is believed to send those who eat of its flesh to the heavens. Compared to the seven hells, this may prove a more desirable destination.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29750.name: Ghost Shark
29750.description:
According to certain sources, it is able to appear spontaneously from any body of water. Such stories, however, are probably best ignored.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29751.name: Quicksilver Blade
29751.description:
While there may be larger and deadlier wavekin roaming the oceans, few can claim to be as hideous as this aberration of nature.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29752.name: Navigator's Print
29752.description:
This denizen of the deep can proudly claim to take its name from a goddess, even if the tale behind it does involve being stepped on by said goddess.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29753.name: Casket Oyster
29753.description:
While there are several theories surrounding the origin of its name, the general consensus is that it is as hard to open as a casket that has been nailed shut. However, it is nothing a brief spell in a pot of boiling water cannot solve.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29754.name: Fishmonger
29754.description:
Known for its habit of seeking out a variety of fish, though unlike its namesake, these are purely for its own consumption.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29755.name: Mythril Sovereign
29755.description:
Known for its beautifully shimmering scales, which are in contrast to its rather lackluster meat.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29756.name: Nimble Dancer
29756.description:
Coveted by keepers of exotic fish for the mesmerizing manner in which its trailing fins catch the light.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29757.name: Sea Nettle
29757.description:
Not the most welcome of catches, as it tends to deliver a nasty sting to those whose hands wander too close.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29758.name: Great Grandmarlin
29758.description:
More often than not, this hulking yet deceptively quick wavekin escapes the angler's hook, usually by severing the line with its blade-like bill.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29759.name: Shipwreck's Sail
29759.description:
This wavekin is so broad and flat that it has been compared to the sail of a ship left to float on the tide. In actuality, it is waiting for sea birds to pick the parasites from its flanks.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29760.name: Azeyma's Sleeve
29760.description:
Many artist's impressions of Azeyma depict Her with flowing, bell-adorned sleeves, not unlike the elegant silhouette of this wavekin.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29761.name: Hi-aetherlouse
29761.description:
An aetherially charged wavekin that has a habit of appearing when one least expects or wants it.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29762.name: Floating Saucer
29762.description:
Far less welcome at a mess hall table than an actual saucer, as these odd creatures taste rather like a sailor's subligar. Apparently.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29763.name: Aetheric Seadragon
29763.description:
Framed in fabulous frond-like fins, this ferocious fish frequently frightens off foes who would fight for its feed.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29764.name: Coral Seadragon
29764.description:
Dedicates its life to looking─and behaving─as much like coral as possible.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29765.name: Roguesaurus
29765.description:
Named after the river rather than the traditional Lominsan profession. Those unfortunate enough to encounter one will testify that to describe it as roguish would be an understatement, and that “murderous,” “man-eating,” and “malevolent” would all be more applicable adjectives.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

29766.name: Merman's Mane
29766.description:
Though the existence of mermen is much debated, if any were to exist, they would no doubt object to the comparisons drawn between their long locks and the tentacles of this grotesque cephalopod.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29767.name: Sweeper
29767.description:
Its habit of moving its head from side to side while searching the seabed for food has earned it this unusual moniker.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29768.name: Silencer
29768.description:
While technically edible, it is not without side effects. Temporary loss of speech being the most noticeable, though there may be others that are harder to detect.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29769.name: Deep-sea Eel
29769.description:
As may be inferred from the less-than-spectacular name, this eel resides in the sea. The deep part.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29770.name: Executioner
29770.description:
Goes out of its way to make life as difficult as possible for those who enter its territory, including sawing holes in hulls and tearing through nets.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

29771.name: Wild Urchin
29771.description:
A creamy center encased in horrendously sharp spines. Only those who acquire the knack of eating one without impaling themselves can acquire the decidedly acquired taste.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29772.name: True Barramundi
29772.description:
This slow-moving, ponderous wavekin manages to avoid the attention of predators by being so unremarkable as to hardly warrant attention in the first place.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29773.name: Mopbeard
29773.description:
Lifting it above the waterline causes it to transform from an elegant oceanic beauty to something resembling...well, a mop.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29774.name: Slipsnail
29774.description:
While it may seem harmless enough, it has a nasty surprise in store for unwitting predators.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29775.name: Aronnax
29775.description:
Its remarkable speed is matched only by its unfathomable clumsiness, the combination of which often leads it straight into the waiting nets of fishers.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29776.name: Coccosteus
29776.description:
Revered by the Sahagin and reviled by practically everyone else. Its proclivity for biting fingers means that most who catch one end up wishing they hadn't.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29777.name: Bartholomew the Chopper
29777.description:
Suspected by some to be the reincarnation of an unhinged murderer, although it is also known to have a more amiable side. Well, about as amiable as one can expect from a wavekin that revels in killing.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29778.name: Prowler
29778.description:
While the word “prowl” may suggest the slow, deliberate movement of one tracking its prey, this particular wavekin is simply slow by nature, mainly as a result of sheer indolence.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29779.name: Charlatan Survivor
29779.description:
At first glance, the charlatan survivor may appear to be a well-armored crustacean, but the outer shell is merely a purloined disguise concealing a much smaller creature beneath. Luckily, predatory wavekin are quite easily deceived and often choose to leave it alone in order to pursue less chitinous prey.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29780.name: Prodigal Son
29780.description:
Rather than follow the standard migratory patterns of his brethren, this wandering wavekin swims to the beat of his own drum, and comes and goes as he pleases.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29781.name: Gugrusaurus
29781.description:
Spends most of its life attempting to slaughter anything and everything that it catches sight of. Considering the ample opportunities to practice such skills, it has become rather good at it.

[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

29782.name: Funnel Shark
29782.description:
Its gaping maw draws in all manner of ocean life, along with a range of less-than-edible objects.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

29783.name: The Fallen One
29783.description:
Believed by some to have descended from the heavens, and judging by the way it nervously flits about the ocean, it wishes it could return to whence it came. Few wavekin look less comfortable in their habitat than this unfortunate creature.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29784.name: Spectral Megalodon
29784.description:
Due to the fact that most of its prey are petrified upon catching sight of this ominously glowing predator, it has rather an easy time finding a steady supply of food.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on extra large canvases.]

29785.name: Spectral Discus
29785.description:
This aetherially infused wavekin gathers rather a lot of unwanted attention, and it has no natural defenses to fend off curious predators.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

29786.name: Spectral Sea Bo
29786.description:
Its strange blue glow seems to have done wonders for its self-confidence, and it can be seen doing the underwater variation of strutting like a peacock...or whatever the chocobo equivalent of a peacock is.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

29787.name: Spectral Bass
29787.description:
This most ordinary of fish has become rather extraordinary thanks to being bathed in otherworldly aether, giving it a fetching blue tinge.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

29840.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Switch
29840.description:
A sharp rap across the back of the thigh in the cold, crisp Ishgardian morning air with one of these light and flexible branches is a surefire way to blow away the proverbial cobwebs of any workers caught yawning.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

29841.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Hemp
29841.description:
One can only hope that whatever purpose the skybuilders have in mind for this hardy plant was worth depriving some herbivorous creature of its leafy goodness.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

29842.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Ore
29842.description:
Something of a mixed bag of metallic elements, but as everyone knows, smithies love a good surprise. Just not when they're swinging a hammer dangerously close to their fingers.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

29843.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Copper Sand
29843.description:
A special place in one of the seven hells exists for those who attempt to fob off the skybuilders by mixing in regular sand with the copper, or so the skybuilders would have one believe.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

29844.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Maple Log
29844.description:
The sap slowly leaking from the logs tends to attract ants, which even the skybuilders have yet to find a use for. This may come as a surprise considering the plethora of bizarre items they request, and it may only be a matter of time until some bright spark invents ant sandwiches.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29845.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Maple Sap
29845.description:
Any insect foolhardy enough to attempt sampling its delight will invariably find itself trapped within this glutinous substance, preserved for future generations to study and possibly experiment on. Still, there are worse ways to go than being enveloped in one's favorite sweet treat.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29846.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Flax
29846.description:
Included in a surprising number of recipes and concoctions despite its only notable property being “it smells nice.”

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29847.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Zinc Ore
29847.description:
Zinc is said to prevent a number of common ailments. However, it must be noted that attempting to ingest it in its current state may actually cause problems such as broken teeth and stomachache, usually in that order.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29848.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Rock Salt
29848.description:
There are few dishes that cannot be improved with a sprinkling of salt. Strangely, this even includes a number of desserts, which flies in the face of all common logic.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29849.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Iron Sand
29849.description:
In the event that one somehow accidentally mixes this with normal sand, the two can be separated by waving a magnet nearby. This knowledge may─or more likely, may not─save your life one day.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

29850.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Teak Log
29850.description:
Although such logs are the perfect material for fashioning rafts and canoes, the distinctly frozen bodies of water that surround Ishgard scupper the locals' chances of enjoying the pleasures of boating.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29851.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Mistletoe
29851.description:
Any ancient myths describing darts made from a sprig of mistletoe neglect to mention the fact that when thrown, it displays the airborne grace of a drunken, one-winged chicken.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29852.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Beehive
29852.description:
A bee colony will often respond to the presence of intruders by swarming their intended target and using their own body heat to cook it alive. The skybuilders have discovered that this can be utilized to keep their hands warm, although the fact that said bees are still very much capable of stinging does present a minor flaw in this otherwise brilliant idea.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29853.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Straw
29853.description:
In some parts of Eorzea, straw is used to weave hats with wide peaks to keep the sun from the wearer's eyes. Fortunately─or perhaps unfortunately─for Ishgardians, there is seldom enough sunlight to warrant such headwear, and the vicious winds would prevent the owner from remaining behatted for more than a few scant moments.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29854.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Tea Leaves
29854.description:
For Ishgardians, discussing the virtues of various blends of tea is almost as much of a pastime as actually drinking the stuff. This fine selection of choice leaves could be placed in the center of a table to serve to facilitate stimulating conversation, while the skybuilders continue to labor away in the bitter cold outside.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29855.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Cobalt Ore
29855.description:
A lot less blue than one might expect, although it tastes about right.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29856.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Pigment
29856.description:
While some of the skybuilders were in favor of naming this substance “purple stuff,” the need to follow a more sensible naming convention eventually prevailed.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29857.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Asphaltum
29857.description:
Plans to use this sticky, black substance to cover the streets of Ishgard were vehemently opposed, as it would ruin the uniformly grey aesthetic─which on most days includes the sky itself.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29858.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Mythril Sand
29858.description:
The bright hue of this valuable substance does make it stand out from the surrounding rocks and so forth, but only under the condition that one is able to find the damnable stuff in the first place.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29859.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Mica
29859.description:
“Mica” would make rather a nice name for a person, if it were not already taken by this rather unremarkable rock.

Used in level 60 crafting recipes.

29860.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Oak Log
29860.description:
The tiny acorn that grew into this mighty oak had its life cut tragically short by the cruel axe of a woodsman (or possibly woodslady). If there is any justice in the world, it will be born anew as a nice dresser or an attractive hat stand.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29861.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Feather
29861.description:
While even Ishgard's finest ornithologist would be hard-pressed to identify the bird from which this came, one thing is certain: there are more where this came from, unless said bird only ever possessed a single feather.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29862.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Vine
29862.description:
Careless owners of high-walled castles in faerie tales often allow these to grow over said walls, thereby allowing dashing heroes to infiltrate the premises to steal jewels, damsels in distress, scones from the pantry, and so forth.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29863.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Toad
29863.description:
One skybuilder was heard to claim that to assign grades to living creatures is degrading. The response was, “No, taking the grade away from it would be called degrading.”

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29864.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Barbgrass
29864.description:
According to local legend, a night raid on a Temple Knights encampment was foiled when the assailants wandered into a patch of barbgrass. Nothing gives the game away quite like pained squeals of, “Oh, my poor bottom!”

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29865.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Mythrite Ore
29865.description:
Due to the fact it is almost identical in appearance to mythril ore, it is sometimes known as “fool's mythril.” Conversely, actual mythril is often referred to as “fool's mythrite.”

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29866.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Spring Water
29866.description:
Despite the potentially misleading name, it can also be collected in summer and autumn. Winter, however, is generally out of the question, for obvious reasons.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29867.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Alumen
29867.description:
Were the skybuilders less exacting in their demands, the standard alumen found in market stalls across Eorzea would be more than sufficient. Many volunteers suspect that such tasks are set merely to test their patience.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29868.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Rock
29868.description:
If you think this rock is uninteresting, you should see the grade 1 skybuilders' rock, which is so plain that it can blend into any background by virtue of its sheer dullness.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29869.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Silex
29869.description:
The name makes it sound far more sinister than it actually is.

Used in level 70 crafting recipes.

29870.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Walnut Log
29870.description:
Think of all the walnuts that could have grown on this tree had it not been cut down! Walnuts for breakfast, walnuts for elevenses, walnuts for luncheon... The possibilities were endless.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29871.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Resin
29871.description:
Resin this pure, this beautiful is far too good for the skybuilders. Perhaps you should keep it all to yourself. They need never know.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29872.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Wheat
29872.description:
There is a possibility that some grade 1 wheat slipped in by mistake.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29873.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
29873.description:
One of the skybuilder's children asked, “Is this what sheep are made from?” The answer was a resounding, “I'm not sure. Possibly.”

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29874.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Adder
29874.description:
Venomous, but not fatally so. Perfect for practical jokes and party tricks.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29875.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Darksteel Ore
29875.description:
