Has the potential to be made into something very scary indeed, like spiked pauldrons or an enormous battleaxe. In all likelihood, however, it will probably become a slightly extravagant kettle or decorative letter opener.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29876.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Crystal-clear Rock Salt
29876.description:
With a name that long, one might be forgiven for expecting it to be some sort of miraculous super-salt, capable of turning even the blandest dish into a festival of flavor. Sadly, this is not the case, although it is nonetheless rather good as far as salt goes.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29877.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Cloud Drop Water
29877.description:
Most people realize “cloud drop” is just a fancy way to say “rain.” Not many customers would be willing to pay for mere rainwater, but cloud drop water, on the other hand...

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29878.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Lutinite
29878.description:
Said to be blessed by cloud spirits, which may or may not be a good thing. Still, “blessed” is infinitely preferable to “cursed.”

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29879.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Basalt
29879.description:
Basalt actually has very little in common with salt, despite its name being approximately two-thirds the same.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

29880.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Log
29880.description:
As the skybuilders prefer to use wooden planks of standardized dimensions, this log is already cut to be exactly the length they require, to minimize the carpenters' workload. One can only hope they appreciate the extra effort by throwing a few more scrips your way.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29881.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Hardened Sap
29881.description:
Although the practical applications of a piece of hardened sap are somewhat unclear, it is at least considerably less sticky than unhardened sap, which helps to keep it free of impurities such as loose hairs, bits of pocket fluff, and so on.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29882.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Wheat
29882.description:
What about this wheat makes it artisanal? Those in the know claim it is massaged daily and fed beer, which is the reason for the delicious marbled texture. Or perhaps they were talking about some sort of cow?

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29883.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
29883.description:
To the untrained eye, this may appear to be no different from any other cotton boll. Those with trained eyes, however, will notice that it is pink, not the usual white.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29884.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Dawn Lizard
29884.description:
Those wondering what separates this from a non-artisanal dawn lizard need only observe the way it devours its prey. For a carnivorous, slavering scalekin, it has the most impeccable table manners, or more precisely, “blood-spattered patch of ground manners.”

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29885.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cloudstone
29885.description:
Believed to be a piece of fossilized cloud.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29886.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Rock Salt
29886.description:
It seems there are almost as many varieties of rock salt as there are varieties of rock, if the skybuilders' somewhat arbitrary system of assigning names is to be believed.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29887.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Spring Water
29887.description:
Rather than simply being free of impurities, this water actually possesses the ability to preemptively destroy any impurities that dare to come near it. As such, only those pure of heart can drink of it without being killed instantly, or so it is rumored.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29888.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Aurum Regis Sand
29888.description:
One of the few substances known to be both edible and highly explosive. While some spicy ingredients are said to be capable of blowing one's head off, in this case, it is no exaggeration.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29889.name: Approved Grade 2 Artisanal Skybuilders' Jade
29889.description:
In the Brume, to be “jaded” means to have a large piece of jade thrown at the back of one's head. Thankfully, the prohibitive pricing of this precious substance means that such incidents are rare.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29890.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Umbral Galewood Log
29890.description:
Carried on raging winds, charged with potent aether. Probably the most powerful log in existence.

Can only be gathered during an umbral tempest.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29891.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Umbral Earthcap
29891.description:
Charged with aether drawn from the earth. In actual fact, most mushrooms possess some earth-aspected aether, but this particular species is especially greedy.

Can only be gathered during an umbral duststorm.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29892.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Umbral Flarestone
29892.description:
Red-hot to the touch, which makes it a bastard to carry.

Can only be gathered during an umbral flare.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29893.name: Approved Grade 2 Skybuilders' Umbral Levinshard
29893.description:
If you thought catching lightning in a bottle was difficult, catching it in a crystal fragment is even trickier. At least a bottle comes with a handy cap to keep in said lightning when caught, whereas crystal relies on nothing more than the bolt's willing cooperation.

Can only be gathered during umbral levin.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

29958.name: Cobalt Alloy Ingot
29958.description: An ingot of smelted cobalt alloy.

29961.name: Duskcourt Cloth
29961.description: Finely woven cloth with that distinctive duskbloom hue that says, “wealthier than you.”

29962.name: Megalania Leather
29962.description: A large piece of cured megalania skin.

29963.name: Grade 3 Strength Alkahest
29963.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

29964.name: Grade 3 Dexterity Alkahest
29964.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

29965.name: Grade 3 Vitality Alkahest
29965.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

29966.name: Grade 3 Intelligence Alkahest
29966.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

29967.name: Grade 3 Mind Alkahest
29967.description: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

29968.name: Fireheart Cobalt
29968.description: Seasoned miners will recognize this as a type of sulfide, its composition lending its surface a permanent sheen that makes it look like a glowing ember in the light.

29969.name: Dwarven Chromite
29969.description: This ore has a high concentration of naturally occurring chrome─which is presumably why dwarves will under no circumstances divulge where veins of it might be found.

29970.name: Purpure Shell Chip
29970.description: A shiny piece of Purpure carapace.

29971.name: Workbench Resin
29971.description: Grenoldt's signature resin─whether the result of one of his more inspired moments or creative dry spells, no one can say.

29972.name: Merbau Log
29972.description: A rough-cut log of merbau timber, bearing the wood's distinctive scent.

29973.name: Tempest Adhesive
29973.description: Another of Grenoldt's creations. Probably best not to ask what's in it.

29974.name: Duskblooms
29974.description: A flowering plant with tiny purple blooms.

29975.name: Caprice Fleece
29975.description: Hair shorn from the pixies' lovingly─in some sense, at least─raised flock.

29977.name: Megalania Skin
29977.description: The hide of the megalania─a scalekin that has changed little since prehistoric eras.

29978.name: Imperial Fern
29978.description: Presumably named by one of history's many oppressed lower classes, this fern's appellation cannot but refer to the pretentious way in which it curls.

29979.name: Dried Hi-Ether
29979.description: Dry, flaky residue found at the bottom of a bottle of evaporated hi-ether.

29989.name: Apprentice's Practice Materials
29989.description: Eager to reduce pointless, pointless waste, Eorzea's guildmasters organized an assemblage of sacks of low-quality materials such as this one that artisans-in-training may practice their skills (or lack thereof, in many cases). However, advances in crafting tuition have rendered this collection of largely useless components entirely obsolete.

30034.name: Sintered Whetstone
30034.description: A whetstone created through compression and intense heat. Used for sharpening tools.

30088.name: Sungold Talos
30088.description:
Guaranteed to make you the envy of collectors and younglings alike.

Use item to acquire the sungold Talos minion.

30093.name: Silver Dasher
30093.description:
Never was there a bird so adorable.

Use item to acquire the silver dasher minion.

30094.name: Paissa Patissier
30094.description:
Currently in training as a culinarian, and looks the part.

Use item to acquire the paissa patissier minion.

30095.name: Paissa Threadpuller
30095.description:
Currently in training as a weaver, and looks the part.

Use item to acquire the paissa threadpuller minion.

30096.name: Ancient One
30096.description:
Small and appearing to be fractured, but whole.

Use item to acquire the ancient one minion.

30102.name: Construct 14 Identification Key
30102.description: A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Placing it near your Construct 14 will magically bring the machine to life.

30110.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Well Bread
30110.description: An illustrated manual providing instruction in the eating of bread, a deceptively nuanced act that philosophers have likened to a good marriage. Use to learn the /bread emote.

30111.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Intelligent Impressions
30111.description: An illustrated manual of how and when to employ books in a social setting so as to appear well-read to those around you. Use to learn the /read emote.

30112.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Emphatic Elucidation
30112.description: An illustrated manual of how to speak powerfully and persuasively, drawing upon techniques employed by the finest orators in history. Use to learn the /insist emote.

30113.name: Modern Aesthetics - Controlled Chaos
30113.description:
The realm's premier publication on beauty and fashion, this limited edition of Modern Aesthetics covers, in detail, trimming and coiffing techniques for an attractively asymmetrical look that's a cut above the ordinary.

Use to unlock a new hairstyle at the aesthetician.

30116.name: Ruby Red Dye
30116.description: A labor-saving red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30117.name: Cherry Pink Dye
30117.description: A labor-saving pink dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30118.name: Canary Yellow Dye
30118.description: A labor-saving yellow dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30119.name: Vanilla Yellow Dye
30119.description: A labor-saving yellow dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30120.name: Dragoon Blue Dye
30120.description: A labor-saving blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30121.name: Turquoise Blue Dye
30121.description: A labor-saving blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30122.name: Gunmetal Black Dye
30122.description: A labor-saving black dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30123.name: Pearl White Dye
30123.description: A labor-saving white dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30124.name: Metallic Brass Dye
30124.description: A labor-saving yellow dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

30125.name: Magicked Prism (Ishgard)
30125.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used in Ishgard for celebratory purposes.

30126.name: Magicked Prism (House Dzemael)
30126.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by House Dzemael for celebratory purposes.

30127.name: Magicked Prism (House Haillenarte)
30127.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by House Haillenarte for celebratory purposes.

30128.name: Magicked Prism (House Durendaire)
30128.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by House Durendaire for celebratory purposes.

30129.name: Magicked Prism (House Fortemps)
30129.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by House Fortemps for celebratory purposes.

30130.name: Magicked Prism (Temple Knights)
30130.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Used by the Temple Knights for celebratory purposes.

30135.name: Cloth-softening Powder
30135.description: Gives even brand-new clothes that worn-in feeling.

30136.name: Signature Skyball
30136.description: The ingredients of this pungent, pasty ball are a closely guarded Skysteel Manufactory secret. Processed bait specially designed for snaring certain species.

30246.name: Aged Oak Log
30246.description: A rough-cut log from an old oak tree. Yellow ribbon sold separately.

30248.name: Twice Stricken Orchestrion Roll
30248.description: Music roll for Twice Stricken. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30249.name: Primal Angel Orchestrion Roll
30249.description: Music roll for Primal Angel. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30250.name: Return to Oblivion Orchestrion Roll
30250.description: Music roll for Return to Oblivion. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30251.name: Ultima (The Primals) Orchestrion Roll
30251.description: Music roll for Ultima (The Primals). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30253.name: The Maiden's Lament Orchestrion Roll
30253.description: Music roll for The Maiden's Lament. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30254.name: The Darkhold Orchestrion Roll
30254.description: Music roll for The Darkhold. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30255.name: Floundering in the Depths Orchestrion Roll
30255.description: Music roll for Floundering in the Depths. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30259.name: Paradise Found Orchestrion Roll
30259.description: Music roll for Paradise Found. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30260.name: Fealty Orchestrion Roll
30260.description: Music roll for Fealty. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30261.name: Stone and Steel Orchestrion Roll
30261.description: Music roll for Stone and Steel. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30262.name: The Mendicant's Relish Orchestrion Roll
30262.description: Music roll for The Mendicant's Relish. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30263.name: Bedlam's Brink Orchestrion Roll
30263.description: Music roll for Bedlam's Brink. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30264.name: A Reason to Live Orchestrion Roll
30264.description: Music roll for A Reason to Live. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30265.name: No Greater Sorrow Orchestrion Roll
30265.description: Music roll for No Greater Sorrow. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30266.name: On Our Fates Alight Orchestrion Roll
30266.description: Music roll for On Our Fates Alight. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30267.name: Order Yet Undeciphered Orchestrion Roll
30267.description: Music roll for Order Yet Undeciphered. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

30268.name: Faded Copy of Ultima (The Primals)
30268.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Ultima (The Primals).

30269.name: Parasol
30269.description: The perfect accessory to protect you from the summer sun, spring showers, and birds seeking to relieve themselves. Use to acquire a parasol.

30270.name: Sky Blue Parasol
30270.description: The perfect accessory to protect you from the summer sun, spring showers, and birds seeking to relieve themselves. Use to acquire a sky blue parasol.

30271.name: Coffer o' Kupos
30271.description:
This nonsensically named coffer contains a full set of moogle-approved kupo attire.

Cannot be opened in instanced areas such as dungeons, PvP areas, or raids.

30278.name: Diadem Balloon Bug
30278.description:
Try not to think of all of the sky-spiders that these sky-bugs will attract. Live bait for skyfishing.

※Only for use in the Diadem.

30279.name: Diadem Red Balloon
30279.description:
You'd best not set ninety-nine of these free in the skies over Ishgard, lest the knights be very cross indeed. Live bait for skyfishing.

※Only for use in the Diadem.

30280.name: Diadem Crane Fly
30280.description:
The veined wings and spindly legs of the crane fly will attract a plethora of skyborne predators in no time. Presumably some part of this situation is desirable to you. Live bait for skyfishing.

※Only for use in the Diadem.

30281.name: Diadem Hoverworm
30281.description:
What is there to say about the Diadem hoverworm? Nothing, so long as they might be listening. Live bait for skyfishing.

※Only for use in the Diadem.

30364.name: Allagan Melon Seeds
30364.description: Allagan melon seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

30365.name: Cosmos Seeds
30365.description:
These seeds will grow into bright and cheery cosmos blooms─unless one is a terrible gardener, in which case they will grow into a sense of self-loathing.

※For use in planters.

30366.name: Red Cosmos
30366.description:
A bunch of red cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30367.name: Blue Cosmos
30367.description:
A bunch of blue cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30368.name: Yellow Cosmos
30368.description:
A bunch of yellow cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30369.name: Green Cosmos
30369.description:
A bunch of green cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30370.name: Orange Cosmos
30370.description:
A bunch of orange cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30371.name: Purple Cosmos
30371.description:
A bunch of purple cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30372.name: White Cosmos
30372.description:
A bunch of white cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30373.name: Black Cosmos
30373.description:
A bunch of black cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30374.name: Rainbow Cosmos
30374.description:
A bunch of multicolored cosmos, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

30375.name: Small Smithy Walls
30375.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to give their estate hall a smithy-inspired look.

※Can only be used with cottages on small plots of land.

30376.name: Medium Smithy Walls
30376.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to give their estate hall a smithy-inspired look.

※Can only be used with houses on medium plots of land.

30377.name: Large Smithy Walls
30377.description:
A set of four walls designed for those who wish to give their estate hall a smithy-inspired look.

※Can only be used with mansions on large plots of land.

30378.name: Factory Interior Wall
30378.description: An industrial wall resembling those seen in the Copied Factory.

30380.name: Factory Chandelier
30380.description: A rusted metal lighting fixture unlike any to which you are accustomed.

30381.name: Trophy of Light
30381.description:
A wall-mounted sword and shield to mark your victory in a battle of like wills.

※One per estate only.

30383.name: Verdant Shelf Partition
30383.description: A charming open partition with ample shelf space in the middle and overflowing planters above.

30385.name: Wooden Staircase Bookshelf
30385.description: Versatile book storage that doubles as tiered shelving for other knickknacks.

30386.name: Gemseeker's Pack
30386.description: This bag is bursting with unpolished gems and crystals─and as such, may attract spriggans. Homeowners are advised to lock their doors.

30387.name: Bluebird Mobile
30387.description: If one bluebird brings happiness, surely those who adorn their homes with this revolving display have naught to fear─aside from taking a faux bluebird to the eye should they move carelessly.

30388.name: Nomad's Tent
30388.description: A little piece of the Azim Steppe, created by trade-minded Xaela using traditional methods and materials.

30389.name: Stage Curtain
30389.description: This sumptuous curtain impresses upon audiences that what they are about to witness is no two-gil production.

30390.name: Floor Sofa
30390.description: A spacious seating option for those who prefer to remain at floor level.

30391.name: Tako-yaki Boat
30391.description: A steaming and sauce-slathered serving of enough doughy fried octopus to share. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Determination Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

30393.name: Barrel Table
30393.description: This reused cask screams “adventure!” Or perhaps “alcohol,” depending on what sort of tavern patron you are.

30394.name: Indoor Pond
30394.description: Bring the outdoors indoors with this perfect imitation of nature. Toads not included...or are they?

30395.name: Giant Beaver Burger Set
30395.description: No actual beavers were harmed in the making of this massive burger. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Critical Hit Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

30396.name: Red Brick Kitchen
30396.description: This rustic outdoor cooking facility is more than capable of keeping any amount of garden party guests well fed.

30397.name: Cracked Arch Window
30397.description: Too competent to smash your own windows? This is the product for you!

30398.name: Industrial Wall Pipes
30398.description: These decorative pipes were designed by the employees of Garlond Ironworks to make their abodes “feel more like home.”

30400.name: Factory Grate
30400.description: A rusted piece of grating. Watch your toes.

30401.name: Factory Staircase
30401.description: These metallic stairs make a satisfying clunking noise when stepped on. You know the one.

30402.name: Factory Railing
30402.description: An industrial safety rail. Given the visible wear and tear, one of those adjectives may have become less applicable over time.

30404.name: Factory Automatic Door
30404.description: The internal mechanisms that allow this door to open and close on its own remain something of a mystery. Luckily, this one was ripped from its surroundings wholesale, and operates regardless.

30406.name: Factory Wall Lamp
30406.description: A grimy lamp extracted from the machine graveyard.

30407.name: Factory Bench
30407.description: An iron bench that remains sturdy despite having seen better days.

30408.name: Wooden Footbridge
30408.description: For those who find walking on the ground simply too pedestrian.

30409.name: Gulg Planter
30409.description: An alpine shrub from the heights of Kholusia.

30410.name: Marble Alcove Bed
30410.description: This indulgent bed frame constitutes an entire wall, and will banish any illusions guests might have held regarding your humility.

30413.name: Mandragora Table Chronometer
30413.description: A massive mandragora-themed timepiece, for those who are into that.

30414.name: Paissa Rug
30414.description: What have they seen? What do they know?

30415.name: Huggable Gaelicat
30415.description: This stuffed imitation of the weatherproof gaelicat looks as if it is─rightly─ready to be adored.

30416.name: Ishgardian Display Stand
30416.description: A decorative pedestal in the Coerthan style.

30417.name: Fortemps Sofa
30417.description: An ostentatious, though elegant, round seat of the sort favored by House Fortemps.

30418.name: Stuffed Estinien
30418.description: Though cuddlier than the real thing, still decidedly prickly. Please enjoy responsibly.

30419.name: Helldiver SD
30419.description: An amazingly lifelike model constructed using specially engineered cloth and cotton bolls by Ironworks employees with a particular...enthusiasm for the helldiver variety of machina. Designation: snuggly.

30420.name: Dainsleif SD
30420.description: An amazingly lifelike model constructed using specially engineered cloth and cotton bolls by Ironworks employees with a particular...enthusiasm for the Dáinsleif machina. Designation: snuggly.

30421.name: Oriental Wooden Deck
30421.description: A slatted deck in the Far Eastern fashion, perfect for quiet contemplation or loud consumption of dango.

30422.name: Slanted Wall
30422.description: This freestanding wall adds fashionable and potentially confounding angles to any interior.

30423.name: Slanted Skylight
30423.description: A freestanding sloped wall with an inbuilt window to let the sun─and only the sun, somehow─in.

30427.name: Sliced Watermelon
30427.description: This juicy, fresh-cut watermelon makes the perfect summer treat. ※Cannot be retrieved once used. ※Can be used up to 10 times. Meal benefits when used: Tenacity Bonus: +4% (Max 10) +5% (Max 12) Gear Durability Bonus: +3 EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

30432.name: The Sinsteeped
30432.description:
A king among sinspitters, and lord of the waters of the Quadrivium.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

30433.name: Sweetheart
30433.description:
A queen among albino caimans, and lady of the waters of the Rift of Sighs.

[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

30434.name: Giant Taimen
30434.description:
A king among hucho taimen, and lord of the waters of upper Watts River.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]
[Suitable for printing on large canvases.]

30435.name: Leannisg
30435.description:
A king among wimple carp, and lord of the waters of Handmirror Lake.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

30436.name: Gold Hammer
30436.description:
A king among golden lobsters, and lord of the waters of Saint Fathric's Temple.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

30437.name: Recordkiller
30437.description:
A queen among silver kittens, and lady of the waters of south Mjrl's Regret.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

30438.name: The Mother of All Pancakes
30438.description:
A queen among pancake octopodes, and lady of the waters of east Caliban Gap.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

30439.name: Opal Shrimp
30439.description:
A king among rainbow shrimp, and lord of the waters of the Norvrandt Slope.

[Suitable for printing on medium canvases.]

30481.name: Crab Cakes
30481.description: To preserve the toothsome texture of blue crab, chunks of flesh are gently folded into flour and molded into cakes, which are panfried to golden perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

30482.name: Chili Crab
30482.description: A whole blue crab braised in its shell in a piquant sauce, which takes on a rich shellfish flavor in the course of cooking. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

30483.name: Brashgold Plate
30483.description: A sheet of highly durable brashgold plate.

30484.name: Defthand's Dissolvent
30484.description: When applied to crafting or gathering gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

30485.name: Tender Dill
30485.description: A small variety of dill characterized by its sweet fragrance. Finds use in both medicinal and culinary applications.

30486.name: Brashgold Ore
30486.description: A decent-sized piece of rock rich in a highly durable, naturally occurring alloy.

30487.name: Blue Crab
30487.description:
A small crab that would be otherwise unremarkable if not for its vibrant blue shell.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

30590.name: Levinstrike Aethersand
30590.description: This coarse-grained, highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter carries the distinctive scent of ozone.

30591.name: Thunder Rock
30591.description: An uncut stone imbued with so much aetheric lightning energy as to echo with tiny claps of thunder.

30592.name: Levin Mint
30592.description: The pink leaves of this peculiar mint thrum gently with lightning energy.

30593.name: Fuchsia Bloom
30593.description:
Vibrantly hued and daintily shaped, this freshwater fish is right at home in the waters of Il Mheg.

[Suitable for printing on small canvases.]

30615.name: Plate of Light
30615.description: A radiant sheet of metal torn from the Warrior of Light's armor.

30678.name: True Barding of Light
30678.description: A suit of chocobo armor designed to resemble an ancient hero not wholly unlike yourself.

30861.name: Gabriel α Identification Key
30861.description: A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Placing it near your Gabriel α will magically bring the machine to life.

30862.name: Megalotragus Horn
30862.description: This imposing horn emits a primordial tone that summons forth your megalotragus, a herbivore so intimidating it puts carnivores to shame.

30865.name: Incitatus Whistle
30865.description: This whistle emits a shrill tone that is said to summon Incitatus, the steed of legend.

30870.name: Magitek Helldiver F1
30870.description:
Minimal firepower, maximum attitude.

Use item to acquire the magitek helldiver F1 minion.

30871.name: Weatherproof Gaelicat
30871.description:
Makes you feel toasty warm simply to behold it.

Use item to acquire the weatherproof gaelicat minion.

30872.name: Ephemeral Necromancer
30872.description:
If it could, it would summon forth an army of equally adorable undead.

Use item to acquire the ephemeral necromancer minion.

30873.name: Allagan Melon
30873.description:
Capable of movement and tremendously juicy.

Use item to acquire the Allagan melon minion.

30874.name: Sand Fox
30874.description:
Will perform tricks for a lick of birch syrup.

Use item to acquire the sand fox minion.

30875.name: Petit Pteranodon
30875.description:
It might be cute now, but wait till it grows and becomes a scourge of the skies.

Use item to acquire the petit pteranodon minion.

30876.name: Dainsleif F1
30876.description:
Does not form the head. Or any other part of the body, for that matter.

Use item to acquire the Dáinsleif F1 minion.

30884.name: Forgotten Fragment of Caution
30884.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 2
Potential memories contained: Lost Manawall, Lost Stealth, Lost Protect, Lost Shell, Lost Cure, Lost Cure III, Lost Incense

30885.name: Forgotten Fragment of Preparation
30885.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 2
Potential memories contained: Resistance Phoenix, Resistance Potion

30886.name: Forgotten Fragment of Skill
30886.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 2
Potential memories contained: Essence of the Aetherweaver, Essence of the Martialist, Essence of the Savior, Essence of the Veteran, Essence of the Platebearer

30887.name: Forgotten Fragment of Ingenuity
30887.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 5
Potential memories contained: Lost Paralyze III, Lost Banish III, Lost Dispel, Lost Spellforge, Lost Steelsting, Lost Swift

30888.name: Forgotten Fragment of Care
30888.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 5
Potential memories contained: Resistance Reraiser, Resistance Potion Kit, Resistance Ether Kit

30889.name: Forgotten Fragment of Awakening
30889.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 5
Potential memories contained: Essence of the Guardian, Essence of the Ordained, Essence of the Skirmisher, Essence of the Watcher, Essence of the Profane, Essence of the Irregular, Essence of the Breathtaker

30890.name: Forgotten Fragment of Support
30890.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 8
Potential memories contained: Lost Reflect, Lost Stoneskin, Lost Bravery

30891.name: Forgotten Fragment of Violence
30891.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 8
Potential memories contained: Lost Focus, Lost Slash, Lost Death

30892.name: Forgotten Fragment of Resolve
30892.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 8
Potential memories contained: Banner of Noble Ends, Banner of Honored Sacrifice, Banner of Tireless Conviction, Banner of Firm Resolve, Banner of Solemn Clarity, Banner of Honed Acuity

30893.name: Forgotten Fragment of Compassion
30893.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 8
Potential memories contained: Lost Cure II, Lost Cure IV, Lost Arise, Resistance Medikit

30894.name: Forgotten Fragment of Superstition
30894.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 11
Potential memories contained: Essence of the Bloodsucker, Essence of the Beast, Essence of the Templar

30895.name: Forgotten Fragment of Mastery
30895.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 11
Potential memories contained: Deep Essence of the Aetherweaver, Deep Essence of the Martialist, Deep Essence of the Savior, Deep Essence of the Veteran, Deep Essence of the Platebearer

30896.name: Forgotten Fragment of Sagacity
30896.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 12
Potential memories contained: Lost Font of Magic, Lost Font of Skill, Lost Font of Power

30897.name: Forgotten Fragment of Becoming
30897.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 13
Potential memories contained: Deep Essence of the Guardian, Deep Essence of the Ordained, Deep Essence of the Skirmisher, Deep Essence of the Watcher, Deep Essence of the Profane, Deep Essence of the Irregular, Deep Essence of the Breathtaker

30898.name: Forgotten Fragment of Transcendence
30898.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 14
Potential memories contained: Deep Essence of the Bloodsucker, Deep Essence of the Beast, Deep Essence of the Templar

30899.name: Forgotten Fragment of Caprice
30899.description:
A single, unidentified memory of the lost.

Resistance rank required for appraisal: 15
Potential memories contained: Lost Fair Trade, Mimic, Dynamis Dice

31090.name: Weathering Agent
31090.description: This corrosive concoction rusts and breaks down metal. Judicious application is key if it is to be used for aesthetic purposes.

31091.name: Seacloth
31091.description: So named for its origin among the isles of the southern seas, this fabric's unique loose weave has yet to be replicated elsewhere.

31117.name: Oddly Specific Cedar Log
31117.description: Must include the initials of star-crossed lovers carved into the bark. The Skysteel engineers will know if you have carved them yourself, especially if you use your own initials.

31118.name: Oddly Specific Coerthan Iron Ore
31118.description: As if specifying the location from which it is mined was not enough, the Skysteel engineers have also asked that you carry it about your person while walking an entire lap around Ishgard, so that it may soak up the local atmosphere.

31119.name: Oddly Specific Mythrite Sand
31119.description: Each pinch must contain mythrite and only mythrite, which in the grand scheme of things, seems perfectly reasonable.

31120.name: Oddly Specific Silver Ore
31120.description: The ore requested must be “similar in appearance to gold, but with more of a light-grey tinge to it.” Silver, in other words.

31121.name: Oddly Specific Gagana Skin
31121.description: Each gagana must be treated with the utmost care and allowed to live a life of uninterrupted bliss, right up until the moment they are brutally slaughtered.

31122.name: Oddly Specific Fleece
31122.description: The fleece must be soft enough that one can put their hand into the basket and not be able to feel a thing─except for the inside of said basket.

31123.name: Oddly Specific Sap
31123.description: Before use, it should be shaken, stirred, shaken again, and then poured down a gagana's gullet and regurgitated, as tradition dictates.

31124.name: Oddly Specific Aloe
31124.description: Should only be harvested after being lightly dusted by the scales of an endangered species of moth, which also has its own set of oddly specific requirements.

31232.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Switch
31232.description:
Makes a satisfying “thwack” sound when swung through the air. On the other hand, attempting to actually hit something will cause it to break immediately, so it is reserved only for scare tactics.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31233.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Hemp
31233.description:
Compared to the grade 2 variety, this is the good shite.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31234.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Ore
31234.description:
The first miner to discover this particular variety described it as “extra-ore-dinary” and was met with a chorus of groans from her peers.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31235.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Bomb Ash
31235.description:
Some might argue that it would be easier to locate a living bomb and wait for it to explode than to scrabble about in the dirt and undergrowth looking for particles of ash from one that had exploded previously. The problem lies in finding volunteers who are not only foolhardy enough to attempt it, but hardy enough to survive.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31236.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Ebony Log
31236.description:
Care must be taken when working with ebony wood, as its sawdust is both highly flammable and toxic. Strangely, the skybuilders failed to mention this...

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31237.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Sesame
31237.description:
Sesame is not only a useful plant, but the mere mention of its name is believed to open many doors in a very literal sense.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31238.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
31238.description:
Often misheard as “cotton bowl,” which has led to several nigh on useless pieces of fluffy tableware being submitted to the skybuilders.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31239.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Titanium Ore
31239.description:
Unlike some other ores requested by the skybuilders, they actually deigned to give the name of the type of metal they would like in this case, rather than simply “some ore.”

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31240.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Rock Salt
31240.description:
This particular type of salt is for sprinkling on rocks to make them taste better, hence the name “rock salt.”

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31241.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Hardsilver Sand
31241.description:
Hardsilver's inherent hardness is somewhat difficult to gauge in granular form.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31242.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Lauan Log
31242.description: The aesthetically pleasing bark of this particular tree allows it to be used in its natural state to give a rustic feel to a home's interior. On the other hand, “rustic” is often used to mean “we can save time and effort by convincing gullible customers that having bits of rough-cut wood all over the place is somehow desirable.”

31243.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Mistletoe
31243.description: Used in a variety of medical treatments despite being highly toxic. Failure to adhere to the correct dosage may lead to symptoms far worse than the ailment it was meant to cure.

31244.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Toad
31244.description: One of the skybuilders has been tasked with kissing every toad they receive on the off chance of it being a cursed prince. This, however, is suspected to be one of the many tasks designed to keep troublesome workers out of mischief, along with polishing the coal and washing the soap.

31245.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Vine
31245.description: A naturally occurring substitute for rope, perfect for swinging through the trees while yodeling like a buffoon.

31246.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Tea Leaves
31246.description: This variety is often used in tea leaf reading, and is said to result in a high rate of good fortunes, though most tasseomancers base their readings more on what they think the customer wants to hear than the patterns left in the cup.

31247.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Diadem Iron Ore
31247.description: Though similar substances exist in other regions, the Diadem variety tends to be more highly coveted. This may simply be due to its scarcity rather than any intrinsic properties, as by and large, the more difficult something is to obtain, the more people want it.

31248.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Alumen
31248.description: In recent years, there have been calls to abandon the use of “pinches” as a unit of measurement for powders. However, the fact that an amount equal to a single pinch is rarely enough to cause even the most sensitive of scales to budge leads to difficulties when deciding on a weight-based standard.

31249.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Spring Water
31249.description: The name may indicate that there are very specific criteria to pass muster with the skybuilders, but the taste and smell are the same as almost any other type of water. That is to say: it tastes of nothing and smells of nothing.

31250.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Diadem Iron Sand
31250.description: As is often the case with items found in the Diadem, this iron sand possesses unique properties. It is magnetically attracted not only to metallic objects, but a range of organic materials, such as skin and clothing, which means it is often gathered regardless of one's intentions.

31251.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Siltstone
31251.description: This flaky, lightweight stone is a firm favorite with street performers who demonstrate their strength by smashing through rock with their bare hands.

31252.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Cedar Log
31252.description:
Due to cedar being a natural repellent for moths─which can be both extremely large and ferocious in some parts─many adventurers have taken to carrying it about their person. Hefting around an entire log might be going a touch overboard, however.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31253.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Resin
31253.description:
“He tried to take it from me, or at least, he looked like he wanted to. So I cut him. Can't blame a man for keeping his resin to himself, can you?”
─Excerpt from How to Win Friends and Execute People: Climbing the Ranks of the Temple Knights
by unknown author

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31254.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Wheat
31254.description:
May contain traces of chaff.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31255.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Gossamer Cotton Boll
31255.description:
In this case, the word “gossamer” is applied in a literal sense, as each boll is covered in a fine layer of cobweb. This is kept intact until the cotton is spun into thread, which grants it extraordinary resilience to wear and tear.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31256.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Adder
31256.description:
As one can imagine, there is a host of practical applications for a venomous snake in the Ishgardian reconstruction efforts. These include the production of snake wine, in which the scalekin is preserved in alcohol that gains a unique flavor and medicinal properties. In several cases, the snake has been known to spring to life after moons of being entirely submerged in the liquid.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31257.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Aurum Regis Ore
31257.description:
“Kingly” is not an adjective that is often applied to metals of any sort, though in the case of aurum regis, it seems perfectly fitting, for some reason.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31258.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Finest Rock Salt
31258.description:
Many people prefer to keep such chunks whole so that they may be used as “salt rocks.” These are placed in the center of the dining table so that anyone who feels their meal is lacking in saltiness can simply lick it and carry on with their meal.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31259.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Truespring Water
31259.description:
Often confused with falsespring water, which is remarkably similar apart from the fact it smells like a wet dog.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31260.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Fossil Dust
31260.description:
“Despite the creature having been dead for millennia, fossilized, and then ground to dust, I was able to extrapolate its diet, breeding habits, and susceptibility to hiccups from the single, remaining fragment of vertebrae.”
─Excerpt from On the Trail of the Thunder Lizards

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31261.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Hard Mudstone
31261.description:
Mudstone may not be the most impressive of substances, but becoming a solid piece of rock after an extended period as a sticky semiliquid is something of an improvement.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31262.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Log
31262.description:
Grade 3 and artisanal it may be, yet the name of the tree from which it came is an enigma enveloped in a mystery. Before the skybuilders and their bizarre naming conventions, it was simply...log.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31263.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Amber
31263.description:
The grade is determined by the number of vilekin encased within each piece. Fewer is generally considered to be better, unless the buyer happens to be a naturalist, in which case, the opposite is true. They have been known to pay absurd amounts for the most heavily infested specimens.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31264.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
31264.description:
These bolls contain roughly twice the amount of cotton as the regular sort, but due to the thickness of the plant's stems, take roughly twice as much effort to harvest.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31265.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Rice
31265.description:
Rice remains something of a novelty in Ishgard, though the skybuilders seem to be experts on the subject regardless. Apparently, they can tell the difference between the truly artisanal and the merely humdrum.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31266.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Vine
31266.description:
The artisanal vines that are chosen for the Firmament tend to stand out from the common-or-garden varieties. One could say they are vine for attention.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31267.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cloudstone
31267.description:
One of the few stones light enough to float in water.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31268.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Basilisk Egg
31268.description:
Most recipients of such eggs would prefer them without a tiny, carnivorous scalekin inside.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31269.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Alumen
31269.description:
Though alumen is commonly used in the tanning of animal hide, the artisanal can supposedly be used to tan other materials, such as hair or soil. Such claims have yet to be verified, however.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31270.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Clay
31270.description:
Many apprentice potters have been known to misinterpret the meaning of “throwing a pot,” leading to hilarious capers, instant dismissal, or both.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31271.name: Approved Grade 3 Artisanal Skybuilders' Granite
31271.description:
Granite is said to be phaneritic, or in layman's terms, macroscopically crystalline.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31272.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Umbral Galewood Sap
31272.description:
Practically pulsating with wind-aspected aether. Also has a distinct sweet taste, although one should take care when adding it to their beverages, unless the aim is to create a literal storm in a teacup.

Can only be gathered during an umbral tempest.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31273.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Umbral Tortoise
31273.description:
In addition to its craggy hide and shell protecting it from the teeth and claws of predators, the earth-aspected aether with which it is infused causes it to taste like soil. Any creatures patient and strong enough to reach the tender meat inside are invariably left disappointed.

Can only be gathered during an umbral duststorm.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31274.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Umbral Magma Shard
31274.description:
Though the name may seem at first to be an oxymoron, each fragment actually contains magma in liquid form beneath a thin crust. Anyone foolish enough to put one of these shards in their back pocket before sitting down will cause a hole to be burned not only in their breeches, but also the chair on which they sat.

Can only be gathered during an umbral flare.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31275.name: Approved Grade 3 Skybuilders' Umbral Levinite
31275.description:
Some scholars maintain that levinite is the result of lightning taking solid form upon striking the earth. Most other scholars, however, maintain that this theory is bollocks.

Can only be gathered during umbral levin.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31320.name: Slithersand
31320.description: Smooth granules of the mineral also known as green cinnabar, containing traces of quicksilver.

31321.name: Vermilion Paper Parasol
31321.description: Though one might assume that paper is less than ideal for protecting oneself from the rain, this parasol has been treated with waterproof oil. The makers cannot, however, be held responsible for any puddles stepped in. Use to acquire a vermilion paper parasol.

31322.name: Plum Paper Parasol
31322.description: Named for its color, not because the paper is made from the wood of a plum tree. Use to acquire a plum paper parasol.

31324.name: Calming Checkered Parasol
31324.description: Creates not only a small, portable circle of shade, but exudes a calming influence. Somehow. Use to acquire a calming checkered parasol.

31325.name: Cheerful Checkered Parasol
31325.description: There is something about a white background covered in many, many straight red lines that creates a cheerful atmosphere, though scholars have yet to determine exactly why. Use to acquire a cheerful checkered parasol.

31326.name: Classy Checkered Parasol
31326.description: Were one to describe this parasol's pattern as “black and white check” then perhaps it might conjure images of chessboards and the like. Even so, it could be argued that this design is far classier. Use to acquire a classy checkered parasol.

31352.name: Bozjan Runner's Secrets (Head Gear)
31352.description: Clasps, protective material, and other accoutrements that can be applied to personal equipment for increased safety and mobility on the battlefield.

31353.name: Bozjan Runner's Secrets (Body Gear)
31353.description: Clasps, protective material, and other accoutrements that can be applied to personal equipment for increased safety and mobility on the battlefield.

31354.name: Bozjan Runner's Secrets (Hand Gear)
31354.description: Clasps, protective material, and other accoutrements that can be applied to personal equipment for increased safety and mobility on the battlefield.

31355.name: Bozjan Runner's Secrets (Leg Gear)
31355.description: Clasps, protective material, and other accoutrements that can be applied to personal equipment for increased safety and mobility on the battlefield.

31356.name: Bozjan Runner's Secrets (Foot Gear)
31356.description: Clasps, protective material, and other accoutrements that can be applied to personal equipment for increased safety and mobility on the battlefield.

31397.name: Magicked Prism (Mandragora)
31397.description: This peculiar contraption creates illusions by weaving together myriad shades of light. Lovingly crafted by the children of Menphina's Arms.

31401.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Uncouth Congratulations
31401.description: An illustrated manual of congratulatory gestures best avoided in polite company. Use to learn the /highfive emote.

31402.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Pointed Misgivings
31402.description: An illustrated manual of how to make clear that you are keeping close watch over the whole of the banquet table, and will deliver swift retribution should anyone try to take more than the socially acceptable number of hors d'oeuvres. Use to learn the /guard emote.

31403.name: Ballroom Etiquette - Dark Entreaty
31403.description: An illustrated manual detailing how to visit an unholy fate upon your social rivals. Use to learn the /malevolence emote.

31406.name: Modern Aesthetics - Saintly Style
31406.description:
The realm's premier publication on beauty and fashion, this limited edition of Modern Aesthetics covers, in detail, shaping and feathering techniques for imitating the unique look of an Ishgardian saint of eld.

Use to unlock a new hairstyle at the aesthetician.
Unavailable to Viera and Hrothgar.

31407.name: Modern Aesthetics - Wind Caller
31407.description:
The realm's premier publication on beauty and fashion, this limited edition of Modern Aesthetics covers, in detail, feathering and styling techniques to achieve the windswept look of a legendary Vartan warrior.

Use to unlock a new hairstyle at the aesthetician.
Unavailable to Viera and Hrothgar.

31630.name: Hraesvelgr Attire Coffer
31630.description:
A banded chest containing a complete set of Hraesvelgr attire.

Cannot be opened in instanced areas such as dungeons, PvP areas, or raids.

31662.name: Eternal Wind - Shadowbringers Orchestrion Roll
31662.description: Music roll for Eternal Wind - Shadowbringers. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31663.name: To the Edge Orchestrion Roll
31663.description: Music roll for To the Edge. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31664.name: Wind on the Plains Orchestrion Roll
31664.description: Music roll for Wind on the Plains. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31665.name: Blood on the Wind Orchestrion Roll
31665.description: Music roll for Blood on the Wind. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31666.name: Discord: Imperial (Zodiac Age Version) Orchestrion Roll
31666.description: Music roll for Discord: Imperial (Zodiac Age Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31667.name: Into the Fortress (Zodiac Age Version) Orchestrion Roll
31667.description: Music roll for Into the Fortress (Zodiac Age Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31668.name: Battle with an Esper (Zodiac Age Version) Orchestrion Roll
31668.description: Music roll for Battle with an Esper (Zodiac Age Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31669.name: Life and Death (Zodiac Age Version) Orchestrion Roll
31669.description: Music roll for Life and Death (Zodiac Age Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31670.name: Where All Roads Lead Orchestrion Roll
31670.description: Music roll for Where All Roads Lead. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31671.name: Hard to Miss Orchestrion Roll
31671.description: Music roll for Hard to Miss. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31672.name: A Tonberry's Tears Orchestrion Roll
31672.description: Music roll for A Tonberry's Tears. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31673.name: Abomination Orchestrion Roll
31673.description: Music roll for Abomination. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31674.name: Freefall Orchestrion Roll
31674.description: Music roll for Freefall. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31675.name: The Heavens' Ward Orchestrion Roll
31675.description: Music roll for The Heavens' Ward. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31678.name: Fortress of Lies Orchestrion Roll
31678.description: Music roll for Fortress of Lies. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31679.name: Grandma (Destruction) Orchestrion Roll
31679.description: Music roll for Grandma (Destruction). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31680.name: End of the Unknown Orchestrion Roll
31680.description: Music roll for End of the Unknown. Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31681.name: Torn from the Heavens／The Dark Colossus Destroys All (Medley Version) Orchestrion Roll
31681.description: Music roll for Torn from the Heavens／The Dark Colossus Destroys All (Medley Version). Use to add to your orchestrion list.

31687.name: Faded Copy of To the Edge
31687.description: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing full scores for To the Edge and Eternal Wind - Shadowbringers.

31758.name: Oddly Delicate Pine Log
31758.description: Yes, this is a delicate log. Oddly so, in fact.

31759.name: Oddly Delicate Silvergrace Ore
31759.description: For all its delicacy, this is nevertheless a chunk of ore, and quite capable of leaving a nasty mark when thrown at someone's head.

31760.name: Oddly Delicate Scheelite
31760.description: While standard scheelite is certainly rare, the oddly delicate variant is scarce to the point of being practically nonexistent.

31761.name: Oddly Delicate Raw Celestine
31761.description: This chunk of unrefined crystal is not itself especially delicate, but has the potential to produce pieces of remarkable delicacy. Whether this is beneficial in any way whatsoever, however, remains to be seen.

31762.name: Oddly Delicate Gazelle Hide
31762.description: Rest assured that the gazelle to which this once belonged was slaughtered in the most delicate way possible.

31763.name: Oddly Delicate Rhea
31763.description: Rhea this oddly delicate is reserved for the production of oddly delicate rhea cloth. It is then, in turn, used to make all sorts of cloth-based items, provided that they are not hindered in any way by being oddly delicate, which rules out practically everything.

31764.name: Oddly Delicate Mistletoe
31764.description: If one happens to eat one of these poisonous berries, they may find that their stomach also becomes oddly delicate.

31765.name: Oddly Delicate Hammerhead Shark
31765.description: The “oddly delicate” part refers not to the shark's physical attributes, but to its demeanor. Due to being dead, however, this is something of a moot point.

31893.name: Grade 4 Tincture of Strength
31893.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases strength for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

31894.name: Grade 4 Tincture of Dexterity
31894.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases dexterity for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

31895.name: Grade 4 Tincture of Vitality
31895.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases vitality for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

31896.name: Grade 4 Tincture of Intelligence
31896.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases intelligence for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

31897.name: Grade 4 Tincture of Mind
31897.description: This diluted brew temporarily increases mind for twice the duration of similar potions. Duration: 30s

31898.name: Pizza
31898.description: A simple-but-satisfying dish of thinly worked dough topped with tomatoes and cheese, baked in a wood-fired oven until crispy. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31899.name: Mist Spinach Quiche
31899.description: Using choice ingredients such as mist spinach and mozzarella, this variation of spinach quiche satisfies even the fussiest gourmand. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31900.name: Chicken Fettuccine
31900.description: Flat, thick pasta smothered in a rich cream sauce with tender slices of chicken thigh. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31901.name: Smoked Chicken
31901.description: A leg of chicken patiently smoked to perfection. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31902.name: Golden Pineapple Juice
31902.description: Tart and invigorating juice freshly squeezed from golden pineapples. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31903.name: Pineapple Salad
31903.description: A salad featuring chunks of golden pineapple tossed with a flavorsome frantoio oil dressing. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31904.name: Zefir
31904.description: An irresistibly soft and airy confectionary made from whipped twilight apple purée. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31905.name: Twilight Popoto Salad
31905.description: Shredded twilight apples give this popoto salad a crunchy texture and fruity tang. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31906.name: Broad Bean Curry
31906.description: Broad beans stewed with fragrant spices, served with a side of steamed rice. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31907.name: Lemon Muffin
31907.description: A sweet and zesty muffin made by mixing lemonette rind and juice into the dough. EXP Bonus: +3% Duration: 30m (Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

31908.name: Mozzarella
31908.description: A fresh, springy cheese made from buffalo milk.

31909.name: Chicken Thigh
31909.description: The thigh of a breed of chicken known for the superior flavor and texture of its flesh.

31910.name: Golden Pineapple
31910.description: A golden-hued variety of pineapple touted for its tart flavor.

31911.name: Twilight Apple
31911.description: A sweet-sour variety of apple named for the gentle gleam of its peel.

31912.name: Cardamom
31912.description: Boasting a unique fragrance, these seeds are the secret spice in myriad recipes.

31961.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Switch
31961.description:
As many Ishgardian schoolchildren will attest, telling one's detractors “Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words shall never harm me” is an open invitation to be assaulted with said objects.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31962.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Hemp
31962.description:
Since time immemorial, this robust plant has helped many a convicted criminal dance the hempen jig.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31963.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Iron Ore
31963.description:
Any smith worth their salt will have a vast amount of ores, ingots, rivets, rings, and plates at their disposal, although finding space to store it all can prove most bothersome. Some have even taken to employing retainers for the sole purpose of lugging their surplus junk around.

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31964.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Iron Sand
31964.description:
Primarily used as a vital component in a children's toy whereby hair and a beard may be applied to a picture of a man's face by means of an ingenious magnetic wand. (For ages three and up.)

Used in level 20 crafting recipes.

31965.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Mahogany Log
31965.description:
Used in the construction of various musical instruments and believed to imbue the music with a certain ethereal quality. This may or may not be due to the souls of elementals trapped within the wood, which brings a whole new meaning to the phrase “haunting melody.”

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31966.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Sesame
31966.description:
The sesame plant is robust enough to grow in even the most inhospitable environments, including those in which the botanists tasked with gathering said plant are incapable of surviving. As valuable as sesame is, most would agree it is not worth risking life and limb for, not that the skybuilders seem particularly bothered by this when making their requests...

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31967.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
31967.description:
A freshly picked cotton boll with the stem still attached is the perfect implement for cleaning one's ears, though it is likely that the skybuilders will notice if that same cotton boll is submitted to them after being used. They tend to object to that sort of thing.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31968.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Ore
31968.description:
Only a true skybuilder could look at a nondescript lump of grey, slightly metallic rock and say, “Yes, this is definitely grade 4 skybuilders' ore,” though it could be argued that this is because they are the ones who named it to begin with.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31969.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Rock Salt
31969.description:
“But Mother, can we not break the salt rock into smaller chunks to save us all from having to lick the same piece? It seems awfully unhygienic.”
“No, my sweet prince, that would not be proper. Now lick the rock and put it back on the table.”
─Typical Ishgardian mealtime conversation

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31970.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Mythrite Sand
31970.description:
A popular choice for hourglasses as the speed at which the sand falls is directly affected by how much those in close proximity are enjoying themselves. With a mythrite sand hourglass, time really does fly when one is having fun.

Used in level 40 crafting recipes.

31971.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Spruce Log
31971.description:
Spruce is the wood of choice in all manner of carpentry projects, from enormous load-bearing beams to tiny intricately carved ornaments. So versatile is it that one wonders why the skybuilders even bother with the other types of timber.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31972.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Mistletoe
31972.description:
A prominent feature in many Starlight Celebration decorations, mistletoe is much loved by the people of Ishgard. Most people would probably view it rather differently, however, if they knew that the plant is in fact a voracious parasite that mercilessly drains the life from its host.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31973.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Toad
31973.description:
You had best treat this warty little creature kindly as it may be a ninja's hellfrog in disguise. “Burned to death by flaming frog vomit” is hardly the sort of remark one wants in their obituary.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31974.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Vine
31974.description:
Although such vines make perfectly adequate replacements for rope, it seems that the skybuilders have more than enough actual rope to make the use of this plant somewhat redundant.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31975.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Tea Leaves
31975.description:
“There are few problems that cannot be resolved─or at least, forgotten about─over a nice cup of tea.”
─Ishgardian aphorism

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31976.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Electrum Ore
31976.description:
A naturally occurring alloy of gold and silver, though many would argue that it is worth less than the sum of its parts. Those expecting it to possess some sort of lightning-aspected aetherial properties due to the name are sure to be disappointed, although that has not prevented several unscrupulous merchants from advertising it as such.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31977.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Alumen
31977.description:
Another in a seemingly endless list of powdered substances that are of vital importance to alchemists, goldsmiths, and the like, but mean─to quote the common vernacular─bugger all to everyone else. Luckily, laymen need only know how much it will fetch at market and whether or not one must face any life-endangering peril to obtain it.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31978.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Spring Water
31978.description:
A number of stringent tests are performed to determine the grade assigned to spring water, including the measurement of time taken to evaporate when poured into a shallow dish and placed next to a hot pig.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31979.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Gold Sand
31979.description:
Each grain of gold sand was once a whole nugget that has been gradually eroded over many thousands of years, which is a rather extreme example of depreciating value.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31980.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Ragstone
31980.description:
Due to being formed from compressed layers of sediment, ragstone may contain rare and precious fossils. The skybuilders, however, care not a jot about any of that and will happily use it to whet their blades and so forth, much to the woe of naturalists throughout Eorzea.

Used in level 60 and 70 crafting recipes.

31981.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' White Cedar Log
31981.description:
White cedar is known to be one of the most longevous species of tree, with one particular specimen estimated to be 1,852 years old, according to the number of growth rings. Of course, it probably would have lived a lot longer if not for a glory-seeking, axe-happy botanist.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31982.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Primordial Resin
31982.description:
Made from congealed primordial soup.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31983.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Wheat
31983.description:
Ishgardian bakers organize a gathering known as a “wheat and greet,” in which they discuss a range of topics, such as the perfect method for wafting the smell of freshly baked bread into the streets to maximize profits.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31984.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Gossamer Cotton Boll
31984.description:
When it comes to cotton bolls, this is the sovereign of softness, the commandant of comfort, the liege lord of loveliness.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31985.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Tortoise
31985.description:
Those who believe dogs are man's best friend have obviously never met a tortoise.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31986.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Gold Ore
31986.description:
“The ambassador's receptions are noted in society for their host's exquisite taste that captivates his guests. The tray of gold nuggets his butlers pass around, however, often leads to confusion and broken teeth when said guests mistake them for chocolate treats.”
─The Highs and Lows of Ishgardian High Society

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31987.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Finest Rock Salt
31987.description:
This particular variety of rock salt has proved so popular with Ishgardian diners, that many choose to forego their meal altogether and spend the evening licking the communal salt rock instead.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31988.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Truespring Water
31988.description:
The advertising slogan, “Spring water never tasted so true,” has left many Ishgardians both impressed and baffled in equal measure. Merchants are hopeful that this will cause just the right amount of confusion to distract from the fact it is essentially identical to the grade 3 variety. And any other type of water, for that matter.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31989.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Mineral Sand
31989.description:
When the skybuilders were quizzed as to exactly what type of mineral comprises this sand, the reply was, “That information is on a need-to-know basis.” One would assume that those mining the stuff would need to know what they are supposed to be looking for, but the skybuilders move─and think─in mysterious ways.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31990.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Bluespirit Ore
31990.description:
Not only is this rock imbued with a spirit, but that spirit is feeling particularly blue. Perhaps being smashed repeatedly with a chisel will cheer it up.

Used in level 80 crafting recipes.

31991.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Log
31991.description:
The word “log” fails to amply convey the undeniable majesty of this immaculate specimen. Unfortunately, there are no suitable substitutes, unless one is content to call it a “tree with all the sticky-outy bits cut off.”

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31992.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Raspberry
31992.description:
Being rather small, it is unusual for raspberries to be handled individually rather than by weight. This may also be because fruiterers are keen to avoid counting anything other than coins.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31993.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Caiman
31993.description:
In this case, “artisanal” refers to the caiman itself rather than the person tasked with procuring it. This scalekin is particularly gifted in the art of nest building, or at least it was before being clobbered over the head and dragged off to the skybuilders.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31994.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cocoon
31994.description:
As the skybuilders neglected to specify the exact type of cocoon they would like delivered, its contents remain unknown. It could be home to anything from a wamoura pupa to the larva of a parasitic wespe. Nothing good, in other words.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31995.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Barbgrass
31995.description:
The countless tiny barbs at the tips of this hardy plant are believed to deter grazing beastkin. However, to counteract this, those creatures have developed an especially tough lining to the inside of their mouths, and could probably bite down on a handful of broken glass without so much as batting an eyelid.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31996.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Cloudstone
31996.description:
According to certain scholars, the islands of the Sea of Clouds are kept suspended in the air by large amounts of cloudstone. It is therefore advised not to mine too much of this valuable resource as it may cause the island to plummet from the sky.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31997.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Spring Water
31997.description:
Spring water is said to result from a series of complex processes that unfold deep underground. But in a place like the Diadem, where the normal laws of nature appear to be ignored entirely, it is impossible to say exactly where this water comes from.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31998.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Ice Stalagmite
31998.description:
Be sure to hold this the right way up or it could be mistaken for a stalactite.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

31999.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Silex
31999.description:
Similar─though rather less artisanal─sacks of silex are sold to the participants in Ul'dah's Coliseum. A well-aimed handful of the stuff can temporarily blind the opponent, though it is only a matter of time until these customers realize that the same is true of the sand that lines the arena floor, which is available for free.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

32000.name: Approved Grade 4 Artisanal Skybuilders' Prismstone
32000.description:
Shines with all the colors of the rainbow, and even a few extra, like luminous black and fluorescent beige.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

32001.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Umbral Galewood Branch
32001.description:
The billowing wind-aspected aether that surrounds this branch might lead some to think it would be the ideal material from which to make a magic wand. Unfortunately, the energies within it are so powerful, the wielder would struggle to even hold on to it long enough to cast any spells before it blows right out of their hands.

Can only be gathered during an umbral tempest.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

32002.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Umbral Dirtleaf
32002.description:
One of the only plants known to grow its leaves underground before allowing them to surface. The fine covering of dirt seems to have the adverse effect of hindering the leaves from doing...whatever it is leaves do, which may explain the shrub's rather short stature.

Can only be gathered during an umbral duststorm.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

32003.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Umbral Flarerock
32003.description:
Each chunk of flarerock is capable of releasing enormous amounts of fire-aspected aether. Unfortunately, for that to occur, it must first be warmed for three days under a medium-sized duck, which limits its usefulness somewhat.

Can only be gathered during an umbral flare.

Used in expert crafting recipes.

32004.name: Approved Grade 4 Skybuilders' Umbral Levinsand
32004.description:
